entries.title: 0x17's-TinyWorld
entries.description:
Okay so this is it. My first Ludum Dare Entry. I used the theme as game name throughout development and now I'm too lazy to change that so I just called it Tiny World with my username as prefix.

Controls:
- Left&Right for horizontal movement and Up/Space for jumping.
- Escape to go back to world overview or quit game.
- Return to enter selected world in world overview screen.

On Android tap on the left/right border of the screen to run left/right and tap both left&right borders at the same time for jumping. Press the back button on your device to return to the world overview.

Difficulty:
Easy -> small inertia, no spikes
Normal, Hard, Impossible -> growing inertia, with spikes.

The jar should run fine on all desktops (Win/Mac/Linux) with a Java VM installed.

Web&Android ports were done after the compo. The web version should run on recent versions of Firefox and Chrome.  Android version was only tested on my HTC Desire so far. Hopefully works more or less on other devices.

Since I couldn't come up with a great idea to fit the theme I just used a small planet as a level/world overview as rationale/excuse. The game itself is quite hard (maybe not in a good way) and the controls are erratic to say the least.

I also put the source on bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/0x17/tinyworld

Not sure if I'll write a postmortem. :-D

entries.title: 9Lives
entries.description:
9Lives is a game that follows the story of Cary the Cat who wakes up to find that his love Kitie has gone missing.  Along his journey Cary goes through many different environments and encounters many different obstacles.  You play as Cary in this pixelated adventure, there are some cool cats as you go along, so be sure to talk to them especially if you believe you are stuck.

This game was developed by The Gaming Project which consists of four members, we worked as much as we could over the three days, but school and work took up some of our precious work time.

The games Protagonist Cary and his love Kitie are based on two of our friends in real life who are about to get married, we made this game as a birthday present to the real Cary.  All eight cats (and the one dog) are also all based on pets of our friends.  It was an extremely fun project and we hope everyone who plays it enjoys it.

The game was coded in HTML5 which is new for us so not everything is as smooth as it could be.  We plan over the next few days to polish up the game and extend it some more.  In addition we plan to make the sound work on all browsers, currently it does not work on Safari or Internet Explorer.  Below a link to the background music is provided if you are interested.

Please let us know what you think and enjoy.

***Yes the game is very small, you can zoom in with your browser if it helps.***

entries.title: A World for Me
entries.description: I feel this was a good first LD.  This was my first platformer, first time using canvas and my first time really finishing a game.  Most of the time I try to make my game too grand and end up shelving it forever unfinished.  But this time I made sure to keep my plans small and I'm glad I did and was able to finish on time.  So enjoy my first submission!  It is about a person who has grown too large to live on his world and must jump from planet to planet looking for a new home.

entries.title: Adventures in NoLand
entries.description:
Welcome to the wonderful tiny world of NoLand !

In this tiny adventure game you'll fight tiny monsters, explore tiny cities and tiny caves, and eventually kill a tiny Dragon !

Tips : 
- mouse-over the monsters to estimate their power before getting killed. 
- make sure to find enough gold to get the dagger and shield before moving forward
- Make the good choices, and walk carefully

entries.title: BatterSwat
entries.description:
Oh no! Kohikuma the mountain bear has been stung by a lovestruck queen bee and injected with a strange poison that shrunk him down to nearly the size of an ant! Think you can help him find the queen bee back and reverse the effect? ...and get your revenge on the bees for messing with you while you're at it? 

Controls:

Arrow keys - Move
X Key - Claw / Decide
Esc - Quit Game
F11 Key - Toggle Fullscreen mode

* This game is also joystick compatible: (and I recommend it!)

Dpad - Move
Button 1 - Claw / Decide

This project was done solo, I moved it to Jam because I needed more time to do what i had in mind, plus had some issues with my tools and also was not sure if my arrangement of the "Flight of the Bumblebee" theme was allowed in solo. I am pretty pleased with it, there are some things that could be added or improved but time was running out. I already used a lot of my time for the graphics alone.

! Please extract all the files and folders from the zip archive before playing
otherwise sounds may not play & custom options might not load from the ini file!

There's also different difficulty modes defined in the settings.ini file, but they are untested, they should work fine. Basically they give you more/less lives and change the power of your attacks to make the game more challenging or easy as pie.

entries.title: Bunny Cube
entries.description:
Play as a bunny, explore and help out the other animals living on this cube.

Controls:
Arrow keys/WSAD - Movement
Space - Interact

(The interact button doesn't seem to work sometimes... I can't figure out why. You might have to hit it a few times before some things register. Sorry.)

P.S. We still doing that kitten thing? ;)

entries.title: Celluloid Combat!
entries.description:
The second link will allow you to NOT install the font.

------------------------------------
TO PLAY, RUN LAUNCHER.EXE, thanks.

REQUIREMENTS : 
* You NEED to install the font in the zip.
* To launch game correctly and modify resolution, don't launch directly game.exe please.
------------------------------------

GAMEPLAY :
* This is a game that let you control a spaceship in the human body, fighting with cells. There is no end, it's a game like Asteroids, a Shoot'Em'Up. It's funny and distracting, the game will be harder as long as you earn points.

CONTROLS : (can be found in the launcher)
* ZQSD or WASD to move spaceship. Left Click to fire lasers and right click to launch a rocket. A debug mode is also here, just press TAB, you will see all the movements.

NOTICE :
* Unfornately, I couldn't do more, because of the time, my family is important...

GRAPHICS : 
* I've created a part using Paint.NET and found another part on the internet, during the 48h.

SOUND : 
* sfxr

PROGRAMMING : 
* AutoIt3

RENDERING/PHYSICS : 
* I've created my own engine, named VCore, using GDI+ and Bass. Development was done before the contest, but I had to modify it a lot, it taked much time.
I will share it when i will think it's ready.

SOURCE : 
* Source code is included in the zip with the binaries.
You can't compile it because you don't have the engine. I will make it public soon :)

entries.title: Creature Collect
entries.description:
Swoop through space collecting creatures and delivering them to merchants.
Marvel at the chaos as a low orbit turtle knocks you off course.
Wave your hands in celebration and or dismay as you triumph over the world's twitchiest physics sim.

Tutorial included but parts of it are easy to miss so:
W - Thrust
A/D - Rotate
S - Reverse Thrust
Space - Engage tractor beam
Q - Release tractor beam

entries.title: Delirium
entries.description:
Comes pastillas para agrandarte y achicarte. 

Flechas - Mover
Space - Saltar
R  - Reset

Tilemap : realizado por Photonstorm

entries.title: Demon Hunter
entries.description:
You have been tasked to cleanse the world of demons. "Easy," you think. "The world is only a few hundred square feet, so it should be a piece of cake, right?"

Wrong.

entries.title: Downsize
entries.description:
A short but sweet arcade/puzzle game about shrinking worlds while their inhabitants, attached to their creations as they are, try to stop you. That last level is tricky.

Now with 50% more packaging! Start the game from /dist/downsize.exe.

entries.title: Five by Five
entries.description:
How to play:
Use the mouse to place the terrain fragments on your tiny world. Terrain tiles of the same type may overlap - if they do, they even get upgraded. How many fragments will fit in your tiny world?

First Ludum Dare, ran out of time, no rotating pieces, no in-game tutorial, no sound, no game over notification, no restart option, no brain function left to write anything meaningful... Thanks, I like turtles, over and out.

entries.title: Galaxy Music Quest
entries.description:
Space Music Quest is a game in which  you need to collect the music notes to fuel up your ship and go back home. Music is the fuel here.

Each note you grab, a new piece of the music kicks in! After grabbing 3 notes, you can move on to the next planet.

This is my first time in Ludum Dare. The idea here was to make the game more music-focused, but more or less halfway there I had to worry more about refining gameplay and gameflow to make the experience more interesting - given the short development time. SO I used the same music on all three levels.

I also ran into technical issues: I had to upload the game to a friend's website (thanks Al Anselmo!) because in mine the sound is off (need to change some host configs that I am not capable of by myself).

This was built using Construct 2 (Engine), Propellerhead Reason (Music) and Demo Photoshop (Images). Please find all the assets and full Construct project link below:

http://www.fluxgamestudio.com/games/SpaceMusicQuest/spacemusicquest.zip (Exported Project in HTML 5)
http://www.fluxgamestudio.com/games/SpaceMusicQuest/spacemusicquest.capx (Construct Project)

Enjoy!

entries.title: Grow
entries.description:
Took a while but I'm done with it now.

Make the planet evolve to a new state. Playable by only using the mouse.

Technical notes:
- The music sucks, but I'm no musician.
- The trees are procedurally generated.
- Created a quick editor to sculpt meshes inside of unity. Used to create the planet.
- My brain doesn't work anymore.

entries.title: Pretentious Game
entries.description:
I used my platformer engine built around WCK-Box2d

The game is on reddit r/gaming hot
http://www.reddit.com/r/gaming/comments/sv636/pretentious_game_help_the_blue_block_reach_his/

Also frontpaged with badge on Kongregate
and Newgrounds frontpage

entries.title: Ra Ra
entries.description:
It's two-player versus extreme star boxing! So grab a friend you want to punch in the face with a planet.

Use WASD/Arrows to move through space, swinging your orbiting planets. Position your aforementioned satellites to block, jab, and uppercut your opponent in a bitter fight to the death.

(note: there is actually zero randomness in the game's physics)

entries.title: Small Slime Adventure
entries.description:
This is my first big game ever(Thus means my first entry too :)

If you have found any bugs, please comment them. I wil not change the game at the web (cause it's against the rules of judging) so everyone will have the same gaming experience.

Have Fun!

To rate the game please play the game at original web page.

Known Bugs: On higher levels you can easily eat mobs that are much bigger then you. If anyone have ideas how to fix this i would be grateful.

entries.title: Tiny Chtulhu
entries.description:
Description:

You control Chtulhu, a tiny creature that needs to get fed in order to retrieve his powers. The more humans you kill, the more you get powerful, and GROW!

The game has no end. Enemies will spawn randomly and the world has no limit. The only aim is fun. 

In fact this game should count as a LD48 entry because I made it in 48H but I didn't see the submitting form... so i wrote an article... Anyway I didn't participate to win but to train myself so it doesn't matter. It was my first participation to LD =)

I used Java, Eclipse and Gimp.

Thanks to ra4king for letting me use his server.

Twitter : @Chtulhu1

Thanks for writting me some comment. I love to have some feedback.

entries.title: Tiny World - Ideas in the Sea of Thought
entries.description:
NOTE: I was right about it working on Mac. I just had no way to test it. xD

Premise-
An Idea is a world in and of itself. It's afloat in the universe, caught on a breeze, growing large only to be destroyed (Except in certain circumstances). It inspires souls to its side and often conflicts with others.

The conflict between the ideas is meant to bring home the 'Tiny World' view point of ideas. While at war, more 'Military' type units were meant to spawn (Unimplemented), enough so that the other three unit types would almost be choked out.

While it would take a lot of balancing, the game favors the player when you have a smaller map. The closer to 37 tiles (Half that's displayed) the higher your chance to spawn a unit each turn. Further, the intent was that when you're not at war with another Idea, you can 'destroy' portions of the world, and if you split the map, the parts not linked to you disappear, reducing the map size.

Success-
Limited. While I got much of what I had wanted to get through done, I didn't complete enough to actually call what I created a game. While you can -do- things in it, it's missing a bunch of functions that would make it -playable-.

HUD From top-
Left 1: Number- Your total belief, spent to do things.
Left 2: Y->T looking thing- Toggles and allows you to randomly place a tile on that spot.
Left 3: * Looking thing- Toggles and allows you to destroy an uninhabited tile, due to the lack of a path-finder, this can break movement.
Left 4: Obelisk with waves- Attempts to convert all 'neutral (Yellow)' things on the map (20 Belief for each yellow, with 4x your spawn chance for each).
Left 5: Dead Tree- Opens up a refinements/tech menu (Obelisk lets you get belief faster, Heart heals your units/structures more per turn, Sword increases unit damage, Wispy flame increases pop cap) each costs 200 Belief.
Left 6: ?- Toggles and was meant to provide info about all of the other parts of the HUD.
Left 7: Hourglass- End your turn.
Top 1: Population Current/Max
Top 2: Spawn chance
Top 3: Number of Blank (Little fire) souls. Can become any other type of soul.
Top 4: Number of Artistic (Candle) souls. Passively increases Belief, Healing and Damage.
Top 5: Number of Creative (Compass) souls. Can work in a structure and increase its output by 50%.
Top 6: Number of Convincing (Sword) souls. Moves to the closest non-friendly structure and attempts to destroy it.
Top 7: Number of Obstinate (Shield) souls. Attacks any non-friendly Soul on a tile you own.

Clicking a tile, when not changing/destroying, pops up a blank window which was meant to display information about a structure (In use, training, health, owner). I just didn't have to time to implement it.

entries.title: TinyBot
entries.description:
*** TinyBot	*** v1.0

Guide your TinyBot through a strange little world to save a scientist.

=== CONTROLS ===
WASD/Arrows     TO MOVE
RIGHT CTRL/Z    TO JUMP
RIGHT SHIFT/X   TO SHOOT  (hold UP to shoot up)
ESC             GAME MENU (during game)

Game made by Murilo 
Music/Sfx by Sary Ishii

Use mouse for menu options.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Tondie and Zupe
entries.description:
Requries an HTML5 capable browser. Chrome is strongly recommended. Firefox has some problems.

This is sort of a cross between a platformer and a tower defense. It should take maybe 25 minutes to beat it. If you're stuck, here's some tips:
 * You start the game able to double jump (jump in the air), and you can upgrade it later.
 * At the beginning, collect money to advance the game. When you reach $250, you get the ability to grow. After that, keep growing to advance the game.
 * Grow will only work if you have 90/100 health or higher.
 * You have to be standing at the base of a structure to upgrade it.
 * The final boss has a pretty small hit box, right in the middle of its dome. Attack from above and try to hit it right in the center. Launchers upgraded about 6 times are excellent for getting up there.

entries.title: Tooth Fairy Fun Time
entries.description:
As the tooth fairy it is your job to collect teeth and bring them to your home base.  Each place in the world is in a different time zone.  Be careful not to stay out after the sun rises! 

This HTML5/JavaScript game was made in about 6 hours of work with library code from the Video Game Development Club at the University of Minnesota. I would have liked to spend more time on it but there were other things going on during the weekend. The novelty wears off fast and I would have liked to add an additional game play component or two. I only tested it in Chrome. Music is made up of Garageband loops.

entries.title: World In A Bottle
entries.description:
This is a sim along the lines of sim earth, a balance of atmospheric gasses,soil nutrients,and plants and animals that interact with them. I tried to keep the chemical reactions as close to the real world as possible. It's very unbalanced right now, since the rabbits were hacked in in the last two hours and there are no wolves to keep them in check.

Language: Silverlight/C#
IDE: Visual Studio 2010
Graphics: Photoshop
Music: OpenMPT

Notes:
The apple trees won't grow without nitrates, so some lupines must be planted first.
A single rabbit will breed with itself, yes that's a bug. So yes, a single rabbit can create a rabbitsploshion.
The system *should* be closed, as in no atoms will be lost, though they will be exchanged: IE: the plants will photosynthesize water and carbon dioxide into glucose and oxygen. If it looks like something's missing, it's most likely in the bodies of the plants and animals. A large amount of plantlife will deplete the amount of water in the air and soil.
If you run out of water, plants will dehydrate from front to back - an artifact of the drawing code.

entries.title: 8-bit "BTTP" Pixel
entries.description:
BTTP  is a retro platformer game created for Ludum Dare 23. Taking it's square adventure you must pass threw all levels of the game. Don't know who you are, just a square that wants to get out of the mysterious place his in. You must reach the glowing pellets that are in each room to proceed to the next room. Each room gets harder and harder with lava, spikes, moving platforms, and enemy's. Are you willing to take this adventure? 
CONTROLS:
Arrow keys to move
Start- Go to next room (only on menu and end of the game)

You can visit my website at samusetroid.net or follow me on twitter here: https://twitter.com/#!/samusetroid Enjoy!

Rate and comment please.

entries.title: An Attempt at Meta Puzzle Design
entries.description:
Controls
Arrows - Move
X - Jump
Z - Activate Terminal
Down - Enter Door
Mouse Click - Grow dots in puzzle mode

This game is pretty sketchy. I wasn't able to get the overworld version of the puzzle working (which my my original goal/point). I also noticed for some reason the puzzle mode converted all of the dots to be full at the start so that kinda ruins the puzzle... But I learned a lot and made some sweet additions to my engine so all in all this was pretty good.

entries.title: Castle Story
entries.description:
Here's my entrance to Ludum Dare 23.  Written entirely in Java, all original art done in Acorn.
This is my High School Senior project, so here goes.  

Written on a mac, and there's a graphical bug on windows that causes some graphics layers to flash in and out of existence.  I can't seem to track it down.

Timelapse soon(tm)?

Any and all comments/feedback is much appreciated.

Chance of incredibad.  Sorry.

entries.title: Crash Effect
entries.description:
An arcade-style game where you ram spaceships within a tiny force field. This is my first LD48 entry, so it's quite basic.

Requires LOVE 0.8. http://love2d.org/

LOVE files are ZIP files. Please open CrashEffect.love in your archiver to access the source code and data files.

Addendum- I somehow introduced a bug at the last minute that prevented enemies from shooting at you. I don't want to break the rules, but if you'd like the game to be even harder, get the non-compo bugfix here: http://ecliss.net/compos/CrashEffect2.love

entries.title: Dwindling Worlds
entries.description:
An abstract game inspired by John Whitney Jr.'s Side Phase Drift, among other things. It makes heavy use of audio, so screenshots don't really do it justice.

Control via mouse. Escape quits.

Best viewed in a 16:9 aspect ratio.

[update: I've changed the links to point to a version which *I think* will fix the crash issues some people had. This replaces the alternate Windows version. I didn't change anything else.]

entries.title: Fire Around
entries.description:
We always have the sensation that the earth is flat because the surface is a lot bigger than us.
What would happen in a shmup if the surface is a lot smaller than what we are used to.

The game is done with XNA 4.0 and can be played with both keyboard and Xbox 360 pad.

Don't forget to post your highscore!

entries.title: Gravity Sucks [WEB]
entries.description:
This game is my first ever entry into a Ludum Dare competition and, although it was a stressful 48 hours, I have had a lot of fun making it! The game itself is a simple arcade platform game, with a 360Ã�Âº gravity engine.

The idea is that you jump from tiny world to tiny world and collect all the stars! Simple? NO! There are monsters to avoid, planets that move (and even explode!) and you have a limited battery life for jumping (did I mention you are a robot?).

The levels are procedurally generated and will get steadily tougher as you progress with more movement and enemies, as well as greater spaces between worlds!

I hope you all enjoy playing this simple game, as I have certainly enjoyed making it! My only regret is that I couldn't pack more into it, but I'll keep working on it after all the voting is done anyway!

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: hALWAYS
entries.description:
Hallways and existential plants.

What more could you ask for?

entries.title: Hummy's Hunger
entries.description:
Hummy is hungry!
You don't want that lil cute thing to feel hungry!
But, at times, it can be to small to even eat yummies...
Thus, you must help him get bigger to eat what it wants. =D

Movement: arrow keys
Eat stuff: spacebar
Reset Stage: R key

And there's cake for the 10 year anniversary! =D
It's not a lie!!
(Ok, that was a bad joke, but... >_<)

entries.title: MoleculeCraft
entries.description: Make molecules out of hydrogen, oxygen, and carbon like a microscientist in a subatomic tiny world! Made in about 6 hours.

entries.title: My Sun Is HUUUGE!
entries.description:
My Sun Is HUUUGE! is a ambient space where you have to blow up every other planet besides yourself. 

You do this by either crashing into them or moving around to change their orbit and make them crash into each other.

This is not only my first full game but also my first ludum dare.

UPDATE: fixed some bugs and resolution issues. Added a web player version although I do suggest the download for a better experience.


The rest of the instructions are included in the game menu and readme.

Have Fun

entries.title: Robot in the Garden
entries.description:
Made with Love2D

Graphics drawn with GIMP,
Music and sounds generated in FL Studio and Renoise

There's not much to this game, I got so caught up in tweaking the visuals and goofing off in front of the camera that I only had time to rush in two game modes.

During the making of this game, 4 friends were also making games for LD, all of them for the first time, and 3 of them at the same place as me (we Jammed in Montpellier in the sunny south of France), check out their games on our common page : http://xi.gd/ld23/

entries.title: Solenopsis Invicta
entries.description:
It's ugly, and there's no sounds or music. I just ran out of steam. But it's a complete game in all other respects. So I'm happy with that.

Also, the Preloader isn't working, so just give it a few minutes.

There's a Timeline/Journal of sorts at my blog here, http://bit.ly/JfctIh

entries.title: Spinworld
entries.description:
Spinworld is a Missile Command-type game with a twist: players can rotate their whole planet in to aim defensive buildings at oncoming enemy missiles. The trick is to create explosions in their path for the missiles to run into.
Your goal is to survive for as long as possible before your planet is inevitably destroyed.
Use Q/E to rotate the planet, Z/X/C for the turrets, the mouse for aiming. Escape to quit, Home to restart. A 5-button mouse can also be used for all basic commands.

entries.title: The Cube Realms
entries.description:
W - Jump
A&D - Move
C - Camera control
Arrows - Camera
Arrows - Menu Navigation
Enter - Menu Select
Esc - ingame open menu
Esc - close at main menu


The Cube Realms is a classic 2d platformer in Java.

Java 7 download: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u4-downloads-1591156.html

entries.title: The Sheep Are Sinking
entries.description:
The Sheep Are Sinking is a sheep-herding, terrain editing game that takes place on a tiny world that is slowly sinking into a tiny ocean. The sheep move towards the safety of the tower, but only if it's high enough. Collect all the sheep in the tower to advance to the next level with your flock.

Sheep can't climb high cliffs, and wolves and alligators appear in the higher levels. Save the sheep!

Made with Unity.

Controls:
A and D rotate
Left Mouse or Q - adds dirt
Right Mouse or E - remove dirt
W - call Sheepdog

entries.title: The World in a Bottle
entries.description:
I present you "The world in a bottle"
Play with your mouse and arrows (or ZQSD, azerty only sorry)
Click to see the intro.
Then choose a jar (some of them are really hard, but since they're is no real goal who cares).
During the first phase you have to miniaturize people using your reducto laser (mouse left), you can also throw minibombs sometimes (mouse right) and move around. Avoid ennemy rockets or you'll lose people.

Once the time is off, if you've harvested at least 10 people you will play with them in a jar, where you have to lead them to the most gruesome deaths (the more they explode, the more you score) in some kind of Anti-Locoroco.

The game has many known bugs, mainly because of bad decisions made very early.

Made by:
Loic P, Celia G, Vincent R and Tom V

entries.title: Through the Blue Sea
entries.description:
You goal is to pick up as many of the yellow pips as possible

To Play
---
Unzip the files to a location you prefer, and run throughthebluesea.exe

The controls defaul to WASD + Spacebar for Jump, but you can change them in game by click on the control name, then pushing the control you want to use.

You score and username is submitted to the online scoreboard automatically, when you finish a level, or fall off the world.

Release History
---
Ludum Dare 48 Hour Prototype
4-22-2012
--
First release of Through the Blue Sea, five planets, and randomly generated platform/pickups on the levels. 
An Online Scoreboard is avaliable at http://allaroundgames.net/LD/23/

entries.title: Tiny Shelf
entries.description:
Control a soldier toy to escape from the house of your evil owner. Jump across the bookshelves, using scenario objects to help you.

Also avoid your owners flashlight, looking for you.

The web version requires the installation of Unity Web Player (free).

entries.title: Tiny Trader
entries.description: Mouse-down to move around. Pick up cargo and deliver it. Longer routes = more money. Perfect dropoffs/pickups = bonus! Avoid pirates

entries.title: Tiny World Hero
entries.description: Use "q", "w", "e", "r" keys to select the building which will then builds instantly on the map.Your goal is to make your town the best possible by reaching the goals showed in the progress bars.

entries.title: Tiny World Travel
entries.description:
My first game for ludum dare game wrote in lua over the iPad.
Source code will be available soon.
First stage: collect people with the chosen one and bring them to the tiny world (planet).
Second stage: kill alien ships and destroy asteroids.
Level increased , lol
What will be your highscore?

I cant export the code to windows/osx right now, it depends on Love 2D project

entries.title: A Load of Bulls...
entries.description:
A Load of bulls... have landed on your miniature planet! Defeat the never-ending horde with a wide variety of 4 weapons at your disposal!

My entry to this LD48 competition. It's a first person shooter, set on a small planet. The world actually curves, and gravity is a bit silly. Requires XNA 4.

Gameplay features 4 weapons and 1 enemy type set on a lush oasis. Defend your home! Use rocket jumps to reach places that have never been reached before!

Also features a menu, with fully customizable keybinds (overloadable to up to 3 keys per action!), the option to invert both mouse axes, volume control, and a FOV slider! It might be tempting to increase the FOV, but this game is played best with the default FOV. Still, if you're beyond pro quake level, set it to 140 for maximum fisheye

Enjoy! I had a lot of fun making it, although I wish I had more time to add more enemies and weapons.

entries.title: Bactarium
entries.description:
Bactarium takes place in a petri dish.  

Consume nutrients and replicate faster than your competition!

[TIP:  Press F1 to learn how to play.]

entries.title: Empty Space
entries.description:
Music: Autotracker
GFX: Gimp/Paint.net

entries.title: Epiquest - mini edition
entries.description:
This game was created in a couple of hours (less than 10) for Ludum Dare 23. The theme was tiny world. This is my first game jam, so please be gentle.

Complete 20 quests to win, kill additional monsters to increase your level to make fighting easier. Complete with the youngest age possible! What is your high score?

entries.title: Flea Circus
entries.description:
A simple platformer. [left] and [right] arrows to move, [up] to jump. Stay away from the nasties and eat the fruit!

I didn't have enough time to flesh out the story more, which is a shame. Too much playing League of Legends.

The level design also sucks. There's only two (very, very, small) levels, and I didn't get to do different art for both of them so they look identical. Oh well, this game was more of a technical achievement for me than a masterpiece of game design.

Written in Ruby with some help from the Gosu framework (http://libgosu.org). Source code available - run it from source, or one of the Windows/OS X executables. Music was made with the help of the built-in samples inside GarageBand for the iPad.

entries.title: Hive

Left: Rotate counter-clockwise around the hive
Right: Rotate clockwise around the hive
Up: Fly away from the hive
Down: Fly closer to the hive
Z: Fire
Shift: Hold to slow your movement

entries.title: Tiny Civ
entries.description:
This is a local multiplayer game.  Supposed to be a quick play 4X multiplayer game, Civilization meets joust.  In practice its not so grandiose and apparently horribly confusing :).

Player 1 uses WASD (S is attack\build, W is jump, AD are left and right movement)

Player 2 uses arrows (down is attack\build, UP is jump, right and left move right and left)

Rules:

Building more cities will level up your character. Cities can also be used as cover for bullets.  Leveling first improves your jump height. When you first start you are only able to jump to the first 3 islands.  This is not a bug, it is by design. The final and third level will give you the ability to fire bullets.

The goal of the game is to make the opposing player's lives zero.  Player 1 is on the right, player 2 is on the left.  In order to achieve this you need to make them fall off islands.

entries.title: Universal Singularity
entries.description:
Universal Singularity

This is an old school dodgem style console game complete with unfair collision detection and shitty controls! (no diagonal movement!). It is pretty hard to win but half the fun is seeing how long you last! Post your times below and let me know if you collected 7 power cells for the win!

Story:

The universe is collapsing in on itself for an unspecified reason! You are the last human alive and your spaceship is being compressed towards a singularity. Your only chance of survival is to collect enough fusion cells to create a wormhole to escape to another universe. You need 7 fusion cells. You need to collect these cells before the universe shrinks to a tiny point! 

As the universe contracts, weird quantum effects are being observed on a macro scale such as the superposition of matter. Avoid the plasma balls and avoid being caught in the middle of some materialising matter!


Instructions:

* Use the arrow keys to move
* Press 'r' to restart the game
* Collect 7 flashing power cells to win
* Avoid the fireballs and phase matter
* You can pass though phase matter unharmed when it is transparent.

entries.title: Volo
entries.description:
Volo is a procedurally generated cave exploration flying platformer. It was built in JavaScript using the JawsJS library which utilises the HTML5 canvas element. Volo currently works best in Google Chrome.

This is my first attempt at developing a game in a game competition. Choosing JavaScript was done lightly but in retrospect I should have put more time into the decision, especially since my only familiarity with JawsJS was briefly looking at the API docs. The theme resonated deeply with my memories of being a child and playing a Nintendo GameBoy, with it being 'tiny' but packing such a large 'world' of adventures and exploration. I have tried to recreate these feelings with Volo using procedural generation, although there is only so much one person can do in forty-eight hours.

I hope you enjoy it.

entries.title: Establichment
entries.description:
E  S  T  A  B  L  I  C  H  M  E  N  T                                             

         is a tower defense / puzzle game.

============== STORY ===============

The financial crisis finally got the best of the planet Earth, and every country has collapsed.

Every country? No! Only Switzerland, living like a tiny independant world since the dawn of ages, with its own
currency, its own mannerisms, has subsisted.

With this general demise, the Swiss are happy not to have to worry about strangers anymore: they are finally alone
on their land.

But one day... aliens arrived! Portals appeared out of nowhere in all the major cities, with weird yellow creatures
being teleported out of them.

The press quickly spread panic about this event, but you kept your calm. Thinking that you maybe, just maybe, there is some money to make out of this.

Build houses, buildings, and mighty towers to house these aliens, make money, and win each level by fulfilling
various objectives.

============== CONTROLS & INFO ================

The game is controlled only with the mouse

F11 and F12 are mapped to cheats, don't use them ;)

The default resolution is 1280x720 but feel free to adjust it, for example you can put the following in config/establichment.config:

screenWidth=1600
screenHeight=920
fullScreen=true

entries.title: Gulliver
entries.description:
Here's my LD entry!  It's a free-roaming adventure shmup, with a neat recursive miniaturization mechanic!

Please try it out and let me know what you think!  It's in Flash this time, so no download or setup required, but it's 17MB (lots of music) so be patient while you wait for it to load.

You can also download the soundtrack for free!  Just head on over to my bandcamp site: http://ddrkirbyisq.bandcamp.com/album/gulliver-original-soundtrack

Note: Easy difficulty might be best if you've terrible at shmup games.  However, dying results in a respawn without any lost progress (think VVVVVV) and isn't much of a hindrance at all, so don't be afraid to try your luck at Normal too.

=====

Tools/Frameworks used:
-Flixel
-FlashDevelop
-Flixel Power Tools
-Actuate (tweening library)
-GIMP (art)
-FL Studio (music, some sounds)
-LabChirp (most sounds)

entries.title: Hero of Rain
entries.description:
----Introduction----

Great LD! I had the time to spend pretty much all weekend on my game, with breaks for sleeping and eating.

I had my idea pretty early on, luckily. Unluckily, it was an action adventure game, and every time I've tried to make one of those I didn't finish much of the story. This LD was no exception--the ending is quite abrupt.

However, I still think it's possible to enjoy this game, short as it is.


----Controls----

- WASD for movement
- Click on dialogue to advance
- Click on doors to unlock
- Click and hold to shoot once you have the gun


----Background----

The in-game story may be a bit confusing because of the format I had to relay it in. I also wrote the dialogues all out of order, so they aren't even very well-planned.

This tiny world, Drop, is contained within a drop of rain. Its people live in hyperaccelerated time, so much like how each human's life in the universe's lifespan is insignificant, each *'s lifetime is insignificant to the Drop.

Recently, Drop has merged with another water droplet, causing a nasty war between their inhabitants. Worse than this is an apocalypse--Drop is falling dangerously close to the ground.

It is hopeful legend that a hero will propel Drop back into the Clouds, to allow it to survive for the length of another fall. Guess who that is?


----Supported platforms----

This section includes some keywords for people who search for their preferred platform to find games to play.
Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, or anything else with Flash Player.

entries.title: Immunity
entries.description:
REQUIRES JAVA 5, BUT MAY REQUIRE JAVA 7 FOR SOME PLATFORMS.
You can get it at: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

If the loading screen hangs and the window cannot be closed, try downloading Java 1.7.

Made by the near-future 1UP Game Making Club of the University of Mary Washington. (oneup.umwblogs.org)
Updates to come eventually, some bugs, no tutorial.
Press keys 1-8 to change cell selection, click to place.
Amino acids (currency) shown in upper-left corner, costs of cells in green below them in the interface at the bottom.

In order of appearance, friendly cells work like this:

Neutrophils are slow-moving but effective as a buffer.
Macrophages are a little bit weaker, but a lot faster.
Monocytes heal all friendly units around them.
Dendrites generate free amino acids (currency) while they survive!
Basophils have tons of health but don't move or deal damage.
Lymphocytes inspire other cells to attack one target!
Natural Killers explode, dealing damage to everything around!
Killer T Cells fire projectiles at enemies!

Basically, try to keep the animal cells (the orange circles that start on the right) alive by keeping the bacteria, viruses, and parasites that enter from the left away from them.  Hopefully, it isn't too difficult and also isn't too easy.  Please give us your thoughts, and follow us at oneup.umwblogs.org.

so yeah....I almost think my last submission was better. Luck next time I guess

History: 

The landscape is called "Transitoria" and is one of the millions of kingdoms that inhabit the world of the Great Mother
Vision zero green and blue, only coordinates electrical, rhythmic and controlled by Powerline Maximum Security and its officers, soldiers or popularly known as Silicon Nano Robots. Everything goes without error and the script of life has already been pre-destined.
However, the security warning of the great industry Antivirus (IA *) sounds the alarm, a beautiful distinctive voice, once again, "DUN DUN DUN ... A suspicious item was found." After the first ring, is further and another, already immediately ten times. The situation becomes dangerous, then the alarm occurs fiery chaos that promotes Transitoria's Society and all other "DUN DUN DUN ... A potentially unwanted program is detected. "
A dangerous power enters the system of the Great Mother, affecting the circuits and destroying passages rapid dispatch communication. Without further loss of the Great Mother, who feels everything that happens, he decides to trigger the alarm for the analysis of the combatants: "DUN DUN DUN ... The definitions of virus were analyzed "
The timing of the war came, and everyone will fight for their lives, for their Kingdoms, by his Mother Transitoria shall defend with all costs and maintain the electrical system working, it is the duty of every Soldier Silicon send electrical pulses to the transistors and save his world from possible contamination.
