entries.title: Escape this Tiny World Alone
entries.description:
With the government collapsed and the world in turmoil, you decide to Escape this Tiny World... Alone.
Get into orbit to win.
Controls: Arrow Keys (Left & Right)

This is Hikari1100 and StayDynamic's first Ludum Dare.
We planned on working alone for the Jam in Java.
We met this really awesome guy on the IRC who goes by Zapa.
Zapa wanted to work in C++ and GDK but needed help since he was releasing a new game with his company and needed to be at work for most of the event.
I thought it would be cool to work in C++ given that I only had less than a few months to work with SDL.
All three of us started out ok on the first day but over time Zapa was continually called into work and I was the main programmer.
Zapa tried as best he could to help us out.  He even stayed awake for more than three days between work and us just to help us.
Unfortunately, Zapa disappeared on Sunday
I really wanted to finsh a game though so I gave up on C++ and coded the entire game from scratch in Java.
Here is our finished product.

Our thanks go to Zapa for being awesome.

Make sure you have the newest Java Runtime Environment installed.

If you have any questions or concerns email me @ [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

PS: Collect the propane tanks to get more propane.

entries.title: Fuseglow
entries.description:
Fuseglow, Chapter 1: Tiny World

a choose your own adventure animated story
------------------------------------------------

I am happy to say I did everything myself in 48 hours including sleep. I wasn't able to get to creating music, but I think the art and story are highlights.


Thanks Ludum Dare, good luck to all who entered!

ZE GAMEN!

@spacerumpus | spacerumpus.tumblr.com

entries.title: Going Rogue
entries.description:
GOING ROGUE!
game by FrankieSmileShow, with music and sound effects by Chef Boyardee.
The game is for windows.

You are a big monster! RAR!
Have a little rampage in town.

The initial idea was to have a giant monster rampage-themed roguelike, but I didn't quite have time to put in the more roguelikeish elements, so by the end I focused on making the rampaging fun and satisfying by itself.

Arrow keys move.
C picks things up, and then throws them.
V attacks with the item held, and eats people if you are holding some.
the M key toggles a very ugly map.

Moving around makes you hungry, eating people will help.
ESCAPE quits the game! Theres no pause menu, sorry. didnt have time!!

The game was made in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 23 jam.

entries.title: HeroRoll
entries.description:
An adventure roquelike RPG-ish game. Features:

-Tile-based movement
-4 levels
-8 enemies
-At least 5 weapons
-Potions
-Rolling screen
-Randomly generated levels
-Too damn high difficulty level (you will die)
-Bugs
-Occasionally impossible level 1

Thanks for checking it out, and please tell me if you found any bugs in the comments! Expect for the occasional impossible level 1. I know that already.

Tools used:

-CoolBasic
-GraphicsGale
-Bfxr

entries.title: Itty Bitty Dimension Warp
entries.description:
"Rats! You've been turned into a red square!

Double rats! You're dimension-warping between worlds measuring 600 * 600 pixels, and they're disintegrating rapidly!

Triple rats! You've dropped your prized collection of green squares, and they've gone everywhere!

Don't lose any green squares, and maybe the world will start to make sense once again!"

(My first Ludum Dare! :O Created in HTML5 from (almost) scratch, used GIMP for the images, and used sfxr for the sounds. Used the requestAnimFrame function created by The Google. Lemme know if it breaks).

entries.title: Let's Go Moon
entries.description:
Let's Go Moon is an arcade style game, where you guide the moon around a randomly spawning galaxy of little planets, meteors, asteroids and alien space ships. Smash into objects smaller than you to grow in size, and grow large enough to take down the Earth itself.

The further away you go from the Earth the larger the planets get, there are also "occupied" planets which will shoot you down, knocking chunks of your mass off.

This is our first ever game for Ludum Dare, entered into the Jam purely because my friend and I wanted to do our first one in a team.

Controls are simply the arrow keys. Q and W zoom the camera in and out, but it should do that automatically based on your size anyway. Flixel has built in sound controls, so 0 to mute (and unmute).

Made in AS3 using a slightly modified Flixel. Photoshop for the art work, though as you may guess none of us were artists.Sound Effects made in as3sfxr. And Music was free to use music by BunnyMajs of Newgrounds.

Hope you all enjoy!

entries.title: Millinaut
entries.description:
What do you do when your beloved little home planet has to find a new place under the sun? You zoom it over to a new galaxy with your rocket, then shrink both and carry them around on your ahead until you come across a spot that looks juuuust right. It's a big universe out there, and it'll take a hero with a big heart to save his world.

A game by Shaun Inman + Neven Mrgan + Alex Ogle.

entries.title: Nom Nom?
entries.description:
Code is messy :( and there a few bugs with some collisions and boundries, but i am happy with it!

I had great fun working out XNA as i went and creating it all

I hope you all enjoy it! 

Make sure you die at least once for the awesome death sound!

All feedback is appreciated! 

My Second XNA game!

entries.title: Pixel World
entries.description:
The hero was going to Earth to participate to this LD, and during the travel, he falls in a black hole and finds himself on a strange planet.

What's this tiny world full of pixels ?

The goal is to find all the pieces from your ship in order to rebuild it. And of course join the Ludum Dare before it ends.

entries.title: Subatomica
entries.description: Enter the extremely tiny world of subatomic physics! You control the charge on a particle to the left with the y position of your mouse, and your aim is to get it to the yellow goal on the right. Other particles, fields and even antimatter will help/hinder you along the way.

entries.title: Survive, my little pixel!
entries.description:
Survive as long as you can by killing waves of evil little robots who want to defeat you!! poor pixel!!!

Commands:
W,A,S,D: Move the little pixel in the map
Mouse Right Click: Shoot to the enemy
Space Bar: Enable/Disable "the magnifying glass view" (Note that, without that, you can't see anything! Because is all so tiny!!!)

Good Luck.... And Have fun :)

*** New Version: Added mini initial textual tutorial, duplicated the life of the pixel and added High scores to beat ***

entries.title: The First Frontier
entries.description:
The efforts of my first Ludum Dare!  Gravity, rocket-powered semi-bald pale-faced spacemen, quick-moving stars, and UFOs!

Since it's made in LOVE, it should be compatable with Mac.  Please send me a message if it doesn't work.

entries.title: The Tiny, Unknown and Unimportant World
entries.description:
Prevent the humans death by building stuff. Click on a object and then somewhere on the field to create the object. You'll unlock other stuff by building more, including kittehs.

----Story----
In a galaxy far, far away there's a tiny world of 800x800 pixels where just one human lives.

You, the all creating god thingy, can help the human survive by building trees, farms, buildings and companions. If you don't, the human will die. Be quick though, as the harsh weather will endanger the human.

You lose when all humans die. You can't win the game. Will you help them survive? Or will you let them die horribly? The fate of this tiny, unknown and unimportant world lies in your hands.

entries.title: Tiny Jack and The Regular-Size Beanstalk
entries.description:
Tiny Jack, whilst off on his adventures has crash landed!

Arrow Keys and Z, X.

(Alternatively, WASD and ctrl, space.)

entries.title: Tiny Maze
entries.description:
Created in a few hours just before the end of the compo because of a failed attempt at making a roguelike in the previous thirty hours...

Warning: the game is hard, and doesn't forgive mistakes!

Have fun! :D

entries.title: Tinysoft
entries.description:
This game is the sadly product of a project with to much to do and not enaugh time. Even the jam was not long enaugh.
So, enjoy a complete, dynamic game engine and a unfinished game.

The game is something like Half-Life in RPG Maker 2K style.
A scientist, Issac Gates, tries to create Tinysoft by building a shrinking ray. Of course something goes wrong and all people die, or something like this. This is the part where I stopped do work on the story.

entries.title: tinythumb
entries.description:
Hi everyone,

Second entry. Tried my hand at an RPG. Although it doesn't seem like a lot, it is a whole lot of an improvement over my previous entry.

Be advised that the jar is 20MB. This is because of music included. If people don't want to download that much, I'll make a musicless distribution. Now, it's time for bed.

Thanks to
My girlfriend for her patience,
Caranch for tech and moral support

entries.title: Wary Forestall
entries.description:
This game is a bullet-hell (danmaku).
It was made using C++, with SFML, Gimp, SFXR, and MilkyTracker.

The game is in the /bin/ folder.

Controls:
Z : Shoot
X : Bombs
C : Shield
Arrows : Move

Have a great time, and don't forget to review some more games too! :)

entries.title: Worlds in Cards
entries.description:
"Worlds in Cards" (name picked up at the last minute) is based on the idea that whole worlds, albeit very tiny, are contained inside cards.  The player can be inside a single world at the time, but she can jump from world to world if they are adjacent *and* the landscape matches.  If for example, a world has a ladder going down, then the world at bottom must have a ladder going up if the player wants to move from one to the other (and viceversa)

However, you can't control the player directly.  Instead the player's character goes back and forth between the limits of the world--either a single card or a combination or cards correctly arranged that forms a "bigger" world--she is confined in.  Howerver, the player can swap two cards on the screen that have neither an object nor a character, be it the player's character or any other of the characters that are wandering around the level. 

Even the game's window looks like a card of sorts, althought this is more a side effect of trying to fit the game in my Android phone.  However, I think it fits the theme, specially if you have a large resolution, because the window looks so tiny...

 
I didn't have time to create many levels--5 to be exact--and they aren't very challenging.  I guess it takes much more than I have to make puzzles.

I couldn't test extensively the Windows version as I only have a VM and the Linux binaries "work on my system", but I can't guarante that they will work everywhere (64-bit was build under Gentoo and 32-bit in Debian testing.)   The Android build works at least on my tablet and phone.

The music was made with Greasymonkey's autotracker, so I don't claim credit and I don't think it would be fair to rate it.  I tried to use a custom "autotracker" that I did sometime ago, but didn't produce the same kind of quality.  Most sound effects were made with sfxr, except for the sound that the cards do when are swapped; this one was made with a broom.

I tried, and failed miserably, to have a look-and-feel reminiscent of GB, partly because I thought that maybe my lack of artistic skills wouldn't be that noticeable.  Oh, boy... how wrong I was!

entries.title: A Theft of Mass
entries.description:
Greetings Planetary Assassin!

Use the WASD keys, Arrows, or Number Pad to maneuver your ship and your mouse to fire your mining laser as you burrow to the core of this unsuspecting planet.
Once it loses the mass of its core it will be tiny indeed, and destined to spiral into fiery oblivion.

Graphics were created with Gimp.

Sounds were created with SFXR and Audacity.

The code was written in nano.

The language and build environment was Flex SDK and make.

I hope you enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed making it!

entries.title: Ayond
entries.description:
For seven days, the world only lives around you...



It's our very first LD Jam.
We were not able to do whatever we wanted and many things are still missing, but the game is playable.

Missing: the percentage of space preserved indicating the goal of the game. Your still got the map for that.

We tried to examine the theme as much as possible. 
Hoping you'll enjoy our interpretation.

Feel free to leave us comment and vote!

entries.title: Boxed in.
entries.description:
This game is a fairly simple puzzle game with a unique way of playing. 
The players are small people in a box being held by a larger person. You must use both WASD and arrow keys to free the players from the box. 
Use arrow keys to move player(s)
Hold W and S to lower or raise gravity, respectively.
Hold A or D to tile the box.

12 days left and we have received quite a few positive reviews, and since it was fun making this game, we may as well keep adding to it in the future. Thanks for the ratings guys :3

Also, for optimal performance, do NOT use IE, instead use Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc.
(for the unenlightened IE = Internet Explorer)

entries.title: Colours in the Void
entries.description: Welcome to Colours in the Void, a game where you have to use the surrounding environment to defeat your enemies. Click the bright sections of the map to create a beam, which kills enemies when they cross it.

entries.title: Cosmicro
entries.description:
The goal is to increase your world's population as high as you can, while protecting them from being killed by aliens.

Defeat enemies to receive stones.
Pressing numbers 1 to 6 on the keyboard will let you place humans or buildings. In order to build, you must have enough shiny stones.

Human - Increases population by one.
House - Up to 3 humans can enter a house to protect themselves.
Shield - Protects humans and building from shots.
Speed - Increases your movement speed.
Shot - Increases shot power for you and turrets.
Turret - Constantly fires.

Below is the link to the Post-Compo version (Don't rate that version).
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/6822849/Cosmicro.swf

entries.title: Dave is in a Fish Tank
entries.description:
Well here is my first Ludum Dare entry, Dave is in a Fish Tank. My personal aim wasn't good coding or graphics, but an original, full-feeling playing experience. I think you can just about define it is a game, but really it's more of a toy. I hope you enjoy it in that respect. But the Game Maker source file shouldn't really be taken seriously. For anything.

Info:
So the deal is this guy called Dave is inside a Fish Tank. Yep. You have to feed him like he's a fish. He meets some other people along the way, but they're not friends. Dave doesn't like people.

Controls:
Left/right - Mouse or arrow keys
Select - Left mouse button or spacebar

Silly bug number 1: Highscore displays the last score, not the highest. Whoops.

entries.title: Deliveroid
entries.description:
Go to the factory, land on the pad to pick up food. Your cargo meter will go up. Take the food to the cities and land on the pad. You will get money. 

Go home to refuel. You can buy an ICBM at home for 250$. Once you get that, drop it on the cities. Destroy both cities to win.

Space bar resets your orientation but costs fuel. 

NOTE: Framerate changes how the craft responds. I introduced a stupid bug late in the day sunday. Sorry bout that.

entries.title: Flip
entries.description:
So it's not really a game, and more of an interactive scene.  Couldn't come up with anything that sounded particularly good or feasible, gameplay-wise.  So I went with a concept for a little bit and stopped.

It's pretty simple, use the arrow keys to rotate and flip the scene.  The disc has more than two sides.  Maybe someone will find it interesting.

I hope dropbox is an adequate host for these.

Also I'll probably need to look into compiling for other platforms, since this doesn't really use anything necessarily windows-specific.

entries.title: Great fish eat up the small
entries.description:
Great fish eat up the small is a game about eating planets and keeping your job. I had only one day to made it, so it is not really finished and has some graphical glitches, but it is playable. Because there was no time for playtesting, I'm not sure about the balancing.

Linux version needs ruby 1.9.3. I fixed the problem with bundler, so gosu shouldn't be required anymore.

Edit: Windows version added. While doing this I noticed that the balancing is terrible. Too bad I'm not allowed to tweak it anymore. Also the player is slower on windows. I did not find another way to fix an odd graphics bug.


I noticed a graphics bug, where the player is drawn inverted. If somebody has any idea why this could be, I would be very interested.

entries.title: Gum Crisis In Pipe City
entries.description:
Hey everyone! Here's my compo entry. Hope you enjoy!

By:
Jason Bakker ( http://twitter.com/Jason_Bakker )

Engine:
Flashpunk

IDE:
Flashdevelop

Tools:
GIMP 2
Ogmo Editor
SFXR
Audacity

entries.title: Hungry Ants
entries.description:
This is a Survival Game! In the tiny world of Ants.

There is a instruction button "?" whith all you need to know, if you are struck feel free to post i will reply!

In order to get more ants move the eggs that queens spawn(a pointer will appear when u move your mouse) to an egg room, after 30 sec a worker ant or a larva will spawn. Larvas need to be places in a Larva room in order to hatch! 

Get in, build your Nest and figth exterior creatures, you have a 7 minutes free of enemies, get a little army before madness starts!

Only Work in Google Chrome and Firefox!!  (It won't work in IE!!)

Save / Load Game NOT WORKING (Will fix later i prefered it to work :P)

entries.title: Lord Deadrock's Adventures
entries.description:
Hey!

Here's my entry.

Controls:
Arrow Keys to move
Space to jump
C to collect


I'm solo if you don't count lizards!
I was going for the compo but i didn't know base as to be shared before start. No Problem here i come to the jam!

I'n Lord DeadRock adventures you are Lord Deadrock, a proud british explorator lost in the jungle
// If the cutscene would be implemented you would see him and his hand Lance flying in a baloon over the jungle until a parrot  sudenly pierse it badly (yeah). DeadRock has fall alone in the jungle... //

The goal of the game is to catch the maximum species you can in each levels (if there was more than one :)) and make your way into the jungle.

Enjoy!

Sorry for nosound stupid conversion problem inextremis..
Same for UI navigation i got it but not in time.

entries.title: Oh No, Tiny Rover!
entries.description:
This has been awesome!  I built a game in 48 hours, and it plays great!

You play as a little rover guarding a tiny planet from invading alien ships.  There is no score, just stay alive as long as you can.

I built the project in a custom engine I wrote in C++ and LUA using OpenGL, OpenAL, and GLFW.

I have some posts about the development on my blog at : http://blog.decultured.com

entries.title: Pixel Wars
entries.description:
USE THE MOUSE!

First I tried a platformer where the player can shrink whatever he wants. It was the first time I used Flashpunk, so I got in trouble learning all of that. Also, there seems to be no scaling in Flashpunk, which is why my game concept did not become a game.

Then I decided to switch to this. Made in about 12 hours. D:

entries.title: Planet X Diamond Defender
entries.description:
This game is like an RPG tower defence
Defend Planet X's diamond as long as you can.
Use the mouse to control units and attack the aliens.
Not much of a game but W.E. ran out of time >.> 

Not much else...didn't get time to finish. I hope the hard work shows... No sound BTW.

BTW source is really messy..

Source is in the ZIP

entries.title: Poor Pluto
entries.description: Whipped this up in 8 hours after giving up on my Plan A game last night. Pretty simple and lacks polish. Hope it's a bit of fun though.

entries.title: Stage 2 Chaos
entries.description:
WASD or arrow keys to move. H to heal health if you have health potions, M to heal mana if you have mana potions.

1 to use the mana to health skill if you have it.
2 to use the health to mana skill if you have it.

If a world is generated in such a way that you are stuck, press R to generate a new one. And if you want press N to skip the cutscenes.

This was a bit rushed, so the different classes don't do anything. And I'm not sure how possible this is, but have fun anyways!

I am planing on continuing to work on this and I have a lot of ideas for it. Some of my ideas are a more friendly interface, better level generation, different types of maps, more classes (and they would be played differently), and randomly generated dungeons. I hope to rewrite this in java so that it will run on more platforms.

My twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/skyboy49707

entries.title: The Last Ride Home
entries.description:
It's a driving game where you have to outrun the exploding world to make it to the next world.

Each world gets harder, faster, and more narrow.

Sound only works in chrome browser.

entries.title: Three Trials
entries.description:
A man on a flying vessel makes unwanted stop on a small planetoid.

DISCLAIMER:
I have used 3rd party music. Please put N/A for the music's rating.
But the sound FX are all mine.

entries.title: Tiny Defender
entries.description:
So here it is, my LD23 Compo entry. Man am I glad this is over! LOL! I learned so much making this game. I hope you all enjoy it.

The premise is this. Viruses have infected humans and being the adventurous scientist you are, you devised a way to eradicate them. You built a special submarine, which when shrunken to microscopic size, will be injected into the infected human. You'll maneuver your sub through the blood stream, and fire your specialized laser, which you also created, kill all viruses you come into contact with. You'll need to fly through the whole body to make sure you get them all. 

Good Luck to all who dare enter this Tiny World!


Arrow Keys to move
Space to fire
M to mute music 
U to unmute music

Easy Mode - Red Blood Cells will not hurt you. Those are the bright red diamond-looking things.

Hard Mode - Red Blood Cells WILL hurt you.

Feedback is always welcomed!


Note:I'm no beethoven, so don't expect good music lol. It worked in a pinch though. Recommend muting music. You have been warned *giggle*

Note 2: It has come to my attention that there are 2 bugs in my game. The first one is when you die and restart the game your instantly killed. The second one deals with starting the game in hard mode and instantly dying. I have fixed these in my offline version but can't upload it to be judged. So I will tell you work arounds for them. 

The first one is easy, if you get to the game over screen that tells you that you lost, just close the browser and open it again.

For the second one, when you choose 2 for hard mode make sure you press x before any of the bright red blood cells are down near the bottom of the screen.

I really can't believe I missed those in my play testing.
 
Note 3: Uploaded a bugfix version. 
- Fixed Hard Mode Insta-death
- Fixed Starting the game again after losing
- Added Auto-Fire

entries.title: Tiny God wants a Bigger World
entries.description:
You are Tiny God, Lord of a Tiny World. But you want it to be bigger! 
Create and modify land with left/right mouse buttons. If you create a good soil, after a while it will be covered in grass. After another while trees start to grow!
Black dots are your followers. They cut down trees, When one of them collects 3 trees, he builds a statue for you. Statues (purple dots) allow you to create more land! (and can even increase your powers sometimes)
But there are also evil beasts (red dots), which can destroy statues and eat humans. 
Cover 50% of the world with land, before they kill all your followers!
(and remember that beasts move much slower in water...)

Post-compo version works much faster, try it if the compo one crashes/works too slow on your comp!

Created by Przemek Muller (@thotep)

entries.title: Tiny Paradise
entries.description:
Watch your tiny islanders work, sleep and just stroll around. Guide them to gather food and prevent the little family from starvation!

Drag and drop flags to create jobs. One inhabitant will take the job. It's one worker per flag. Place a "bow" flag next to a tree to hunt (for squirrels :D) and a "fish" flag at the shore to... well, fish.

Time went by so fast. It's been huge fun. But, the game was too ambitious. I couldn't include some of the elementary functionality, like love + breeding. I decided to submit nevertheless. Should have started with gameplay instead of graphics, as always.

The graphics are made solely by code. Everything is just arcs, rectangles and lines. I'd really need some tool for that, took a hell lot of time -.-

It's really more of an ant farm watching experience. Still, enjoy!

entries.title: Tiny Shipping
entries.description: Shipping on a little planet.

entries.title: Tiny Sword
entries.description: You play as a small, red cube guy. The town has been overrun by an army of skeletons controlled by a wizard, you must bring the wizard to justice and take his treasure.

entries.title: Alice and Bob's tiny cubic planet
entries.description:
Here is my first game for Ludum Dare:

Alice and Bob's tiny cubic planet.

Alice and Bob live happily on a tiny cubic planet...
... but then a volcano erupted and they've got separated by each other!
Help them to fnd their way back to each other!

Controls:
Arrow keys to walk. Escape to quit the game. Other keys are described during the game.

Windows Version:
You might need the Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable Package, which you can download here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=29

Timelapse video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X1PmrKgocWY

New, improved versions (The links above point to the original versions):

* Python(Pygame): http://kch42.de/ld-23/abtcp-improved.zip
* Source: http://kch42.de/ld-23/ld-23-improved.zip
* Windows: http://kch42.de/ld-23/abtcp-improved-win32.zip

entries.title: Another Kind of World
entries.description:
Zimboy is a little guy who has found himself in a strange world of bugs and bombs. Help him find the way home.

Windows and Mac-version are up. If you are on linux you can use the .love -file together with the love2d engine (www.love2d.org)

entries.title: Arnold Bros (est. 1905)
entries.description:
LD48: Original version of the game, 320x240 window size.
v_01: Update with a scale zoom and some fixes in initialization code. I mantained the gameplay and graphics at it's original state. 

You are a little gnome living in a big mall. Elders have chosen you to cross the haberdashery section and find a mysterious cube which has fallen from Space.

There are very few files in the source code, but most of the game is data driven.

entries.title: Asteroid Belt
entries.description:
You play as a man fed up of living on an asteroid, find your way to the edge
of the asteroid belt, and to a real planet.

I originally had a much grander game in mind, but then I hit some problems and couldn't get it finished in time, so instead I ripped it down to a simple game to get something submitted. Check the about page for more about what I was aiming for.
What was implemented is mainly just commented out and left unused.

Note the builds are untested off my own machines, they should work, but let me know if not.

entries.title: Bad Neighbors
entries.description:
Defend your tiny little home world against your aggressive neighbors. Click the satellites to upgrade their fire rate, damage, and the number of times the laser bounces targets.

Its not fully implemented and there are plenty of bugs, but I'm happy for my first real project with Unity. Cant wait for the next jam.

entries.title: Bellerophon
entries.description: Use WASD to shoot and arrows to move Bellerophon around:)

entries.title: CastleMania
entries.description:
You must kill all the enemies by launching  an ax.
Be carefull, your weapon can kill you during its fall.

A,D keys or Left/Right arrows to move
W key, Up arrow or space key to shoot axes.

Warning: If the WebGL version does not work, it means you have a too old navigator or graphic card. Use Chrome or FireFox, not IE. If it is still not working, try the Java Applet.

entries.title: Little Sheep
entries.description:
Little Sheep is about a sheep living alone on a very small world, until he meets a migrating goose...

Unzip the archive and launch littleSheep.jar to start the game. 
Playthrough is about 10 minutes long, with three different "endings" ("end states" may be more appropriate).

The tools and libraries used are:
_ Java / Slick2D
_ Tiled to create the maps
_ Paint.net and Gimp for the sprites and tiles
_ Bfxr and LMMS for the sound and music

I created this with a friend (he did the art/music and I did the coding). This was both our first game, and a very instructing one. What we would have improved with more time/experience:
_ Put a few more elements in the storyline
_ Use the paths tool in Gimp instead of Paint.net's curved lines
_ Improve the bass line in the music

An updated version is available, which fixes framerate issues on the third world, a collision bug, compatibility issues with MacOS/linux and some typos.

entries.title: Lost Lapootah
entries.description:
Rescue Lapootah use the cursors to move and the space bar to navigate (sail ho!) 
Thanks for watch at least. :)

entries.title: Microcosm
entries.description: This is a pretty simple 8-bit style puzzle game I started on Saturday night.  Only controls are mouse and spacebar, along with shift to mute/unmute.

entries.title: Planet ZOOB
entries.description:
Planet ZOOB is a dizzying musical auto-shooter set on a tiny world!  The artwork and name are inspired by my childhood drawings.  I went for a minimalist design, so the game features almost no text or instructions, you should be able to figure out the rules.  Press Esc to quit when you're done.  I hope you enjoy playing it as much as I've enjoyed making it, this is my first ever Ludum Dare!  Post your best score in the comments and I'll put the top ten scores in the description!  :)

Developer's High Score: 254

High Scores:
189 - chambers
106 - bitbof
105 - Jezzamon
98 - MadGnomeGamer
97 - demonpants
92 - YMM
85 - Werxzy
56 - SonnyBone
51 - Catman
18 - Riccardo Stucchi

Tools Used:
Game Maker 8.1 Pro
LateralGM
GM4Mac
MS Paint
LittleSound DJ
Audacity
sfxr

Check out my website at www.pacifistgames.com
my twitter at twitter.com/pacifistgames
and my facebook at facebook.com/pacifistgames
Mobile version coming soon!

entries.title: Microscopia
entries.description:
Stencyl, Photoshop, GarageBand, Audacity and bfxr. 

My first time making a game! This was a blast!

entries.title: Quest For Matter
entries.description:
In order to play the game, simply download it, extract everything from the zip-archive and run "Quest For Matter.jar" in the QuestForMatter folder. Sometimes a folder named "MAC_OS" or something like that is included. I don't know why, but I'm guessing it has to do with the fact that I compressed the folder in Mac OS X. However, this folder does not seem to serve a purpose and everything needed for the game should be included in the QuestForMatter folder.

(Copied from the included README file:)

Quest For Matter
Made by Emanuel Gedin for Ludum Dare 23.
Theme: Tiny World

Instructions:
Control the yellow particle and collect green matter while avoiding the red matter.

Controls:
Use W, A, S, D or the arrow keys to move.
Hold LShift to move faster.
Press SPACE at the gameover-screen to restart.
Press ESC to quit the game.
Press CTRL + F to toggle fullscreen mode.

The game and source code is available for download for free, however, I would appreciate if the game and source code is not redistributed for commercial purposes.

The game is written in java using LWJGL(Light Weight Java Game Library) and slick-util. Resources for the game are made in Adobe Photoshop Elements and sfxr.

Most of the code was written during the competition, however, I copied some of the basic code from my earlier projects. This base code is mainly found in:
ld23.game.Game (setup code)
ld23.game.Input
ld23.player.Camera
ld23.sound.SoundEffect

entries.title: Rat Conquest
entries.description:
Java-Applet

My first game and my first Ludum Dare ;) Thanks for playing!

Tools used: 
- Paint.Net + Animation-Plugin
- Bfxr / Aviary Music Creator (http://advanced.aviary.com/)
- Eclipse / Java 1.6

The game:
- Arrow-Keys to move
- You can grow, if you eat, but you can only eat enemies of your size

entries.title: sailboatboatboat
entries.description: A rogue-like with boats and pirates and fishing and stuff.

entries.title: Startrash Galaxy
entries.description:
I only had 8.5 hours of time. :(
-Not finished, but should be fully playable.
-Source code is in GLBasic. Not very well documented, though.

--- BRIEF ---
Aim:
  Find the key, go to the door.
  
Controls:
  Click in the direction where you want to move one step.
  Optionally try the cursor keys.
  
More:
  There's a README.TXT!

*** STORY ***
You're a ball - don't ask why XD - and have been locked into a tiny world (theme, see!)
by a mad wizard that cast a spell on you so you can't stop bouncing. With this bouncing
energy you create on the tiny world (theme again, so full points, K?), the wizard charges
a super electro buzzer that will directly hit the ludumdare.com server, making everyone
be unable to submit their compo entry in time!

The only chance to stop him is to find the enchanted key that locks the door to the exit.

The game is inspired by the Amiga/AtariST,C64 game "Startrash" that no one will be aware of.

entries.title: The Amazing Atom
entries.description:
Enjoy effecting objects on an atomic level in this First Person Puzzle Solver. Created using Blender, Unity3d, Abelton Live, Photoshop, Coffee, Sweat, and Google.

http://hashtagnerd.com/the-amazing-atom-ludum-dare/

Justin: Coding, Level Design, and Music
Phil: Modeling and Textures

entries.title: The Battle Of Tiny Earth
entries.description:
Plot and controls are in the console window, My code for this entry is not exactly neat, but it's done, it will do.

If anyone has any problems playing it, please, comment with the problem, and I will try to fix it!

entries.title: Tiny World Racer
entries.description:
Race around the rings of Tiny Planet!

note: i made this in VS express, so you may need the vs redistributable installed to run it.  
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555

Credits:
Jade: code & design
Kinoko: art & design
Abrisene: music [credited as Presage in game - i forgot he's going by Abrisene now and i don't have time to resubmit]

This game supports LAN multiplayer - see Readme included in the zip for details.

The game will track your laps and position, and prompt you to reset when you drift off of the track.
The track is algorithmically generated, so if you don't like the shape you're given, feel free to load it up again for a new variation.

This game also features configurable controls, so you can play using a controller or joystick too!

Please report any bugs/feedback to us either here or at our journal entries. Winning is strongly encouraged! :)

known bugs: 
 - the detection of who is in the lead / who wins doesn't seem to work right.  It tells multiple people they've won.  
 - There is a tendency for the car to fall through particularly steep ramps.  
 - We've also noticed on network clients, a stack of phantom racers can build up at the start line between rounds, which can cause slowdown.
 - The chat shows up in the top of the screen in the lobby, which overlaps the server start button.

Get the latest version here:
--->  http://www.alchemyprodigy.net/worldrace.php  <---

- Jade & Kinoko

entries.title: tiny world war
entries.description:
Play with up to 4 players in nostalgic tank combat (remember the good old days when you drove a tank?).

Relive all the excitement of your army days with four different weapons and two game modes (team battle and free for all).

When setting up your controls, you can use any combination of buttons on any keyboard or joystick.  If only you could plug in real tank controls, it would be perfect...

A note about the controls:  Controls are naturally mapped, so "left" makes your tank go left, etc.  To facilitate hiding among allies, your tank is unidentified.  Part of the fun is figuring out which tank you are and which tank your target is.  War is messy.

entries.title: Tiny Worlds
entries.description:
Tiny Worlds

The objective of the game is to score as much points as possible by shooting a bomb at other worlds. However, you can use gravity to increase your score.

But watch out! hitting your own planet could be disastrous!

Tools I used:-
- Eclipse / Java
- Otomata
- Bfxr
- Audacity
- aseprite
- libgdx
- Chronolapse

You can view a timelapse of the developments at:
Day 1 - 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5AoE6gfmxkE

Day 2 -
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fCsVQSkWjr4

Game is compiled into a Runnable JAR, so it should work on all platforms

Final Notes
------------
This is my first Ludum Dare attempt, and I found it very exciting.
I spent a total 23 hours developing the game, with 2 hours of those in a panic stage where I had no ideas for the theme.

Good Luck Everyone!

entries.title: Too Big For This World
entries.description:
My first attempt at Ludum Dare. I spent too much time fixing my engine so the game is kind of basic, there are no levels it is just a go as far as you can (distance tracked in top right). Difficulty increases as you get further.

Instead of a tiny planet, its a world where everything is tiny. The tiny inhabitants of the planet (apart from some allies) try to kill you because they think you (being normal sized) are a monster.

If you dont have .NET or XNA the exe version wont work. Either use the installer version or download them here:
XNA - http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.Net - http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=17113

Thank you for checking out my game and I hope it was worth it.

Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BtTDWP71eVo

entries.title: Untitled, So Far
entries.description:
Started off as a Yume Nikki fangame. Didn't turn out as I had hoped.

Arrow keys to move 
Z/Enter to confirm/examime
X/Escape to bring up menu/cancel
F4/Alt + Enter to switch between Windowed/Fullscreen. Windowed should reduce any flickering.

If you get stuck, just keep examining things and then use the bed. Things will change when you sleep.

The game really gets going after you leave the house, so try and stick with it until then! I know it's rude to ask. 
There's probably a lot of bugs so please let me know if you find any!

Made in RPG Maker 2003. Sounds in bxfr and audacity.

entries.title: When Worlds Collide
entries.description:
Objective of the game is to destroy the 'Tiny World'!

Game is an old-school arcade style action/score
game, when you have to try and do as much destruction
to the planet as possible before the timer runs out.
Complete with old-school start menu and score screen.

Special powers are:
* Comet storm : Unleash a deadly storm of comets.
* Vaporize : Melt away the different layers of the world

You can use the W,A,S,D keys to accelerate and rotate the
camera, but it is not essential to the gameplay.


YouTube Video showing features:
http://youtu.be/405WskSHbm4


Author:  AlwaysGeeky
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/alwaysgeeky
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/alwaysgeeky
LD:      http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/alwaysgeeky/


NOTE : If you get an assert message, it means you graphics
card doesn't support the pixel and vertex shaders. See the
2nd comment posted below for a solution.

entries.title: Apocalypse Inc.
entries.description:
a small planet is being menaced by alien pirates, and only Apocalypse Inc. has the tools/style to help.

WASD - move
left mouse - shoot
scroll wheel - change weapon
right mouse - open build menu

fight the aliens, build/protect your base, and rescue the natives. 

ran into some problems early on with this one, so there are a lot of features that are blatantly missing here. the most major feature left out is a display for how much each building costs

health mill :: 5,000
money dispenser :: 10,000
turret :: 2,500
little person factory :: 10,000
escape rocket :: 7,500

follow me on twitter or keep an eye on my website if you'd like to know when the finished version of this will be released.

https://twitter.com/#!/zak_ayles
http://helvetica-standard.blogspot.com/

links.label: Please read the description before playing!!

entries.title: Aquarium Adventure
entries.description:
Aquarium Adventure is a short foray into the minds of sweet aquatic fishies. What are their thoughts? What makes them tick? Find out first-fin (sorry) in this game.

CONTROLS: WASD/arrows to move horizontally. CTRL to descend, SPACE to ascend. Mouse looks.

There is no "END" in the sense of a "you win screen". The game offers the following:
* find and interact with two characters
* a quest!!

Built in Unity.
"Models" built in 3ds Max (I chickened out of using Blender).
All textures made by hand in Photoshop or photographed by me (photos available in source pack). Taken Saturday and Sunday.
Music with Musagi!
The single sfx was foley recorded this morning.

entries.title: Chip Wars
entries.description:
A game about putting down chips on a PCB in order to combat the holographic minions.

Didn't get it as finished as I would like, but I got finished enough.

I'm still inspired by the concept. If it gets a lot of comments, I'll keep working on it. :D

entries.title: Even Tiny Worlds...
entries.description:
A game about evasion. 

Something of an homage to Toe Jam and Earl, this is an autogenerated game with tenacious enemies. Big worlds, tiny worlds, all colliding!

This is a browser game, best seen in Chrome.

entries.title: Immune
entries.description:
Play as your immune system and try to keep from getting sick. 

Works best in Chrome.

Source: https://github.com/doowttam/ld23-immune

entries.title: Inside My Radio
entries.description:
Hi there ! 
Here's our entry for the jam competition.

It is called "Inside my radio".  
In this game you play the guy who's in charge to keep the rhythm in a boombox.
All the moves you perform must be synchronized with the tempo of the music.

The game was made with game maker.

For this LD (and probably for the next ones as well) TurboDindon has recruted an awesome musician.
So put your headphones on!

Note: As the game is based on the rhythm it can be quite challenging. Press F1 to display a visual gauge if you experience some difficulties :)

The TurboDindon team : 

Vincent Filipiak --> Art 
Joachim Neuville --> Sounds and Music
Baptiste Martin and Jerome Fait --> Game/Level Design and scripting

Hope you'll enjoy the game.

Bisous

TurboDindon

entries.title: Junior's Car
entries.description:
Wow, that was fun! My very first LD-entry. It's a racing game taking place on YOUR desk! Also has some form of story..
controls: arrow key +space

Tools I used:
-Game Maker 8.1 Pro
-GIMP (learned some new tricks today!)
-sfxr
-autotracker-bu + schismtracker
-audacity

entries.title: Killer the Ant
entries.description: My first time using Action Script and my first time making a game. Oh, and first Ludum Dare. Enjoy!

entries.title: Laser Coin Planets
entries.description:
Collect all coins to win.  Avoid the black screen of death.

The "bugfix" version plays exactly the same, but fixes keyboard handling and WebGL buffer allocations.

Based on HTML5, WebGL and JavaScript.  Almost certainly works in Chrome if your graphics card drivers can support WebGL.

Controls:

  A - Move left
  D - Move right
  W - Use teleport
  Space - Jump, double-jump
  Mouse - Aim and shoot laser
  F - Shoot laser

Just to be clear: Avoid the exploding things that make your screen go dark.

entries.title: MacroPong
entries.description:
Now it's time to enjoy all the glory of the traditional Pong in your amazing high definition monitor you're so proud of! 
MacroPong is a Pong game that uses every little pixel in your favorite monitor but the paddles and ball always remains at the same size.
WARNING: Regardless of which resolution your monitor is, THIS GAME IS HARD!!

Play with your mouse.

entries.title: Microbial
entries.description:
A strange cellular Action / Puzzle game - made in 47.9 hours :). Get your white blood cell to the tentacle-looking receptor to advance through the levels (40 total). Fight a big tumor at the end.

Built with XNA, BEPUphysics, Blender, FL studio, Audacity, and Photoshop.

More info / source code at: 

http://net-savant.com/ludumdare/

Tip for filthy cheaters: you can skip ahead a level with PageDown. 

[Update 1: Fixed a localization problem that kept people in some countries from starting the game. ]
[Update 2: If you get an empty "Level 1", use the "compatibility mode" .exe - it turns off hardware 3D model instancing which is not working on some graphics cards.]
[Update 3: Fixed occasional intermittent level-skipping bug. Current "Windows" download is fixed version. No gameplay changes, etc., rest is exactly the same as the original.]

entries.title: Nibbles
entries.description:
This is my first LD entry.

The game is probably not very unique like it is. But, a lot of the code is setup for my primary idea... which I think is mostly unique.

The idea that I wanted to do is that as you kill enemies you level up and gain more bits. You store programs in your memory bank. Some take up a single bit and others more. You have four to start with. I was hopefully going to make these programs item drops from the mobs. In fact the mobs are setup very similarly and have a random set of programs that fit into their memory (which has the same size as yours if you're at the same level). 

I didn't get to do everything I wanted. Here's the short list:
1) enemies need to attack back
2) inventory to hold dropped algorithms
3) the ability to reflash your memory...

The code is fairly close to having everything work together, and I'll probably finish it in the near future.

Here is the list of the current programs (many of which are implemented, but you can't change which ones you use).

Aesthetic Programs:
ChangeShape
ChangeColor (Note: the random colors of mobs! They look particularly good for no good reason.)

Stat Programs:
SpeedBoost
SightBoost
ArmorBoost
AttackBoost
HealthBoost
AttackRangeBoost

Specialized Programs
DetectSight
ElementalAttack
RangedAttack (Note: I imagine that as this grew that I'd have to live with the fact that all attacks are ranged and remove this is a special.)
PoisonAttack
SplashAttack

If I end up doing more work I'll add an extra link in the description as to not mix it up with the entry itself.

entries.title: Pollinate
entries.description: A puzzle game where you must collect flowers by going through a variety of puzzles and then breed them to collect every kind.

entries.title: Seclude
entries.description: Made using Twine. Hope you enjoy. I know it is quite short, I tried to make the best use of the very short amount of time I had!

entries.title: Seeds Of Destruction
entries.description: You must finish a new seedling before all the soil nutrients are used up.  Use your launch pod to destroy the hostile seeds before they can land and deplete the soil.

entries.title: Submarine: This Ain't Your Momma's Bathtub, Tovarisch
entries.description:
The Soviet-American cold war wage spiraled out of control. Both sides take insane risks to prevail in indirect conflict, seeking out all manner of myths and legends to find that last advantage.

Krakens! Bears! More Krakens! Pirates! Food! All in the shining new game from the shining new team.

Join the brave comrades of a Soviet Submarine seeking a legend in the deeps. Lead by an insane Captain and crewed by misanthropes and eccentrics. Fight to stay alive in a tiny world under the ocean!

Oh, and you get to watch old men wrestle bears (maybe).

To the death!


Advice: you can press "N" on your keyboard to end the turn, and "1"-"4" to select sailors. If you get lost, check the "About" screen which gives some gameplay information.

Suggestion: in case you are replaying the game and would like to skip all the reading, you can disable interlude events in the "Options screen" - select "Turn text events off".

Linux/Mac users: Be sure to get the version from Mac\Linux link as it includes the important fix for the launch script (courtesy of youdonotexist).

entries.title: Super Orbit Worlds
entries.description:
Welcome to my Ludumdare#23 entry page.

"The universe is starting to get more and more dangerous. Meteors are running rampant and it's up to you to save the remaining small worlds." 

The worlds will orbit around your mouse so keep them safe from the meteors. Having multiple worlds/ Moving quickly will multiply your score. Good luck!

Made using Flixel, Flashdevelop, SFXR, Paint.net and Autotracker-BU.

entries.title: The Tourist
entries.description:
Every person belongs to their own personal universe. Through our lives, we are explorers, seeking out and defining ourselves. "The Tourist" is a game about how we form our individual world.

If you're having trouble getting started, try clearing out an open area around where you begin.

entries.title: Tiny Adventures In SPACE
entries.description:
You must guide a creature from a tiny planet on his quest to explore the galaxy!

Sound effects, but no music. Maybe in an update...

Fun Note #1:
I had the 'interest' idea from the beginning, but didn't know what to do with it. I figured something out with ~14 hours left.

Fun Note #2:
All sound effects were recorded, not generated. Most of them were made by my mouth.


Made in Actionscript using FlashPunk and FlashDevelop.

Post-compo version will be updated as stuff happens.

entries.title: Tiny crap
entries.description:
The name says it all.

WASD/arrow keys, space bar and escape for controls.

I'm sorry. :)

entries.title: Tiny Flat
entries.description:
It's a SCUMM-like game (point and click)
So, you have to click on object and talk with characters.

No need to install.
Just extract RAR, and open "LD-23_Tiny_world.v1.0.0.4.exe"

Tip (LINUX) : Try through WINE emulator - http://www.winehq.org/

Dev:
Built with AGS - Adventure Game Studio
http://www.adventuregamestudio.co.uk/

Thanks for playing ;)

Post-Mortem :
+ added few dialogs who made some difference.
+ translation version : english / french
+ setup file, to define display parameters (check Help link)

Francais :
Trouvez le jeu traduit integralement avec la version "Post-Mortem"

entries.title: Tiny Word
entries.description:
Defend your Planet against the enemies!
Kill the aliens!
From the smallest to the largest!
-- 
Built with Processing - http://www.processing.org
--
Incomplete... 
Just 5 hours of work...

entries.title: Wunderworld
entries.description:
"Wunderworld" is more a toy than a real game. Make your own adventure, within a tiny dungeon!

==========

BEWARE: The webplayer version will save your levels in the registry (under Windows at least). With the standalone, you can trade levels with your friends (levels are saved in the "levels" folder within the data folder)!

==========

Controls Edit Mode:
WASD/RMB/ScrollWheel - Movement
Q/E - Change Slice
LeftClick - Edit
RightClick - Pick Template
T - Test Level
F5/F8 - Quicksave/load

Controls Game Mode:
WASD/Mouse - Movement
LeftClick - Attack
Space - Jump
T - Stop Test

Tip: Don't make levels larger than 20x20x20 or so, this version is highly unoptimized.

==========

UPDATE: I uploaded an updated version on Kongregate (see above), so the Mac mouse movement is fixed in there, it has a preset level, and you can delete a level now. Also stairs and lava were added. UPDATE2: The Kongregate version now has the option to share a level with your friends! Please try it out and post a level in the comments. ;-)

entries.title: Zephyr
entries.description:
Use your fan to guide the forest sprites to the flowers.
Don't let them fall off the bottom of the screen, and watch out for beetles!

entries.title: 25 Rooms
entries.description:
Welcome to the tiny arena of 25 rooms ; )
Your objective is to chase your enemy. He knows always where you are but the opposite is not true!
Throughout the game supplies spawn that will help you achieve your goal.

Extra Note: If you experience flickering on Macs while using the applet you have two options:
1) Downloading the game gives you a framed version.
2) Like Jezzamon stated beneath: "However, it is possible to run this version on a mac. If you hold SHIFT and COMMAND, then the borders of a window appear around the applet. Clicking on that then brings the app into a separate window (ie a frame), which doesn't have the flickering problem."

Notes: I have been ill over the weekend and had to rest very often so it did not work out as much as I wanted. But concerning this I'm very pleased with my output :)

Requires an installed Java Runtime Environment of at least version 1.6.

Edit: Your enemy looks like a little devil to not get confused ; )

entries.title: A day in your Life
entries.description:
R-Key to reset
Arrows or WASD to move (your choice) :)
SPACE for actions
Don't let your hunger or warmth hit zero!
Enjoy A day in your Life :)

I believe in you all!

All actions you do cause something to happen so be sure to check out all of the corners of the map. Goodluck! 


Added a walkthrough in case anyone really really wants to complete it but just can't. :)

entries.title: C:\ Infected
entries.description:
Written in Java; jdk7 so I'm not guaranteeing that it'll run on 1.6 or lower.

No guarantees for it working on Linux/Mac only tested windows.

Instructions are in the .zip file for each OS. READ THEM.

Press space to start, press space to restart.

entries.title: Escape From Dungeons
entries.description:
*************************************
LUDUM DARE 23 COMPO 
48h Game Developed with GLBasic  
DEVELOPED BY Paolo 'Neurox66' Borzini
*************************************
"Escape From Dungeon Planet" is a 3D maze 
developed for the Ludum Dare 23 compo.
I've used GLBasic and wrote in 4 hours!

Thanks for playing! 
www.borzini.it | @Neurox66 (Twitter)

entries.title: HMS Imahara
entries.description:
After years of travel, the HMS Imahara is hit by an alien vessel. They come with no good intentions. Can the crewmembers find their way to the escape pods, before suffocating or being eaten?

HMS Imahara is a turnbased tactical game with abstract graphics. The game consists of a single spaceship and its 76 rooms and shafts.

Controls: 
Arrow Keys to move crewmembers,
WASD to move camera,
EQ to zoom in/out,
Space to confirm,
Escape to quit the game.

entries.title: Little Sky....
entries.description:
"Little Sky..." by Davi Santos

Timelapse video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BE1giHECDpU

Gameplay video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CkjDsjLYnnw

To Run:
     Unrar and execute LittleSky.exe

Controls:
Left and Right keys: Move the character.
             Up key: Jump
              Mouse: Interact with the on-screen buttons

Cheats:
  Hold "Space" and click on the "Create Cube" to create a more resilient cube.

Webplayer added, but it was not tested. If you have any problem with it, try the windows versions. If the the windows versions has the same problem, it's a bug in the game :D.. LOL

entries.title: Mr Cool
entries.description:
Play a Snowman in a fast plattformer, avoid fire trolls, open doors with keys

Tested with FF, IE9, Chrome, Opera
Best with Chrome or Opera
IE9 tends to lag and has no sound

Safari lags heavily under windows, no idea of Mac, though

entries.title: Narrow
entries.description:
Narrow - 

You're a black box. You love to travel around world enjoying land. However the world is not big enough. Let's walk as much as possible and score points before this place be filled.

Control: Arrow Keys only.

HowTo: Move to score points, diagonal one will gain lot. Population growth shows interval between arrival of boxes. Box frame act as indicator before real box come.

Note: on applet sometimes you need to reload twice, or it takes long time to load. I made it roughly from desktop one so please don't press exit on applet.

entries.title: Petri
entries.description:
"Petri" - the scientific misadventures of a small blob. Or maybe not?
Instructions:
* Left mouse button - move your character
* R - restart a current map
You'll get hang of it pretty quickly.

This game is Windows only. It's best played in fullscreen. All of the sounds have been recorded by me. Music tracks have been created on my keyboard Yamaha PSR-1500 ( my best pal. Say hi! ).

The game is written in C++ and uses HGE engine. Type it in Google and you'll find it immediately. Unfortunately I didn't think of creating my own framework before a compo. That resulted in a rather hectic creation process - that's why my source code is so messy. Sorry for that!

It's also worth mentioning that it's my first LD entry ever. And it's my first game I've ever finished as well. Turns out you have to have a deadline for a game to get completed.The point is, don't be too harsh on me when commenting - that's all I suppose.

I wonder what did I forget to mention? Anyways, have fun. Cheers!

entries.title: Redbeard the Borrower
entries.description:
Ryan and Jon of Stone Monkey Studios present this hand-crafted adventure starring the brave borrower Redbeard. Antagonize the human scum and drive them from your home.

All of the content was created by the two of us within the 72 hour competition period with one exception: a few of the icons we used were created by Lorc (links included at the bottom to the Reddit thread and OpenGameArt.org sources). Big thanks to him, and a big thanks to you for playing!

After taking some of your feedback, we have also released updated builds of the game on our website. These builds represent the game as it was meant to be played (but are officially not part of the competition-- they are meant only for personal enjoyment :P).

Fixes included in the updated versions:
-Added joystick support for Windows and Mac.
-Updated the splash screen with scripted visuals and information on the new control schemes.
-Changed the player camera!
-Human AI fixes (now the detection ray is cast from the head and he can no longer spot the character out of his buttocks). 

Controls:
Move with WASD.
Run with Shift (slight speed boost) 
Click on sparkling objects to perform actions with them.

Postmortem link:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/24/redbeard-the-borrower-postmortem/

Lorc's Icon set:
http://www.reddit.com/r/IndieGaming/comments/ifmie/i_made_700_rpg_icons_free_for_use_for_your_game/
http://opengameart.org/content/700-rpg-icons

entries.title: Rush Hour
entries.description:
Try to fly to the top of the screen whilst avoiding the traffic.

- Move with the arrow keys.
- Use Z or X to break (If you are level 2 in control.)
- Collect fuel to fly longer.
- Collect stars to get money.
- Avoid other vehicles.

entries.title: Super Strict Farmer
entries.description:
YOUR GOAL
You have 12 rounds to accumulate more victory points than your opponent. At the end of the game you receive victory points for extra cattles, sheeps, grain and food

USING ACTION SPACE
On your turn, you can use your blue farmers on various action space, you start the game with 2x farmers wich mean you can perform 2x actions each round.

FEEDING YOUR FARMERS
At the end of the round you must feed your farmers, they consume one food each. If you have no food, farmers eat grain. If no grain they will eat victory points. If no victory points, your farmer will die.

BUILDING STUFF !
If you collect enough ressources you will be able to use the workshop action space. Choose one card and the building will be added to your territory. Some Building have special power, or have victory point value.

EXTEND YOUR FAMILY
If you start a round with at least one empty house, you will gain one new farmer. So build a third house as soon as you can ! You need 3x woods and 1x grain for this !

PLOW FIELDS
You need fields to keep animals or to sow grains

entries.title: Tiny Galaxy
entries.description:
v_00 is the original entry uploaded before the competition deadline. 
v_02 adds restarting after death - no more permadeath! This was finished after the competition but includes a minor gameplay change that makes the game much more enjoyable.

Comments
========

A bright cube based game with platformer and puzzle solving elements. A bit like Zelda! The goal it to find the 6 hidden artifacts for everlasting happiness by exploring the other tiny worlds... use your computer terminal to gain the power to steer your tiny homeworld around!

Windows only. No installer required. There is no audio. To play unzip and then run latest\exe_client.exe
WASD to move and steer your homeworld and SPACE to jump. 
Left mouse button to interact - usually when close to the object.
Keys can be remapped and mouse invert changed in the menus.

Cheat Sheet
===========

For anyone stuck on finding the next item or artifact take a look at the SPOILER sheets above!

========================

Bugfix - now you can't use the teleporter pads until you've found the teleporter (!)
Bugfix - graphics anomalies that occasionally appear at edges of worlds gone
Bugfix - very rare getting stuck when falling out the bottom of the world fixed
Gameplay change - fixed sequence break artifact collection on one of the asteroids
Gameplay change - renamed one world from "grass" to "prison"

========================

Gameplay change - removed permandeath based on feedback below.

entries.title: Equanimity
entries.description:
Equanimity
by HD408
for LD48#23
in 2012

Release info:

Made in 40 hours approx. (with 8-10hr sleep)
Engine: Game Maker 8.0 Lite
Graphics: Paint.NET
Music: ModPlugTracker
Sound: SFXR


Controls:

Arrow Keys and WASD - Movement
Left Mouse Button - Shooting (consumes energy) and system expansion (see HOW TO in the game)
Right Mouse Button - Teleport to the cursor (needs full energy)


Story:

You are a hyperstellar being in control of some 10^9000 WTFmeters of matter, energy and whatever else, encapsulated in a spherical unit, floating in the middle of unknown aka the real world. Your "tiny" world is populated with a huge diversity of intelligent races (none of which are even important on this scale), who restore its power and integrity, as enigmatic alien structures of even greater sizes roam around and perpetually attack. Unit integrity and energy depend on the inner systems that collapse over time, weakening the inhabitants, and the whole defensive logic. Only you can expand the systems to fix this, but your fight with the universal enthropy will never end.

Your goal is to protect the unit for as long as possible, making your way through humanly unimaginable times and spaces. Your single step is thousands of years.

Equanimity.

P. S. Well, this game actually looks so much more like micro-world than macro-world. But wait, how can you tell?!

entries.title: No Space
entries.description:
IMPORTANT: Disconnect your gamepad before starting the game, please :)

In NO SPACE you play an astronaut who is kept enclosed by his own space ship. It travels to small planets and forces you to gather resources like helium and water. Both, the ship and you, need these resources to survive.

Dig your way through the planets and build conveyors to transport found resources to the ship. Luckily, the space ship creates a gravitation field so you can walk on the planet's surface.

Back in the ship, in your tiny room and prison, you upgrade your tools to better your mining skills - and maybe you will find a way to escape.


This is a XNA game.
If you haven't installed the XNA framework, here you can download it:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914


If something won't work (installing, starting, playing) please leave a comment here.

entries.title: Tiny Religion
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare, and I must admit I'm pretty happy with result. Most of what I had planned out to do has been done, and there's even the possibility of winning and losing!

Sadly there is no music however, I simply did not have the time to do it.

In any case, this game here is sort of a reverse god game, where your people want to please your god as much as possible. Everything you do is perceived differently by your god and it is up to you to learn what it likes and what it dislikes. Also, annoy your good too much and your people will die.

The game is text-based, and the way you learn what you can do is through the help command, and if you want to learn what you can do for a specific action, you use the "action" help command (so for instance, train help will tell you what you can train)


This is done in XNA and thus it only works on windows (sorry for all the other OS users, I simply do not know any other language than C#)
This requires both the .net framework 4.0, found here:

http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

and the XNA redistribuable, found here:

http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Before The Big Bang

I don't blame people for not sticking with it, as I coded the "ending" as a "for whoever really wants to" kind of thing, but I just thought I'd let people know that it's not impossible :)

TIME-LAPSE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ifwv0TAV5Aw

==========
Controls:
==========

Enter - Confirm in Menus
Escape - Pause/Exit Credits Screen

W,A,S,D - Move In-Game.
Space - Continue Dialogue/Exit Map
M - Toggle Music
E - View Map


=====
Info:
===== 
REQUREMENT: Latest Java Version

Calamity is my third Ludum Dare entry, but only my second solo. It represents a giant leap forward in my own technical programming skills since my first Ludum Dare in August 2011, and indeed in the last couple of months, too.
I was considering OpenGL for this comp, but I felt like I wasn't ~quite~ there yet.
Oddly enough I felt quite relaxed this comp, which is not the norm. I've enjoyed myself and had a lot of fun, and now I have ~1000 games to play and a new one of mine to share.


Thanks for playing my game, contact details below.
- Jonno Allcock, SevenSpace Games
- @jonnopon3000,  @SevenSpaceGames

entries.title: Leptogenesis
entries.description:
NOTE: This game requires XNA Framework Redistributable 4.0, which can be downloaded here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

=== DESCRIPTION ===

Play as leptons in the early and very small universe, battling antileptons for the dominance for all future! (reference: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leptogenesis_(physics) )

=== HOW TO PLAY ===

You play as the blue leptons and use the left mouse button to select and move the different leptons, use the right button to pan around the level. 

A lepton (blue) and its anti-lepton (yellowish green) will annihilate on contact (The exception is if the anti-leption is positioned on a spawner (orange square), then the lepton survives)

The goal is to annihilate all the anti-leptons while having at least one remaining lepton yourself! If there are any anti-leptons remaining without you having any of the normal lepton (for example if there are an antitau left, but you have no tau particles) the game is lost.

=== COMMENTS ===

There are only two levels, but they might give you the general idea of what this game is capable of!

Code, music and graphics by Karl Bristav

entries.title: Quest^3
entries.description:
Tips (Read if you're having a difficult time):
----------------------------------------------
-Potions can be (and always could be) used AT ANY TIME.
-Every item increases your fighting (and some fleeing) chance.
-In the beginning, your fighting chance will be 15% less than your fleeing chance.
-Fortresses and Towers are difficult, so be prepared (with potions) before you go.
-Massing potions, and deciding when to fight or flee are very important.
-Dying a few times is normal. If you really are completely lost, head for a Fortress to get your first item.

Theme Integration:
------------------
The whole 'Tiny World' theme is part of the fact that the cubic world is tiny, and that its basically on top of a Rubik's cube. This is just what came to mind when I thought of 'Tiny World'.

General Notes:
--------------
Instructions are in-game.
No sound. I didn't have enough time to generate and implement it as I actually just finished. :(

Development Notes:
------------------
-I didn't use any libraries really, I just used whatever is offered by HaXe (which is open-source).
-I did use some base code, though they were extremely simple . I actually ended up discarding most of them and rewriting them during the compo anyway.
-I used someone else's free-to-use font. There are no specifications with personal vs. commercial use, but here is the pool of fonts I got it from, and it's creator's profile: http://www.dafont.com/max.d967

Gameplay Notes:
---------------
-When the map moves, it always moves upward so you know what's next.
-More potions = not failing.
-Its not a very long game, and figuring out where the items are comes from exploring, really. The village shop will give you some hints after you buy <something> *hint hint*.
-It has been confirmed that the game is DIFFICULT, but not impossible! ;) Play the [Updated] version for a (hopefully) easier time.
-Be wary that if any bugs exist (I think I managed to pick up most, if not all of them :D), they will exist in both the [Updated] and [Original] version.
-I would really appreciate if you played the [Original] Web link first, primarily because that is what I believe I should be judged on. Not much difference exists except what's listed in Post-Compo Notes.

Post-Compo Notes:
------------
-Found out the Windows version is sort of due to some things I hadn't considered with compile targets. Opt to play the Web link rather than download the Windows version, at least for now.
-I took the comments below into consideration and made the game somewhat easier (I hope) in the [Updated] version.
-I made the text on the signs for OK and Yes/No lighter and easier to see.

entries.title: Stranded
entries.description:
After being recently awarded your spaceship pilot's license you set off to explore the galaxy only to come crashing down on an unknown alien planet. Can you survive long enough to repair your ship and escape?

This game was created by a team of four for the 72 hour jam. We were down to the wire but finally got there and are quite pleased with our results.

TEAM
Patrick Beasley - Programming, Art, Design
Andrew Beasley - Art, Design
Brendon Byrnes - Audio, Design
Luke Baird - Art, Design

PLATFORMS
The game has been tested on Windows, but should (untested) work in Linux and Mac OS/X as well.

CONTROLS
WASD, Arrow Keys, or Numeric Keypad to move.
Space, F, Ctrl, or Enter to shoot / skip dialog boxes.
Escape to return to the world map.

We welcome suggestions and bug reports. We may be doing a post-jam version at some point with more maps (and a volcano zone), as well as some fixes / improvements to the mechanics.

There is a timelapse video coming within the next few days.

We hope you enjoy our game!

entries.title: The Tiny World of Buzz
entries.description:
NOTE: HTML5 game, so the audio is a bit poor and sometimes wont play :-( 

You play as a worker bee, Buzz, fly about and collect your pollen quota, but don't get caught! Dangerous parasitic wasps will try and infect you when you land on a flower.

EDIT: OK finally found out how to edit your submission posts, web link in the post now points to hosting that works.

entries.title: The Tower of the Four Winds
entries.description:
This was my first time competing, it was quite a fun experience even though my game isn't as far along as I wanted it to be. There are bugs, I didnt get to make the level that it was named after, but I'm still proud of it. 

My theme interpretation was that a tiny world is a small world, and it's a small world after all. So the four levels are themed after Disney attractions, and the fifth level would've been the Tower of the Four Winds (tower in front of the small world ride.)

Also my computer does not have an older version of Java, nor will Firefox allow me to download it, so for now atleast the game is a standalone application.

Controls: w,a,s,d to move. Space to attack.

entries.title: TINY LIZARD SWELL WORLD
entries.description: wasd moves lizard

entries.title: Tiny Robot Island
Tiny World Domination
entries.description: I didn't really have all that time this weekend, but I still think I came up with a pretty simple and slightly fun turn based strategy game for two people sitting at the same computer. Enjoy!

entries.title: TINY WORlDS
entries.description:
Made by Klomer and Machinas!

We more or less stuck to compo rules, but there were two of us, so I guess we're jamming!!

A white hole has opened up and is threatening to explode your planets by enlarging them as they get closer to the center of the singularity. Spell words to use your shrink ray so that they can get small enough to use your teleporter to pull these tiny worlds to safety!

PROTIPS:
* enter key submits, space clears words
* mispell a word to get new letters!
* dictionary only goes to 7 letter words. don't be too awesome, please.

Post Compo Edition Improvements:
* add support for 1, 2, and 8 letter words
* make backspace clear the last entered letter
* pull the screen edge repulsion further down from the top
* decrease score font size
* add a click response delay to the dialogs so they can't be closed accidentally
* moved the white hole down a bit
* experimenting with keyboard input for letters. let us know what you think. better? worse?

entries.title: Trapped in the Lawn
entries.description: You play a scientist in an experiment gone awry!  You've found yourself, due to a failed size portal, stuck in your lawn having to fight off bugs and jump on leaves and twigs, you must find the crucial component to fix your machine and get back to your normal size!

entries.title: Zoomed Out
entries.description: Game turned out to be pretty hard, guess I should have made more people test it. The art is really lacking, but that's expected for a single programmer. The code's rock solid though, without any major bugs. That music generator really came in handy.

entries.title: "Vesta: Galactic Convict Colony
entries.description:
The game is made with Java and purely by the libraries that come with it, NO LWJGL, Slick2d etc was used.

To win the level, you must kill 74 criminals (orange clothed guys) and then the boss will appear somewhere randomly in the world. The boss is wearing red clothes, and takes a lot more hits then the normal criminal!

The storyline for the game is inside the game, just go to story in the main menu!

The game contains 4 worlds I have created, and 1 randomly generated square world.

W A S D and arrow keys to move, shift to sprint, c and f to attack, and use the arrow and enter key inside the menu. Oh and escape will take you back to the main menu / pause, just press play to continue on the same level.

If the criminals reach -14 tiles or 64 tiles out (map is a 50x50) the criminals will appear back on the main island.

To get to the boss level, your score should be 740, (74 orange jump suit criminals, 1 red jump suit criminal (the boss)).

entries.title: A Tiny World Hero

#####################
LUDUM DARE 23 COMPO

DEVELOPED BY MIDGARD

entries.title: ACTION SCIENCE DOG
entries.description:
This is a game where you are ACTION SCIENCE DOG.  The SCIENTIST has made special science for you that can shrink you to SUBATOMIC WORLD.  Once there, you can search for treasure and bring it back to the lab!


For this LD I wanted to purposefully challenge myself and make something really challenging; I've made platformers the last couple times but this time I wanted to do something with random dungeons, random loot, enemy AI, and CHARM.  I first set out to build a roguelike but decided to instead build a dungeon crawler where the world only updates as you move (similar to a roguelike, but not bound to tiles).  This would be friendly to "deciding what to do next" and would allow for a pretty decent mobile experience.

I ended up with base systems for all of that, and then only had time to implement one enemy and a couple types of loot before I ran out of time.  I will definitely continue working on this!  In fact I already have it running on my iPhone and iPad and hope to release it before long!

UPDATE: source code released. Has an extra, unused music track (WHICH IS WAY GOOD) and a couple scribbles from my notebook that I made while working on it (THERE IS A DRAWING OF A WALKING BURGER).

entries.title: Bombs World

entries.title: Enlargement Issues
