entries.title: GRIDiots
Internal Monsters
entries.description:
A tower defense game set in the human body.

The rules
- If bacteria get past your defenses you lose 200 energy.
- If you lose all your energy, you're dead.
- Press N to use 100 energy to create a Neutrophil that eats bacteria.
- Tiny viruses will take over your Neutrophils if too many attack them.
- Press B to use 200 energy to create a B Cell which shoots Antibodies to kill viruses.

Hold onto your energy early until you need it.

entries.title: microrail
entries.description: "microrail" is a tiny world of a not-super-innovative but solid and fun puzzles, where you make a rail line connecting the two endpoints and every station in between in a traingular  - err, triangular -- grid.

entries.title: My Wonderful World
entries.description:
My Wonderful World is an attempt at a sim-game for a REALLY tiny world. 
Men and women arrive at your train station looking for love and money. 
After a "game-ticks"-night of sleep its off to work to earn some hard earned
 cash with the compulsory after-work-party where all the singles can hook up
 with the man/women of their dreams. Spending a night in the apartment
 building with their significant other gives the women a chance to become
 pregnant and after a "game-ticks" period of pregnancy they head to the
 hospital for delivery, giving birth to a healthy young boy/girl, and the circle of
 life is complete. Watch out though, your humans never know when their 
"life-ticks" runs out, and if they loose all their money they're heading back to
 the train station to seek their fortune elsewhere. Complete with annoying
 looping soundtrack.

*update* 
Ok, so I kind of makde it demaning a device running Android 3.0. 
Also the display is super tweaked for my Galaxy Nexus so you just 
might get displaced sprites ;)

The >1.6 apk should at least not complain on devices starting from 1.6 
and beyond. The display issue is codechanges though, so those are 
features rather than bugs :D

--requirements
Android 1.6 device (if you want to see the entire canvas, you probably want to go buy a Samsung Galaxy Nexus, or just go with the flow ;) )

--tools
Eclipse
Gimp
Renoise
Lame

entries.title: Nasty Bubbly - 72 Hour JAM Entry
entries.description:
Controls:
UP and DOWN Arrows: Move the fish well, Up and down.
SPACEBAR: Speed boost.

The goal is to escape from the landing net to not being catch and die in pain and suffering.
You must use the boost to go faster and pollute the bowl at the same time, avoiding such obstacles as bubbles and pillars, in order to win the game.
The fish food increase your boost bar.

Enjoy, and for the love of nature, save this goldfish's life ! Just a question of Karma.

entries.title: Planet Jay

My first time in Ludum Dare. I know it's bad.

Source code and and game is in download. Made in Java.

WARNING: It is pretty buggy. Also, god made eggs in the sky.
To run on OSX, rename file extension to .jar.

READ THE README BEFORE PLAYING
Alrighty. Its time I explained myself. When I started this game, I got a rough start. I also stayed up way too late finsihing it. The problem is I'm not efficient enough of a programmer and I had to broad of an idea to make in 48 hours. The game was released very unfinished and buggy. I hope next time I do Ludum Dare it turns out better. Thanks for playing anyways.

entries.title: Primordial Smackdown: Bacteria with Badditude
entries.description:
IMPORTANT NOTES FOLLOW:
The standalone link includes the exe and content folder.  If it does not run, or gives some sort of XNA error, you MUST use the installer instead (or install XNA).  This happens because you cannot run the application without the XNA dependencies, and if you do not have them the installer will get them for you.

PLEASE READ the readme either linked above or included in the downloads.  It's not a long read at all and has all of the information about the game you need to know what's going on.
----

You are a bacterium struggling to survive, thrive, and evolve.  Attack other bacteria with a variety of weapons, get a variety of upgrades and buffs, and for goodness' sake watch out for bacteriophages.

The controls are explained more in the readme, but here's the short version:
Mouse - target
Left click - move towards mouse
Space - bite
C/V/B (configurable) - use active abilities
Escape - Open/close upgrade menu, which also has keybinding and sound control

Some people have reported that biting is rather difficult, so I advise tracking your target with the mouse first, and using it to swim towards them secondarily.  It doesn't really matter your orientation or position as long as you're close enough, mouse-over-ing them, and pressing space.  Hope that helps you all who are having trouble.

Combat, short version: "mouse over bacteria and hit space to bite" -racarate.  It might take a bit to get used to the controls.

entries.title: Protector
entries.description:
From the intro:

You are the protector of this planet.
You have kept it safe from disaster for hundreds of years.
But now a new threat has arrived.
Your planet has been swallowed by a giant vessel.


I really enjoyed my first Ludum Dare. Thanks for taking the time to play my game!

If you're interested in what went into this; I used Otomata for music, bfxr for sounds, Audacity for audio editing, GIMP for tiles and sprites, kilo (my JS library) for base code, and JavaScript edited in Eclipse (with Aptana and MercurialEclipse plugins used)! Also, bitbucket for play hosting and code repositories.

entries.title: Quaternion Nightmare
entries.description:
Hi everyone, and Happy Anniversary to the event organisers! :)

This is my third Ludum Dare event and the first game I have ever developed in Unity. Trying to work to the 48 hour time limit with unfamiliar tools meant I really had to cut some corners but I'm fairly happy with the result given the circumstance.

With 'Tiny World' as the theme I took my inspiration from Super Mario Galaxy because it seemed an interesting challenge to recreate the very small planets of those games with their 'gravity could act in any direction' physics  ... the first day and a half was spent just trying to get the player model to point 'up', and fall 'down' without vearing off course while turning or walking over such unpredictable and often upside-down terrain; hence the title "Quaternion Nightmare". All other aspects of the game were developed on Sunday afternoon.

If I had had more time I would have added: engaging combat, simple 'key + lock box' style puzzles a boss fight and more than one world as well as music and a menu system.

The tools I used in development were:
Unity (http://unity3d.com/)
Blender (http://www.blender.org/)
BFXR (http://www.bfxr.net/)
Paint.NET (http://www.getpaint.net/)
Spacescape (http://alexcpeterson.com/spacescape)

For anyone interested in the physics behind this type of game the following article explains it very nicely: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/131997/games_demystified_super_mario_.php

Good luck everyone with your own entries!

Enjoy :)

entries.title: TinyInspiration
entries.description:
Simple handdrawn adventure about an LD programmer who just can't find his inspiration...

Simple point and click, please note that there are several ways how to deal with both basic problems in the game. Simplest walkthrough can be done probably under a minute.

Also be warned, although no actual porn takes place, there are more then enough hints. Think Leisure Suit Larry.

No sounds and music :/

Currently web version is only in unity... I'll put a flash version up later after I'll fix some problems with it.

UPDATE:

I've made a postcompo flash version and also fixed stupid bug in the inventory which was making the game annoying in web build (damn Unity GUI to hell anyway). It's a very minor bugfix, but if you consider even this small change as breaking of the rules, you can try original untouched unity version. Have fun.

UPDATE2 : Postmortem is online.
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/26/tiny-inspiration-postmortem/

entries.title: Winzig
entries.description:
What is this game?

It's a faux 8-bit RPG like you would have seen on the NES or older consoles! Basically, I just wanted to make a game for Ludum Dare, having never done so. Graphics, music and sound are all made by myself in a period of 48 hours. There isn't a whole lot of variety and I didn't really have time to make any battle animations or enemies that did things other than attack, but hopefully the game is a little funny to at least one person and a good waste of 15 minutes or so. 

THE ENDING!!!

Yeah, I know. I didn't have time to do more and the story actually starts getting good here. I might pick the game up again and release WINZIG DX SUPER AWESOME EDITION or something with a complete story, more variety, etc. I left out the fact that you get Eliza in your party and you actually get to a town and meet people instead of just traversing the inside of Jack's cubicle. There's always tomorrow, eh?

CREDITS

Thanks to Dragon Quest for inspiration and RMVXACE for the engine because without it lol what is programming? Next time I hope to make something that's all from scratch though, engine and all.

EXTRA TIPS!

You can full screen by pressing alt + enter
You can run by holding shift
If you "Guard" you will regain HP for free
You can save anywhere, but the save points are there to regain HP/MP + inspire you to save

JUDGES!

Made using an engine (RMVX) but everything else is mine. If that bends the rules somehow, please make this a jam entry!

(Source is included in the main file)

entries.title: "The best" CCG
entries.description:
UPDATE 2

I've now put up a web version. There are no new features (actually some features like custom names and saving were removed to make it work) but the code was changed quite a bit to make it work online so this should probably be considered a post-competition version.

Hopefully everyperson can at least try it now.


A collectible card game named "the best".


Requires Python 2.x (may also work in Python 3), downloadable from www.python.org

Download the ZIP, unzip the contents somewhere and run "python menu.py" or alternatively (on Windows) double click on run.bat

You can manually delete the file savegame to delete your save file.

The entire game plays on the command line. There was no time for the planned GUI. So the .zip file is actually 3 times smaller than the screenshot :)

UPDATE 1

I'm looking into putting up a web based server side version this weekend. For the moment, here is an alternative mirror if Fileden goes down:

http://www.filedropper.com/best

(except this one is not a direct link).

And finally here's another attempt to explain what a card does.

By example (from the screenshot):
The card

3-4 1:opp discard

swaps positions 3 and 4. If the current order is BFDEAC (as in the screenshot), it becomes BFDAEC (A and E are swap). After the swap, if position 1 matches the goal (it does not since F isn't B), your opponent discards a card (if it doesn't match as in this case, there is no second effect).

Generally:
The card

a-b x1:effect1 x2:effect2 x3:effect3 ...

swaps positions a and b. After the swap, if position x1 matches the goal, it triggers effect1. After the swap, if position x2 matches the goal, it triggers effect2. And so on.

END OF UPDATE 1

entries.title: Ant Slayer
entries.description:
The bone-headed obvious choice, a small world ant shooting fps!

It's short, as I ran out of time for making levels (same as last time), but it does have a better ending at least.

I have music this time!  I normally don't but the fellow that wrote EZMUZE for xbox indie games talked me into trying it and it turned out to indeed be easy!  Thanks!

One issue everyone will no doubt hate:  Often when spawning in the camera will be pointing at some super strange angle, and I didn't have time to fix it.  Just wiggle around a bit and get your bearings.

Timelapse of the creation:  http://youtu.be/GY8BGTK2NjU

Edit:  I totally forgot, but you'll need the xna 4 redist to run this:  http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

And the .net framework 4:  http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

Edit2:  There is a problem with currencies that use decimal places other than '.' that will cause the game to crash on startup.  I've fixed this and the link for the fixed game is:  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/59900676/Ludum23DecimalFix.zip

entries.title: Attack of the Space Fruit
entries.description:
When Humanity took their first tentative steps into the world, the last thing they expected was GIANT SPACE FRUIT! The fruit hated Humanity's fleshy bodies, and the war with the Space Fruit begun immediately!

Made with Gamemaker.

entries.title: Castaways
entries.description:
This is my not so polished/finished game.

Story:

Through wars and ecological disasters the entire human race has been forced to hitch a ride on an asteroid for a ride to a new world.  Nearing the end of their journey and having faced countless trials, they are now at the mercy of a fierce meteor swarm.  As commander of the Human Defence Force you are humanities last hope.

entries.title: Cytokine
entries.description:
NOTE: WHEN IT SAYS "PRESS A TO START", PRESS Z!

A neat take on tower defense: you're a collection of cells preventing virii, bacteria, and diseases from entering your body. Aim using the mouse!

entries.title: Dreamworld
entries.description:
You, the player, begin as little boy waking up at night... people are unwell, with broken nightmares in their sleep. You must help them by jumping into their dream and fixing it!

Green blobs are the cause... You must attack them by holding the 'E' key, or they will attack you!

Use the 'A' and 'D' keys to move, and space bar to jump.

Sadly, this concept wasn't fully realized in time (Almost! I swear! Almost!), so you just hit the 'W' key to enter the one-and-only dream level. Also, I made some very nice piano music for it, but sound wouldn't work... *sigh* If you want to hear it and *imagine* it was part of the program, it's in the sound folder, happy.wav or happy.ogg.

Source is included with the download, you need Python 2.7 and Pygame 1.9.1 to run it.

The executable is in the /dist folder, main.exe. If it doesn't work, try launching it from the command line.

Credits:
pytmx for tilemap
pygame for game engine
eeymontt and JoeCool17 for programming
JoeCool17 and GraphiX for art

entries.title: Drop of Life
entries.description:
You play as bacteria in a drop of water fighting to survive on ground.

Finishing this game was a tough challenge. My friend (ilovepixel) and I had literally like 30 hours (no official count) to make it but we are proud of what we achieved.

That means we didn't have time to make music or sound effects for it, sorry.

I'll probably do a postmortem later but now I only want to sleep. Hope you all enjoy the game.

entries.title: Elevation

Well, i had all this finished in time, but the website was so slow, it didnt allow me to upload my game :(

Use your arrow keys to traverse the mini islands and solve puzzles. There are a few bugs. Use the mouse to select the level in the level select

entries.title: Flyght
entries.description:
KILL ALL THE FLIES !

MOVE: Array keys.
SHOOT: Spacebar, or V key.

Bonuses will increase your character abilities (speed, shooting rate, bullet numbers and speed).
You can't die, but your score will drop if you get hit.

This is a little arcade shooter game, made during the 48h compo using HTML5 and Javascript. 
I wrote everything from scratch and only use one external library for the sounds/musics (https://github.com/jakesgordon/javascript-audio-fx)

For those who ask question about the music, it's something I made using Garage Band for mac. (based on music samples and loops included in the soft). I hadn't enough time nor skills to do something based on digital instruments... maybe the next time!

Day 0: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/20/french-jammer/
Day 1: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/21/24h-update/

entries.title: I Heart Ludum Dare
entries.description:
Instructions:

Arrow keys = move
Z = jump
X = fire

I had a lot of fun making this; I've been itching to write a platforming engine for a long time now. My only regret is that there just wasn't enough time to do all the things I wanted. I had plans for a much bigger story, spanning multiple levels. Oh well, that's just how it is.

No music I'm afraid. I really wish I'd had time to make some, it would have brought a lot more feeling to it.

There's a 48-hour timelapse video of the creation here (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R98mENbJXMU)


I made this game for you.


Ludum Dare loves you too.

entries.title: Macro Marines
entries.description:
Credits: Ricky Willis, Duncan Stead and Jonathan Gover

Command your macro marines, tanks and jets to conquer the tiny worlds!  Place arrows to redirect your troops and those of your enemy!  Balance unit production with battle control to overwhelm and destroy the enemy HQ!

You can play against AI or a second player with an Xbox controller.  Controls etc can be found in the main menu.

entries.title: Mirror Rays
entries.description:
Controls: arrows + Z/X/C, R to restart

Note: when you press on the ray twice, it changes its direction. On the third time you put the ray to the inventory.

entries.title: Only Your Home
entries.description:
Heavily undertested due to events that I failed to foresee. Expect some actions to not quite work, and some rooms to be empty.

Note that this can run in any platform using an interpreter with the zblorb file, or the inbuilt one in index.html.

Now onto the things about it:
Events aforementioned were the one thing that nagged at me at the back of my head when I began developing this. It wasn't nice at all to be chased by a different deadline that would probably have been avoided had I just been doing less procrastination. As such, quite a bit of the rooms are empty, and there are exceptions where rooms are overcrowded. No doubt there is probably a large amount of bugs and other things that shouldn't be happening (like picking up fixtures), though I have tried to do some testing.

Going down stairs is an issue that I haven't been able to get out of the way so far, though 'go down' seems to work fine...

Overall, the result is this text adventure. There's still much I could have done, but I unless something is seriously broken, I don't expect to make any changes.

entries.title: Planet 161
entries.description:
A little game about an astronaut, imprisioned on a very small planet. The theme here is more about the small and claustrophobic level design then the story.
Gameplay inspired by Sokoban, Goof Troop, Quackshot and suteF.

More info about me and my studio on: www.studiominiboss.com

(After the 48 hours)
I added a mute button and fixed a minor bug on the barrel collision after the jam. I hope that's Ok, but anyeay, the Dropbox version is still the original one.

entries.title: Runaway Square
entries.description:
My first game ever, and, obviously, my first Ludum Dare.

Although it's basic game, I'm very proud of it.

entries.title: Snow Globe Kerfuffle
entries.description:
A shoot-em-up game of snow globe warfare. Can you slay the pesky catapults and crown yourself as the king of snow globe?

Tools used:
Code: Actionscript/Flashdevelop + Flixel + Flixel power tools
Art: Photoshop + Wacom tablet
Audio & Music: Ableton Live 8 Suite + plugins (u-he Zebra, ValhallaRoom)

entries.title: The Dream Sequencer
entries.description:
This game is a quick (and pretty simple) point'n'click adventure game.
The player is a commander of a spaceship when, somehow, something goes wrong and...

...reality isn't what it seems.

Without spoiling anything, the theme itself (Tiny World) may not be apparent at first, however at the end of the game it should be clear enough. 
The rest is free to interpretation. 

Enjoy the game! :)

GAME DETAILS:

Since I didn't have much time to polish the game as much as I wanted and make it user friendly (I wanted to make a small tutorial screen, oh well.. ) I'm going to explain it here a bit:

INVENTORY: To access the inventory simply move the cursor at the bottom of the screen, it's a black bar with all your items.

ICONS:
To use items, there's the USE icon (pretty straightforward). This also works for things like doors and portals.
To combine two items together (be it in the inventory or on screen) use the HAND icon. Just select the first item (in your inventory) and click on the item you want to combine with.
To pick up items, use the SATCHEL icon (the one with the hand gripping at a small bag).
To examine/look at items, use the EYE icon.

UPDATE:
Ported the game to windows successfully (after a whole day of trouble... curse you Microsoft!). If the game doesn't run for you, you may have to install the vs2008redist.exe file...

entries.title: THE TINY PIRATE KNOWS MAGIC
entries.description: Far from beeing finished.

entries.title: The Tiny World of Fiorella
entries.description:
Help Fiorella save her tiny world from the bugs!

Game inspired by The Binding of Isaac and The Secret World of Arrietty!

Try the post-jam version if you are having a hard time. 

-----------------------------------
Controls:
-----------------------------------
- WASD                          <- movement
- arrow keys or mouse button    <- attack in pressed direction
- space or tab or mouse wheel   <- switch weapons
- esc or p                      <- pause the game

-----------------------------------
Post-Jam Version Features:
-----------------------------------
- Complete sound track!
- Better sword range indication!
- Shiny win screen!
- Finalized graphics!
- More balanced gameplay!
- Continue from the last room when you die!
- Continual updates!

-----------------------------------
Credits:
-----------------------------------
- Vu Ha - Programmer (http://vuha.carbonmade.com/)
- Rose Peng - Artist
- Hal Helms and Johan Soriao - Musics

entries.title: Tiny Tale
entries.description:
Tiny Tale is the story about Jack, he has no clue where he is standing or what he is doing there.

[Update: It seems Dropbox put back an earlier edition, will fix this as soon as I am home]

[Update 2: It should now be the complete version as intended]

Tools used:

* Construct Classic
* PyxelEdit

entries.title: Tiny World's Lunar CTF
entries.description:
Tiny World's Lunar CTF is my first submition to a game compo of any kind; and it's actually my first game.

The game is VERY buggy right now as I simply ran out of time to tweak out the gameplay. If the AI isn't responding, just reload/refresh until it does. 

Missing is all UI features, game win/lose events, title/credits/how-to screens.

The controls are WASD/Arrows + Mouse.

The game is built in GameMaker:HTML5. I chose that engine when my Java dev enviroment went in to Crazy Land about 6 hours before the start of LD#23.

entries.title: Tinyverse
entries.description:
A game about saving tiny people on tiny planets by moving them between the planets and eventually onto a spaceship.

There are a lot of mechanics that we simply don't have time to implement. Such as, sun radius shrinking, planet and people preferences so only certain people can be moved to certain planets, static planets and orbiting planets to force the player to time their movements. Just to name a few.

We felt this game was screaming to be on a touch screen. The controls would be so much more intuitive on an iPad. Also the action nature of the game is accustom to the app store.

We might revisit this idea as there are so many more places it can go. 

Let us know what you think! If you have any suggestions, ideas, or run across any bugs, we are all ears.

entries.title: Weird And Virtual Reality Emulated
entries.description:
You are in a litle city with very full peoples.
You must give milk on peoples for survive.

Well... I must be the ditribution I know... 
For the time being: you can download <a python : http://www.python.org and panda3d : http://www.panda3d.org/download.php
the commande for run this game is python main.py  (in root of the folder)

entries.title: Ant Colony
entries.description:
Playable!

Some things I'll probably add post-jam, but all in all an enjoyable experience.

Controlled with wasd or arrow keys, use enter or space in order to communicate with other ants. Convince them to leave the colony before it's destroyed!

entries.title: esCape
entries.description:
The story of one OS's attempt to escape from the tiny world of a laptop's C drive.

This is a 2D puzzle game for Windows (and maybe other platforms later).

Excuse the lack of many screenshots but it's hard to think of what to show without giving away clues about how to complete the game..

Hope you like it!



CONTROLS:
Movement: Arrow keys
Click: Space key
Move between text boxes: tab
Character entry: keyboard (as space cannot be used, use _ instead)



NOTE
Post compo version speeds up player movement.

entries.title: Good Cell, Bad Cell
entries.description:
GOOD CELL, BAD CELL
Identify and eliminate the bad cells. 

Destroy all bad cells to win.
-1 point when bad cells eat a good cell.
-1 point if you destroy a good cell.
You lose if you have -50 points.

Move: WASD, Arrows, or Left stick on controller
Fire: Space, Left mouse button, or A button on controller
Pause: Tab, Escape, Start button on controller

Tools Used:
Unity 3d and some standard assets
Gimp
Labchirp
Blender

entries.title: Interstellar Moai Ranger
entries.description:
Uchuu Sentai Pastagaga succeeded to contain the evil forces during 72 hours. But now we need your help! 

Play as Moai Ranger to save innocent girls and beat the evil army in this Rail Shooter-like game.

Go through the level and defeat the Evil Giant Mantis Robot and his minions to get the highest score possible.

-

If you have any issue with the game, make sure that you have direct x and dotnet installed on your computer. 

If you can, please play with a gamepad. Here is a free tool that allows you to use your Xbox360 gamepad on a Mac OSX (http://tattiebogle.net/index.php/ProjectRoot/Xbox360Controller/OsxDriver).

-

KNOWN ISSUE #1: When the game starts, if the ground is not scrolling try to quit and restart the application. It should fix the issue.

KNOWN ISSUE #2: If the input for the camera doesn't make the planet rotate (just the background or nothing), try to play in "Fantastic" mode.

entries.title: Interstellar Planet-Ship Adventures: The Search for... $@#% Aliens!!!!!!
entries.description:
A mix of strategy and arcade games. Fill your distance bar and reach your destination! Can you survive the great unknown terrors of space?

The source is included and it also comes with a How-To-Play guide.

entries.title: It's a tab
entries.description:
The tiniest place on the web: the favicon, 16 x 16 Pixels. Through a mysterious force you get sucked in this world of pixel madness. But you will realize soon that this isn't a place to stay and you have to escape from it before you turn crazy.  

Unfortunately this game runs only on recent Versions of Firefox, Chrome and Opera.

This Game was made on the real life gathering in Darmstadt, Germany. Thanks to Spielmeister for organizing this event.

entries.title: Kao
entries.description: Kao, a lone traveling character, now stranded in a snowy world.

entries.title: LittleEarth's Last Stand
entries.description:
"LittleEarth's Last Stand" is a Missile-Command style arcade game with 4 levels + an infinite challenge mode which is unlocked after completing the main 4 levels. 
Also features Kittens!

View the README file for details on how to compile the code and Licensing info.
This was made using flixel so should be easy to compile on any platform.

Edit: Now available on kongregate, changed my web link to point to this. This is the original version without modifications.

Thanks and enjoy!
- j0n

entries.title: Memento XII
entries.description:
Day 4380 of your prison term. 12 years. And many more to come. 

But something strange is happening today... A mysterious puzzle seems to unfold in your cell.

Cool features

 * super-old-school gameplay!
 * 256+ colors scenes!
 * many many texts to read and lots of details!
 * an ingame help system, in case you are really stuck!

I tried to make a "SCUMM-VM"-like for this Ludum Dare to finally discover the huge amount of work needed to do that properly... 

I didn't have much time for the sounds, I spent most of my weekend on the engine and on the texts. I'm french, so I had to check the dictionary every 10 seconds...

Blog : http://blog.deepnight.net
Twitter : https://twitter.com/#!/deepnightfr

entries.title: Mr.No's Laboratory
entries.description:
[Description]
You are a 'volunteer' in a laboraty.
You want to get out?
Hack yourself your way through consoles and doors to the freedom!

[Keys]
<ARROW KEYS> - move
<SPACE>      - activate
<ESCAPE>     - escape (from the game for the moment)

entries.title: Path O' Invasion
entries.description:
Only one virus can reign supreme!

You are the leader of a troop of pathogens. Take over nearby cells to strengthen your platoon, but watch out for the cells defenders, antibodies, or even worse, the dreaded rogue phages.

EDIT: Thanks everybody for your feedback.

I've gotten really excited about this project and plan to release a post compo version, so any further criticisms and suggestions are most appreciated. I'm already working on multi-unit selection and fixing the AI.

entries.title: pixTown
entries.description:
Have you ever opened your computer screen?
You can find a strange city...
Welcome to pixTown!

Tools :
- AS3 (with TweenLite) 
- Flash CS5
- Illustrator CS5
- Garage Band (and its samples)
- As3sfxr
- Fraise

First Ludum Dare, it was fun!
I hope you like my little game :)

Edit :
A tiny update after the deadline to fix a critical bug with some PC :s

============================================================
Edit 2 :
Test the post-compo version with endings (the only change) !
============================================================

entries.title: Planet Gravity
entries.description:
You are stranded on a strange little planet in space.

Gravity on the planet is sinking with an increasing speed, but you can save yourself by collecting red "magical items" which restore some gravity. The goal: Survive as long as you can!

Controls:
Keyboard: WSAD + Arrow-Left/-Right + Space
Gamepad: Left Stick + Right Stick + A/RB/RT

Requirements:
DirectX 10 (SM 4.0) GPU
Latest DirectX 11 runtime
.Net 4.0 Client Profile

Sorry for the crappy shadow mapping, couldn't get it better in time (never did shadow mapping before).

Enjoy!

entries.title: Pogo Planet
entries.description:
Use the arrow keys to move your bouncy guy left and right, and avoid hitting UFOs! Landing on differently-colored sections of the planet has different effects! White ones are checkpoints!

The game doesn't end properly, instead the scrolling-planet-thing loops and gets a little faster each time. So just see how far you can get, I guess! 

NOTE FOR JUDGES:
1. To create the music(more of a soundscape I guess) and sound effects, I downloaded instrument samples from http://bit.ly/GKEEj and modified them only slightly.
2. For the title screen, I used the Tuffy font by Thatcher Ulrich (http://bit.ly/I2ZWKa)
The rules seem to allow that stuff, but we can move the game to the jam if it bothers anyone.

entries.title: River Runner
entries.description:
Fast paced river racing.  Try not to hit the walls.

Special prize for anyone that beats 10000.

To play, download and double-click the jar file.  On mac/linux, it might be necessary to run it with: java -jar river_runner.jar

entries.title: Spaceways
entries.description:
Spaceways our first Ludum Dare entry :).

Protect your tiny world from the tyranny of bureaucracy in this space-based protect em' up. All the larger worlds want to build super spaceways through your little planet. Stop them using any means necessary. 
 
How to play 
 
Use the arrow keys to move your ship around the universe. Press space bar when in range of asteroids to anchor them to your ship. Bring them back to your planet and press space again to release them in orbit. Asteroids increase your resources, which increase your military might.  
 
Be alert for the corrupt larger worlds trying to build roads through your tiny world. Follow the dotted lines back to their worlds and set up trade agreements to stop the roads, or attack with the full force of your tiny worlds military might. 
 
You can also drag space hippies from your planets orbit using the space key and place them within range of planets building spaceways to delay the building of a road while you build up your trade or military numbers.

Update : We have an installer but it doesn't seem to work for everyone, we tried a bunch of things and it works here, not sure what else to do.

entries.title: The Revenge of Grodzilla
entries.description:
I hadn't planned to enter this in the jam, but my netbook broke down a few hours before the deadline yesterday :S
It's a Game Boy game written in assembly.
... Actually, it's not much of a game since there's no winning or losing.
It should run on just about any game boy emulator out there. I've included a link to a great and accurate one, "gambatte", in case you don't have one installed.

Have fun!

entries.title: The Tiny World
entries.description:
This game was made as a purely text based adventure.

It should operate on any browser that supports the content editable attribute, and that jquery supports.

No libraries were used beyond jquery 1.7, everything was made from scratch.

Sorry for poor grammar, spelling, or any lack of polish -- the time constraints get to us all :)

entries.title: These Tiny Planets are mean
entries.description:
So this is my first entry, and as basic as it is I'm really proud of it. I hope at least one person gets some small amount of enjoyment out of it :D

Make sure to read the readme, you will also need XNA 4.

If I had slightly more time I probably would have added in more levels with obstructions/planets bigger than you, but that's what I get for sleeping in on Sunday.

entries.title: Tiny Perspective
entries.description:
WASD to move

TAB to open crafting 

walk up to trees and rocks and press left mouse button well the mouse is over them to mine and chop.

E to place sapplings that will eventually grow

fences and turrets you can rotate with scroll will and mouse over.

entries.title: Tiny Worlds
entries.description:
This is more a minimal plaything than a game really - I was lacking inspiration this weekend :/

You are Gravity, new on the job, and you've been given a trial period by God, before he decides to keep you on full time. He's been handcrafting worlds all over the shop, but He's bored and wants a holiday.

Using your Audacious Powers of Coalescence, you have to form as many planets as you can from the space dust the Boss has left floating around. Be careful! Don't form the planets too close to each other in case they collide. You wouldn't want all those innocent deaths on your conscience.

To activate your APoC, simply press the mouse button, hold it, and drag your gravity point around. When enough bits of dust are close together you will pop a new planet into existence.

Linux users: unfortunately I haven't worked out how to create Linux packages for LOVE yet, so I'm afraid you will have to install LOVE 0.8.0 from https://love2d.org/ and then run the love package: `love LD48_Tiny_Worlds_-_mnem.love`

entries.title: Tiny's World
entries.description:
A collaboration with Jimun (credits below)

There once was an adorable bundle of dust, named Tiny. He lived his life in a dark place named Thohkowch. He was a happy little dust bunny - it was a warm home, comfortable and cozy.
One day he heard a sound... a horrible terrible whirring sound! It made his ears hurt and he could feel the ground shaking as whatever was causing it drew near! 
A giant machine of some kind was at his door! It was going to eat him! It drew close then stopped suddenly. It's pilot had moved away, leaving the machine running. This was Tiny's chance.
He knew that he had to run for it - whatever this sound was didn't make him feel good at all, so he started to hop away...

Little did he know where he was heading...

Little had he thought the world was outside of Thohkowch...

Little hope he had for finding a new home...

This little dust bunny would leave home, only to uncover...

Tiny's World


Instructions:

You may use the Windows File, or Love2D File.
To run the Love2D file you must have Love2D installed ( http://love2d.org )
Double-click the LOVE file to run the game.

Your goal is to find a nice cozy home to live in. 
Make your way through the game by hopping through obstacles.
You can jump on enemies, or maybe you could find something better...

Keep an eye out for the Kitten! She is hidden!

Unknown to Tiny, you may collect dust, and maybe even upgrade yourself in the process!

Controls:

To play, use the following keyboard keys.

Space - Hop
Shift - Sprint / Hop faster
Left + Right - Walk / Steer Tiny
Up + Down - Climb lattice 
1 - 5 - Store item into inventory / Take item from inventory
V - Pick up item / Toss item (Toss while moving to throw)
C - Swing weapon

Advice:

Spiders are big, but they're clumsy with their legs. Jumping on them is tough but maybe there's an easier way to best them!
Watch out for water. For a creature made out of dust, it's quite easy for one to fall in and dissolve. Don't fret - you will be sent back to the start of that section
Tiny is not a very fit bunny - having lived all of his life in Thohkowch, he tires easily, so be careful!

Credits:

Code, Level Design, Graphics, Sound - Jimun
Graphics, Level Design, Sound - ChipCaramel


Music - SynthR - http://opsound.org/artist/synthr/ (Used under CC BY-SA 2.5)

SynthR - The Last Prophecy
SynthR - Forest of Sorrow (Orchestrated)

entries.title: tinyConquest
entries.description:
A neat little space defense game. Try to protect your home planet for as long as possible! It has 3 difficulty modes but the basic gameplay is thus: your ships are completely out of your control, but you CAN choose what area around your planet they patrol when you build them! Just click the waypoint you want to send newly built ships and then click the buttons on the sides!

This is my first LD48 game, so thanks for looking! Special thanks for everyone on the IRC, Pkeod, Dorth and other people who gave great suggestions! :D

entries.title: Wirepair
entries.description:
W, S, A, D, to move up, down, left, and right respectively. You can also use the arrow keys if you like.

The goal of this (very simple and slightly buggy) game is to hit as many "dead" wires as possible. In keeping with the theme (Tiny World) I thought up an idea where you're inside this wire and you have to "repair" the little dead areas on the wires inside the larger wire… if you've ever taken a look inside one of those you'll understand. Not realistic or anything and it's not supposed to be! :D

I am SO glad I finished this. I learned so much making this game, even if it is a pretty simple game, and does have a few bugs. (Such as the random generation of the "dead" areas being a bit dodgy from time to time.)

I rushed it out to meet the deadline. There were a few things I wanted to add, such as lightning bolts that would kill you, working out the more minor bugs (of course) and adding a boost feature. And more GUI, a better menu, and a little intro animation explaining the point.
But oh well, it's still a "complete" game anyways. Perfectly playable and surprisingly… kind of fun IMO. I didn't expect to impress anyone with this, just learn more myself and be more motivated this time around after giving up during LD22.

Anyway, enjoy. I'm glad I'm finally done so I can start playing all these awesome games I've been seeing people post WIPs of the past two days. This has been a great Ludum Dare for me, and from what I hear from friends and other devs, it was for them too.
See ya!

entries.title: Ant Run
entries.description:
You are the ant, only knowing this tiny section of the world, bringing back the food needed for move night is vital!

W, Up arrow - moves forward
A, Left arrow - strafes left
D, Right arrow = strafes right
Space - jump 

Notes: You will be immune to damage for 2 seconds after being hit and you cannot move backwards, because ants only go forward...and strafe.

entries.title: Cells
entries.description:
Here is my take on the tiny world theme. Use your god like powers to mutate you colony of cells and let them prevail against the evil red cells.

Click on one of your cells and then select mutation you want to add. Each game tick it will execute one of the mutations. After some time the cells will split. Dead enemies are eaten for extra health.

Mutations:
- Aggression. Move toward the enemy instead of randomly.
- Poison. When this is active the enemy takes more damage when the cells are touching.

Features:
- Awesome programmer art
- Somewhat finished

entries.title: Chromatic Breeding
entries.description:
In Chromatic Breeding your objective is to steer the evolution of the bacteria towards the target color.

You have 3 tools and 2 minutes to achieve a colony of 20 specimes.

I created an applet for the web version but I didn't find anywhere to host it :(

ps. This is my first entry in Ludum Dare. I wanted to create a very different game mechanics, but half way through I thought it didn't work as expected. Given my time limitations I had to finish without big modifications in the original project.

Edits:
23/04 - Added Web version

entries.title: Dont Touch the Button
entries.description:
Jump over the button to press it

Arrow: Move
X or Up: jump
XX or Up Up: Double Jump

entries.title: Fracuum
entries.description: HI GUYS!

entries.title: Gravitation
entries.description:
TheFridolin & AyCe present: GRAVITATION!

A little experimental game by TheFridolin, optimization & sounds by AyCe (also the music).

Use WASD or arrow keys to control the moon.
Protect the earth from comets.
Good luck.

There is no winning limit afaik...


Story:
-------
I told TheFridolin about Ludum Dare, and convinced him to make a game for it. So we met at the weekend and I showed him how to make GUIs in Java. That's what his experiments yielded.
His homepage: http://www.champany.de/
I wanted to make a game myself too, but unfortunately I was too busy :(
Next time, hopefully :P

-----------------------------------
This is version 1.1. It just includes a workaround for the soundbug which caused the game to crash on startup, as well as a typo in the window title bar.

entries.title: Imuno
entries.description:
Presenting, Imuno! 

I decided the interpret the theme as the tiny world inside the human body, and made a game where you indirectly control white blood cells and have to guide them to destroying viruses.

This is my third Ludum Dare entry, and the first one where I feel I have actually made a complete game (albeit a very short one).

Once again, I ran out of time before I could add any more levels, and there are more features I would like to add, such as environmental dangers, new types of blocks to affect the blood cells, a logo, and more audio.

Despite that, I am incredibly proud of what i've done, and I can see enough potential in the idea that I am really keen to polish it up some more over the next few weeks and see how far I can take it.

entries.title: ineptia
entries.description:
You control MARRV, a lone robot aboard a generation ship carrying the remains of a dead planet. The ship has been boarded by evil robots bent on destroying all life. They have wiped the system memory and are attacking the animals in the three biomes.

Your task is to destroy the bombs they have placed and scan the animals so their DNA can be catalogued for future generations.

Rather than moving MARVV directly, you give him a set of instructions to follow. 

I'd like to polish this up and release it in the future, so any feedback is very welcome!

entries.title: It's a tiny world
entries.description:
"It's a tiny world" is a little Rogue like. Try and defeat the mighty beast that threatens your world.

Fight lower monsters to gain strength. Grab chests and arrange monster blood puddles to cast magic spells. Fight until you can finally beat the beast!

For those wondering, the boss is designed for level 20. Be level 23 and you'll be pretty save.

entries.title: Lilac.27
entries.description:
Lilac the cosmonaut travels around Tiny Worlds to exterminate the galactic vermin!

Click and hold to shoot!
More Instructions in-Game!

Progress updates in the Journal!

Another exclamation sentence!

Bonus: Kitten.Challenge included =)

Note: feel free to go full-screen on the web-player for extra immersion (Right-Click)

entries.title: Lone World
entries.description: Controls are explained in-game, exception being the 'F4' key toggling between fullscreen and window mode.

entries.title: Micro Warfare
entries.description:
Inject viral cells to combat the spread of cancer cells. Then watch as the two replicators go at each other on the smallest battlefield known.

Readme included for instructions as there aren't any ingame. 

Hope you enjoy.

entries.title: No Air Out Here
entries.description:
This was our first ludum dare game jam, so we weren't quite sure of the best way to submit the game. Download the .rar and run setup.exe to play. Have fun :)

Edit April 28th, 2012:

Just would like to apologize to those people who don't have windows machines and therefore are unable to play, I don't know the first thing about how to make a c# game with Xna work on different operating systems, and sadly will not be doing so for this competition. :(

On the brighter side, we have decided that we will be making a version of this game for xblig at some point (with better controls :P) So thank you to everyone so far for the great feedback. :)

entries.title: Omni-Illusion
entries.description:
Movement: W,A,S,D
Shoot: Arrowkeys
clear the field of enemy bullets: RCtrl

In HC-mode, your bullets aren't homing, and you can't use RCtrl

entries.title: OWWW
entries.description:
Enter Terry Cavanagh's mouth to investigate the cause of teeth pains! What has happened! AND HOW TO HELP:

---

The post-compo version is now more or less FINISHED; it has 6 levels, a boss, some secrets, and two endings. Thanks so much everyone, for encouraging me and playing this thing.

---

Tools I used:

- Paint.net
- Sprite Something
- sfxr
- Nitrotracker
- pxtone
- Flashpunk

entries.title: Pastor Mundi
entries.description:
Only had today to do this as I was jamming on saturday.

The actual gameplay isn't finished at all, sadly. You're going to be a shepherd guarding your flock from wolves, as well as ensuring your sheep stay fed (thus the gardening aspect).

Everything went surprisingly quickly. Spend about 12 hours on it according to the clock (subtracting food time, rest time and IRC breaks).

Sorry for no sound, didn't have time :(

How to "Play":

Unrar the archive somewhere convenient.
Run the game (choose a high res if you like)

Arrows UDLR to move.
X to plant seeds (near suitable soil) (strangely therapeutic)
K to lose hope (quits the game)
ESC quickly quits

entries.title: Planet Trot
entries.description:
Collect shroomberries, wreck some chickens, avoid scorpions, help the planet grow.

Arrows to move.

entries.title: shiprage
entries.description:
Thanks everyone for you comments and suggestions!! ^^

/*POST-COMPO VERSION

You can change the camera mode pressing 'c'. Bullets are now colored. The game might lag down..

With huds, camera, limited to 4 ships per team: http://bluecodestudio.com/ludumdare23/airrider23_player_v2.swf

Only CPU: http://bluecodestudio.com/ludumdare23/airrider23_cpu.swf

*/


Link to the high-res screenshot: http://bluecodestudio.com/ludumdare23/screenshot.png


The game ins't finished. The plan is to implement some kind of towers on each base, that would be the ones that power the bases. In order to conquer your enemy's base, you should take down those towers, and stand on that base.

It also lacks a hud showing the HP and the energy in order to shoot. I wanted to add a XP and improvement system too.

However, for the little time I had this weekend, I'm quite satisfied with the result.


All the content is mine except for some sound effects. The background music is also mine, made with GarageBand.

I hope you like it!


Made with Flash, AS3.



//Notes edit

Okay, I feel like I should explain something more.

How does it shoot? You can only shoot if there's an enemy ship close to you, so if you can't make it shoot, just try to get closer to the enemy's ship.

Even though there's not a HUD, ships have HP and a reload time. So you don't need to spam the spacebar, because it's not going to shoot faster. You can even hold it down, and it will shoot when possible.


You can also just look and enjoy the AI.


The game gets slow after some time, and other bugs and lacks, but I prefer not to modify my entry until the judgement periode has ended. I hope you like the game! Thanks for the comments!



//Okay, EXTRA DESCRIPTION

What is this game? Even though I aimed for more (but I hadn't the time to achieve it), the result is an endless battle between two factions. It WON'T end.

You can just try to survive while killing enemy ships. With a little of practice, you will figure out (more or less) how projectiles move and, therefore, it will be more easy to avoid them. (Just a bit)

So you might have some great moments, like luckily avoiding 5 bullets that were on your tail, and you'll feel like a badass X-Wing pilot.


//Goodie!

The background track is uploaded right here: http://soundcloud.com/airrider3/premiere

It is not finished, but I had to use something, so...


//Additional information!

- The screen size (SWF stage size) is 960x640, the same as the iPhone Retina screen in landscape mode, as I was hoping to release it for iOS and Android too. But time didn't help.

- For getting the key events, I always use a class I made a year ago. If anyone's curious, it's also included on the source, though there are different versions of it, and there's not a read me, instructions, or anything because it hasn't been released yet. Maybe this summer.

- The map was initially a floating island. A tiny world. An idea was being able to conquer bases along different planets on a system. Maybe even on different systems.

- You can follow me on Twitter at @AirRider3

entries.title: The borders of Tiny World
entries.description:
You are " Blob #23105 " . You come from the " Tiny World " to search for lifes outside of it . You get trapped into an tunnel system - the borders of Tiny World . You are the last living blob sent to the search for live . Why living ? You've got the power to twist Gravity . But you are weak , and you know it . You notice your short-distance-teleportation-device is working well , but you must get outside thru the small holes in the tunnel . It won't be easy . 

Controlls ( standard ) : 
Up : Up
Down : Down
Left : Left
Right : Right
Enter : OK
Space : Twist
F2 : Screenshot
R : Use short-distance-teleportation-device , also known as " Retry " 

Yellow Beams will absorb your health and also drop you back . Watch out ! When you just can't do other , or are trapped , use the short distance teleportation device . Then it's my fault . Any other use of the sdtd is " cheating " ... and removes the fun of this game .

entries.title: The Two of Us
entries.description:
This game is about two brothers, their room, and their imagination.  It consists only of boss fights, 3 in total.  We hope you enjoy it!

If you're a ludum dare judge/scorer, play the regular link. If you're looking to play the game with updates as we add them, play the updated version.

You can find more works by either of us below
Eugene Paik: http://ekun.nukenine.com/
Keo Bun: http://sketchb0ok.tumblr.com/

:-)

entries.title: Tiny World is in Danger!
entries.description:
Tiny World is in Danger! This is my first game I have made ever. It is made in java.
The aim of the game is to score points. To do this you need to doge the asteroids and make you world as big as possible. You use the arrow keys (up and down) to change the size of your world. Press space or make your world tiny for a shield. Note you won't earn points when shielded. You points/second depends on your size, the bigger, the better. Post your high scores on the comments (if there are any). Pics or it didn't happen. Thanks for playing my game!

To compile the source code you will need eclipse. The MainClass is the launch class.

entries.title: Tiny's World
entries.description:
Tiny is a mouse who is exploring. But he explores the world from his perspective; a tiny one. 

This is the first game I have ever finished, and my first ever entry to Ludum Dare. I hope you enjoy it, and I'll improve on my next game with the feedback you give me :)

entries.title: Tiny's World
entries.description:
PLAY WITH SOUND! Don't use IE. Please use Safari if at all possible.

Tiny Tim is singing on the town green. The girl of his dreams isn't feeling it. But slowly, with your help, Tiny's infectious song spreads through his little town and it even pierces his love's heart. Come tiptoe through the tulips with Tiny Tim in "Tiny's World" by Taco Graveyard!

Made using CraftyJS.

*Edit* I posted a version with improved performance for those using browsers other than Safari. There was a particular bit added in for Safari compatibility that was wreaking havoc on other browsers.

*Edit* Here is the full soundtrack from the game: http://soundcloud.com/the-four-hats/sets/ludum-dare-23-tinys-world

entries.title: Under the Glass
entries.description:
This is a pretty simple arcade-style game that takes place under the microscope. Steer your little micro-organism to pick up the green goodies while avoiding the deadly cell-thingies that float around. 

I couldn't get a .exe working in time, so the game is packaged as .zip of the assets + python script. Requires python (works on both 3.2 and 2.7) and pygame.

entries.title: A Cube Race
A Minecraftesque Adventure a`  la Rogue
entries.description:
[unfinished]
I was short on time. So there is no way to use your stuff. No exit. No goal.

[description]
This is a tiny world. 
The sky touch the ground, and no one can break through it.
We are trapped in.

[background]
You were thinking that these days, it was safe to teleport. Look like you were wrong. Welcome in a tiny world, where the sky touch the ground and no one go through it.
But it's your lucky day. The local elder tell you about the legendary emergency escape. No one know what it look like, but it should let you teleport somewhere else.

Be brave, explore this world, find the exit, and this will end as a story you'll tell to your children.

[what was the plan ?]
What is a tiny world ? The first thing I've think of is a snow globe. Small also bring to me talk about rogue-like from #ludumdare. 
So the base was to add mining and crafting to a rogue-like interface. The interface is copied from Crawl Stone Soup, the only rogue-like that I've played. As you will see, mining and crafting haven't made it to the game. Lack of time/motivation.
But anyway, you don't make a world by yourself. There was plan for multiplayer. I'll try to polish a bit more this game after the LD.

[thank]
Thank you for reading, sorry for the lack of fun.
Have a nice rating session o/

entries.description:

entries.title: Bottlecolonies
entries.description:
Place the buildings of tiny bottle world colonists. Unfortunately the different colonist factions don't like each other that much.
All handdrawn graphics and handmade guitar soundtrack.

For windows just unzip and run "Bottlecolonies.exe". Linux users should get it working with starting Bottlecolonies.py.

entries.title: Buggiest Game Ever
entries.description:
I've submitted this early to avoid the feeding frenzy in a couple of hours, and will update my web host one last time within the submission hour.

The object of the game is to survive as many waves of monsters as possible, while building your ants' nest. You can control your workers and their harvesting by creating networks of pheromones; you can create some fairly complex networks.

[edit]

I've added a zip archive of the source. It runs on a vanilla  LAMP setup with no plugins. there is only 1 file of PHP, the vast majority of code is in JS, but I thought I should include this as well.

entries.title: Epic space defence
entries.description:
well, i was sick all weekend and my grandpa has pneumonia now, so i had to spend some time helping my grandma, so I didn't get much time on the jam. We tried our best but couldn't pull it off in the end, but heres what we got (didn't get to implementing the graphics yet).

controls:
wasd : move
1-2 : switch tower
click : place tower

entries.title: I Painted a Tiny World
entries.description:
Edit: woops, didn't realise using sourced music was against the rules of the 48 hour compo, changed to a jam entry instead

Edit2: If you struggle with the game it may be because of a bug - when you get hit by an enemy it slows you down until you release the key and then press it again. It's kinda a bug I never fixed.

You play as a collector of tiny worlds, several tiny worlds exist within your
world, and your world is a tiny world existing within another world.

You hoover up the worlds and their inhabitants.

The main gameplay concept is that your character must paint the platforms they
run on. The paint gradually 'drips' and the platform is lost.

WASD - Movement
Left Click - Fire paint platforms
Right Click - Hoover up planets

Edit "prefs.txt" to set your window resolution (1280x1024 or less for best performance)

entries.title: Invasion of the Planet Snatchers!
entries.description:
INVASION OF THE PLANET SNATCHERS!

A silly game based on a REALLY silly take on the theme, so hopefully it makes up in charm what it might lack in technical polish.  Oh, and there's no actual win condition...  Just have fun rampaging around!

Start main.exe or run main.py if you have python and pygame installed.  Instructions are on the title screen.

This is my first submission to the Ludum Dare and there are bunches of things I would wish to do better in this game.  There are a few bugs with geometry, the draw order is inconsistent, and I only got to implement about half of what I wanted.

But still, it works!  Great success!   :-)

Technical notes:
 * Tested on Python 2.7 and Pygame 1.9, on Linux and Windows XP and 7
 * It does all the drawing and junk in software, so it actually needs a fairly powerful CPU to run at full speed.  I didn't really try to optimize it.  Works fine on my Phenom II, didn't run so fine on my Atom netbook...

The goal of the game is to make it to the wormholes (the big spirals) and those will take you to the next stage. There are 5 stages (after finishing the 5th, it takes you back to stage 1).

Controls
-----------
w, up arrow, or space to jump
a or left arrow to move left
d or right arrow to move right
r to restart the level

-------

Here is the link to download the XNA framework
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

Also big thanks to The Tape Factory for providing our music!

entries.title: Super World of Progress Achievement
entries.description:
Sadly, our game isn't remotely finished, but here it is anyway. I wonder if anyone is interested in seeing it developed further in the future. We'd really like to complete it.

This was our first jam, and the first time we've attempted to make a full game together. The main focus of the project was to learn how to make games in HTML5 and to get experience in pixel asset creation. Though the game wasn't finished, we learned a heck of a lot and had loads of fun.

The idea was to present a world in which the only currency is "progress" (the stuff that fills bars). To the inhabitants of this world, achieving progress is all that matters in life.

It was intended to be a satire on the current state of 'achievement'-based game design - especially within MMOs - where some players can be compelled to feel that their game world is more important than the real one, when in fact, it is 'tiny' in comparison.

In its current state, it's a simple demonstration of basic platform mechanics and tile rendering in HTML5. In the future, there will be an ultra-compelling level-up mechanic, NPCs to talk to, and hopefully an ending of sorts.

One of the biggest lessons learned during the Jam was that no matter how small you think your idea is - it's still pretty big.

entries.title: The Tiny Green World
entries.description: The Tiny Green World is a game based around the theme TinyWorld. In it people are wrecking the tiny world you grew up in cutting trees, drilling into the earth and building factories that belch greenhouse gasses into the atmosphere. Things have gone too far, posters alone used to help but now you must use another tool, the brainwashing ray. You must brain wash the citizens to get popularity and make them respect the environment. However the military aren't too happy at you brain washing their loyal citizens and they are out to get you! Every time you use the ray they are alerted to your presence and send a plane to sort you out! With the popularity you earn, you can buy upgrades to your brain washer, as well as buying propaganda items (fliers, blimps, billboards) until eventually everyone is environment-happy you save the world! Left click on the shop items to buy, and left click on the BrainWashingRay(tm) to start brainwashing citizens! The aim of the game is to get your poularity upto 150, if you have any questions or would like to send me your score please do so, my twitter is @EliteWareGames and my email is [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ . entries.title: Tiny God
entries.description:
Little God is a Ludum Dare 23 - Little World game.
It is written in WebGL using Three.js. This is the first time I've worked with WebGL or Three.js... overall, I had a blast!

There is at least two known bugs:
-When restarting the game, the textures don't load properly, which can result in "invisible" worlds.
-It takes a second to load, which can be choppy for a second.

If the assets don't all load the first time, try reloading the page.

I only tested this in Chrome on OSX.

Please let me know if you have any trouble

entries.title: Tiny World War
entries.description:
Action packed war on a global scale... Will you heroically conquer the tiny planet Gearth? Or will you simply be blown into tiny bits?!!

* Top down run and gun shooter with a twist
* Fast paced and gratuitously violent :D

Created in around 20 hours with Flixel, DAME, otomata, sfxr and chums ... Any and all comments gratefully received, please feel free to visit my blog at www.superfluidgames.com and hope to see you for the next Ludum Dare ;D

entries.title: Unforbidden Planetoid
entries.description:
We set out with an ambitious plan to make a single-level metroidvania game set on a small planetoid. I was writing the game basically from scratch in Processing with a bit of a leg up using my QEngine game template. We were not able to finish much of a game by the jam deadline as planned, but we've got art, animation, music, sound, collision, player movement, and gunfire implemented. So this is to show you what we were able to accomplish in around 68 hours of work with one artist and one programmer. You can still play this as a traversal game - try to navigate the maze to get to the core of the planet!

Controls:
Move: Arrow keys
Shoot: x
Jump: z

You may need to click the window after the game has loaded before input will be accepted.

Credits:
Art, Level Design - Daniel Adams
Programming, Sound Design - Eliot Lash
Music - Optomon

entries.title: A Giant Step
entries.description:
A self discovering journey seen through the eyes of a giant. We call this an avoid'em up game. Do you believe you can get to the end?

- Use the left and right key to control your steps
- Use the space key to stomp your foot earlier

Made using:
- Stencyl for programming
- Audacity for Sound
- Photoshop, 3ds Max and GraphicsGale for graphics

Known issue:

- The right leg animation sometimes bugs.

entries.title: Affinity World
entries.description:

Go on a 'adventure' where you control....yourself and discover how the world really works...

The game was made with Game Maker 8.1.

entries.title: CursorVsMan
entries.description:
Hi,
I couldn't dedicate a lot of time to this Ludum Dare because I have exams next week...

Anyway, here's my game - you'll need cgywin if you want to turn it in windows since it uses the curses library.

You play a cursor trying to stop someone from typing a text file by messing with them a bit.

It's the "Tiny World" inside the computer, though that's a bit of a stretch.

Should work 100% fine on Mac and Linux if you have Python installed, windows will need to be run within cgywin (I think...)

To run go to a terminal window and type "python CursorVsMan.py readMe.txt", you can use pretty much any text file instead of readMe.txt!

entries.title: Finding Yourself
entries.description:
Finding Yourself is a game about finding yourself. "Fancy bumping into you here! It's a small (I mean tiny) world!", you'll say.

It's a platformer. There's 15 levels. Stats are recorded and saved, so you can continue playing later on if you get tired for the time being.

The controls are shown as you play the first few levels, but whatever:
You use the arrow keys, D, and... If it so be, ESC. :(
You can also press F4 to toggle Fullscreen, and F9 saves a screenshot in the location of the game.

Source file is a .gm81 file.
I ended up using Game Maker, SFXR, Pxtone (for one sound), Autotracker-bu for music, MS Paint and Paint.net for Graphics. Funfact: I made the font used in this game (with http://fontstruct.com/) over a year ago with the initial "Finding Yourself" idea in mind. The font can be downloaded here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/6478756/Misc/shake.ttf

Enjoy, and tell me where I went wrong!

~Maple

Player 2 moves with the arrow keys and interacts with things using shift.
