entries.title: Land of Food
entries.description:
NOTE TO ALL PEOPLE WHO CAN'T PLAY IT:
The JRE6 is required. Get it at http://www.java.com/en/
If your on Windows, use my .bat file. If your on Mac or Linux, run it from the console by "java -jar SmallWorld.jar" (Obviously after CD-ing into it's directory).

Made in ~10 hours due to complications...

It's a game styled after MUDs. but with only one player...

Made in Java, works on all platforms.

entries.title: Lemming Apocalypto
entries.description: Lemming Apocalypto is about a lemming that has to run somewhere very fast in order to save the lemming princess before something bad happens to her. Evil lemmings will try to prevent you from reaching her, jump over them and conserve your momentum to succeed. Choose your jumps wisely.

entries.title: Little Gray Rocketeer
entries.description:
If the Dropbox link doesn't work for you, please play here. 
http://www.truploader.com/view/714516

The game is incomplete. I had half of what I had planned done with only four hours left, so I only added some polish. 

IF YOU CAN'T FIND THE PLANET
-Don't give up.
-You can figure out how fast you're moving with the stars. If the stars are moving, you're going really, really fast and you're going to whiz by the planet.
-If you come to a complete stop, the planet will suck you in.

I know there's not much to it, but I hope you have fun anyway.

entries.title: Operation Tinder Feat
entries.description: This game is based on childhood summer water-gun fights I would wage in my neighborhood.  The combination of all out water battles, post-battle water treaties, and other elementary school politics formed a tiny world that me and every other kid on the block lived in every summer.

entries.title: Our Worlds
entries.description: Re-size the cubes to match the Circle its moving to. Use left mouse down to expand and right mouse down to expand the cubes. Every wrong landing shrinks the World.

entries.title: Rock 'n' Slash
entries.description:
Rock 'n' Slash is an arcade where your goal is to stay alive and increase your score by killing enemies with your gun and sword.

I'd say the man-hours invested in development is somewhere around 19 to 21.

Note: To get the source code submitted to Ludum Dare, go to the tags section in the GitHub repository and download ludum-dare.zip.

entries.title: Searching for Heaven
entries.description:
You are a spirit lost in the ether, trying to find your way back to heaven. Along the way, you will change forms to discover different abilities. I am purposely not posting any how-to because the game is designed to be intuitive.

PLEASE LET ME KNOW IF YOU GET STUCK, MENTALLY OR GAME-BROKEN-LY.

We only had 48 hours to do this (we work on Mondays, duh), so the levels don't get as deep as I'd like and there is some placeholder art (mainly the gorilla has only 2 frames of animation). But I think we did what we set out to do.

"We" is...

Eli Delventhal (demonpants) on code, game design, level design
Seth Robles on art and game design
Mario Godoy on musix
sfxr on sound effects ;-)

Please enjoy! Rate it all 5s!

=======

If you're stuck, a walkthrough:

World 1 -
Throw a bone to hit the switch, wait for the rabbit to eat the carrot (get good karma), kill yourself, walk clockwise to the goal.

World 2 -
Walk clockwise and press the switches in the order: dirt, seed, water, sun to grow the tree. Walk counter-clockwise and hit the switch to feed the rabbit behind you. Walk into the spikes to kill yourself. Jump over the spikes to the goal.

World 3 -
Jump clockwise onto the raised platform above the rabbit. Walk right until it falls, killing the rabbit below. Keep heading clockwise onto the spikes to kill yourself. Walk counter-clockwise to the goal.

World 4 -
Walk clockwise and go up the hill. Drop down. Notice the two saplings. Walk counter-clockwise under the hill and hit the switch. Jump back counter-clockwise to where you started. Keep going counter-clockwise until your are past the rabbit and on top of a platform with a ramp going down counter-clockwise. Jump clockwise onto the raised platform, keep running and do another jump. Wait for the spike ball, then jump again. Finally, jump up and clockwise to hit a switch on the top of World 3. This feeds the rabbit. Now drop down and go counter-clockwise down that ramp. Platform up this section, avoiding the spike ball. When you get to the top, head clockwise first, and walk clockwise (don't jump). You'll drop onto a platform with a switch. Now that you have 3 karma kill yourself. Hold space and press left on the keyboard to push the block down. Keep walking counter-clockwise up the hill to the goal.

World 3 part 2 -
Walk counter-clockwise until you're at a tree. Don't proceed counter-clockwise to the trees, instead go up the ramp by walking back clockwise. Push the block down onto the switch to feed all 4 rabbits. Then go counter-clockwise to the goal.

World 5 - Kill yourself on the spikes. If you do not have 4 good karma from the rabbits on the previous world, then you can never make it to heaven. Walk into the spikes. Walk into the goal.

HEAVEN! WIN!

(FYI, a game-breaking sequence break was hotfixed and uploaded)

entries.title: SheNanoGans
entries.description: SheNanoGans is an exploratory experiment on the genre of visual novels and adventure games.

entries.title: Shrink Force
entries.description:
This was our fun little weekend project made by a few high school kids. Unfortunately, I'm about to head of to school now, so I can't give a detailed description. The game is called Shrink Force and you enlarge shrunken, floating, rocket propelled life rafts people created before their tiny demise. You must get to the giant grow ray on the moon to destroy the expanding shrink force and save the universe.

CONTROLS:

- WASD to move
- Space bar to jump
- Left click to shoot grow-ray

I'll improve this post and post the source when I get home. It was written in C++ using a game engine I wrote myself that uses Irrlicht, Bullet, and irrKlang. It's based off of Unity.

entries.title: Steel
entries.description:
Story: After crashing on a strange, small planet made out of steel the only thing in sight is a lever. As you pull it, the planet seems to change...

Kitten included. Everything except for the kitten banner and rbSFML logo made in the 48 hours by me and myself.

Tools:
-Ruby
-rbSFML
-gedit
-Gimp
-sunvox

Edit: Fixed Windows binary link.

entries.title: Tiny Neutrino
entries.description:
- PLEASE USE CHROME OR SAFARI FOR BEST RESULTS -

In the world of the tiny, a neutrino is about as tiny as they come.  So small and so near zero mass, they can pass straight through any matter.

Built in the core of the Sun, break your atomic particle apart until you reach the size of a neutrino.  Pass through walls to reach the exit.

Use the arrow keys to move.  Crash into other particles to score points.  Other neutrinos cannot help break you down, they will pass through you.  So if you run out of particles, you will have to start over by pressing ESC.

entries.title: Tiny Parallel Worlds
entries.description:
His world may be tiny in 2 dimensions, but he has the new found ability to travel to parallel tiny worlds!

Help the 3-pixel red dude find his spoon so he can eat and grow up big and strong.

- Java Applet, requires Java 1.6
- Source code created from total scratch in IntelliJ IDEA IDE
- Sounds created with bfxr
- Killer graphics created in paint.net

entries.title: Tiny World Defense!
entries.description:
Well here it is then, my first LD entry! Not only that but my first finished game too.

It's not that great .. but it exists! So that's definitely something there. :D

Instructions and whatnot are in the Readme file.

entries.title: Tiny world helicopter rescue
entries.description: Woo! My fist ludum dare is DONE O.o

entries.title: [Darkness Creeping]
entries.description:
My Entry for LD 23 - An attempt at a 3D survival horror in an insane 48 hours. Highlights of LD23 included TWO power blackouts (the first was for 7-8 hours).

Game Summary:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You play as an unknown character, whos been rejected by the people he belongs to. You've spent too long, lying on the floor in a dark and abandoned old dungeon, completely forgotten. 
Suddenly you take it upon yourself to escape, and so that is your main mission - starting by escaping the cell youve been in for an immeasurable amount of time, into an unknown and potentially dangerous environment. 
Lots of critters scurry about the floor, and with thanks to a special ability (the very ability which got you into so much trouble in the first place) you find you can inhabit the bodies of the smaller creatures scurrying nearby.

Maybe this will be your first step towards being free again?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




Made with Blender(BGE), Gimp, Audacity and coded in Python.


>>Read the Readme.txt!<<
Controls are in there, I didnt have time to add all of the instructions in-game, but most major controls made it into actual in-game popups.


**** Missing VCOMP100.dll error????
Some people have reported that the game wont run due to a 'missing VCOMP100.dll' error. This is to do with not having installed the Visual C++ 2012 Redistributable on your system
Its a pain that this is happening, but quick google search will come up with several different places to download (go for the one hosted on the Microsoft website). Once thats installed everything should go smoothly. (for those of you who are really keen to play this game, but who are being stopped by this error)
****



-Audio issues fixed in v0.9-

Ill be trying to get both a mac and linux version up asap as well, so no one will be forgotten hopefully :)
Also, note, you may need a pretty modern rig to run this game. Theres a link below to a less resource intensive build of the game, either way though -let me know if your fps are acceptable - or not. That was my main concern during the development of the game....

Full 48 hour timelapse of the creation of the game below!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-s_raRVcF0


So feel free to download (30mb) and give it a shot! Id appreciate feedback and comments.

Windows(32bit)- http://www.mediafire.com/?7684syfaa19day2 (as in the header)

*source is also available (~85mb) (see header)


Original build (v0.6) is here, this is what I first submitted, and is 64bit windows only, with show stopper bugs - so most people wont be able to play it - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?ly15m87itpqkoj0





Is the game running slow for you?? 
Heres a build which should run faster for those with slower computers/laptops, Ive cut out the dynamic shadows so youll lack some eye candy there. And the frame size is reduced to 800x600. 
Link -  Win(32bit) http://www.mediafire.com/?c4e3u8oribpz0ba

entries.title: Accretion
entries.description:
You are a caveman. In Space. You live on a tiny floating rock, constantly hounded by impinging ice crystals. You can jump from one rock to the next, with your own personal gravity field determining where you land. 

Up Jumps. 
Down Kicks. 
Left and Right circumnavigate the rock you are on.

Your goal? Kick all the rocks into each other, until finally you create a decently sized (yet still tiny) world you can live on.

BUG ALERT: You are in the depths of space. You may freeze. So may your browser. 

About 4.3 MB. Stencyl exported to Flash.

entries.title: Big Bad Dom Finds a Little Happiness
entries.description:
Intended to be a mini-RPG, the battle system is still a work-in-progress and thus not reachable. That leaves only the globe trotting to pick up items. 

This game has BDSM themes but is cartoon depictions of nudity.

entries.title: Boulder Drop
entries.description:
This is my first entry into Ludum Dare and it went far and large better than expected. This is the first game that has seen the light of day from my frame work. The other game I'm working on has been taking sooo long it felt really good to get in and write a little dirty code over the weekend.

All in all I spent < 20 hours on the whole thing. I would have submitted to the Compo but I work at a bar to help make ends meet right now and this weekend I happened to be scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Friday was the only night I wasn't on till close (2am). I also had not used some of the code in my framework before so I had no idea how much patching it might take to get it up and running, of those 20 hours about 5 was spent on rewriting classes. So, for me, this was quite an accomplishment.

I am very seriously thinking about making this into a full game, I like the boulder dropping mechanic and have a ton of ideas on how to make this interesting for 20+ levels.

As always feedback is appreciated, good or bad. It actually just puts a spring in my step knowing people are playing something I created. 

Cheers and happy gaming!

entries.title: Crysthurl
entries.description:
A very simple platformer where the protagonist has to throw blocks/crates to smash a white hexagon, which is meant to represent a crystal.

You must build towers, avoid spikes, commit suicide and... jump, to progress.

After a couple of failed attempts, this is my first finished game for Ludum Dare. So, although it's not the best game ever, I'm still pretty happy.

Made with FlashPunk (FlashDevelop), PXTone, Fireworks and Paint.

entries.title: CULVEN
entries.description:
Culven is a sandbox themed RPG game, it consists of 4x4 sprites(a few exceptions) and has very retro-like gameplay, it features auto-saving, particle effects, Animated water, a very large world, 3 types of monsters, collectibles, a menu-screen, Dynamic Leveling/Damage System, Dungeons, Aweomse Lighting system, Pixel Art galore.

Enjoy,
NeoTalon


NOTE:The black lines that appear on the screenshots are related to my computer, they will NOT show up on your screen

entries.title: Doctor!
entries.description: This is far from complete. We have one level atm. It looks like it'll be fun to expand though so if you like the looks of it, just let us know and well link you to the more final product in a week or so. Also, it might not even be up right now, seeing as we made it in greenfoot and I'm not sure where they start their main...

entries.title: Electron Cloud
entries.description:
Maybe need a bit more adjustments and other balances, but it is really playable (but maybe hardcore), and there are ways to have fun !

Click on an electron of another nucleus to steal it. When you have more than 10 electrons with you, you can click on the monster in the center of the world to trade 10 electrons for ("your number of electrons" -10)*2 + 10...So if you have 14 electrons, you'll receive 18 points, you see ?

Play like hit-and-run, and be carefull, if you focus too much on a nucleus, he'll become angry...

CLICK ON ATOM WAY TO SEE INFOS ABOUT HOW TO PLAY

entries.title: Milunar
entries.description:
Milunar is a defense shooter in which you fire from turrets on moons to protect your little planet. Click or tap to fire, and try to avoid hitting your planet whilst hitting the blue enemies.

Timelapse Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HV9wNQO2k8o
Burst Project: http://indiefunction.com/burst/p/milunar

Oh yeah, and it's an HTML5 game, in case anyone's wondering.

entries.title: Necro Gaia
entries.description: You are a Terra; an earth like planet. Your sun has begun to travel to another galaxy, and so you must follow. Drag & drop your planetary siblings in this retro styled arcade defender. Complete with boss battle!

entries.title: Scape
entries.description: Arrow Keys to move

entries.title: Smashbot 2000 vs The Small Ones
entries.description:
Smashbot 2000 is angry. He's found a horde of tiny people living on a tiny world. He MUST destroy them!

Use WASD for steering, mouse for aiming and shooting and spacebar for triggering your shield.

Notes: 
Made in XNA. Requires Installation of the XNA Framework. (Link provided)

The game may be a bit unbalanced, and it lacks a lot of features that i simply didn't have time to implement(Music, more enemies etc)

entries.title: Snowglobe
entries.description:
"A snowglobe is like a small world, but it's only alive when you shake it"

Snowglobe is a christmas themed game about snowglobes, santas and running shoes.

If the 64-bit linux version does not work, you can try the 32-bit one.

Controls:
Arrow Keys or WASD - Move
Up, W or S - Jump

entries.title: Sprace
entries.description:
You are a spermatozoon/sperm/spermatozoa. You want to be the only one in the race. Touch them all to kill them all.

Protip: Play in Chrome rather than Firefox (sorry, poor performance under the latter).

>>> Homepage for the game http://xi.gd/ld23/niavlys/ <<<
>>> Check out 4 other games made for LD23 by #define true false! http://xi.gd/ld23/ <<<

N.B: It's unfinished, buggy, and definitely not... polished. Probably better than I thought it would be, though.

N.B.2: It was made using only HTML5 <canvas> and <audio> elements, and several hundred lines of JavaScript. I used the jQuery library, and GIMP for creating sprites and backgrounds. The 'plop' was recorded using my mouth, and a Zoom H2 recorder. I tried to add some music and more sound (using a beautiful Gretsch guitar), but I wasn't able to finish this in time.

Edit 2012.04.27: I added a Start/Restart button and (very) simple instructions. I hope this kind of change is accepted after the 48 hours. I promise I did not change anything except that. If anyone has a problem with that, I can revert to the previous version, but the game in itself is exactly the same.

Edit 2012.04.29: Fixed preloading of images (somehow) and game launch (with the Right key rather than click on button), I consider these as bugfixes.

entries.title: Stupid Ants
entries.description:
Ants are stupid, they just walk around randomly. Help them collect food by marking a path. Food means more ants, more ants > more food > more ants... You get what I'm saying.

Try to gather 200 ants before the time runs out !

- ants pickup food (berries and sugar)
- if they bring it back to a heap, more ants will come
- create bounding boxes to keep them in a certain area
- use your boxes wisely, sometimes it's better to just let them run arround


-- UPDATE --

Thanks for the comments so far, here's a quick apology on why the game is so short.
I tried to implement different levels so you could get the hang of how the boxes would react and what the better tactics were. But unfortunately I ran out of time leaving the game without levels but with a few bugs. Those bugs are:

- once the food recource is gone all remaining recources (if the ants are still carrying them) won't spawn any new ants.
- when you deselect a tile the collision detection fails horribly and warps ants at the border to an adjacent tile.

For those who are interested, I'll try to upload a fixed and an enhanced version somewhere this weekend.

-- THANKS FOR PLAYING --

entries.title: The Lair
entries.description:
The Lair is a puzzle platformer. You are locked inside the demons lair and to get out, you have to find the key to the main door.

Keys:
A or LEFT: Move left 
D or RIGHT: Move right 
SPACE: Jump, Skip splash screen

entries.title: The Last Colony
entries.description:
I'm happy with how this turned out - an onslaught style tower-defence game in 12 hours :)

I still need to add more waves, balance it, give them abilities (shields etc) and add more than one tower type.

Made with unity, bfxr and spacescape.

Controls:
Rotate the view with the cursor keys.
Click on a triangle to select it, then click the 'build' button to construct a tower (the button is just below the planet).
There's a limit of 4 towers (I put the limit in at the end as it's too easy - you can beat it with just 1 tower)

entries.title: The Traveler
entries.description:
UPDATE (01/03/2012) : Added Mac application. Music is not working (only compiled sources without modifying what was made during the 48h)

Travel through differents snow globes. Shake the globe, to create a passage.

Featuring 5 levels + 1 Secret Level


Tools : haXe NME, FlashDevelop, BFXR, AVIARY, ASESPRITE

entries.title: These Planets Ain't Big Enough For The Both Of Us!
entries.description:
Unfortunately I had to abandon several features due to lengthy bug-hunts, but local multiplayer works!

I was under heavy pressure with the AI right at the end, I was on a roll, nearly finished it first time without any bugs which I was overjoyed with as it used recursion and a fair amount of looping and lists, until there was one, and with 15 minutes left, all I could do was box off singleplayer... Oh well, so close.

Controls are:
........................Player 1:...Player 2:
Left:.................A...............Left Arrow
Right:...............D...............Right Arrow
Jump:...............W..............Up Arrow
Crouch:............S...............Down Arrow
Hop Planets:....I...............Numpad 0
Punch:..............J...............Numpad 1
Kick:.................K...............Numpad 2
Block:...............L...............Numpad 3

Grab your buddy and throwdown! In space! Because everything is better in space.

entries.title: Tiny little World
entries.description:
Instructions:

Click on any character or their respective portraits on the right to select him. 
Click anywhere to send the character to that spot or place.
Left/Right or A/D (Swipe on Android) to turn the Camera around the map.
You can not walk through or on Mountains or off the island.
If you want to interact with something, click onto it. Make sure there is no gap or mountain in the way of the character.

Thanks for your interest!

Fridge Eater & Salynrad

entries.title: Tiny Planet
entries.description:
Set off as many stars as possible before day the night is over!

Use the mouse to rotate the planet and collide with stars.

Made with Unity. Unity webplayer required to play. Makes copious use of iTween and the Detonator framework. Bfxr for sound and Aviary for music.

Phew! Looking forward to playing everyone else's game!

BONUS POINTS: Guess the Joni Mitchell song I was listening to when I came up with the concept for this... ^_^

EDIT: Post-comp version with MOAR SPLOSIONS: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1971219/Tiny%20World/tinyworldv101/WebPlayer/WebPlayer.html - Enjoy!

EDITv2: Post comp link version above now has keyboard controls - use either the arrows or wasd to control the tiny planet. Cheers!

EDITv3: A post-comp version that reduces explosions, to make it easier to see what you're doing. Wusses. ^_^

entries.title: Tiny Protector
entries.description:
Best experienced in Chrome
Some performance issues in some versions of Firefox
See how long you can last, post your scores :-)

entries.title: Tiny Timmy and Big Bill
entries.description:
***Game's preloader isn't working. It's 3 mb, give it a few to load***

Art and animation by Xelu. www.xelubest.com

Programming by Omar Shehata. www.4urentertainment.org

Allow me to introduce you to Tiny Timmy and Big Bill! Control both as you get them to work together to get over obstacles!

Collect all the mustaches in the level to advance!

So we practically killed ourselves making this game. More on this in the imminent post-mortem. Stay tuned!

What I am really proud of is how much potential this game has. While the concept of moving around two characters by switching between them has been done before, I don't think controlling two simultaneous characters has been explored too much.

entries.title: tiny World Defence
entries.description:
Defend Tiny World from the evil flying spheres of doom!

WASD = Steer Ship
Up Arrow = Boost
Left/Right Arrow = Roll Left/Right
Space = Fire

entries.title: Acari love
entries.description:
Developed by AwokerGames.com and with Gamux.com.br

Flashpunk, SFXr and AutoTracker-bu (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/13/if-you-find-it-hard-to-make-music-read-this) were used.

entries.title: Astrosurf
entries.description:
Your planet has been knocked off course by a wayward asteroid, and you'll need to guide it through a series of wormholes to get back to it's orbit. Doing so however, comes at the tremendous cost of your planet's inhabitants.

Controls:
(Hold) left-click behind the planet to propel it
Right-click in front to shoot a vine out
Zoom in and out with "W" and "S"

entries.title: Atomic Bug
entries.description: This is a tower-defense like game, but I didn't really get to finish it. The obvious thing missing is more than one combination of atoms to make weapons. I wanted to add lots more enemies, and weapons that can block the lane. I will flesh this out over the next few days though and try out those ideas. I think this game could be fun!

entries.title: Away from Home
entries.description:
Hello!

This was a fun game to make and I'm glad that I joined this competition. I had plenty of fun designing planets to explore and strange traps and hidden resources. The hardest part of making this game was the shrinking menu system, it kept on having bugs non stop.

This game is kind of split into two parts.
1. You have to collect coal and machine parts in order to fly home and win the game.
2. If you don't fly home you can shrink the worlds so that they are tiny. You can also change their climate and gravity. and you can plant and harvest plants.

Press F1 for more info on the shrinking system and on the game in general.

Thanks goes to:
Lumberjack_Liam for Ideas and support.
Missjaykay for support and testing.
Lava_laura for the hot chocolate.
Ysmor the wise for suggestions and testing.
Titou for ideas, bug spotting and testing.

*Spoiler!: for those of you who want to find all four parts but can't find the last, here are the locations: Second planet in Alpha, Beta, Third planet in Gamma, Last planet in Omega.*

entries.title: Baby Farm
entries.description:
Here it is, the one and only Baby Farm.

Simple Description:
You plant baby seeds in a farm and watch them grow up. A metaphor for life. As we grow older, the world becomes smaller, eventually tiny, and women are everywhere.

Tips:
-Do not press the "Start Living!" button unless you've already planted some babies!
-Do not choose "normal" speed unless you are an experienced baby farmer!
-Babies need food and sleep to keep them alive! Make sure you surround them with beds and food.
-When you turn into a man, use the arrow keys to move him around.
-Also, do not trap anything living in a 1x1 closed area, the game will freeze.

First Ludum Dare entry.

entries.title: Bugs Planet
entries.description:
My first Game for Ludumdare, FUN :)

I created it in less than 24 hours because of some time issues, (one of my cousins got married this weekend ;))


Goal: rule the Planet (with your Bug population)
Theme: guess :P
Programming language: Java

Uses Programs: Eclipse, GIMP

Edit:
uploaded a timelapse, unfortunatly i only captured some parts in the end

entries.title: Don't Mess with the Gnomes!
entries.description:
Hello there, second Ludum Dare for me. Hope to improve a little bit December's result!

For the theme "Tiny World" I immediately thought of gnomes. So here's a small platform game of an angry gnome that must help his captured friends.
I kind of tried to twist it a little bit by adding a few puzzles including mouse buttons, I hope those are not that messy.
This time I think I better managed my time and came up with a more complex game.
There's a total of four levels with increasing difficulty.

CONTROLS:
keyboard left and right arrows - move
keyboard up arrow - jump
left and right mouse buttons - interact

Game made in HTML5 with Construct 2.
Graphics with Inkscape.
Sound effects with Audacity.
Music with Musagi.

I hope you enjoy it as much as I did creating it!

P.S.
Awesome ending, so don't give up and finish it!

entries.title: Expand Explore Expatiate
entries.description:
Hello, thanks for stopping by!
Expand Explore Expatiate (EXP3) is my second Ludum Dare game, made with GameMaker 8.0 and sfxr. It's a simple top-down exploration game, using the arrow keys for movement. Red things allow you to take control of larger objects, while purple things kick you down another size. Get to the goal in the upper left corner to win!

(After a few folks played and hit a bug, I uploaded a fixed version that keeps you from getting stuck in the sliding floor puzzle. If you play the older version, don't go on the bottom-most circle tile, you'll get suck!)

entries.title: Free My World
entries.description:
Free my world.

Destroy the evil Demon who is threatening your tiny world.
My first LD submission for learning myself XNA, somewhat shoehorned into theme :)
 
XNA4 Game.
The following prerequisites are required and will be installed by the setup.exe file (use the Web selection):

Windows Installer 3.1
Microsoft .NET Framework 4 Client Profile (x86 and x64)
Microsoft XNA Framework Redistributable 4.0

entries.title: Hoperay
entries.description:
Ok, my Ludum Dare #23 entry is done at time! It's my first try and I'm happy with myself. 

The game is a shmup about a tiny spaceship against a big and tough boss with increasing difficulty when boss health is decreasing. 

Please, read the "Readme" file. There are the controls' guide to play it. Sorry, I didn't have the time to explain it in the game. If you have a doubt or advice, PM to e-mail or tweet me. I will answer your questions.

The music is not mine, though. I get them from Newgrounds' webpage and i has give the credits to their respective artists (in the Readme file and in the ending scene), like says the Newgrounds' webpage, so I'm not breaking any rights using it.
I put them because no videogame deserve be "in mute" and they gives a better videogame's feeling.

But i will try to learn to create music so in the next Ludum Dare i can say "It's all mine" xD

I hope you enjoy it.

EDIT: I'm posting an updated version of the game with some fixed bugs, some animations added, lower sfk volume and some patterns changed. Maybe it's a little more difficult than before, so enjoy it xD

entries.title: Itty-bitty botty
entries.description:
Itty-bitty botty is a point-and-click adventure game.
It is developed for Ludum Dare #23, a rapid game development contest.

The game is developed within 48 hours by Roy van Rijn (http://www.redcode.nl and/or http://www.royvanrijn.com)

Tools:
- Java (100% own code, no library)
- GIMP

Key elements of the game:
- Cute animated robot
- Multiple exciting rooms to explore
- Procedurally generated music 
  (partially created prior to the contest)

entries.title: Kamikaze Planet
entries.description:
Hello folks! My  name is Monomer, and here's my compo game!

Created using Flash Develop and Flixel, as well as Flixel Power Tools!

Music was done in Reaper primarily with Plogue Chipsounds and a little bit of Kontakt and Battery.

Sprite work was done in Paint.net.

SUMMARY:

Great scott! A vast race of vehement tiny aliens is attacking your beloved city, and their using their own tiny planet as a weapon! Enter your Gargantuan Defense Robot (patent pending) and try and shoot that planet back up into space; don't forget about their tiny alien ships, though, and be wary of your robot's heat levels!

CONTROLS:

A and D to move

Space to fire (builds up heat)

Shift to dash (builds up more heat)

If your heat gets too high you won't be able to fire until you cool down!

Thanks for playing!
-Monomer

entries.title: Lady Bug!!!
entries.description:
I am not much of a programmer (at all) so using my limited knowledge of game maker and stuff I threw this together. I don't think I followed the theme very well... but at least its cute! Right?
Anyway you really can't lose in this game but you can win! Won't that make you feel awesome? Oh and there is no music because what I made for music was nightmare fuel.

Anyway to screw with the source (if you can call it that..) you will need to get the game maker studio beta.


EDIT: I really wish I had more time to work on this, I am planning on releasing a more fleshed out version at some point. Anyway thankyou for all the kind feedback!

entries.title: Last World
entries.description:
"You are a tiny little world in a big and hostile solar system. Try to survive by dodging solar flares, black holes, asteroids and more. Pick up moons and use their defense turrets to defend yourself."

Gameplay video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nMfX2GseRAI

A physics/gravity simulated space survival game with charming 2D graphics, sound effects, particle effects and an awesome original soundtrack. Enjoy the ambiance of space!

Note! Moons can shoot lasers. Click when you have a moon in orbit to shoot.

Made by 5 Swedish university students, participating in Ludum Dare for their first time: 
* Simeon Atanasov - Graphics and sound
* Cem Eliyurekli - Programmer
* Einar Holst - Programmer
* John David Olovsson - Programmer
* Marcus Wennermark - Programmer and coffee maker

Details:
Developed in Java using the Slick2D engine and JBox2D for physics. 

IMPORTANT:
* MAC USERS! If you cannot run the regular JAR file, please give the Web Start one a try. It just might work. 

* Please make sure that you are using the official Sun/Oracle Java versions. OpenJDK has UNPLAYABLE performance in our game for some reason. 

* If the applet is running slow, please go ahead and try one of the standalone versions. 

Update history:
1 - Initial upload. 
2 - Added a Java Web Start version. 
3 - Some performance improvements. Applet/Web version.

entries.title: Lost in space
entries.description:
A short interactive story.

Your spacecraft crashed on a mysterious planet (more about that in the intro), and you have to rescue your crew in order to get out of it.

I hope you'll have as much fun playing it as I had making it !

entries.title: Lotion Lunatic!
entries.description:
You shoot and aim with the mouse. And move with AWD. Pretty simple. Sorry for the sloppy code! I'll fix it later when I really finish this.

~ Moist that skin!

Huh I can edit posts? Alright.
The context of this whole thing is that you're this tiny little man spreading lotion on a giant. I suppose it fits the theme.

entries.title: Mr. Butter and the Infinite Bread
entries.description:
You control Mr.Butter, and all you have to do is help him spread... himself, all over a piece of infinite bread! Avoid those pesky holes, and pickup some butter on the way to keep going!

Control Mr. Butter by pressing the left and right arrow keys. :)

Didn't have much time to work on this, but at least I'm participating. :D

entries.title: Salmonella Attack
entries.description:
I'm sending it now because I won't have time to work further on it before Ludum Dare ends.

This game is far from finished. I'll keep working on it even after Ludum Dare ends, though.

There's no art or sound effects whatsoever in the game in its current state.

I'll write a post mortem about this game on my LD blog later, and tell more about what happened during the development of this game. 


Instructions:

Use the arrow keys to move the player character around the screen. 

Every time the player character touches the rectangle in the upper right parte of the screen, it becomes larger, but it makes little creatures called "Salmonellas" to hunt him down. The idea behnd the game is to make the player character grow as large as possible while, at the same time, avoid the Salmonellas chasing it.

This game was made with Unity 3D.

entries.title: Tiny Floppy
entries.description:
To launch the game, use the bat on windows, the .sh on Linux.
/!\ on Linus you might need to give the execution right to the binary

nota : the gameplay is small as I hadn't the time to implement the computer's ai. But all the base mechanics are here.

BackGround:
You are an AI stuck on a tiny floppy disk, and the floppy is going to be erased...
Take advantage of the situation, getting the control of the computer, and this way surviving.
[not implemented yet]
Once in control of the computer, it appears that you've grown so much, that a tiny computer is no more enough...
It's now time to find something bigger.

Description:
This is a turn-based strategy game.
There is two critical resources : memory and Computing Power.
Each components you have in your possession give you more or less of each (a CPU for example will give many CP but few mem).
There is several actions, and several units, each consuming respectively Cp and mem.
[not implemented yet]
But the computer will not let you invade it, and each aggressive action will raise the alert gauge, 
and so resulting in aggressive actions from the computer

Units: (for now) 
- code builder : this is your base, almost what's doing of you an AI : you can self generate code !
				 You get it, this unit allows you to build units (without, you can't build nothing).

- code Mover : They covers all the transportation of the units. Without it all your units are stuck on the component they are on.

- defenders : They encrypt your datas, setup firewalls and all the stuff.
			  The more you have of them on a component, the harder it will be to be taken by the computer. (and vice versa).

- viruses : All the opposite of the previous one : they undo all defenders do.
			The more you have of them on a zone, the faster it will be to get a new component, but the faster it'll alarm the computer.
			
		
Actions:
- attack : only enabled if you have viruses on the selected component. X viruses will "kill" x defenders of the attacked component.

- move : only enabled if you have code movers on this component. Move the selected unit to the selected component.

- build : only enabled if you have code builder on this component. Allows you to build a new unit.

- realloc : reallocate the memory of the selected unit. Actually, it's a big word to say that the unit is destroyed.

Interface:
no keys.

click on the components : 
 - left : select the component. allows you to perform actions from this component
 - right: show additional informations on the component.

click on the buttons :
 - attack : you need to left click a component to attack it:
 - move : you need to select a unit in the displayed menu, and then a component en which send it.
 - build : you need to select a type of unit to build
 - realloc : you need to select a unit to delete
 - end of turn : end your turn, apply all you actions, and let the computer play
 - cancel last : cancels the last action;

entries.title: Tiny Infection
entries.description:
You are a species of a virus, fighting other similar ones in a battle for the tiny little known world. Infect other cells and become the dominant species.

---

My interpretation of the theme here was more about the *tiny* than the world, as you can see. I've been thinking on this game for a few weeks, so it was just about time.

The game is HEAVILY inspired by Phage Wars and Eufloria. If you don't know them, try them, because they are quite good.

---

The game controls are quite simple:
- Move the camera with the arrow keys or WASD
- Left Click to select a cell
- Right Click to send viruses from the selected cell
- Keys 1, 2 and 3 control which types of viruses you send:
  + If none is pressed, all types are selected
  + If at least one key is pressed, only those types associated are sent. 1=Triangles, 2=Squares, 3=Circles

Cells with a shape inside them generate mostly that kind of virus. Each type of virus has a different ability:

* Triangles deal more damage and reduce the enemy's defense
* Squares increase the defense of a cell
* Circles increase the reproduction rate of a cell

The AI is really simple and basically plays randomly. I might or might not improve the AI after rating has ended.

---

APPLET ISSUES:
Some people can play on the applet, some people can't.
To be precise: The applet crashes on my laptop (Ubuntu 11.10, Java7), but works on my father's (Win7, Java6).
Just try...

INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS:
Download the "Binaries" distribution from the link section and unzip it to any location. It is important to unzip it, it won't work otherwise.
After that, just double click the JAR file. If you are on Mac/Linux, you might need to give it execution permissions before.

If it doesn't launch, execute ir from the console as:
java -jar LD23-Darkhogg-TinyInfection.jar

You might see an error. If is says something about "libjawt.so", I'm on it. If you know how to fix it, PLEASE, PLEASE contact me. If it says something about the jar/native versions, I'm also on it. I don't really know what is it, but I'll look into it.

THANKS FOR YOUR PATIENCE.

entries.title: Tiny Stick Twin Shooter
entries.description:
A hollow shell of a game that could be a Twin Stick Shooter.

Supports the Xbox 360 Controller on Windows and Mouse & Keyboard for everything else.

Basically you go through one level and destroy everything.  I wish i couldve added more but with the limited time i had I think this was a good first Ludum Dare for me.

entries.title: Weathering
entries.description:
A short little text adventure game.
Python 3.X.X is required. Explore and enjoy!

entries.title: World of desTiny
entries.description:
Instructions:

Setup: Each player clicks on a territory to choose the starting location for their empire.
Turn Sequence: 
    1. Choose a race.
    2. Collect resources.
    3. Deploy troops.
Goal: Eliminate your opponent.

Choosing a race: 
At the beginning of each turn, you choose the race you'd like to play. Each race comes with a unique magic ability that is only available while they are being played. On turns that you change your race (from the race you used on your previous turn), you will forfeit collecting resources.
    Goblins: can deploy magic resources as defensive units.
    Beasts: attack with one extra unit per deployment.
    Undead: receive a new defensive unit for each slain victim.
    Humans: can deploy magic resources as offensive units.
    Dwarves: defend with one extra unit per deployment.
    Elves: can attack territories that are farther away (neighboring their neighbors).
Collecting resources: 
After choosing a race, you are automatically awarded new resources that correspond to the types of territories that you control. Green grasses yield attacking units, blue waters yield magic units, and red clay yields defensive units.
Deploying troops: 
You can deploy troops as offensive, defensive, and sometimes (depending on your race) as magical. You may deploy as many troops to as many territories as you'd like until you either loose an offensive campaign or click on the TakeTurn/EndTurn button at the bottom of the screen.
    Offensive deployments can only be made to uncontested or enemy controlled territories. Uncontested territories are automatically won, and all of the offensive units immediately begin defending that territory. Enemy territories must be won. Each offensive unit is has a 50% chance of defeating a defending unit (even rolls are successful). When you have at least as many successful attackers as there are enemy defenders, you win the battle and any excess attackers begin defending your newly acquired territory. When you lose a battle, you lose your deployed units along with the ability deploy any more troops on this turn.
    Magical deployments are only possible with the goblin and human races. Other races' magic abilities are used automatically.
    Defensive deployments can only be made to territories that you already control. The number of defenders on a give territory is shown on the top face of the die in that territory. So there is a maximum of 6 defenders per territory.

Inspired by the theme Tiny World, and by the so-addictive Plants vs Zombies game, 1625 is a game that give an humoristic look at the current conflict between the students and the government here in Quebec.

Made in c++ and opengl under linux. 

Edit: Now works in Linux and Windows.

entries.title: A Matter of Size
entries.description:
A Matter of Size

This game is a total mashup.

It mixes dungeon-crawling, RPG, puzzle-game and arcade-game together!

Read the Read-Me for controls etc.

entries.title: Aedicula
entries.description:
An "aedicula" is a term used to describe a small shrine within another building. 

Aedicula is puzzle game where you're a minor deity trying to escape your shrine. You can shrink to a smaller size or return to your former size by going over a size changing block.

entries.title: Archipelago
entries.description:
Archipelago is a simple village building game where you help villagers gather resources to build homes. The world is procedurally generated as a string of islands. If you grow your village to 12 villagers, you win! 

==Instructions==
*WASD to move, mouse to look
*Click water tiles to convert them into land tiles to allow villagers to reach other islands.
*Villagers will gather either wood or stone and deliver it back at the main camp.
*When the villagers have collected at least 1 stone and 1 wood, hit B and switch to build mode. You can then click on a land tile to place a house, earning you another villager. Hit B again to switch back to terraforming.

Known issues:
*Sometimes you can get stuck with a tiny island with no resources and the villager wont do anything. Try connecting it to another island.
*There can potentially be performance issues when there are many villagers around.
*Day night system is pretty wonky.
*Never really got to implement much of an end game.

entries.title: Battle of the Worlds
entries.description:
This was a really fun game to make. Those that want to can use the src code and the assets in any way that you want. Ingame, use the arrow keys to move your tiny world and use the mouse to click the few things that you can including to buy stuff in the market and to eat food to regain health.

P.S. The src folder along with all the assets are found in the jar file. Just open it up with a zipping program like WinRar. I also did a journal which is also found in the jar.

Have Fun!

entries.title: Beyond
entries.description:
Floating fragments gathered together to form something of a world

A first-person game about exploration. There are 15 Golden Orbs floating around the Islands for you to find. If you enter one of the blue tubes it will become you're waypoint should you plummet into the endless void.

You can play the game online, on Windows or on Mac here > www.benswinden.com

entries.title: Big Atoms
entries.description:
Move your molecule to collect all the golden atoms. Use ARROWS keys (WASD is broken). You have a lot of inertia, use it to push the others in the way. If you did something wrong, press 'SPACE' to retry.

There is only a few levels, plus a secret (impossible) one.

A complicated level editor is included, 'Enter' to open it and test changes. 
Edit atoms: click, mousewheel, keypad 1-4, delete, insert(copy), h(lower)
Edit Molecules: pgup/pgdown, g(select). Black/negative number means fixed. 0 is player.

entries.title: Controlling
entries.description:
A platforming game with block placement. 

So I interpreted Tiny World literally and also conceptually.
Literally because the game is only 128x128.

Conceptually because the game's mechanic emerged from the idea of someone who thinks he's in control of his world. And while that is true, he can only really rearrange the pieces he has... which may help temporarily, but not in the long run. The small size of the game also contributes to his view of reality.

Some extra controls:
Left and Right arrows keys will also work 
R to reset, in case game bugs out.
If you must... [ or ] to go back and forth through levels.

Tools Used:
Flixel
FlashDevelop
Flan
Gimp 
OpenMPT Tracker

small EDIT:just made size a bit bigger so its a little easier to see. Still small though! (256x256)

entries.title: Crashed on Minutiae Prime
entries.description:
After crashing on an tiny alien planet, do you have what it takes to fix your ship and save your life?!

A point and click top down sci fi game written in ClojureScript, using HTML5.

Somewhat short, but c'est la vie. Hope you enjoy!



Works best in Google Chrome, but should work in any HTML5 ready browser (tested in firefox and chrome, let me know if you have any bugs).

entries.title: Kupow
entries.description:
The last level is ultra hard. That was intentional, since there are only 5 levels :)
Move with WASD/Arrow keys.

entries.title: Little World Adventure
entries.description:
Made by FirstRow Games
Code by DanPC
Art by FacePalmPT

(Please use the latest version of Flash player or Google Chrome)

(Please note that i was not able to complete the game so theres no ending.)

Update 22-05-2012
The world chaging mechanics is somewhat done,if the creature is happy enough the planet will start to restore and if a meteor randomly appears and it will infect the planet and destroy it.

This version's file size is quite bigger.

this is sort of tamagochi like game were the creature eat fruits from the tree when its hungry and poops when it needs to.

The objective of the game was keep the creature happy if he is happy the planet will restore and become green but this was not implemented on time.

You can plant seeds to grow trees,and fire comets the creature will mine the comets to gather stone.

wood gathering

a well

endgame mechanics.

entries.title: Pixel Progression
entries.description:
Make sure to read the included README. 'Windows' download *may* work on other OSs, but it is untested.

Crash to desktop fixed, hopefully.

PRO TIP: when you start, generate pixels as fast as you can, and move to them. Otherwise the enemies will spawn and kill you.
PRO TIP #2: There is a certain skill in combat - remember, space only works when you are next to them and the enemies walk onto you and back. If an enemy walks on you, just wait until he walks off again.

Generate your tiny 1 pixel sized world into a large area, while fighting off the enemy pixels.

Also, if you have time, play the post-compo version and give me some feedback!

entries.title: Pond: The Strider
entries.description:
Play as a water strider in this abstract arena shooter!
Left mouse button: start game/shoot
Right mouse button: glide

You can glide from anywhere to anywhere else on the screen. Look out for the pond scum! Also, the yellow eggs and larva are too strong for your projectiles. You can push them out of the way, though. You'll have to kill them when they hatch.

entries.title: ResourceCollector
entries.description:
I uploaded a post compo version which includes changeable keys(hold enter and press your desired key in option menu), looping sound(darn...i missed that bug),a simple chrashfix(dumb mistake) some more options, automatically collecting resources and best of all !!!! -> holding keys instead of tapping

Your World is in danger of becoming overpopulated...so your government send you to beat some alien butt and steal their precious ressources to maximize your tiny tiny world.

The goal of the game is to maximize you homeworld to a size of 1000. You increase the size through sending ressources to it.(you can do that in the ship menu) other then that...you can upgrade yourself and kill some aliens ^^

The Controls are :
Arrow keys for menu handling
WASD for movement
rightcontrol for attacking
space for weapon switching
hold shift for sprinting
rightalt for sucking up ressources
m for minimap
and t to teleport back to your ship
and press enter near your ship to access it

tip: traveling to the world you are currently on will respawn enemies | entering the ship will heal you

pic 4 is a Tutorial




This was made with XNA 4.0 . All the code,art and music was made by me.

XNA Redist is included in the zipfile.




Please do not vote down if you simply have a problem with xna. I will be happy to help if anything is not working.

entries.title: Run, Unicorn, Run!
entries.description:
Run, Unicorn, Run! is a dizzying endless runner.

Controls:
Fire: F
Jump: Spacebar

Developed by:
Mike Sheldon - Programming
Melissa Pohl - Art

** A Windows port is now available! **

In Run, Unicorn, Run! you play a unicorn, who may or may not be evil, fighting aliens, who may or may not be evil and also aren't really aliens, on their tiny home world. It's hard to tell who's in the wrong here, I suspect it's both of them.

We unfortunately ran out of time before we could finish the game, so it's lacking UI, sound and some gameplay features we had planned, but the existing game is fun in a simple kind of way and we hope you enjoy playing it.

entries.title: So You Want to Create a Game
entries.description:
1/2 demo / 1/2 game. This was done in about 8 hours after I learned the technology. It should only take 2-5 minutes tops to play through.

Used MS Paint and SketchBook Pro on the iPad for art. Used Screeming Bee's MorthVOX Pro and sfxr tools for sound effects. Programmed in GLBasic.

Was unable to test Mac or Linux version. Let me know if you have any issues.

entries.title: Space Cabin
entries.description:
Plot: You're stuck on a tiny floating island and you've finally grown tired of it. Find a way home any way you can!

Features: 2.5D adventure game with text parser and timber chopping action.

How to play: Press enter to bring up the text parser (or just start typing), arrows to move around and shift to attack.

Unfortunately, no sound/music made it into the jam entry due to time constraints. Planning on fixing this for a later release.

Just a disclaimer: this game is actually completable. You will get an ending screen, even though I completely forgot doing a title screen. :)

Written in C++ using Boost, Bullet and custom framework.
Artwork made in Blender, Inkscape and Gimp.

Requirements: Windows Vista/7, Direct3D 11 compatible GPU (Sorry about the crazy requirements, also hoping to fix this later).

Included CRT with zip (no more msvcp100.dll missing errors).

entries.title: Spaceman Biff vs The Red Robots
entries.description:
Bug status: The bug has been fixed!  You can now get off the ship, and so the game is playable.  And I squeezed in under the original submission time limit, too, woo!

Update: I added a link to an enhanced "jam-like" version.  This is the same game, but a bit more polish.  It was finished within the jam submission deadline.  Be sure to use the compo link for judging purposes. :)

********
THE GAME
********

You are Spaceman Biff and those annoying ex-terraformer Red Robots are lowering your property value.  Destroy them!


************
INSTRUCTIONS
************

Controls in Spaceman mode:

ARROW LEFT/RIGHT to move
ARROW DOWN to board ship (if under it)
SPACEBAR to shoot

Controls in ship mode:

ARROW LEFT/RIGHT to steer
ARROW UP/DOWN to thrust/brake
(If on planet)  ARROW DOWN to disembark Spaceman Biff!

********
ADDENDUM
********

There is no sound.  I ask that you do not vote me as 1-star for the lack of aural abuse -- just mark "NA". ;)

entries.title: Spheres..
entries.description: BEST VIEWED IN CHROME (performance fix url coming post compo)

entries.title: The Big Bang
entries.description:
Fill planets with sexual tension
Release the planet's children into the cold depths of space via planetary destruction
Spread your seeds of destruction throughout the universe

CONTROLS:
Click to select
Click + Hold to birth towards cursor
Double-Click to birth all children in current direction
Press 'R' to restart the level
Press 'M' to mute audio

STEP BY STEP:
Click on a planet to select it
If a planet is full (solid center and fetus symbol) it can be birthed while selected. 
Click and hold to birth people towards the cursor or double-click to birth all children at once.
When the planet has been completely birthed it will explode.
People are then launched through space, collide them with other planets to spread the love.
Destroy all planets to win.

* The slightly different controls for the fixed version are below the game on my site (the link takes you there). Also please rate based on the original version, it wouldn't be fair to rate based on the fixed one.

entries.title: Tiny World!
entries.description:
YELLOW ARROW GIVES YOU DOUBLE JUMP! SORRY FOR NOT MAKING IT MORE OBVIOUS :-)


follow me on the twitters!
@briancavallaro


I was only able to work on this for half the time. Not making excuses! Happy with what I did. This is my first competition, and if it weren't for the fact that I had to go to work I would have done a LOT more. As it stands it is a fun metroid-vania styled game set in a house. Hope you enjoy it! See you at the next ludumdare!!!


What to do!
So you move with arrows left and right. Then up to jump.

You collect keys to match to the colors of the doors. If you get stuck and can't get through a door you've already been through, don't worry! Keep going! You'll find another key eventually!

You will also get a yellow arrow that gives you double jump at some point to allow you access to other areas. 

The main thing is, if you get stuck, keep going! There is always a key to collect!

entries.title: tr-3012

entries.title: Triskelion
entries.description: NOTE: Firefox does not appear to work for some people, particularly on 64bit Windows. Please use Chrome if you can. Triskelion - an epic quest for the Secret of Space! Or, er, something like that. You start out in a spaceship on one of three arms of a spiral galaxy. You don't have much fuel, but you can get some more by taking the cores from the tiny worlds on the way. I'm sure nobody will mind, though watch out for the guardians... You can follow the arms of the spiral, or risk running out of fuel by jumping between them. If you make it to the center... This is complete and works fine, though there's probably a good helping of bugs. Source is on github, too, if you like. Made using that autotracker music generation script and relying on Enchant.js. The black-and-white screenshot is the locations of the planets from an average game. NOTE: If you have problems with it not taking input, try the "Alternate" link. NOTE (4/27): Fixed a bug so you actually get fuel for blowing up planets. d'oh! It should be possible to win now.

entries.title: Aloft
entries.description:
NOTE: Windows and Mac version are slightly older builds, so web version is recommended!

Had great fun making this, and am so glad I managed to actually get something done for this LD! I'll hopefully be expanding and improving this after the competition.

Created with Unity, Blender, Photoshop and as3fxr.

How to play:
------------

Construct buildings using the panel on the right. You can hover your mouse over resources to collect them. 

Watch out for airborne attacks - If all your people get blown of your world, you lose! There is no real win condition, but if you manage to complete the statue give yourself a big pat on the back :)

(Hint: Enemy bombs can be thrown back)

entries.title: Ancestor's Sword
entries.description:
On a tiny planet, the grandson of a hero is bored. Then he finds out the sword his grandfather used is still around somewhere. 

Use the arrow keys to move.
You can use space to jump regardless of direction as well.
F5 saves the game, F6 loads the game.
The game has two endings.

entries.title: Ant
entries.description:
A platform puzzle adventure game in which you play as an ant whose colony shrunk down the human race in order to dominate the world.

Music download from http://incompetech.com/m/c/royalty-free/

Probably broke a rule there. :P

entries.title: Ant Quest!
entries.description:
Save your brain damaged ant-buddy from hordes of invading beetles! 

You must get both ants to the exit to win! 

Controls: Arrow keys to move, SPACE to attack, ENTER to switch ants. 

Written in HTML5, no engines or external libraries used. Will run in all modern desktop browsers.

entries.title: Contained
entries.description:
My first LD entry ever! Epic!
Little bugs might exist, as I used this project to learn Lua and Love2D.
The game idea is that your world is becoming smaller and smaller and you have to survive.
Now has Linux and Mac port! Good play!

entries.title: Cylcubere Origins
entries.description:
My first time in ludumdare and i've learnt a lot. This game was actually made for the 48 hour competition but after waiting for an half hour on the page to load, i decided to wait and upload it to the jam instead, which gave me a solid three hour sleep before school :)

I turned out putting to much weight at the details and all my hard work is quite hidden, i hope you'll enjoy it!

EDIT

There are some bugs in the wed build and if it becomes to much off a problem please download the windows or mac build.

entries.title: Defend Tinyworld!
entries.description:
The City of Tinyworld has to make a run through hostile territory. The citizens (whose municipality extends roughly 50 metres) are about to be interdicted with extreme prejudice unless the lone flak tower and aerospace fighter can cover them.

Don't expect to make it to the end without significant loss of life.


Gameplay consists of periodic and progressively more dangerous air raids (consisting of fighters and bombers), with a breather to smash the missile crews on the ground ahead.

Tactical advice: Early on, you are far more vulnerable than the city. Try not to bump into anything, break off an attack if necessary to preserve yourself.

Later on, at about 3/4 the way through, bombers really start to overwhelm the defense tower unless you wipe them out before they reach the city.


Made with Game Maker 6.1, runs on windows 98SE through to windows 7.

entries.title: Dessert Planet
entries.description:
A pretty straightforward arcade-y item collection game. Pretty proud of this one -- whole thing came together nice and smooth, and well under the deadline. :-D

I didn't do a preloader, but it's so small it doesn't really need one. 

Update: I've made a projector, so if you want a Windows standalone, it's all yours. I've toyed with making an Android version, but can't quite get it working. We'll see if I can solve it.

entries.title: Escape from Minimars
entries.description:
NEW: post-competition version added. Should help with some performance issues in Chrome.

-----

Robolove... what can be done?

X to jump. C to shoot lazer. Shake dudes off.

ESCAPE FROM MINIMARS

Hint: try to finish the game without committing genocide!

-----

Made with melonJS.

known issues:
Collision is a bit wonky on chrome. Firefox generally works best (though audio on Linux FF may be a bit weird)
Performance is also a bit weird in Windows Chrome, depending on the level. Post-competition version fixes this somewhat.
Uses lots o' memory. Probably an issue with melonJS.

Credits:

adhesion - Code, Music, SFX, Level Design
emarcotte - Code, Level Design
mroushey - Code, Art, Level Design

entries.description: Just check the tuto and have pixels of fun xD

Because of an accident, laboratory staff was shrunk to the size of the insect. You must accompany scientists to the neighboring building to restore your size.

Highlight soldiers and give them commands.

entries.title: Mothly's World
entries.description:
You need JRE7 for playing it.

Post-Mortem: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/05/06/mothlys-world-post-mortem/

Description:

Mothly's World is a Survival Shoot'em up, where you have a fluoride agent who shoots bacteries.

Bacteries, which spawns from food, decays the teeth, and can set up in the teeth for shooting the player.

Let's defend the Tiny World of your mouth!!!

TO-DO List:
We didn't have time to add all the features we want.

Fix Save Manager
Add powerups

Mouse move: Move crosshair
Mouse left button: Fire
Use bomb: Space

Programming by:

entries.title: My Little Planet
entries.description:
"Day 13:

13 days ago, being hunted by a bizzare faction of
creatures I have never seen before, I crashed, and I have
been battling them and asteroids ever since. Trapped on
this godforsaken rock, I am low on supplies, but more have
been falling from the ruins of my ship as the the gravity
of the planet I am on is pulling them ever closer to me.
I may be hallucinating, but some days I think I can see the
lights of rescue ships coming from Sector Alpha-3,
looking for me. I have no way of signaling them, and can
only hope they find me before it is too late..."
--Captain Scott

My Little Planet is a fast paced arcade style defense game with a somber atmosphere. Oh, and the music has a beautiful face! Upgrade your defenses and gain new weapons to fight off aliens and asteroids!

Controls:
Z: Shoot/Confirm
X: Instructions
Left/Right: Turn Player
P: Pause
F4: Toggle Fullscreen
Esc (or X on Game Over screen): Quit Game

Be sure to extract the ZIP file completely, otherwise the music may not play properly! Oh, and this is a Windows-only game. Sorry!

--Nate Wiesel of The Layabouts

entries.title: My tiny world
entries.description:
My first ever Ludum Dare entry.

We wanted to make a game where the user would build his own world. You start out in the forest and the idea was to build a city using only material that you could find, with the help of others (NPCs) living in the forest..

We soon realised that this would take way too long.

All we managed to do was:
You can collect things from the ground / from trees.
Map is randomly generated.
There's one NPC, with a quest (and reward).
It is possible to dig water canals. Dig twice in the same place to make a big enough hole for water to flow in it - connect the holes/ditches with water and water will flow in the ditches!

Controls:
Walk around with WASD.
Interact with objects and NPCs using "1".
Dig wholes in the ground using "2".
When you have completed the first quest you can use the axe with "3".

First press the action you want to use, then press one of the available tiles to use it at that tile. Axe has no animation when facing south.

Tip:
You can teleport to NPC and to water by pressing T. (target += 1%2)


Game made with the awesome game development library libGDX!

entries.title: Ok...Now this is akward!
entries.description:
As usual, my game is much a story than a game, and as usual, I didn't took the theme too litteraly.
Tiny World evoked me this thing you say when you stumble across someone you didn't expect to see : 

"It's a small world!/It's a tiny world!" 
(At least, we say it in french...)

You'll understand...

The game was made on Adventure Game Studio, graphics on GraphicsGale and Music on Aviary's Music Creator.

entries.title: Tiny Black World
entries.description:
Brief description:
You are in a tiny black world. It seems to be empty, but it isn't. Move around to find hidden things and win the game. Your score is displayd at the bottom of the screen.

I made this game in a half day (EDIT: I only had a half day, I couldn't work longer). The reason that this isn't a compo game is that I used some code from earlier projects.

Everything is made in Java/Eclipse. I didn't use any images, everything is drawed using code.

Have fun!

entries.title: Tiny Catan
entries.description:
I used Procedural Generation for the world generation and People placement.

I tried working on an Android port, but the API I'm using is crappy >_<

All assets are generated in code. I didn't have time for music, but I think it went pretty well!

Please Rate + Comment!

entries.title: Tiny Shards
entries.description:
Tiny Shards is a tiny platformer with multiple levels and enemies, a few power ups, a little plot and the hope of some meaning! :)

We'll probably launch a "Tiny Shard 1.5" in our blog once we get some time - take a look at www.pixelcows.com if you want!

Hope you enjoy!

This game was made by myself and Joao Pedro (NecroToad). The  Kid's design is somewhat based on the protagonist of "The Journey of Eko", our main 'in production' game (see more at www.pixelcows.com).

Special thanks to Dan Filimon for the valuable feedback and some last minute graphics, to Kevin MacLeod at incompetech.com for the great free music, and to our supportive family - you guys are just GREAT! :)

entries.title: Tiny Tim's Race World
entries.description:
----------------------------------------

*EDIT* DAMMIT it contains a bug. I added a bugfixed link, which directs directly to appspot to ignonre a security sandbox problem with flash. I didn't know that Flash Builder deactivates the security sandbox per default, so I was in my little own workspace programming world where everything worked until I deployed and this morning a colleague told me, that my game wasn't working. lololol

the old flash link still contains the file, but for real experience, test the fixed version

------------------------------------

Tiny Tim is living on a small world. So small. Soooooo small. And there's nothing to do! Except that he bought himself a car not too long ago, so he spends his time washing it and cleaning it and washing and cleaning .....

BOOOOOOOOOOOOORIIIIIIIIIING!!!!!!

So he decided to make a race on his planet! And he invited many many many people he didn't even know!


-------------------------------------------------------

You are playing Tim in his yellow car. When you are online, you should get data of other players, as well as the current highscores

There isn't even more to say, except that since your planet is soooo tiny, one lap of the race also flies by like nothing. The only thing that could stop you is your little dog named Doggy because he likes to sit on the street.

So: Click with your mouse or press space to jump. Your car must have been bought from a different planet as it is so light that it can jump high into the air. Even twice! (or maybe you're just strong enough that a fistbump into the air is enough ^^)

have fun everyone!

entries.title: Your Little Tale
entries.description:
Our game with the features we had the time to implement.
Its a good concept but we had time problems. Give it a try 
=D

entries.title: Amoebae
entries.description:
Here's my entry, Amoebae. Use the mouse to swim around and eat the smaller guys, avoid the bigger guys. Esc to pause. I didn't have time to implement mouse in the menu so use cursors / enter.

There are Win32 and Mac builds, but if you're using Linux you'll have to install Love2d to play it until I have time to package it up properly. https://love2d.org/

Have fun!

entries.title: Bacteriom nom nom
entries.description:
Alright, so I didn't make this in 48 hours, my PC was out of action until 4pm on Saturday, and I didn't really start working on my game til about 10pm. So this is more of a 24 jobby, hence the simplicity.

As a simple-minded bacteria, after a good telling off from your 'father' you decide you will prove him right and show just how fantastic you are at consuming things.

Think of it like Tales from Space about a Blob/Katamari meets the simplest idea in the history of forever.

Move around with the arrow keys eating your fellow bacteria until you can eat the world as you used to know it.

Made in GM8.1 HTML5, the web version unfortunately doesn't loop the music, I assume this is a problem with the engine, as the executable plays fine.

Very simple idea, simple game, and some nice cute sound effects, enjoy :)

entries.title: Bioclash
entries.description:
A defense game with semi-automated units.

- Done with HTML's game maker Construct 2: www.scirra.com.
- Actual work time was about 18-20 hours.
- Couldn't work on my main theme so the visuals are abstract.
- Also, it took me a lot of time to create the mechanics so menus, tutorials and sound is missing. :(
- Balancing is a bit off, but you'll still have a nice time playing it. :D

TUTORIAL:
- The buttons are: ATTACK / RETREAT / CREATE MINION
- When in your base, your recharge health, and can spend XP on upgrades.
- Minions stay close to the base and attack the enemies that are close to the edge of the screen.

Hope you like it!
Tell me what you think in the comments!

entries.title: Down
entries.description:
You are a informatic program, you must destroy viruses which want to destroy the central CPU!

Be careful: the game is developed in html5, ans I can't guarantee it will work good on another browser than Google Chrome. So... use Google Chrome ;)

Source code can be seen in the browser.

Have fun!

entries.title: Fancy Seeing You Here

Mouse to move and use inventory items.
Requires flash 11.2

Made by sstrandberg and cool James using as3 with flashpunk.

entries.title: GraviPlay
entries.description:
Welcome to GraviPlay!

The game is played by following the below specified rules:

1) Don't read the help file.

2) Eat cake.

3) Use your mouse control device to manipulate your path through space.

4) Navigate around the small planets using the gravity slingshot effect

5) Set your ultimate goal in life to the gate at the opposite end of the solar system.

6) Reach your ultimate goal in life.

7) Avoid hitting evil beings (e.g. Jellyfish) who wish to take your life before you accomplish your ultimate goal.

7b) Avoid smashing into large objects of floating cheese (e.g. planets... yes, that is what they're made of).

8) Eat more cake.

9) ???

10) Profit.

pi) Watch that ninja.

11) Enjoy. :)

Note: Because the Mac OS X version does not have a certain model, it will crash whenever it tries to use that model in its randomly generated universe.  Please retry running it when this happens.  Thanks!

entries.title: In Delusion
entries.description:
Finished first ludum dare entry ever, made from scratch in as3.

arrow keys move, shift run, space interact

there's a bug where when you get the hammer and nails your inventory becomes invisible, you still have the items

entries.title: Ivory Kingdom
entries.description:
The game "Ivory Kingdom" is a Strategy game, where you build a settlement of germs living inside a human mouth. They gather ivory from the tooth and the food that accumulates around it. 

Once in a while this human washes his mouth, and so annoying water drops come in and can destroy your castle. It's nothing serious though. You can fix it. But the most horrible creature of all is the toothbrush dragon, which will destroy anything in its path!

survive 7 attacks of the evil dragon, and victory will be yours!


The game has no music, since I didn't have the time. Other than that I think it's ok :)

entries.title: Kill Drill
entries.description: Planet-killing drills are invading your fragile tiny world.  Kick their behinds (literally) - into outer space!
