entries.title: Macronauts, Go!
entries.description:
You may have to play for a bit before you get the thematic connection (or maybe you're very perceptive and you'll pick up on it right away!).

This is a Flash game written from scratch, so there are some rough edges (literally - the text is rendering poorly).  I hope you enjoy it anyway!

During your first play through, you'll get a tutorial.  Just click to go through it.  If you accidentally click through and miss it, reload the page to see it again.

entries.title: Mini Marauders!
entries.description:
Mini Marauders is a little game where you are stuck on a tiny world and being chased by 3 Marauders. They will cause 15 damage each time they hit you and you must try to avoid them.
You can pick up coins found in chests around the map to increase your score. These chests will also have a chance to drop bombs that can be used to kill the attacking Marauders.
Your goal is to get the highest score as you possibly can before you are killed.
Further instructions can be found by pressing F1 in game.
Made with:
Game Maker 8.0
SFXR
Streamed with:
xSplit
VOD's of the stream can be found at:
http://twitch.tv/xblinkedx
The Timelapse can be found at:
http://youtu.be/F-YIowwnpK0

Patches since uploaded:
-Minor bug fixes.
-Expanded instructions slightly.
-Added mute button.

entries.title: Nobody
entries.description:
Yeah...

Just yeah...


I was going to make a real game out of this, but the theme struck me back and then there was StarCraft2 and then...

I should really learn to prioritise better. :P

Until next time!

Warning: May contain traces of male genitalia.



Tools used: FlashDevelop, Flixel, Paint.net, sfxr, autotracker, Windows 7, mouse, keyboard, computer.

entries.title: Only Walls
entries.description:
The title screen should have all the information you need to play.

I'd have liked to have done more posts throughout the competition but it's hard to find time to post, and to make a decent game. Between the two, I think I made the right choice. But next time I'll try to find the time for both.

As usual, there's a ton more features half-implemented in there that I'd have liked to have. But 48 hours is never as long as it seems. Anyway, Enjoy!

entries.title: Planet Master
entries.description:
Well that was fun. 

However anyone that plays this be warned as its not as great as it looks sadly. There is no sound as A) suck at making mods B) MaxMod had a fit with all my poor coding and made all the sound effects crackly.

There is also a graphical glitch which kind ruins the whole game for me and I tried so many things to try and fix it. The planets will suddenly pop out of no where are also become huge squares. This is cause by the way that the GBA handles objects on the screen. Rather than going to -1 in the x it actually wraps round to 511 which I do checks for and have it all set up to cut them out after a set distance but they seem to enjoy ignoring it.

Other Notes Save and Map doesn't work since the planets are always in the incorrect places and I didnt get round to sorting out the memory copy to the SRAM and I dont know how to set the make file to clear the SRAM to what I want on each build.

I think I did the worst thing you can do for this event: go to work, use a low end bit of hardware and try and make a complex game haha.

Any way have fun. emulators included if you wish to use them

entries.title: Poor Pluto's Revenge
entries.description:
Wow, I can't believe I did it! 

A really simple game, but I'm very happy with the idea although I could only work about 20 hours on it. I think the playability is not as good as I'd like and the difficulty is not well balanced. Oh, well... :)

You are Pluto in his way to defeat an evil astronomer to get his real planet title back! Engage the asteroids with your gravitatory field and shoot them back.

Made using:

* Unity3D and RagePixel.
* Inkscape
* Gimp
* bfxr
* Autotracker-bottomup - Incredible!

entries.title: Shrinkage
entries.description:
Find all light pads to shrink your world... Until it will vanish completely!
Destroy red blocks to uncover bonuses, kill the enemies and try to survive!

FOR LINUX USERS: Works under Wine too :)

entries.title: Synthesis
entries.description:
Are you good at chemistry? Well, you should be, because you got NANO-SIZED! Use your NANOSHIP force fields to attract atoms, and when you're ready, activate reaction trap!

ARROW KEYS control your ship
Z pulls the atoms around you towards you
X pushes the atoms around you away
C activates reaction force field

The aim is highest score (feel free to post it in comments below)! Chemical compounds with more atoms will give you more points ! Clearing whole screen gives you +100 points!

There are 44 chemical compounds available in the game! If you don't know any, try some of the more popular ones, like oxygen - O2, ozone - O3, hydrogen - H2, water - H2O, methane - CH4, sulfuric acid - H2SO4, and so on!

Made using AS3 and FlashPunk by ChevyRay.

entries.title: Tiny Castles
entries.description:
Hello tiny world!

We finished the Jam in under 48 hours. 

We are Thomas Sennsjo (code) and bitslap (graphics)

Tiny Castles:
Break, smash, squash and annihilate tiny houses, people, castles and wizards.
 
XNA and .NET required:
XNA- http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

.NET 4.0- http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17718

Stream archives
http://twitch.tv/thomassennsjo
http://twitch.tv/bitslap

Will upload full timelapse of graphics later.

Thanks for watching

entries.title: Tiny Man
entries.description:
-- Story
"Tiny Man is the story of Julien who just discovered a tiny world where you can become small"


-- Tools
For this game, I have used FlashPunk & as3sfxr.
Also, I have used Audiotools for the music and Tiled for the map. 


-- Tips
- For use the double jump, press the jump key (arrow up or W) and release it when you are high.

- Don't be big if a wall is above or close, the hitbox is big too.


-- Other
The game was made in 23 hours.


Thanks for playing !

entries.title: Tiny World of Bees
entries.description:
*******PLEASE READ THIS SECTION********
Please try my update (after voting on original version). 

I've worked at adding a bit more to it (it's almost like a real game now!)

Just added music too although not quite got it linking from one bit to the next as I'd want it. Main;y because it never seems to run at the right framerate
Ah well.

Still to come - day counter (to see how long you survived) and might need to add an extra column to the score counter seeing as you currently can't accumulate more than 9999 bees)

Thanks for trying this out! Any feedback or shameless promotion is more than welcome :D :D

*********Thanks!!***********

How to Play
You start with 1 bee, click to send him out. Collect pollen to get more bees.

Click twice if you want to send out 2 bees (if you have 2 bees) or 3 times for 3 bees etc (No limit on number of bees) 

Bees are deaf, so there's no sound (this could be a lie to justify not adding sound).

I'll be adding more to this after the jam so if you like it there'll be updates at:

http://www.triplevisiongames.tumblr.com 

You can also check out 'By Candlelight", which is a work in progress (and me learning to design, draw and use XNA/C#)

entries.title: Zilla the Destroyer
entries.description:
Zilla the Destroyer is angry. And when she's angry she wants to level a city with the ground. Burn the buildings. Incinerate the trees. Show those dirty apes that opposable thumbs are no match whatsoever to a 100 ton angry lizard on two legs and a bad temper.

WASD moves. UP/DOWN controls head. SPACE shoots firely ball of death and destruction.

entries.title: Walker
entries.description:
There is a tiny world just before our eyes, but we can catch just a glimpse of it, through square and circular windows. 
It is the world of the traffic signs, were the Walker lives.

However, our world has changed. GPS is everywhere, so there is no more need for Walker and his world...

Enter the roadroller!



This game has been made for the Ludum Dare #23 Jam by
Michele Pirovano of the Politecnico di Milano (programming, game design, 3D art, sound&music), Federica Tana (2D art, game concept) and Dario Campanella (2D background art & the "Hello").

Thanks to Pier Luca and his students and to Paolo for their pieces of advice.


This game was made with:
Unity3D
Blender
Gimp
Linux Multi Media Studio
Audacity

entries.title: Save the World
entries.description:
Save the world by attacking the spaceships with your roller-tank. Be warned however, that by shooting you also propel the world in the opposite direction, try not to go off the edge of the screen!

Desktop is recommended, as android has no multitouch at the moment (it was a quick port).

--CONTROLS--
A and D to move the hover-tank.
W files the hover-tank's cannon.

--WARNING--
There have been reports of ghost ships. Ships that you can't see and can't shoot but will still kill you. It has been rumoured that if you download and decompile the jar, you can change setRender(false) to setRender(true) in one of the source files to see these strange and deadly ships.

entries.title: $ales
entries.description:
$ales is a game where you are a traveling salesman, trying to earn money by buying and selling goods. You travel across the Earth in the hope of making profit with your trading.

Make sure you play with audio, it makes the game way more clear.

Don't be afraid to write down where you can get goods cheaply and where you can sell them for a lot afterwards.

If you encounter any bugs, please let me know.

I want to thank everyone that makes Ludum Dare possible, because Ludum Dare is great!

entries.title: Asylum
entries.description:
my very first Ludum Dare entry

WASD + Mouse to control

I barely finished it - therefore I hadn't any time to make sounds :(

entries.title: Catamari Meowacy
entries.description:
The evil wizard Zorlax has shrunk poor kitty!  Eat food to grow and see if you can find him.

This gets weird.  Sorry in advance.

entries.title: Cereal Prize Astronaut
entries.description:
The idea is you're an astronaut that got sucked through a wormhole, and awakes in a strange large man made building with huge metal spheres and holes on the wall. After some exploration the building turns out to be a free ball bearing puzzle toy inside a cereal box.

The story was pretty much built around the concept of doing a 2d little ray tracing light/shadow system. I'm pretty happy with how that turned out, but it cost, as basically none of the rest of the game is finished, the collision detection and keyboard controls are terrible, and i didnt get round to adding any sfx or narration.

I would have liked to do more with this but in the end I only really got about 8 hours to work on this, and unfortunately I cant do anything tomorrow, so I cant put it into the 72 hour one, kind of a bummer, but oh well, I know next jam I'm gonna put way more time into it. Enjoy!

entries.title: Dude, where's my planet
entries.description:
Press enter to start at title screen and to reset current level.
Arrow keys to move.
__________

Made by:
Alexander Batsis : Programming
Teo Mathlein : Graphics (teo.mathlein.se)
Martin Petrini : Programming


The music during levels is credited to www.audionautix.com

entries.title: Dunscape
entries.description:
Langage: C
Library needed: SDL only

After ~17h of work, Dunscape is finally born!
It's a turn-based exploration game in a roguelike style.

I hope you like it!

note: for people who don't have a numpad I have added the support of QWERTY keyboard (and fixed the bug when you pass through a rat with the 9 key).
the controls with the QWERTY keyboard are:

Q W E
 \|/
A-S-D
 /|\
Z X C

-------------------------------
All my timeline is write in the README file in the sources.

entries.title: FlyAway!
entries.description:
This game have many bugs. Have fun!:)

WASD/Arrow - control
Lcontrol - jump
Space - tractor beam

entries.title: Fort in the Woods
entries.description:
A turn-based game where you build up a fort and defend from attacks.

Windows - Extract the .zip and run Fort.exe.

Other platforms - Not tested, but if you have Python 2.7 and PyGame installed, you should be able to download the source and run Fort.py.


TIPS

    Farms produce 5 Food per turn.

    You need a Barracks to train one military unit. Two Barracks let you train
    two units per turn, etc.

    Walls give archers a bonus to attack and defense.

    Combat is automated; you can only watch.


ADDITIONAL CREDITS

    Tools used:
    - Editra
    - Paint.NET

------

entries.title: Rediculosis
entries.description:
I had to cut out a lot of features and additional content I had planned to add (more interesting enemies, powerups, SOUND, MUSIC, etc) about 2 hours from the end.

I haven't programmed anything in this short a timeframe before and it kinda shows, and I'm still learning C++, but obviously I learned a lot.

In hindsight I probably spent too much time on the engine at the beginning, and I'll probably be using something ready-made next time.

There is a game in there... somewhere. I hope someone enjoys it, at least as much as I did making it.

(Also, in case anyone cares, the title is a play on "Pediculosis", which is an infestation of lice.)

EDIT: I updated this slightly, see journal entry here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/26/rediculosis-final/

entries.title: Skylands
entries.description:
This was our first game we made together and we entered the Jam as BitByte Games. So here it goes:

You have lived in peace in your tiny world for many years. One day, a mysterious portal appeared and large monsters from a larger world started pouring out, determined to destroy your house. You must fight back and destroy the portal, returning your tiny home to peace. Equipped with only TNT and barricades made from the bricks and steel they drop, can you survive and save your home?

All of the music, art and (most of) the code were original items we created just for Skylands. To find out the key controls, click on the about screen from the main menu of the game.

entries.title: Space Rescue!
entries.description:
Shoot turrets, and rescue spacemen!  Alternatively, shoot spacemen and rescue turrets, but score much fewer points.

Fly into the asteroid space station (use your imagination! :) ), shooting turrets out while dodging bullets, and rescue the waiting spacemen.

As with most time-limited projects, this was much less extensive than I originally intended, but it still turned out to be pretty fun :)

--------------------------------------
LINUX USERS: it may not work for you first time :(  If you get this error:
"Cannot open shared library /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/alsa-lib/libasound_module_pcm_pulse.so"
Please just delete the "libasound.so.2" in the spacerescue directory, and it should find the one on your system, which should work fine.
If you double-clicked the icon and got no error, please try running in a terminal to check for the above message.  Please also let me know if something different goes wrong, and I'll see what I can do.
Sorry about the hassle!
--------------------------------------
WINDOWS USERS: '#' to reset the ship may not work for you, depending on your keyboard layout.  This seems to be a pygame bug :(  (it's saying the key is backslash, which I never spotted)  Sorry about that.  Unfortunately I can't see a workaround without making a new version.

entries.title: The Underground Court
entries.description:
You are a faerie, half insect, half man, who lives in a world separate from our own. In this game, you must venture from your comfortable home underground into the realms of men, in order to find delicacies to your queen.

Your final goal is to enter the very lair of Men, avoid his monstrous guardians, and acquire the ultimate prize for your queen. Can you do it?


***

This is my second dare. My initial idea was based on the movie "The Secret World of Arrietty", where a family of tiny people lived hidden in a house, taking food from the house while avoiding the "big people". 

The original plan was to have other aspects to the game such as expand your own underground realm with specialists to help you, dealing with humans who would try to close the ant holes, etc. But due to my terrible time management, I only got so far as the "keep the queen alive, and go for the prize" part.

At least, compared to my previous LD entry, this was a big improvement. Mobs, Music, Real time, pausing, this game has many technical options not present on Maze Explorer, even if it might look a little less polished. More info about that on my upcoming post-mortem.

entries.title: Think Green
entries.description:
Think Green is an environmentally-friendly game for Python 2.7 and Pygame. Includes awesome graphics, awesome music, and a very satisfying gameplay.

I'm actually most proud of how the music turned out; it really adds to the graphics to create a nice mood, especially when you die.

You'll need Pygame to run it! If you're on linux, your distribution probably has a package. If you're on Windows or Mac, it's fairly easy to install if you already have Python. See the readme for a few more details.

links.label: Python code (zip; with a few post-deadline bug fixes)

entries.title: This is You
entries.description: This game sucks, I know. I didn't manage to get around to creating world gen, because I managed my time poorly. I do however think it is kindof pretty though, so I like that. I was also not able to get music to work, so if you want to play the game with the mood I intended play the dungeon.wav file on loop.

entries.title: Tiny Contamination, well almost

entries.title: Tiny Oblique World
entries.description:
Tiny Oblique World is a god-simulation/survival/programming game.

Survive in the wildness. Program short combinations of verb+noun, a list of possibilities can be found under options. They consume water and die when there isn't enough to drink. At night some monster might appear.

If you find the compo version hard try the slightly easier jam version.

(You will need love 0.8 to play the .love/source file, get it from love2d.org. Choose your platform for a standalone executable.)

entries.title: Tiny Room
entries.description:
Made with DirectX9.0c (managed DirectX) and Visual Basic 2010
Note that if you install the project into a Directory which you can only access with adminitrative rights, you'll have to launch the game as an administrator as well.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/74880983/TinyWorld.zip

entries.title: Tiny World: The Musical: The Game
entries.description:
Tiny World: The Musical: The Game is an attempt by myself (Paul Sztajer) and Angus O'Sullivan, with the help of the talented Emma Lindley and Gideon M.K. (I'll get his last name right once I've slept) to put together a game that evokes the feel of a musical within a 72 hour timespan.

Specifically, we felt that it wasn't enough to directly involve lyrics in the gameplay: we wanted to tell the kind of stories that are told in musicals, with the same sort of tunes.

While a little rough around the edges (the time constraints were a big factor in this) we actually did it! We really didn't get a huge amount of chances to playtest this thing, so we'd love any and all feedback you can send our way. We're both really excited to look into doing more projects like this, so any thoughts or suggestions would be much appreciated.

More info on how we put this all together will be coming by once sleep has been had.

Note that the post-comp version only added a small explanation on controls.

entries.title: Vac-Man
entries.description:
Play as Vac-Man, a miniature robotic vacuum cleaner, as you attempt to protect the house from the dust bunny invasion!

Controls:
z - accelerate towards the mouse position
x - brake
c - vacuum up dust piles (avoid overheating)

Goal:
Shoot the bunnies with the popcorn that you pick up.  Then vacuum up the dust piles they leave behind. Get consecutive hits to increase your score multiplier up to 8x.  If there are too many dust piles on the screen, you lose!

*** Only tested in Chrome, so please use Chrome ***

entries.title: Alien Comets
entries.description:
Hope everybody enjoys!

I think it's self-explanatory, but the aim is to increase each terrain to it's max on your planet.

entries.title: Astro Break

An arcade shooting game wherein asteroids are dodged and, eventually, blown to smithereens for fun, profit, points, and delicious space fruit.

entries.title: Block Bros
entries.description:
Hello, my name is David H. and this will be my first Ludum Dare game, and actually one of my FIRST actual game i've ever completed. I thought taking part in Ludum Dare would be a challenge for me due to my limited knowledge (Studying Programming for only 5 months!) and thought i should give it a try.

entries.title: Blue's World
entries.description:
You MAY require the Visual Studio 2010 runtime!

DEV NOTE:
Well, this is what I could muster up amid school projects, homework, and other obligations. So firstly: Thank you for playing my game! I know I submitted this rather early, but it's all because I MEANT to enter the Compo, then decided that I would rather enter the Jam due to a multitude of reasons:

1: SDL Mixer decided it didn't want to work, so no sound could be used.
2: I just didn't put as much effort as I would have if LD23 took place during Summer. So I'll put a good run in for LD24!
3: Motivation and ideas were lacking around the midway point

I had fun, of course! I wouldn't have finished at all had I not.

Also, this is another game that'll hopefully add up to that goal of 1000! We can do it, guys!

For those interested in the source: My header file setup is weird, I know, but SDL wasn't looking to cooperate for whatever reason, so that's how it turned out.

DESCRIPTION:

Blue's World is the interactive story of Blue, a lone blue square, in a room that was completely blue. One day a portal opens up, and he decides to investigate.

CONTROLS:
Left/Right - Move
Up - Jump

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:
- A computer that can run Visual Studio 2010 applications.
- About 5 MB of space.

Coded using C++ and the SDL library

entries.title: c!ph3r
entries.description:
You're an elite hacker, using your tiny avatar to explore a highly secure computer system -- try to locate Secret File X.13 before the system shuts down!

Goal:
Reach the secret file at -Node 9- before time runs out, collecting batteries along the way for extra points.
Each mistake takes time off of the clock.

Controls:
Click on tiles to move in a straight line.  It's all about timing.
Click gates to hack into them and disable them.

Credits:
Game design & Programming: Joe Lesko
Artwork & Music: Wormburn

NOTE ON CONTROLS:
I agree with some of the comments that it isn't a perfect mechanic, but the idea behind the delay and the straight-line movement was to focus the gameplay on timing puzzles where a little bit of planning (and patience) is important, versus turning it into a more vanilla arcade-style maze game. Thanks!

Bonus Tip: The delay doesn't happen if you make quick moves in succession.

entries.title: Cheddly and Cloud's Tiny Adventure
entries.description: A light-hearted platformer in which you must save Tiny Planet from the Shadowian Forces. Use your fire and sword to destroy all the Shadowian Factories and defeat Dignity.

entries.title: Dusty
entries.description:
You are a tiny dust bunny with huge ambition. Consume the other dust bunnies and become the biggest of them all.

Audacity

entries.title: Eidolic New World
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry. It's a top down puzzle game based on the idea that systems of robots act as their own self contained world. The idea has changed a lot since I started but I'm reasonably happy with the entry.

The game uses the 'Apple Kid' font, which is freely distributed, as well as "Decisions" by Kevin MacLeod (http://incompetech.com), royalty free music.

entries.title: Enzyme Frenzy
entries.description: You are a white blood cell and you need to eradicate viruses by eating enzymes.

entries.title: Flyspeck
entries.description:
** If you REALLY get stuck ... there's a hint in the comments somewhere **
The first "puzzle" is a little mean, I apologise for that.

...

I made it!

This time life and lack of sleep got a little in the way, again, and so I went for the extra time in the jam. But I achieved what I set out to do: make a tiny adventure. It's tiny, but I think it works and it even has an end! I had planned to put more story/content in there, but as time was ticking away, managed to scale it down a little and have a working game without (I hope) loose ends.

I made all graphics and code from scratch, apart from the Flixel framework. I used Flash Builder, Tilestudio, Photoshop, Red Bull Cola and of course Autotracker.

Hope you like it.

Cheers!
~ Amodo

entries.title: Heracles N Chickens

Hi!

You can find this framework at : http://gforge-lirmm.lirmm.fr/gf/project/agde/ )

How to play :
The goal is to store food at your home.
Use <Arrow keys> to move.
Use <Space> to grab the Dung ball.
If you are at home you can use <Left Control> to eat stored food to restore your hp.
Use <Left Shift> at home to close the door and finish the game.
Avoid Chickens.
If you die, You Fail. Close your home to finish the game and get your score.

entries.title: Manifest Destiny

entries.title: Max Stardust in "Asteroids and Stuff"

Max Stardust is a young lad who has received a dwarf planet for his birthday. Bored of his new present, he decides to strap rockets and guns to it and flies it directly into an asteroid belt!

entries.title: Me, Buck & Tina

It was hard and i didn't got the time to add sounds and polish because i learned the tool Adventure Game Studio during this Ludum Dare to make this game.

See you later.

entries.title: Men not wearing hats
entries.description:
INSTRUCTIONS - PLEASE PRETTY PLEASE READ! =)

Control with WASD, Fire with left mouse button.

Tip: If they catch you stealing, you loose life. Look at the resources and deposit them into their containers for a treat!

Story: On one side we have precious diamonds, on the other oil. User your mighty uzi of justice and limit the "men not wearing hats" growth! Let them never rise to the cultural and economic heights that we have! (or, not).

Tech: XNA, Lua, C# and my precious entity framework.

entries.title: My Little Planetoid
entries.description:
Build an outpost on your own little planetoid. Gather resources and get access to new buildings, and launch satellites and ships into space!

Features:
- Real graphics. That's it. Nobody can ever surpass this.
- Beautiful environments
- Serene and fitting soundtrack
- SPACE
- A failure-state (no call-of-duty-esque handholding here)
- Challenging & cerebral gameplay (may differ from person to person)
- Possibilities for emergent gameplay
- Multiple ways to play
- Space-ships! Space-objects. Space-PLANETS

You control the entire game with the mouse. Everything else is self-explaning within the game.

Also available for your convenience: A timelapse-video, and windows- and mac-standalone-files. 

Have fun!

-Matthew

//Updates!
Fixed a highly critical bug. Just a single line in comments caused the Destroy-button to not appear. 

//Music! 
I uploaded the "space-banjo-theme", for all your soundtrack-related needs :).
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=suTOZUyYKcs

//Review! (sort of)
Dogbomb made another Ludum-Dare-review, My LIttle Planetoid shows up at 9:50
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCpFY0_Ygqg

//Thoughts!
I wrote a post-mortem. Read on for insight into my brain.
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/30/thoughts-on-my-little-planetoid/

//Awesome review!
My Little Planetoid appears on RockPaperShotgun. According to them it "has stupidly impressive graphics given the timeframe it was built in." It's also being likened to Spore :P
http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2012/04/30/tiny-world-tour-ludum-dare-23/

entries.title: SpaceMission Part 2
entries.description:
This game is an unofficial sequel of my previous entry.

How to play:
The game consists in two main parts
Shooter:
Arrow Keys - Move Ship
X - Shoot
You must shot enemy ship and planets to destroy them.

Runner:
X - Jump
X while in midair - Use jetpack
Try to stomp your little enemies while running away from a ship.
Jump to avoid buildings.

Tools:

-Paint.Net for graphics
-Bfxr for sounds

entries.title: Sun Save World
entries.description:
Written in ActionScript 3 with Flixel, GIMP 2 and FL Studio 8.
I'd like to say that it didn't take me 48 hours, but it almost did!

The only control is mouse movement to direct sunlight.

The humans need plants to survive.
Stimulate plant growth with sunlight from the cursor.
Attempt to sustain life as long as possible.

Flixel 2.55 required to build source.

Edit (7/5/2012): Apologies, I had to change the web link because I was having some problems hosting my game. Game is completely unchanged, of course.

entries.title: Tiny Cubic Maze World

entries.title: Tiny Fishy World

I logged 26 hours of (not so serious) work.

entries.title: Tiny World

You control the Planetoid orbiting Tiny World, your objective is to block energy meteorites with different
color than Tiny World, while you have to permit the pass to meteorites with the same energy color than
Tiny World.

When a meteorite of different color impact <b>Tiny World, the planet will be slightly smaller,
if is the same color, the planet will be slightly larger. Be careful, or Tiny World will dissapear.

entries.title: TinyWorldGods

entries.title: A Super Mario Summary

Revisit the entire original Super Mario Bros game served in bite sized tiny little pieces! Try to get to the top of every flag pole and get every single coin in the game. Can you do it?

Good luck and have fun!

Includes time trials, updated ui, difficulty tweaks, tighter controls, lots of tweaking, and bug fixes.

Please rate the game using the original version.

entries.title: ascii world

entries.title: BamSquitch

You're a big slime in a tiny world, solve the puzzles and make it home! Arrow Keys to Move, Comma (,) to restart the level.

entries.title: Battle of the Planets
entries.description:
Credits:
Matthew R.F. Balousek (@mrfb): Art/Game Design
Bill Kiley (@billtron209): Music/SFX
Grant Wu (@gfwu): Game Design/Programming

Controls:

entries.title: Bottled Worlds
entries.description:
READ THIS: Save the game's executable in a folder or something instead of saving it to your temporary folder so the game can save! (you'll crash every time you finish a level if you don't do this!!)

Tiny creatures from four different planets want to eat all the metal in the world!

Coding: Yotam Frid
Art: Mati Ernst & Itamar Ernst
Music: Cave Story & Brother Android

Joystick support is available but quite buggy.
Made in Game Maker 8.1
(the engine was written from scratch for LD23!)

entries.title: Cocoloco
entries.description:
Cocoloco
A two player game of coconut throwing and sand castles. You're trapped forever on a tiny island and it's all your friends fault!

Created by Anuschka Roberts (Art and Sound) and Roydon Wagner (Programming).

Made in about 18 hours using Flixel. Wish we could have committed the full 72 hours. We would of done some play testing and added more visual effects and gameplay options.

Note: This game requires that you have at least one friend in real life. If you don't, I can be your friend if you pay my travel costs to your house.

entries.title: Corgi Recon Force
entries.description:
A human spaceship crashes into a bowl of petunia, while orbiting a distant planet. It's up to the ships dog, to find the lost parts and save his owners precious life!

So the game is a simple platformer, you can use the arrow keys to control the dog, and the small probe helps you with finding the lost parts of the ship. You can't really die, so it's more like a relaxing exploration game, set in a small world, than a hard boiled platformer.

It's our first game ever, building the "engine" from scratch, using my own opengl code to draw everything. So I hope you guys enjoy playing the game, and manage to find everything. The expected gameplay length is 5-15 min.

entries.title: Disastronaut
entries.description:
**BY POPULAR DEMAND - I've uploaded a version without an installer. All code and assets identical, just more rating-friendly!**

My first ever LD48 entry!

Stranded on a tiny planetoid far from home, you must collect space debris to build a ramshackle ride back to Earth.

Supports keyboard (WASD / Space) and joypad (left analog / A button) 

Windows only, built in XNA Game Studio 4.0

entries.title: Estrape
entries.description:
Shoot the arrows from the side of the ship into the planets to rescue the aliens.

Use the Arrows to move.
Down: Stop the ship.
Z: shoot the rope to the left
X: shoot the rope to the right

-If you run out of rope, or lost the lives you lose.
-the rope have a max distance, you have to stay close to the planets, otherwise the rope can break.
-If the planet get red, iy will explode.
-Every shoot 'cost' 10 ropes

entries.title: Giant Apple Pie
entries.description:
So you're a giant who wants apple pie. U need a lot of apples to make a pie (cause you're a giant). So you gotta visit all the apple pies in the world. Just be careful where you step.

It's my first Ludum Dare. I made this kind of lazily, didn't work too hard on it, but it was fun. Hope you guys have at least some fun playing it.

Next time I'll try to me more commited! :)

Thanks and have fun!

entries.title: I want to turn the heater on
entries.description:
Your entire world and everybody else's for that matter is a room literally inside your head. Problem is you're in your room while it's in your head while you're in it while... yeah...

Now you want to turn your heater on but then someone steals your bed. Go on an epic journey of discovery and puzzle-solvery to get some sleep!


***********READ THIS**********
Try the first version, that will most likely work on most things(except for sounds in IE because it doesn't like ogg). Firefox 11 might die when you try to warp because.. well.. yeah. The second version doesn't have the warpy effect or the room indicator, so it should not only work on FF11 but work slightly faster on slower machines.


In case of touchscreen: clicking/tapping the sides of the screen works like the arrow keys. 
*****************

NEW!
Added an android build, there are some minor tweaks, so you can consider it a post compo build.

links.label: Lite version - for ff and old machines

entries.title: Immunity
entries.description: Read the instructions carefully! Use the mouse to control (there's only one level in the game). Thanks for playing my LD#23 entry, it's my first one, so be gentle.

entries.title: Just keep dying
entries.description:
Arrow keys move
Z uses items
X runs

I would have solaris support if it's natives didn't conflict with the linux natives. If you have no idea what I'm blabbering about, that's OK. Just skip ahead to the next paragraph

If you die randomly and hear an explosion, you've stepped on a land mine.
Oh, and you cannot fall off the world and die because this is a 2-D game, so the player and other objects cannot move along the z axis

The main character (Fred) recently died. He appeared in this frustratingly tiny world. He was so mad he killed himself. It got smaller. He decided to see if he could shrink it out of existence. When there is no more world, you win. He shrunk it out of existence and now he is alone in a non-existent world.
THIS GAME IS POSSIBLE TO COMPLETE. I've tested it

entries.title: Kid's Wars
entries.description:
HTML5 version only. Just keep in mind, GMStudio is in beta so the HTML5 version is quite buggy. It's still playable.

No tooltips available ingame due to a bug with HTML5. So here are the units' descriptions:

Gunman (1)

HP: 10
Speed: 1
Damage: 2(Light)
Light Armor: 0
Heavy Armor: 0
Attacks: Ground and Air

Tank (2)
Cooldown: 10s
Cost: 100
HP: 50
Speed: 1
Damage: 10(Heavy)
Light Armor: 5
Heavy Armor: 5
Attacks: Ground

entries.title: Link
entries.description:
Enjoy your experience with Link and if you are locked at a specific level, in the folders Content/Data you can find the solutions of the last levels but they are not so difficult :p

To skip the story, press TAB

entries.title: ONLY US
entries.description:
Version 1.0 - HTML5 / Impact Engine
Developed by Datamosh - http://www.datamosh.com

Pablo "Datamosh" Cotoia - Lead Programmer - Twitter @DatamoshGames

Emmanuel "Kaeru" Pajon - Lead Designer - Twitter @kaeruntastico

**********************************

KNOWN BUGS/ISSUES/EXTRA COMMENTS:

* On the first area, to avoid the "no space" message, try building the checkpoint between the spaceship and the flag. Or around the flag. On the other areas, avoid the limits.

* On CHROME you will suffer SLOWDOWNS or LONG LOADING TIMES. If you wish (or can), try another browser and let us know how that worked.

* You can EMOTE with your own buildings. We also recommend building the Driller as soon as you can.

* We are currently working to make this a BIG full gaming experience but we will show it some time AFTER the Ludum Dare. Because work and life, you know.

**********************************

We're an HTML5 indie game studio in Buenos Aires, Argentina! And we are really happy of being able to submit our 72 hs. work, so you can try it, play it and hopefully enjoy it!

We tried our best to develop multiple concepts of the words "Tiny World" in our videogame. I mean, is it a tiny world because of the size of the characters? Is the "Tiny World" the bond between two human beings? Or just because the Moon is tinier than the Earth? Well, it's up to you to think about that. As well as it's up to you to explore this ideas, it's up to you to explore this weird Moon. To do so, you can use:

W, A, S, D keys (or the ones with the arrows) and MOUSE.

But watch out. You won't have time to think when creatures attack you. You must go with ease, building checkpoints so you don't get lost!


FEATURES
* Exploring oriented gameplay with a mix of platform, turn based combat and strategy
 * Web browser game! No need to install anything!
 * Saves your progress locally!
 * Multiple endings!
 * Express a lot of feelings and interact with objects with the EMOTE action!
 * Science Fiction references!
 * Awesome pixelart graphics!
 * Original music score! Chilling ambient with a Space mood while you explore this mysterious Moon.


**********************************
LIKE "ONLY US" ON FACEBOOK!
https://www.facebook.com/OnlyUsApp

entries.title: Petri
entries.description:
Hey!
This is my second Ludum Dare entry, Petri!

It's about a Petri dish... I made it super psychedelic on purpose cause I made 90% of the game from 1:00am - 4:00am.

I composed all the music in Reaper with VSTs from http://woolyss.com/

Written in Java using NetBeans.

I consider this about the equivalent of a Pirate Kart game.

entries.title: Real War
entries.description:
This is a game about real war.
Translated by The Bad.

Controls:
WASD - movement
Left Mouse Button - action
Spacebar - jump
F5 - in main menu - switch between display mode (Windowed/Fullscreen)
Esc - quit

entries.title: terminus
entries.description:
look into the sky. you can't miss it. it's coming.
only the gods could stop it now, but will they come?
the denizens have a plan. will you aid them? however, there are other ears listening to their pleas.
you have an axe
you have five minutes
you have the world
look again into the sky. it's bigger, now


controls:
a , d - move
w - pick up
s - drop
space - chop, borrow axe from a villager (if they have one and you lost yours)

there are four endings. there are three weapons. each session is five minutes long. you can interact with most anything, and the world will react accordingly. 

experimentation is key.

note: contains blood and strong language

4/23 - added a tweaked version with some minor changes.

entries.title: Rockland
entries.description:
Yay! my first ludum dare done and in time :D
I think i did a pritty good job, i know java for 8 months now. so what i did i think is ok. i had no time/energy left to add sounds. also some things where a little bit rushed.
Can't wait till the next ludum dare!

Controls:
WASD - Movement
Left click - Shoot
Right click reload
Q - toggle hide hole

How to start:
Download the jar. click it. have fun.

How to win:
Get 100 coins. you will have a quite big pile.
Do not get hit by bird to often or you'll die. cruel world.

Please rate and if you have time and can look in the source please do so and say what was good/what i could have done beter. thanks!

Tools:
java + eclipse + paint.net + lwjgl and jarsplice to combine it into 1 jar.

I hope you like it :)

entries.title: Tiny Island
entries.description:
You'r a man on a tiny island.

You can walk around the Tiny World by selecting a little man (left mouse click + drag) and point him where to go (right mouse click). To move map, use W, A, S and D keys. To Zoom In/Out you can use either Q ans E keys or scroll wheel of mouse.

See this game as relaxation therapy.

I didn't want to chose relaxation music for you, find something good!

Every time you start game, you get totally new island, only for you. Islands are procedural generated. There is 6 types of ground; Deep water (cant walk here), Shallow water, Sand, Light grass, Forest. You can walk in Shallow water, but you'll be slower.

So... For real now, this game was meant to be and 2D RTS (economy more, war less). There is not yet finished action menu that you can access by pressing Space key. 

I'll definitely finish this game (in near future), just not for this competition. 

If you have question, advice or suggestion please contact me @AleksandarDev

Hope you'll like it!
-- Aleksandar Toplek


To play game you'll need XNA Redistributable 
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Tiny Maze Speedrun
entries.description:
This is my first finished game! And my first Javascript project. And the first time I made my own graphics... oh well :)

The mazes are randomly generated each time. I implemented a recursive backtracking algorithm for this. Which took the most time since I'm not that familiar with Javascript.

I love my game! ;) I'm more than happy with what I've accomplished in 2 days.

Run with cursor keys or WASD. Press and hold multiple keys at the same time for smooth maze running.

Tested/working in Chrome and Firefox. Crashes Safari. Doesn't even load in IE.

entries.title: Worlds End
entries.description:
A little spacewar management game. 

Try to survive the war raging around you and score some points by sending out ships to attack planets.

Hopefully you should be able to figure out the strengths and weaknesses of each ship type. If not, give a shout in the comments and I'll give a little rundown.

Update:
Technical Note: I've been told that when running at low resolutions then not all of the game elements can be seen properly. Please run at the highest resolution available. Ticking the fullscreen check-box on the launcher should give you higher resolutions too.

entries.title: A Drop of Water
entries.description:
Pretty much the worst game ever, however--
It holds a tiny surprise if you collect 6 green orb thingies.
and, I learned a lot making this game!

I used C++, SDL, and Opengl for the programming
Gimp and PyxelEdit for the art (lol! what art!?)
And Bfxr for the sound effects.

I look forward to seeing the creations of others! 

https://github.com/dreamycactus
Here's the code in case those links don't work!

entries.title: AtmosFeast
entries.description:
Instead of doing a game about small worlds, I made a game about small planets. Use the arrow keys to move your player around your planet and use space to pull in the surrounding planets to make yours grow.

I really enjoyed making this type of game, it's not something I usually make so it's refreshing making a fun little action game. Especially when everything's neon. I had lots of fun making this and I hope you all enjoy playing it. There's a highscore chart on Kong where this is hosted so try and beat my highscore :)

Made in AS3 using flash builder, flash cs5.5 and photoshop. Graphics were initially all coded in until I turned them into bitmap graphics in photoshop for memory usage. This game already is pushing it having a whole load of objects on screen at once, and its not optimised due to time constraints so, if it starts to lag, I'm sorry.

I didn't use any frameworks to build upon, just built from scratch since it's so small. I used a bunch of code snippets I've built up over the past few years, but thats not really a personal library, just code knowledge. 

I used TweenLite for my animations, Hires stats for debugging and google analytics for stat tracking. 

Audio was created using garage band for the background music and as3sfxr for the SFX

You are a Pirate! Arggghhhh! Sink all the other ships!

This is also my first time participating in Ludum Dare and my second time ever making a game. I learned a lot from this and I'll definitely improve in gamemaking. This game could be a lot better, in a technical and in lot of other ways but I think it's at least some good. I'm definitely looking forward for the next Ludum Dare!

You play as a lost white robot in a world of tiny bright planets on pedestals. Also there are a lot of switches for some reason. Beware of the darkness, which will drive you mad. Try to find the tiny world that is your home.

The theme link is pretty tenuous - sorry about that. I didn't have enough time to tie it in :(

entries.title: Dr. Nano - tiny surgeon
entries.description:
Dr. Nano - tiny surgeon

You are a microscopic doctor. A hero. A marvel of modern science.

Shrink down to the size of a single cell and enter the bloodstream of your patients.

Destroy the bacteria, and fight the evil cancerous tumor to save the day!

Survive three BOSS BATTLES to get to the final credits.

Written in AS3 for Flash 11 using the Stage3D API. 

Tools used: 

- FlashDevelop for code editing and compiling.
- A marker and paper for the sprites.
- Photoshop for processing the scanned images.
- A microphone for the background "music". 
- BFXR for the gun and explosions sounds.
- CoolEditPro for sound processing. 

By Christer Kaitila aka McFunkypants
http://www.mcfunkypants.com

NOTE: this game is designed to be run FULLSCREEN in a 1080p HD monitor. 
Be sure to maximize your browser window so you get a better view. Flash 11 required.

P.S. Happy 10th anniversary, Ludum Dare. 
Here's wishing everyone another decade of gamedev goodness.
Ludum Dare is my favourite online community - I'm so happy I discovered it.

I had SO much fun making this, and I hope you have fun playing it! ENJOY! =)

entries.title: Forever Alone
entries.description:
Our first ever Ludum Dare! We're pretty proud of this....

Idea was djdduty's, but he didn't participate.
Me and razorquick expanded upon it.

You need at least Java 6 to run this. Get it here www.java.com

Instructions:
WASD to move
Hover over planets to popup info window.
Expand the drop downs to interact.

Ship info:
- To Fix: metal = level x 20, oil = level x 10, slaves = level x 5
- To Upgrade: metal = level x 50, oil = level x 20, slaves = level x 10

Home Planet info:
- To Upgrade: wood = level x 100, stone = level x 70, slaves = level x 50

Description:
You're a dejected robot on your tiny home planet, all alone with no resources. One day a random spaceship crashes into your planet, which you proceed to claim as your own!
You start adventuring around your "cluster" of planets (50 of them), quietly stealing resources necessary to upgrade your spaceship and your home planet.
Your goal is to conquer the universe, by destroying all 50 planets, making you the most powerful robot ever....all alone.....Forever Alone......

How To Play:
- To take an action on a planet, you hover your ship over it where a window will popup on the lower right hand corner of the screen. Expand the tab to take actions!
- You can only manage to quietly steal from a planet once, all further attempts will cause them to notice you and hurt you by 10 HP. You do still manage to steal, but not as much as the first time.
- Attacking a planet will make you take all their resources (to the max your spaceship can hold), and even the population become slaves. However, your HP will go down by the planet's Defense value.
- Your home planet is where you store your resources. Storing puts all your resources on the planet. Equipping equips your ship up to the max it can hold.
- There is no point to upgrade your home planet, that was for a proposed idea where planets attack your home to try and stop your unending rampage!
- Your ship's max HP and max resource capacity can be increased by upgrading your ship.

The background music is Clair de Lune by Debussy. I would have performed it (I'm a professional pianist), but I had no time and ended up using an online source. I don't believe you can copyright such music, so it's considered public domain.

It has quite a bit of data to load, so give it a minute...I should have put a loading screen :P

Coded by me from scratch using my lovely game library: java-game-utils.googlecode.com

Art is by razorquick. He's pretty awesome. :P

entries.title: GERMS!

I made it because I thought of of how small germs are. It was hard and I learned a lot and next time I hope to do better. If you don't have java, Make sure you install that. entries.title: Large Hadron Collider: Ludum Dare Edition

Action-packed not-so-well polished survival game without weapons. Try to avoid other particles as you may cause a new Big Bang inside Large Hadron collider. No sound, sorry.

entries.title: Magniverse
entries.description:
Collect resources to expand the size of your home planet in this minimalistic space game.

I'm afraid I didn't have time to implement a "how to play" screen in anywhere, so here are the instructions:

You control the entire game using just the mouse.
AIM: Make your planet as big as possible without dying.
BUT HOW?: By ramming into enemy ships, you can destroy them, leaving resources to pickup. These resources will expand the size of your planet (The numbered circle). However, your health will also decrease with impact. To replenish health, just head back to your planet.

The music also cuts and repeats weirdly halfway through... I have absolutely no idea why, but it sounds okay, I guess.

entries.title: Materia
entries.description:
Materia was created in 24 hours by Nick Breslin (http://www.etiquettestudio.com), @EtiquetteStudio


Objective
----------------------------------------------------
Collect as many points as you can by clicking cubes without destabilizing the materia and causing it to explode.


Progress
----------------------------------------------------
Each 100 points per level to move on. Earning extra points on earlier levels can make up for slower progress on more difficult levels.


Cube Types
----------------------------------------------------
White - Cheap and easy to collect.
Orange - Worth more than white.
Red - Most valuable, but also reduces stability.
Pink/Purple - Very unstable, but recharges energy.


Misc
----------------------------------------------------
Clicking cubes costs energy, which does recharge slowly.

Use The Arrow Keys or Right-Click+Drag (doesn't work on Web) to Rotate the Materia.

entries.title: Redeye
entries.description:
Control a giant flying robot and wreak havok on tiny green people.

Movement: up, down, left, right
Weapon: w, s, a, d
Abduct: space

Abducting heals you.

Made with http://craftyjs.com

entries.title: Sfrumz!
entries.description:
Goal: Allow player to control village elder type guy loosely based on the smurfs.  Issue commands to nearby "smurfs" like collect resources, attack target, build home.  They were to only work when you were around watching. Otherwise they'd just goof off.  Just like the smurfs, there is only one female which could lead to hideous mutated offspring.  Also other villages were to come and attempt to take your female.

Result: Walk around play field an watch "smurfs" wander aimlessly.

entries.title: Space Dozer
entries.description:
A simple twitchy shooter. Destroy everything on the planet before they destroy you. Topple multiple stories to get big bonuses. Use the enemy ships to your advantage, explosions cause damage too.

The list of stuff I never had a chance to add is endless and the source is a disgrace! But I guess there's a lot of people in the same boat :)

Used:
Flashdevelop
Nape
as3sfxr (which is awesome)
Flash
Photoshop (not that it shows :P)

entries.title: Spaceship Planet Merge
entries.description:
One day a voice spoke to the aliens:
"To fulfill your destiny you have to travel to the center of the Galaxy.
To do so, merge all your planets together, and afterwards, merge the large planet with the sun.
Your entire solar system shall be your spaceship."
And so they did...

Use explosive plants to move planets and to leave gravity.
 


Keyboard Controls:
Arrows for walking
Up to jump
X to pick up things
M to show the map
Tab to switch alien

Gamepad Controls:
Left stick to move
A to jump
B to pick things up
Y to show the map
Shoulder to switch alien



You can run CheckPrerequisites.exe to check whether all required Prerequisites are installed already. Run it if the game won't start or causes an error.

Prerequisites:

- Microsoft .Net Framework 4 Client Profile ( http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=24872 )
- Microsoft XNA 4 Runtime ( http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914 )


Development Tools:

Visual Studio 2010 and XNA 4
Music created with cgMusic ( http://codeminion.com/blogs/maciek/2008/05/cgmusic-computers-create-music/ )

Unfinished stuff:
- Aliens don't have any animations
- Forgot to add the planet-merge sound. Duh.
- Planned to add ropes and other things, but didn't have the time.

entries.title: The tiny life
entries.description:
It's a journey into the tiny life or cards. 
Totally physical driven game where you will destroy tons of cards.

entries.title: Tiny Hack/
entries.description:
You are Mr. Herbert Evan Robert Ondvar, Adventurer extraordinaire!

Are you a bad enough dude to slaughter them all?

Hit stuff with your sword and accept in menu using Space

Or if you launch it with -j you can use a joystick (Controls based of a Xbox 360 controller)

Hit stuff and accept in menu with button 0

Menu with... well menu (button 7)
Exit with back (button 6)

Update (24/4 2012 11:52):
Uploaded a linux version, tell me if it works.

entries.title: Tiny Island Adventure
entries.description:
Tiny Island Adventure tells us a story about young, girl mechanic Lydia, who once build her house on a floating island, but for her misfortune, it one night suddenly flew to the sky with her and her house on it!

Ever since she has been stuck high in the sky.. until one day another floating island appears next to hers. Lydia decides to explore the new island, in hopes that she could figure how to escape from the tiny floating islands.

Read post-release thoughts:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/23/tiny-island-adventure-post-mortem/

---
Controls:

Use Arrow Keys to move, Z to Jump, Up arrow to enter doors.
Enter to advance text or start the game in main menu
P to pause, - and + to adjust sound and 0 to mute.
Esc to skip the intro.

entries.title: Tiny World - God Mode Edition
entries.description:
Built in Unity. 
Used Blender for modeling, Gimp for textures, ArtText2 for icons, SFXR for sound effects, and atrk-bu for music generation.

entries.title: Astronautics
entries.description:
In this game you need to get as far as possible. You need to stay within the radar reach and because the radar is slow you need to land on tiny worlds and planets to slow down and refuel. 

To create this game i've used: haXe, NME and Inkscape.

It is also possible to compile the game for iOS and OSX, but i didn't test it so I don't know if it works. I didn't test the WebOS version too.

entries.title: Atomic Galaxy Factory

Ponder about the mysterious of the universe and spirituality.  Believe!

D: Move Right
W: Jump
Space: Food Miracle

Civilized Pixel

Civilized Pixel is a game set in a very tiny world where (almost) everything is made out of pixels. In order to progress through the game, you will need to build your civilization and different buildings. The goal is to run a flourishing city and economy.

make with:

mmf2 dev

photoshop

entries.title: Globe
entries.description:
The game is pretty basic, You are a single pixel in a Snow globe. The object of the game is to get from your starting destinations to the Love heart at the top of the map.

Game Controls:
Space: Jump.
WASD: Move.
Tab: Restart game.
F12: Toggle Music

Camera Controls:
Q: Zoom in.
E: Zoom out.
F11 (Toggle ON): Lock camera onto the player.
F11 (Toggle OFF): Full camera control, move camera with arrow keys.

Finish Condition:
You have finished the game and all areas of the map will be reviled once you have reached the heart at the top of the map.

Game Requirements:
XNA 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
Windows.

entries.title: Meal's Last Keen!
entries.description:
A kid's journey through the vast wilderness of his backyard on the way to dinner! Can he make it in time!?

Python2.7
PyGame 1.9.1release

entries.title: Nineties Holywood Hacker
entries.description:
Hack like in a cliche nineties Holywood movie, with sweet rigs, bright colors, lasers, and apparently some sort of spaceship!

First you need to build a link from the entry point (white( to the access (blue), then when you're ready, fly your program to the access through the link and destroy any rogue programs, anti-virus and firewalls you come across.

My first entry to Ludum Dare and it's been heaps of fun and swearing. I've decided I love Flixel, as it would have taken me so much longer to do this with anything else. I did have trouble with the theme and it does occur to me that this probably would have been perfect for 'Build it then use it', but I swear I came up with it while brainstorming for TinyWorld!

The general idea came from wanting to do something top-down in Flixel, but randomly deciding to mash it up with Pipeline. This part was going to be an actual game with a timer, but I ran out of time.

entries.title: QBik

QBik is a square. He live's in his own Tiny World with Three rooms and soda-addicted Triangle. The only hint for his world being a part of something bigger is a single window. Will you open it?

A to move left, D to move right, S to save, L to load.

Known Bugs:
-Crashes sometimes when you click on an empty space or an object.
-Crash on loading game on windows(due to pickle)
-Input lags when walking and moving mouse at the same time.

Sorry about the input lag, guys. I'm really-really sorry. It has something to do with the way I handeled events, and I'm not sure if it's not against the rules to fix the bug and send the game again.

Control a giant red robot by moving it's legs. Deliver flowers  as you stomp around the tiny town below.

entries.title: Sako
entries.description:
Sako is a game about a hero's journey to regain a place within his tribe. Traverse treacherous terrain in order to defeat a vengeful forest god. 

Space bar  = Jump
Arrow keys = Move

Level data is incomplete. Will be updating it soon. :)

entries.title: Snow Globe

The result of me and my friend's work. I must admit I'm a bit disappointed because I suck at programming and thus haven't been able to use another tool than Flash Pro.
Many game mechanics had to be cut and the BGM doesn't even loop... But still, I hope you'll enjoy it.

entries.title: The Moth and The Menace
entries.description:
Pretty standard metroidvania with some old cryptic hints.  hope it's not too confusing!  if you die, you keep your powers but i didn't get decent waypoints set up so don't die!

z=attack
x=jump
eventually down blocks

there was to be a dying scorpion at the outset whose tail you use as a weapon.  that part didn't get finished in time so you just start with it!  i'm sure the rest of the story makes even less sense.

Originally tried to hit up the 48 hours, but overestimated my ability.  even with the extra 24, i didn't get to polish up as much as i would have liked, mainly with the tilemaps.
as this is my third or fourth dare i decided to really cram a lot of stuff in here but it was just too much!

entries.title: This Town (ABEFTTOU)
entries.description:
Aaah it's almost time isn't it oh no.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
The game runs on the XNA framework, so the game is in the form of a self-extracting installer.  The game can be "uninstalled" by going into All Programs and Features in Windows and uninstalling Engine.exe.

Also, for people with bad graphics cards, the postcompo version is compiled in Reach mode for that.  I'd do it for the compo one too but I don't have the commit for that anymore :(

Quick Summary:
Catch up to your enemy by building energy harvesters that speed you up after you cross them.  Research items to do nice things with them.  Whoever catches up to the other first shoots them and wins.

That's all you really need to know.  go go go go go go

Linear RTS.  Shoot your enemy before he shoots you.  Speed yourself up by building harvesters.  Slow your enemy down by researching dead babies, detonators, and the elusive nuke.

Left Click is only control.  You cannot walk backwards.

Some things to try:
-Drop dead babies to slow down your enemy.
-Better yet, throw dead babies in the air to take down enemy harvesters.
-The detonator destroys harvesters within a small radius (including your own).  Useful to drop harvesters on the enemy this way, hint hint.
-Nuke destroys all enemy harvesters etc.

Good LD this time enjoy everyone etc.

EDIT: Why didn't /anyone/ tell me the game wasn't working on their machines?

I uploaded the working one post-deadline.  There's no changes except that it's actually packaged correctly so now it'll run on machines that don't already have XNA installed.  Hopefully that's alright? :<

EDIT 2: Well, it works now.  But there's a pretty game-breaking bug where the enemy would freeze if he hit a generator.

I've uploaded the fixed version but for the sake of honesty the old one is still up.  For the compo I'd recommend you judge based on that one.

entries.title: Tiny World

Written using Ruby/Chingu. Didn't finish.

entries.title: Tiny World? Yes!
TinyIsland
entries.description:
NOTE: If the game does not run, chances are you don't have .NET Framework 4 and/or XNA Framework 4 installed. Fetch them at:
.NET Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=17851
XNA Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

NOTE: There seems to be a major graphical glitch (requiring a relog to fix) with digging up moss, grass and sand and demolishing floors. Avoid using the shovel for anything but digging dirt or digging pebbles if you don't want to be forced to relog and lose your inventory. Alternatively, drop any items you want to keep before you relog so they won't be lost.

An online persistent world building game on a small island. There is no direct goal in the game, but you are instead free to build anything you like. All changes to the world are stored on the server so anybody else playing the game will see your buildings.

Controls are listed on the right side of the screen. Besides those controls, you can also press F4 to switch between windowed and fullscreen.

You can edit config.ini to specify which server to connect to, or you can edit it to play offline (the world will have to be manually saved in offline mode by pressing S).

Made using XNA and my sprite and networking engines VBXSE and GNI (see blog posts) in C# (Microsoft Visual Studio 2010). Music made in FL Studio 9 using DSK's soundfonts. Graphics made in GIMP. Sounds recorded using random stuff around my desk and Audacity.

Licensing information:
Music (c) 2012 VDZ, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial: feel free to steal and/or modify, but don't use commercially without my permission, and give me credit for it if you can reasonably be expected to.
Everything else (c) 2012 VDZ, licensed under Creative Commons Attribution: feel free to steal, modify and/or use commercially, but give me credit for it if you can be reasonably expected to (for example, if you have a credits screen in your work somewhere, or in a readme file).

You are on a toast. Mine wood-mold and jam, and build stuff.

entries.title: Berry Hunt
entries.description:
You are a tiny person who has to collect berries without being noticed by the cat. Hide behind bushes or your house when the cat opens both its eyes. Avoid twigs (which make noise and alert the cat). Bring all the berries back to your house.

entries.title: Glue Galaxy Rescue!
entries.description:
Take control of Chadley the Astronaut, and glue together planets to divert a meteor from its collision course with a tiny inhabited galaxy! After all, why play a game with one tiny world when you could play a game with two galaxies-worth of tiny worlds? G to grab/release planets and F to use the jetpack. The jetpack gives fast movement speed but runs out quickly when carrying many planets.

I got in about 25 hours on this one, but there are still a few bugs to fix. I had to cut it short for some work on homework, unfortunately, but I'm still happy with the outcome. However, if something inexplicable happens...try releasing and grabbing the planets again, and try not to let planets collide when you aren't holding any of them. There shouldn't be any problems most of the time...

Other tips: The range of Chadley's grab is somewhat finicky, so you may have to line up his hands with a planet in order to grab it. Also, releasing a planet/planet group gives it a bit of angular momentum.

Coded in Javascript/HTML5, with library code from the Video Game Development Club at the University of Minnesota. Audio in GarageBand and SFXR, artwork in GIMP and Paint.

Oh, and the stage is randomly generated, so it's different every time!

entries.title: Legends of Babanok
entries.description:
I made this game in 13 hours, starting from nothing. All of the graphics were made by me, the levels were made by me, and all of the code was made by me.

The object of the game is to gather as many coins as you can. You can pass a level by gathering all the coins in the level. When the time runs out, the game ends and you are given a level number, a score, and a total number of coins.

The hearts have not been implemented yet. The energy is filled when you eat a cupcake. While there is at least 1 energy left, you can move faster.

The controls:
W - up
A - left
S - down
D - right

Hopefully you guys will appreciate this game as I made it in 13 hours with only 7 months of java experience. This is my first Ludum Dare and I really enjoyed it!

Enjoy the game!

Made by: Longarmx

IMPORTANT: When you unzip the file, the folder renames itself to "bin"!

entries.title: Purgatorio
entries.description:
** Purgatorio was one of the picks in Rock, Paper, Shotgun's round-up of LD. Thanks Adam! http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2012/04/30/tiny-world-tour-ludum-dare-23/ **

My only plan coming into LD23 was to draw a rectangular, pixel-art kiwi (the bird, not the fruit). It really didn't look like a kiwi in the end, but that's okay, because I like it. And hey, I made some kind of a game for it to live in! 

The game itself is semi-autobiographical, and attempts to equate mental health issues with biblical concepts. It's built in AGS (Adventure Game Studio), as I'm not much of a coder. So it's a very non-traditional point-and-click game - no inventory, and only one puzzle: how to get the hell outta there!

** Make sure you use "winsetup.exe" to set it to run in a window, unless you want to be truly frightened! **

** If you're interested in what I get up to with my team, head along to http://seethroughstudios.com **

entries.title: Super Tiny Adventure
entries.description:
Edit : We add a dialogues text file. You can check all the dialogues, even those not integrate in the game.

Super Tiny Adventure is an RPG or Zelda like in only one screen.

There is only quests and dialogues.
This is our second participation and we are happy to be here again.

entries.title: The Story of a World
entries.description:
A game is about deciding how this tiny world presented to you will grow. Will nature rule the world, or will human life evolve and take over?

By choosing in which order different aspects of the world will grow you can affect how it evolves.

Try to unlock all the achievements, or simply try to build a world as beautiful as possible.

entries.title: Tiny Blastoff
entries.description:
Once you take off there is no turning back. The goal is to reach escape velocity and advance to the next level. You will need to smash through asteroids to replenish your fuel so you can keep your speed up.

Use Chrome to get 60 FPS.

The flag on the rocket is chosen based on your IP address so if it doesn't correctly show your countries flag then either don't worry about it, or visit hostip.info to find out why.

entries.title: Tiny Island
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare, but luckily it worked out better than I expected! It's a Sokoban-like logic game where you need to push boxes out of the way or into the water to reach the goal! :P

The game is coded in core Java, without any libraries. I used Notepad++ to code and as tools Paint.NET, MS Paint and the Tiled Mapeditor. Sorry for no sound, but I didnt want this to trouble me in my first Ludum Dare. If I'm not too lazy, I will try to add sound in my next one ;)

-----

Story:
You are a star, and while flying around and exploring the universe, you fell down to a tiny island on a tiny world of water. Can you collect enough stardust and refill your star energy, so you can fly in space again?

Controls: Arrow Keys


--
The game has 8 levels, and a little surprise at the end!
--


I hope you enjoy it ;)

entries.title: Tiny World
entries.description:
*Edit********************************
I had by mistake uploaded a 64bit version of my game. I have now fixed this so hopefully the game will run for everyone!
Thanks for testing it!
*************************************

*Edit 2******************************
I've added a Mac and Linux version. I haven't been able to test either, but hope they will work. 

To run the game (these instructions are copied form love2d.org):

-- MAC -----------------------------
On Mac OSX, a folder or .love file can be dropped onto the Love.app application bundle. On the Mac OSX Terminal (commandline), you can use love like this (assuming it's installed to the Applications directory):

open -n -a love "/home/path/to/game"

In some cases it may be faster to invoke the love binary inside the application bundle directly via the following:

/Applications/love.app/Contents/MacOS/love mygame

You can setup an alias in your Terminal session to call the binary when you use love by adding an alias to your ~/.bash_profile (open -a TextEdit ~/.bash_profile):

# alias to love
alias love="/Applications/love.app/Contents/MacOS/love"
Now you can call love from the commandline like Linux and Windows:

love "/home/path/to/game"

If you debug using the print command, it is useful to see this printed in realtime. In which case the following will open an extra window that will show the printed text.

xterm -e /Applications/love.app/Contents/MacOS/love "/home/path/to/game"

-- LINUX ------------------------

On Linux, you can use one of these command lines:

love /home/path/to/gamedir/
love /home/path/to/packagedgame.love
If you have installed the .deb, you can double click on .love files in your file manager as well.

----------------------------------

Run in fullscreen mode:

To change tofullscreen to window mode: change love-file's ending to zip. Edit the conf.lua inside setting fullscreen = true (and then change the file ending back to "love"
*****************************************

A game by Andreas Hedin

Control the balloon and tower to defeat the zombies, evil birds and beasts.

-- Controls:
F: Switch between balloon and tower
WASD: Steer the balloon
Left mouse button: Fire primary weapon
Right mouse button: Fire secondary weapon

entries.title: WTF LEMME OUT!!!

A Simple Text Adventure Game in a very tiny world.

I was unfortunately unable to finish in time. T_T
I had plans on going all the way to the YinYang Temple, and then after that the bad guy's lair. I think the reason is that I haven't made a game in years so I was out of practice. I also made everything from scratch instead of starting with a pre-made engine or anything like that.

I'll probably still finish the game eventually. What do you guys think? Should I finish it?

I made this with GameMaker-HTML5.

entries.title: 100seconds'World
entries.description:
It's Over ! What an epic Adventure for my first time ! 

Here it is my project : 100seconds'World 

The main idea was to propose the following context to the player : 

There is a planet which live only 100 seconds. You have the power to create Building and Tree ( symbols of the civilisation and the nature). There are somes interactions between them. Your aim is to get the higther score possible  which depend of theses interactions.
What will you do on this tiny planet and with theses rules?

At the end, I didn't have time to add music (snif) and others elements like animals, virus and stuff...and alls rules with them...But anyway,my main idea is here !

I hope you will enjoy it and comments it !
A big Thanks to all of you people for this memorable experience and for your futurs comments!
I wish you a good night !

entries.title: Ant, Bee, Cow, Pig and Spider BOSS
entries.description:
You are a lost ant and you have to go back to your underground nest.

But to get there you will have to hide from the Evil COW, PIG and the SPIDER BOSS.

Maybe your friend Bee can help you? Maybe if you save her from the spider?

A little platformer with some stealth action.

Instructions:
- Move with WASD or Arrow Keys.
- Jump: Space.
- Action/Shoot Rocks: E
- Shoot Stick: T
- Switch Character: Tab (if unlocked)

** Use your rocks and sticks wisely **

TIPS:
1) Rocks don't hit meat
2) Rocks hurt wood.
3) Wood cuts lines.
4) Lines cut can save friends.
5) Friends can reach higher places.
6) Higher places can open lower altitude places 
7) If it runs, you can also run away
8) If meat sees you, you can go back and it will stop
9) And you want to fall after using your friend's help
10) HEY LISTEN, THE GROUND!

entries.title: Atom Grid
entries.description:
Drop atoms, create molecules, do science! Comes into flavors:

--> ENDLESS MODE
As your queues fill up, you need to keep a cool head and create complex constructions and combos to score big! Includes an Online Highscore table and annoying alert sounds!

--> PUZZLE MODE
Use the limited supplies wisely, and clear all the atoms in one out of 29 (+ one secret!) levels! This mode is delivered to you along with a kitten ( http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/12/16/remember-you-love-kittens/ )!

Made in FlashPunk by ChevyRay, with levels made by Ogmo Editor by Matt.
Special thanks to the folks in the #ludumdare channel at Runouw.com for testing and being cool bros. High fives. o/

entries.title: Lost Planet

You are a tiny spaceship in the void of space. You have limited fuel to find your home planet. Explore the stars in order to find your home.

Game created in pygame.

entries.title: Nano Ascension

Journey into the heart of a computer and fight for your freedom while a programmer tries to eliminate you.  Features voice acting, sound, music, puzzles, an original story and more.

This is my first attempt at making a 3D game, making a game with sound, and more importantly, making a game with an actual story.  It was a crazy experience.  I need some sleep.

I hope you enjoy it.  I had an excellent time making it.

Twitter: @mikelovesrobots

[edit: An early playtester didn't notice the brief message informing him he could hold SHIFT to run.  The game is super hard without it so you might want to make a note that shift is awesome and may improve your experience if used once in a while.  Also, undocumented, you can press escape to quit the game.  You'd probably figure that out on your own though.]

[Bonus: Try to find the easter egg of me making the AW YEAH face.] 

[edit 2: Win32 link fixed.  Sorry for the inconvenience.]
