entries.title: Overpopulous
entries.description:
"Overpopulous" is a game about space colonization.

Mengolia is overpopulated.
Major advancements were made in interstellar traveling to colonize other planets.
Today is the day the first manned shuttle will leave your planet in search of a new home.
But, oblivious to everyone, the shuttle is upside down.
And then it propels the whole planet through space.
You can still colonize though - at the speed of light!


How to play:
- Press the SPACE key to blast off!
- Use the A, D, left or right directional arrows to steer your ship.
- Crash into a planet to colonize it.
- If a colonized planet crashes into an empty planet, it colonizes it and starting a Combo counter.
- Crashing into planets and satellites (natural and artificial) fill your Blast Off meter, allowing you to use it again once it's complete.
- When hit, artificial satellites and spaceships release astronauts that can be picked up to start a Colonization Multiplier.
- You can stack Colonization Multipliers until you hit an empty planet.
- Avoid the Sun!
- Be a sport and post your Best Time and Score. ;)


We've been working hard to fix some game breaking bugs.
Hopefully the game is more playable now that the Home World doesn't disappear (we think) from the screen.


Bug List:
- Some animations need speed tweaks.
- Combos sometimes don't end.
- Combo and Multiplier counter sometimes don't appear (but points are still given).
- Planets that crashes into Sun isn't removed from the total number of planets and doesn't subtract score (don't worry though, only colonized planets are destroyed by the Sun).
- Some physics are f#&%$ up!

Missing Features:
- Leaderboards button in main menu leads nowhere.
- Intro animations aren't playing completely.
- Planet number should be random.
- ESC should bring up Pause Menu.
- No end screen when colonizing all planets.
- No Retry option on Game Over.
- Particle system is disabled.

entries.title: Rudolph the JUMPING SPIDER
entries.description:
Hi All!

This is "Rudolph the JUMPING SPIDER" - my submission to LD48-23.

Use the arrow keys to move, space to jump - the longer you press space, the higher you jump.

See if you can catch the fly!

C++ with ClanLib, FL Studio, Inkscape and sfxr.

Windows only - Hope you have fun!

Cheers,
Daniel

entries.title: Science 101 - The Sewer Chronicles
entries.description:
Sadistic science professor R. E. Searcher, Ph. D., has met with an unfortunate incident that not even tenure can alleviate. In between kidnapping and "instructing" this year's batch of ill-fated freshman, Professor Searcher has somehow managed to turn his most recent instrument of torture- his shrink ray- against himself. 

	Having shrunk to the size of a lima bean and fallen through the drain in his classroom's much-used emergency eye wash station, Professor Searcher must now navigate the sewer tunnels and collect beakers of chemical energy before the effects of the shrink ray wear off and he becomes crushed to death in the tiny world within the sewer pipes. 

	Welcome to Science 101: The Sewer Chronicles, where exams are cumulative and there is no extra credit.

entries.title: Shrunkit
entries.description:
Shrunkit is a game about shrinking and growing objects. You play as a less-than-desirable thief tasked with stealing a prototype shrink ray. 

The game can be a little buggy, but there shouldn't be anything game-breaking. You can always restart the level if something goes wrong.

Enjoy! I'd love to know what you think :)

(PS: Sorry about the sound, I am not musically inclined)

If you're interested, my (team's) website is www.magnesiumninja.com

entries.title: Survivor
entries.description:
"You play a lone survivor aboard a makeshift raft adrift in the vast ocean, looking for civilization. Avoid the sharks! Find civilization before time runs out and you go crazy, therefor, jumping into the ocean and ending your so called life! Will you survive the terrors of the ocean? Will insanity take over your mind? You are on your own in the tiny world that is your raft..."

My first game made on my own. Bad code, no skills, but you gotta start somewhere!

entries.title: Terra Bellum
entries.description:
Still a number of bugs, you might enjoy it more if you don't exploit them :)

* * * Please let me know if you have performance issues. I don't have access to any older graphics hardware to test with. I have a more lo-fi version ready to go if there are any requests for it * * *

Another semi-multiplayer LD entry. Early players will have a significantly different experience to later players, so consider playing again after the game has a few worlds in play? 

* update 12th May 2012
Fixed a couple of the most gamebreaking bugs (able to position world tree outside of enemy firing zone and your own island self destructing after you win sometimes) and reduced the particle count a little - I hadn't forseen that a few players would actually max out their islands and have hundreds of shots in the air simultaneously :)

also added a lofi version a few days ago without shadows or blur, so should run quite a bit better

entries.title: The Cheesiest Game Ever!
entries.description: Hey! I'm 13 and this is my second LD submission. This really drained a lot of me. That's all I have to say, enjoy the game!

entries.title: The Small World of Professor Strange
entries.description:
*** PRO TIP: typing HELP will list all the things you can do ***

A bit of promotion on Hacker News suckered 9000 people into wasting collectively 130 hours on this game in the first 24 hours :)

This is the kind of game we wanted to make when we were young..  a classic bit of nostalgic interactive fiction, perhaps with a twist.

Its a puzzle game - you really can retrieve the treasure! - with a small but beautiful world to explore.  If you get stuck, its quite ok to ask for HELP.

Who doesn't want to play a game with pirates, Sioux in a canoe, a mad baron in a steam-powered zeppelin, a peculiar hedge-hog and ... sucked in yet?

Of course we could add so much more detail if only we'd had more time!  We managed to plumb-together and make-work 51 locations, 33 objects and 7 NPCs so it should be good for hours of game-play.

The illustrated version is absolutely beautiful, but the PROGRAMMING UI is safe for playing at work! ;)

We hope you have as much fun playing it and solving it as we had making it :)

Artwork by Mr War, Code by Will Edwards, Text by James Lovett, Song from the internet "Artifact" by Kevin MacLeod (ISRC: US-UAN-11-00324)

entries.title: Tiny World
entries.description: It is an interactive text adventure that i spent many hours writing ^_^

entries.title: Tiny World Defense

Defend your tiny world against asteroids by shooting them!

Simple but fun!

entries.title: TinyLabyrinth

Select one of the three classes and push, fight or plot your way to the top.

Hey, This game was made by Tintounn(french, so sorry for my bad english).

You are a pill and the goal is to destroy any bacteria being the fastest of different levels of human corp.

entries.title: Big Space Tiny Man
entries.description:
A,D - Move
SPACE - Jump

CLICK To Shoot

Try not to die! Even though you can't! The little people will overtake you.

Watch for the little people.

Mac version is up!

Also, it should be noted that while you cannot die, you also cannot win :( Thanks for playing if you do, though!

entries.title: BioBattle
entries.description:
Created in Java using LWJGL and Slick.

In this game you create and then battle bacteria against an AI. When creating yours and your opponents bacteria, keep in mind that each part will supply some stats to your bacteria as well as a certain skill that you will be able to use in the battle.

Up and Down arrows to navigate, Enter to confirm.

In 'Create Game' mode, you have to create your bacteria as well as your opponents.

entries.title: Boundaries
entries.description:
Atomic* gladiators.  Now with contradictory and outdated physics.

*No atoms were harmed in the making of this game.

entries.title: Cannon Planet
entries.description: Defend your planet with missiles!

entries.title: Circuit
entries.description:
Well I slacked off all wekend and managed to whip this up within the last 6-7 hours, so here you go. There's no background music but there is sfx, I tested with headphones so the volume might be low.

INSTRUCTIONS:
arrow keys to move on the grid. the wavy tiles slow you down.
Get across the level and reach the exit to win! it's pretty simple.


I had a grand old time this weekend slacking off with a tinge of game-making, and I salute all of you who put in the whole 48 hour effort. I might work on this a bit more and get a polisheder version for the jam tomorrow, but we'll see.

EDIT: I didn't have time for any playtesting so you'll most likely (I can't say for sure, I didn't get any playtesters!) have a lot of trial and error to do since there will probably be some B.S. deaths from enemies you didn't know were there

Also thanks to SpaceManiac for hosting the file for me.

entries.title: Fill that jar! now put some crumbs in it!
entries.description:
The title is pretty self explanatory, not much of a game. I couldn't spend as much time on it as I would have liked, but I will probably expand upon it from here.

If you have any problems with rollover states, try the web version instead. (I didn't get chance to build in support for resolutions other than 1024 x 576)
Fun!

entries.title: Le Petit
entries.description: My first Ludum Dare entry!  Sorry for all you Mac and Linux users but I have no idea how to port it over to other operating systems.  If anyone can tell me how it would be greatly appreciated. I know it's a bit early but I feel that if I start to add other stuff, it will loose that sense of completeness that I think it has now.  I'm happy with it and I like the little "gimmick" it has.  Arrow keys to move, and you can double jump.  A quick tip is that this game is majorly about saving your second jump for the right time.  Hope you guys like it and good luck everyone.  This game is quite hard, sorry but I didn't want to ruin it by making it too easy, and I used to making hard games.

entries.title: Magma Defense
entries.description:
In Magma Defense you defend a tiny world from a barrage of missiles. You use different types of terrain to shield your world's core.

Written in HTML5/WebGL, using the following libraries:
jQuery
https://github.com/evanw/lightgl.js
https://github.com/evanw/csg.js

Works in current versions of Chrome and Firefox. Also works in Safari if WebGL is turned on. There are random pauses in Firefox on some systems.

entries.title: Marble Worlds
entries.description:
After receiving a mysterious bag of strange marbles, you discover that each marble contains a tiny world.

Uncover the secrets of each world to unlock the hidden power within.

Use the arrow keys to move about.

entries.title: Muffin Time!
entries.description:
As we all know stealing a muffin in a spaceship triggers the selfdestruction sequence. You have 30 seconds to deactivate it. But don't panic (too much): time will slow down to a crawl when you enter the tiny world of machines.

To activate doors and disable the evil guard robots, you have to enter them with a tiny version of yourself. You can spit out tiny-you by pressing space. Jump by pressing the up key. You can also do walljumps!

Muffin Time is brought to you by Patrick Wachowiak, Dominik Schneider, Austen Fano and Tonio Freitag.

entries.title: My First World
entries.description:
Everything you need is on the page. 
Instructions purposely vague.

entries.title: NiÃ±a Nueve
entries.description:
Puzzles, brawling, boss monsters.  A bit like a Zelda game trapped in a 9x9 box.

Arrow keys control.

entries.title: Obsolescence
entries.description:
There are no resources left in the Universe, the only planets unharvested are the tiny worlds. Although untouched, because of their size they can only sustain life for a few hundred years. So you are at a constant threat and must keep jumping between planets to keep the human race alive and prevent us from becoming obsolete.

I put everything I have into this. I managed to finish in 24 hours and still get something I was really proud of. I was especially happy with the soundtrack which only took 2 hours but came out really good.

entries.title: Shrink-O-Matic 9000
entries.description:
This is my Second Ludum Dare entry, and I had a lot of fun with it!  So without further ado here's my game overview:

A 2D puzzle-platformer in which you use the shrink-o-matic 9000 to shrink objects to overcome obstacles!

Let me know what you think!

Update! - You can now use arrow keys to move and space-bar to shoot!

Update #2! - Fixed the jumping bug!

entries.title: Single Cycles
entries.description:
THE SHORT
---------
Race your unicycle around the little globe as fast as you can! 

Local multiplayer one-button racer for the web! Everyone can play! Open your browser, grab a key, and hang on tight! Careful, though: build up too much speed and you'll take off, losing traction and slowing you down.

* Controls: ANY KEY. LITERALLY ALMOST ANY KEY ON YOUR KEYMABOARD.
* Strategy: Hold your key to accelerate, but let off before you fly off the planet and lose speed.


THE DETAILS
-----------
I developed this game solo in 72 hours. The game is built on the HTML5 canvas and Javascript. Libraries at work behind the scenes include CraftyJS, Jukebox, Underscore.js, and jQuery. Sound effects were generated by the always-lovely sfxr (flash port at superflashbros.net). The game has been tested in Firefox 11 and Chrome 18 for OSX.

I had plans for multiple unicycles, multiple planets, more advanced physics, and a lot more feedback to players. I've had the whole one-button UI flow worked out for a while and this was going to be the proof of concept. As is, I barely squeaked in under the Jam submission deadline (with SECONDS to spare!), so I wasn't able to realize anything more than the basic gameplay.


KNOWN ISSUES
------------
The sound isn't great in Chrome. I think Zynga lists this as a known issue with Jukebox on Chrome, something to do with Chrome's audio codecs. Use Firefox if you can.

The game swallows most keystrokes, so your browser shortcut keys probably won't work while the game is displayed. This is the price of admission.

The player color selection is overly simple and gets confused when multiple players join and leave. There are only 10 colors in this version, so they repeat if you have more than 10 players. Also, the player tint is supposed to apply to the sprite, not the background, but there's a long-standing bug in CraftyJS that I haven't gotten around to patching.

You'll find there are some key combinations on your keyboard that work better than others when you have several players. Anyone who played local multiplayer shareware games in the '90s remembers this problem. =) Experiment in the pregame to make sure everyone's key works when all the others are held down. Try hooking up a game controller or wiimote and binding the buttons to keys to cram even more players in!


LEAVE A MESSAGE
---------------
Each and every smidge of feedback is fabulous; please do leave a note or hit me up on Twitter (@mildmojo) if you have any words for me. And thanks for giving it a try. Really, thanks.

entries.title: The Pitful Pits
entries.description:
This game was supposed to have a story, which followed you, a vermin exterminator, who happened to have shrunk. You would find yourself inside the Rat caves, fighting for your life until you escape.

However, it I did not have enough time to implement a story-line and such. Anyway, please give me a rating - don't be shy.

CONTROLS:
ARROW KEYS - MOVEMENT
ENTER/LEFT MOUSECLICK - SHOOT

entries.title: Tiny Journey
entries.description:
Tiny Journey is a graphical adventure where you control a tiny kid with huge dreams.
With an engaging storyline, the game features text-based interaction with the world, puzzle-like challenges, and beautiful art and music. 

There are two versions of this game.

The FIRST VERSION (Web) was made in time for the Jam, and has some minor problems. If you are going to play this version please read the following:
We are aware that the game difficulty is not well adjusted, so at the moment it may be a bit challenging to get out of the initial room, and then too easy to complete the rest of the game.
Hint: there's a hammer under the couch!

The SECOND VERSION (Polished) is the tweaked version we promised. This improved version has now more easter eggs (have you tried to sing, switch the lights off or do funny stuff with the objects?), smoother difficulty, comprehensive help on how to play the game, an incorporated hint system in case you get stuck (just type 'hint') and no bugs that we could find.
If you find any problem with the polished version, please tell us, so that at the end of the judging we have a problem-free version.

Please vote and have fun!

If you are still stuck, check the walkthroughs at our youtube channel. (Spoiler Warning!)

entries.title: Tiny the Adventurer
entries.description:
This is my second solo game, and my first go at Ludum Dare.
I quite liked the 'tiny world' theme, and hey... my game's world is so tiny it fits in a 480x480 screen! =)
No animations and no sound, because I was running out of time, but I hope to do better next time.
The game was made with Construct 2 and I used the ZX Spectrum's palette, albeit without the infamous attribute clash. =)

Please note that I uploaded a smaller version, with no changes at all (still no sound, no animation, no endscreen and quite a lot of bugs) right after the compo ended. I also uploaded the correct version of the source file, since I mistakenly uploaded an obsolete one. I hope that doesn't throw me out of the Compo. =P

entries.title: Tiny world
entries.description: Cool game

entries.title: Asteroid Defender
entries.description:
Asteroid Defender is a shooter where you move around a tiny asteroid defending it from waves of falling bombs. Spare pirates want to kick you off your asteroid and plunder its resources! Move left and right with the arrow keys or A/D, and aim and shoot with the mouse.

This was my first Ludum Dare compo, and I had a lot of fun! Source is included in the zip file. The .gmk is a Game Maker 7.0 project, code included, that requires the Pro version to compile. The .vge file is a VGM Music Maker module file for the title screen music.

I've written a postmortem now! Basically, I was going to add a lot of different structures that did different things, but the only structure that made it was the turret. You can read it at http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/05/15/asteroid-defender-postmortem/

entries.title: Freedom
entries.description:
Story
You are a little Smiley, trapped in a cave, alone.
Find your way out of this scary, tiny world!

Instructions
Press A to move left, D to move right.
Space to jump!

Special Character
A to move left, D to move right.
Space to jump.
Shift to run.

Bugs
The Special Character is pretty buggy, so don't mess around too much with him ;-)

entries.title: Gravity Force 3
entries.description:
Well, this is my first Ludum Dare Entry and indeed, my first Unity 3D Game under my belt!

Gravity Force 3 is a retro style shooter with simple controls so anyone can pick-up and play it. 

Ther game starts off with a low difficulty level which slowly increases the more enemies are destroyed.

I'm going to release and Android and hopefully an IOS version a while after the compo has finished which should be groovy!

----------------------------------------------
Update - 26-04-2012 

A website dedicated to the game will be coming up soon. Thanks again to everyone for their feedback it's really encouraging and once I've finished rating ludum dare games I promise I'll be improving and releasing the game fully.

The website is available at: http://www.gravityforce3.com/

Hope you have fun playing!

----------------------------------------------

There's some lovely timelapse footage where my blurry webcam makes it look like I'm punching myself in the face constantly. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bsZ0dRSMTi0&feature=g-u-u

Update - 29-04-2012

entries.title: Haxe Planets

Haxe planets are planets that have the most precious metal in the universe: Haxe - the fuel of intergalactic ships.

You are in the base of one of these planets. Your first mission is to get out of the base and get Haxe.

This is a one button platformer. Press space to jump, avoid enemies, and try to get the exit of each level.

This game was made using the following:

Coding: Haxe
Library: NME
IDE: Flash Develop
Sound: SFXR+Audacity
Music: ChordPulse+GXSCC+Audacity
Graphics: Paint.net+Gimp2

The game was tested succesfully in Flash, Android, HTML5 and Wndows native using the same source code, unfortunately sound is not working very well except in Flash, so I'm submitting only the Flash version for the contest.


***UPDATE 20120424 (Please don't use to rate)
Native windows version

The applet is not working somehow...

Sadly, I had to cut out some cool stuff though, like Civilians that walked around the map on roads and stuff. The code's still in the game, but it had to be chucked because it laginized the game too much. Also, if you look at the source code, it's a total pile of rubbish because I was in a mega rush. So please don't kill me because I have a module called 'Glove' that was a misspelled 'Globe'. :D

entries.title: MiniQuest
entries.description:
** Unfinished Entry; while you can admire the world generation and music, the final boss is a stalemate as we failed to get hit detection working against the boss. **

You are an ant. Use the arrow keys to move and find your sword on the one-screen overworld, then confront the bird lurking off the north edge.

Spacebar swings your sword, you can test it against the Miasma.

entries.title: Mitochondrion
entries.description:
You are an sub-organelle within a single mitochondrion.

Collect the amino acids and deliver them to the granules (yellow)

You will grow larger as you collect, and will have to sacrifice some to shrink down far enough to fit in some spaces.

WASD to move, mouse to aim and expel collected amino acids.

First time here, had a blast. This is quite unfinished, but complete enough to be fun to explore.

entries.title: Mozi Life
entries.description:
Currently only tested in Chrome!!!

I struggled with an idea and hit on the life cycle of a Mosquito. I wanted to add a blood sucking and mating scene but ran out of time. The "fun" is kinda lost in the awkwardness of a disgusting little life cycle and it resisted gamification rather nicely... I found the result quite interesting.

On a technical side it was all written from scratch on just Javascript and Chrome. I'm rather proud of the little debugging interface and quick turn around on playing around on the systems. Though I didn't get time to use it the adult has a full 2D rig with simple constraints built in.

Overall I'm happy with the project but the resulting game is slightly creepy and not very fun but has a certain... something :P

=================================

*Egg Laying Trouble*
Don't want to alter the game post compo till the voting is done but the egg laying is meant to start at the head and to the tail. If you hesitate or go off on the gesture the egg cracks (black square)

Missing Bits: Finding a Target, Blooding Sucking, Finding a Mate, Sex. Was going through it linearly but when running out of time I jumped to egg laying o help reinforce the cycle aspect

entries.title: Phi-projekt
entries.description:
Phi-projekt is a musical/puzzle/experience.
Since I haven't had time to explain this in the game, here's the story.

---STORY---
You are Viktor, a (mad) scientist who cast apart from the scientitific elite because he has a lot of ideas well... quite dangerous.
Since then, his only purpose is to find the ultimate weapon to enslave and/or kill the other scientist if no one gives him some respect and a Nobel prize.
His working in both the physical and chemical field and swear only by the power of the tiniest elements : atoms, nucleos, quarks... 

---PURPOSE---
You'll be his hands while he experiments things in experimental chamber : he tries to split apart atomic elements to produce the most powerful weapon.
You'll have to move things in the experiment chamber to keep the elements moving and splitting.

---GAMEPLAY---
To move things around, drag&drop the things you can. Depending on the material, the bounciness isn't the same.

If you press number pad "5" key, you'll gain access to the initial gameplay : using the UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT to control the right hand and the A(or Q)/Z (or W)/S/D to control the left hand. You can only move things by moving both hands onto the material. While both the hands are overlapping the material, you can move it. Beak apart the double overlapping and the material will fall.

---KNOWN ISSUES---
Sometimes, when there are too much sprites on the screen, the game can freeze.
There's no game over (neither by winning or losing)
Some strange collisions with the Drag&Drop control
Not a lot of variety with the sounds (no time)

entries.title: Quantum Entanglement
entries.description:
This is a puzzle game solved by manipulating objects (mirrors and filters) so that a light beam reaches its target (which must be a matching color). The catch is that these objects are "quantum entangled", so moving one moves the other!

Figure out the rules that govern the world and make your way through 10 levels, starting off very easy and becoming much more challenging. The controls are simple - clicking and dragging.

The sound effects were mostly created with processed recordings of my voice.

This is a Windows XNA Game. The zip file for Windows assumes you have XNA installed. If not, you can use the link for the ClickOnce installer - that will install the XNA redist along with the game.

NOTE: There are bugs in levels 7-10 that make them easier to solve than I had intended. Judge based on the official links (since I think it may be against rules to upload fixes), but if you want the fixed versions here they are:
http://icefallgames.com/Files/LevelFixes.zip (this is for the zipped version: just copy over the same-named level text files)
or:
http://icefallgames.com/Downloads/QuantumEntanglementPostComp/publish.htm (this is a new install package for those w/o XNA)

entries.title: The Little Glitch
entries.description:
You're a Debug agent trapped in a glitched byte, and must rebuild the data structure to be able to flow back to the great universe of the Internet.

* Fixed Web version.

entries.title: The Wizard Delven
entries.description:
A Prototype Game :)
Please read the Readme... I know you don't want to...
By the way, its a .jar, so there's only need for one download :)

entries.title: Tiny Cavern
entries.description:
It's a story focused, platformer type of game. It has multiple endings, although the game is really tiny.

Graphics were created by drawing on hand + scanner.

Sounds were made with sfxr program or by recording self ( whistling + cat sound).

I'm very happy that I managed to do this on my first time on LD!

I used AS3, Flashpunk, Ogmo editor, FlashDevelop, Sfxr, Audacity, scanner, pens, nokia N8 (to record audio) , paint, gimp, paint.net

Controls: arrow keys. (Also N, Y, SPACE, ENTER, M keys are in use, but the game instructs when to use those). M key works for mute / unmute any time.

entries.title: Tiny Failures
entries.description:
Unzip the game wherever you want.
Double-click on game.exe to start.

The current version does not allow you to pass the tutorial.
But you can use a disable help button during game when you get some experience.

Don't look for sound as I have not been able to add sounds...

entries.title: Tiny God : Small Diety, Big Pantheon
entries.description:
My entry is a mix of god game and resource strategy. You are the god in control of a tiny world, but there are other, bigger, gods out there who do not look kindly on your rise to power.

You have no direct control over your units, only the mix and number of each that exist. It is up to you to make sure there is an adequate food supply, and a sufficient number of them to hold off invaders.

I didn't have time to complete the additional levels I had planned, but I plan to complete more sometime this week and put it up separately. This first level is an introduction to your main units and how they interact and building story, the second level would be taking them to the world of another god and using them to invade.

P.S. There are hints that show up as you play at the bottom of the screen, they are relevant to what is happening at the time.

UPDATE: I added a WIP link with the latest version, with bug fixes and new features. Including a 4th unit that plants grass.

FAQ:

Q: Why did I win?
A: In the instructions (button on the title screen) it says that you need to hit 2500 Life force to beat the level. I'll try to make that clearer in an updated version.

Q: How do the zombie waves work?
A: The number of zombies is random, currently its (5 + random(1-6)) * wavenumber. I'll try to make it more incremental.

Q: Why did some of the humans run from the zombies?
A: The women (humans with bows) run from zombies but are required for men to reproduce. Men will run towards zombies and fight them.

Q: What is the relationship between Life Force and Life Power? 
A: Creating Life builds your Life Force. The more complicated the life is the more Life Force it is worth. In order to hit 2500 Life Force and end the game you will need a lot of Men. In order to sustain a lot of Men you will need a lot of Cows to feed them. Life Power is granted to you every 4 seconds based on the amount of living beings that currently exist in your world. It caps at 200 and is the currency used to create life.

Q: I plateaued at X life, how do I get more?
A: Build more units! The more units you build the higher your life force! Just keep building till you hit 2500.

entries.title: Tinyville Confidential
entries.description:
Welcome to Tinyville, population 6! The residents have nothing better to do all day than gossip, argue, and form alliances. When the town is asleep, you keep the peace by moving the houses of friends together and enemies apart.

Instructions: During the day, residents will talk to each other and become friends (indicated by a heart) or enemies (indicated by ! and then an X). At night, you can swap their houses by dragging and dropping them. You get points in the morning depending on how many people's houses are next to someone they like or don't like.

Please note: I didn't get around to adding an actual win condition, so just try to fill up the happiness meter and play as long as you want.

I wanted to do more with this game, but I wasn't really able to pull it together. Still, I hope you enjoy it!

Post-mortem journal post: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/24/tinyville-confidential
My website: http://roseabernathy.weebly.com/

entries.title: Virus Wars
entries.description:
Virus Wars is a game where you fight against all the viruses which attack your body. Every virus is made of at least one color. You have the antidotes with the same color as the virus. To kill one you should kill all its colors. But beware - if you try to kill it with the wrong antidote the virus will consume the color and become stronger.

Use WASD to move, SPACE to change color, Mouse to point and shoot. 

Mechanics Details: The current color is put around the screen, around yourself and it is used to fire at the enemies. You change it with 'space'. If an enemy is hit with a color one of the following can happen:
 - If the enemy already contains this color it will be removed (i.e. its health will be decreased)
 - If the enemy does not contain this color it will assimilate it (i.e. its health will be increased)

(Sorry, no time for music or beautiful graphics)

entries.title: Athletic's Foot
entries.description:
Did you ever like to build your own athletic's foot?  No?  But anyway, now you can!

In this mini game you can build three different types of entities:
 * HQ to get more space where you can build and to get more score but costs 300 cheese and 300 water
 * transpore to fetch 60 water or 60 cheese from pores (cheese if the pore is infected or water if not)
 * infector to infect pores

Transpores and Infectors can only be places around pores (green area).  Just click to get a drop down menu to build and middle click to remove a fungi.  If a HQ is destroyed, then all the fungi which are no more on the build space, are also destroyed!

But watch out, evil ants will attack and eat you and will never stop.  You will have no chance against them (if there is no bug) but you can try to beat your highscore.  Be careful if they attack your HQs!

The game stops if your cheese or water resources are less than 0 or if all your fungi are gone.

Requirements:  Jave 6 should be enough for all systems.  Just Doubleclick the jar file

entries.title: Attack on the Planet XXS-01
entries.description:
EDIT:
Finally, after (as you may have guessed) 8 nights and 9 days of work, I hereby introduce you to the new version of "Attack On Planet XXS-01"

The basic mechanics are in place: you control the turret with the mouse, right button shoots, left button places a satellite. The movement is somewhat smoother than before.
If you press the Space key, an orbit will be drawn on screen. If you then place a satellite (while pressing the Space key), it will follow said orbit, instead of being stationary.

There's a new HUD (there's "A" HUD, in fact XD). It shows:
  - Score
  - Energy
  - Highscore
  - Active weapon  (bottom left of the screen)
  - Active satellite (bottom right of the screen)

To change the type of satellite to use, just press the 'Q', 'W', 'E' and 'R' keys. The satellites are:
- Type 1: shoots like a Boss
- Type 2: tractor beam. Kinda weak, though - it only slows down the enemies
- Type 3: repulse beam. Move them out of the way!
- Type 4: energy sucker. Steal their energy to increase the turret's regeneration rate
Placing a satellite sucks half of the available energy (50 units). And they regenerate their energy too, now.
You can place up to 4 satellites on screen simultaneously. The only requirement is to have enough energy for its "teleportation"

Two new types of enemies, that you will encounter from the 8th wave onwards:
- Mine: slow and erratic movement, but smallish (hard to hit) and with quite a bang!
- Mecha: enters an orbit around the planet and chases the player's position. It has a front shield that repels energy shots. And that's as much as I can tell :D

The 'Ripple' gun (number 3) is weaker than before, but it has the ability to slightly push enemies back (depending on a variable 'weight' associated with each enemy type)

There are some new graphical bells and whistles, of course. Like a nifty tiny life bar that shows you how your enemies are feeling.
Oh! And there are some sounds! No music yet, though...
The game can be completed successfully. But it won't be easy. Trust me on that one XD

Please try this version out if you feel like the original Ludum Dare version had some potential. You'll see you were completely wrong! XD But, should you vote, please vote solely based on the original version!

ORIGINAL POST:
Please enjoy my first Ludum Dare game to date! :D

Source code included with the .exe

Enjoy, and thanks for your time!

entries.title: Craemle Zone
entries.description:
USE Z, X, ARROWS TO PLAY

Thanks everyone for your feedback! Some have asked for more detailed instructions:


*** BASIC INSTRUCTIONS  ***

- Use Z to shoot, X to grapple
- Collect coins to unlock doors, and explore space


*** MILD SPOILERS ***

- The real goal is to appease the planet-gods
- Fly near to listen to what they have to say
- Grapple things, and release them near a planet to put into orbit


*** MORE HINTS ***

- It's really a matching game
- Each planet will require something specific, and then require 2 more related things
- The specific object should normally be somewhat obvious, and is usually nearby (though often one map away)
- If you think carefully, you can solve the matching puzzles but each planet typically has one item that requires lateral thinking


*** EXTRA HINTS ***

- Watch your score; when you have all three objects for a planet, it will be 2
- Once all planets are appeased, you can escape through the big door.


ENJOY! And thanks for playing... You can definitely beat this if you persist, there IS a proper ending.

entries.title: Phobius
entries.description:
This is our first entry in Ludum Dare and we are very satisfied with the result! Although lots of features got cut out and a great deal of bug fixes was still left to do, we managed to learn a lot and have fun with the experience.



Idea

We tried to tackle the "tiny world" theme by focusing on the character's inner world and that is how we got the claustrophobia idea.

So basically he will gradually panic and the world around him will get tinnier.



Plot

In our game you'll control a young.. something (even we aren't quite sure what race that is) who gets scared at every other turn and hates tight spaces.

The plot is very simple. He is going with his family to visit a building and he gets scared before going in, which results in being left behind. He then tries to catch up by going up the floors on his own.



The hitboxes didn't end up so good but we didn't have time to try and make them better. Also the panic bar times needed tweaking but we think the idea comes across.



Be patient with the loading, we didn't manage to get the pre-load working, it's just a few seconds.

*if you get stuck press R to restart level

Hope you like it :)

Have fun and thanks for playing!

The game is built for Chrome and has been tested to work in Chromium on Linux.  If you're having trouble running it on linux try this: http://www.borfast.com/blog/how-enable-webgl-google-chrome-linux-blacklisted-graphics-card

entries.title: TinyColony
entries.description:
**NEW**: Windows build added!

You are a tiny any in a tiny world.

Defend your colony from the evil red ants! Collect food! Kill things!

Contact me if you would like to help get a Linux build up! The windows build was built on Windows 7, 64 bit, but should be compatible with 32 bit as far as I know. Your milage may vary - let me know if it works for you!

---

Development details:

This is my third Ludum Dare, and the first one I have finished. I wanted to use a C++ based game engine, as I am doing a technical job interview in the next few days where C++ is a assessed, and I haven't done any C++ in several years :)

So, that said, I used the Angel game prototyping engine (built for game jams like this). See (http://code.google.com/p/angel-engine/) I've never used it before, but it seems fairly well rounded. The docs are a little out of date though, so digging through source code was necessary. I built the game in 40hrs, finishing with 4hrs to spare.

GIMP was used for graphics, Xcode for programming (Angel engine needs XCode to build on Mac). I used SFXR for sound effects and the music was taken straight from the Angel engine demos.

I wanted to add more functionality: Rain that hurts ants, the ability to travel down the anthill and dig underground, random insect encounters and magnifying-glasses of death, more terrain types (rocks, grass etc) and also more AI functionality (ants will help other ants / communicate where food deposits are). All of these features got cut due to time :)

I'm super stoked to have actually finished this to a point where it works and is fun - a bit of a personal milestone for me :)

Things I learned:
 * I HATE XCODE! SOOOO MUCH HATE!!! There were many occasions where a physical bug in Xcode itself would prevent me from being able to build my game. I would have to delete entire methods and re-type them before Xcode would link them correctly.
 * Next time, I'll be using a JS-based html5 engine, so it's much easier for people to play and vote :)
 * If your game engine supports a scripting language, such as Lua, use it. It will save you a lot of time.

entries.title: Anthill
entries.description:
Source included in download.

Anthill is a puzzle/strategy/infection game where black and red ants do battle for control of the anthill! Help the black ants win by destroying the stone the red ants lay and planting grass along with the black ants. Ensure there is more grass than stone on the map when time runs out!

NOTE:

For those who asked, as far as I know, there is no way to deploy XNA games as a standalone .exe and have it work reliably across all machines without requiring installation. It can be done, but the failure rate goes through the roof. If anyone wants a standalone .exe version to try, you can get it here: http://www.mediafire.com/?t29xvhkehvigngu

The likelihood of issues is high, however. This is due to XNA projects being dependent on other libraries that the installer puts in place if they are not already present. Essentially, if the XNA framework libraries are already present and correct, the game should work, if not, you will likely have issues if the game even runs at all.

Chris - http://jitterbones.tumblr.com/post/21697071191/ludum-dare-23-nanonaut

Nanonaut - an ambitions 72-hour jam entry for Ludum Dare #23. 

Features:
* Stargates
* Randomly generated planets
* 5 different monsters

We are quite proud of what we have accomplished in such a short time, but there were a few features that couldn't make it into the game before the deadline. Most notably, an end-goal and persistent worlds. However, we do plan to continue working on this game and fleshing out all of its intended features in a post-dare version. For now, enjoy what we've completed in the past 72 hours of sleepless nights and no showers!

entries.title: Pico Planets
entries.description:
Pico Planets is a auto-orienting 2D puzzle game where you have to jump from tiny planet to tiny planet to get to your goal before your oxygen runs out. Our intrepid explorer doesn't have any thrusters, so after you leave the surface of a planet, you have no control! If you jump too far, you may escape the gravitational pull of the planets around you and drift into space forever! 

Three levels take you from learning the basics to avoiding hazard (a sun) and then finally requiring you to slingshot around the sun to get to the other side.

Programmed in Javascript

entries.title: Roller
entries.description:
Use W,A,S,and D to move.
What you do is move around and destroy other planets by hitting them, Watch out for astroids! They will decrease your size.

There is a total of 5 levels.

If you want the fixed version where lvl2 IS playable go here:http://dl.dropbox.com/u/75054274/LD23%20Fixed.zip

If not, Download from the normal link.

entries.title: Soul Searchin'
entries.description:
Soul Searchin' is a game about a man called Benjamin. Benjamin is feeling a little 'meh', so he's decided to enter his own brain in order to go soul searching. Inside he uncovers the ugly truth about his mental well being.

The game's main mechanic is that you can shrink down to 1/5th your previous size. Each next level is located in the current level at 1/5th its size, so when you shrink down you can enter the next level. Inside which you'll find another smaller level, and so on and so on.
In short you continuously enter smaller and smaller worlds :3

entries.title: SpaceToSpace
entries.description:
After fooling around with colorscales a while, I got the idea of making a space game where the R-G-B colors serve as fuel to the ship, and the player collects more color by siphoning it from asteroids. Sadly, this idea didn't get to come entirely to fruition, but this is what I've got.

Mostly done as javascript practice, so the 'game' is fairly unfinished. The level can be beat just by zooming straight ahead!

(You can press W to cheat and reset all fuel tanks. ;))

entries.title: Stuck In  the DOM world
entries.description:
Not quite a game (boo) But a very nice experience  with JQuery and the DOM world.
Next step: Complete the game, and invade random web pages.

entries.title: Super Shotgun Showdown
entries.description:
Super Shotgun Showdown
Created by Daniel Bryant in 48 Hours for Ludum Dare 23
License: GPL (Free Software)
http://twitter.com/allhaildaniel
(Requirements: Java 1.6)

*UPDATE* I've added a .bat file hopefully to fix issues with running the game.

 * Super Shotgun shooting
 * Awesome Particle Effects!
 * Wacky 8-Bit soundtrack.
 * Epic boss battle.
 * Modding support.

CONTROLS:
 * Move: Arrow Keys
 * Shoot/Action: Z or x or Left Control

DESCRIPTION
You play as a man who doesn't like the other men, so he decides to use his shotgun and steal their gold.

entries.title: TINY COMPUTER PEOPLE
entries.description:
It's a management game about tiny people inside your computer and do stuff!

It's inspired by "The Settlers" games.

entries.title: Tiny Galaxy
entries.description:
Tiny Galaxy is a platformer, where you run and jump around tiny planets in a tiny star system in a tiny galaxy in a kind of 2D Mario Galaxy style of game.

There are four levels (not including the intro stage)

Controls:
Arrow keys to move
A to jump
S spins planets faster (only used in one stage)
M mutes/unmutes the music
Escape quits

Game saves automatically whenever you beat a level.

Created in BlitzMax
Sound effects created using sfxR
Music created using pxtone

entries.title: Tiny World Adventure
entries.description:
A game done thanks to Impactjs engine and the book "Introducing HTML5 Game Development".
I have learnt a lot in just 48 hours :)

The game is a platform game in an "Tiny" world ;)

Enjoy it!

entries.title: Tiny world survival
entries.description:
This is my first full game :). 
I'm proud of the result! 
On the "second day" i was uninspired but it got better at the end. 
Next ludum dare : make a team, start with en engine or librarie!

*EDIT* Added a soundless version for Mac and linux. I'm going to debug that when I get near a Mac next week ... meh.

entries.title: TTA - Tiny Theft Auto
entries.description:
The game isn't complete, but I honestly don't have the energy to finish it. My throat and head are killing me. But, I did have a great time making it. I really wish I could finish it and add all the things I haven't yet. Such as Police and Pedestrians and music and sfx. I know its not that fun without them but I tried my best and if only I wasn't so sick. Have fun playing it, though. 

EDIT: Feeling much better today, I managed to add the little bit of code required to add working cops and pedestrians (even though they are extremely primitive and buggy). I didn't manage to add any music or sound though as I still am extremely sick and even went to the ER yesterday on account of a very high fever. I am feeling better today, my throat still hurts like a b**** though.  I didn't add any sound because that would be going out of my comfort zone unlike coding which is quite relaxing. I am keeping the original game, on here though, as it is what I managed to finish before the deadline. But, if you don't consider updating the game cheating, or simply want to play the new version, which i recommend you do as it is much better, you can. 

NOTE: The Web version is the new version, all the others are the original.

Also this game was made using Flixel and Flixel Powertools, which are both great and extremely useful.

entries.title: A Flying Shame
entries.description:
Summary:
Take control of a humble fly. Navigate through the dangers of his world. Last as long as you can!

Details:
- Control the fly with Up for up and Down for ... down (>_>)
- Avoid The various mean killy things.
- Beat your best score.

Tools:
The game was created mainly with Unity3D and RageSpline.


Also, here's a time lapse:
http://youtu.be/kig33OKe7Tc


I've been playing with it a bit after the release...
http://www.kongregate.com/games/vonsatan/a-flying-shame

entries.title: Adler's Planet
entries.description: Adler's Planet has an inferiority complex. Destroy the other planets in the solar system! 'A' and 'D' aim, 'SPACE' shoots.

entries.title: Anticolor
entries.description:
Anticolor is a puzzle game about making opposite-colored orbs work in unity. Orbs can only exist in their opposite-color space, and they leave a wake of their own color behind them that allows the passage of orbs of the opposite color. 

Created by Ty Taylor, Justin Nafziger, and Cole Wardell.

entries.title: Atominus
entries.description:
Fast-paced arcade game. Grab particles and grow your atom from "Very tiny" to "Just tiny".


CONTROLS : Hold left button to drag your Particle catcher. Release to send it back to your core.


Just in case those 2 Dropbox links aren't working, here's 2 extra mirrors :
Windows :  http://mysterarts.com/divers/atominus/Atominus.rar
Source : http://mysterarts.com/divers/atominus/AtominusSOURCE.rar

(Thanks, Mysterarts !)


Game Maker 8, FL Studio & SFXR, Adobe CS5 stuff...

Happy birthday, LD48 !

entries.title: Breakdown on a Tiny World
entries.description:
At the last minute I had to completely scrap my original idea due to time constrains but manages to get this made in under 6 hours.

The basic story is that you have crash landed on an alien planet and need to survive as long as you can.

There are some issue with this game, such as it starting off too easy and then getting too hard later on due to mobs spawning on top of you but I intend to fix all the issues and release an android version soon.

As this is the first game I have ever made I am pretty happy with myself but have also learnt lessons for what to do/not-do next time.

entries.title: Dimension Jumpers
entries.description: This was just a test for Ludum Dare. I just wanted to see if I could make some sort of game in 48 hours without external libraries and such.

entries.title: Escape from tiny world
entries.description:
This game is not exactly finished, I didn't manage to get around to making a menu or soundtrack (wouldn't know where to start on that one!) or any cut-scenes as I had planned. However the platforming actually turned out pretty well.

It's written in Love2D. (.love file only is available if you don't like running EXE files) I used aseprite to draw the graphics, LapChirp to generate the sound effects, Tiled map editor to edit the map and the AdvTileRenderer library to render them. Very impressed with these softwares.

Controls are
Left, Right = Move
Z = Jump
X = Fire

entries.title: Extraordinarily Awesome Petroleum Male Child!
entries.description:
You are the Awesome Petroleum, on the quest for the ultimate cupcake or something.


The idea for this was to have a protagonist that started out huge and replayed the same level over and over getting smaller each time, with more and more hazards appearing as it happened.

I also wanted to prove to myself that superior organization beat out superior elbow grease, so I spent several hours doing planning, UML layouts, and tasks for myself. Code-wise it worked great, I got all the engine coding beginning to finish done within about 8-10 hours. Unfortunately you can't do a major amount of planning art and design-wise, and the final level design took the brunt of the lack of time. It was initially going to be 9 levels (ended up 5) with a much more gradual curve. The game is also quite difficult which I wound have evened out a bit more if there had been more time. And hey, brutal platformers are all the rage these days.

All in all though I'm happy with the results, the controls are nice and fluid, the engine does what it's supposed to (although there are some bugs and jankiness) and I survived my first Ludum Dare.

entries.title: Fish Tank Commander
entries.description:
GUEST ACCOUNT:
 Login: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
 Password: ludumdare

Keep in mind that you will be seeing each-other's games!  Please try to avoid confusing yourselves. :)

Feel free to challenge me (quill18) -- I'll try to be as responsive as possible!


---

Fish Tank Commander is a multiplayer, turn-based tactics game set in the world's most violent aquarium.  Your goldfish and seahorses will battle your opponent's bettas and turtles for dominance of the tank!

Every win and lose is tracked and you will be ranked using Elo Ratings -- the same as professional chess players. You also earn XP for every game, which unlocks huge e-Peen!

A full map editor is built right in, and users can vote for their favorites.  Make your own maps, then own people with it!

Fish Tank Commander was programmed in Ruby on Rails and JavaScript using Sublime Text 2 and Gimp and is hosted on Heroku. Full source code is available on GitHub!

---

The entire game creation was streamed live and recorded at: http://www.twitch.tv/quill18

entries.title: For (g>v)
entries.description:
A nice little game. It's pretty short, you can beat it in about 5 minutes. It's a lot better than what I thought i'd end with, and i'm proud of it. 

Sorry for you guys who can't play it. I'm 13 and just learning how to code, this was made in Gamemaker. Im learning java, so next time I hope to submit a browser based game.

This was my 2nd Ludum Dare.

entries.title: Geo Praderia Maximus
entries.description:
This was my first ludum dare entry, EVER. And I'm very proud of what I accomplished. Although it is a tad spastic and finicky overall it is finished. 

--

KNOWN BUGS:
1) during the cut scene tabbing away from the window will crash it. 

2) sometimes instead of going to a score board after you successfully eat the sun the game will go back to the cut scene.

3) The first few spawns of planets clump together, after you eat that clump the spawns get better.

--

Story: 

you are a geo praderia maximus a rare breed of asteroid sized planet eating animals, your name rex. One day two derpanauts land on your surface their conversation goes as follows.

derpanaut 1: We've discovered a new world!
derpanaut 1: We could claim it as our own and colonize it.

derpanaut 2: We could, but it's such a tiny world(not theme or anything)

derpanaut 1: Yea, I guess your right, it is tiny.

Rex hearing this becomes fed up with being "tiny", he decides he will stop at nothing to get revenge on those humans who called him tiny. He starts by eating the derpanauts and their space ship. Then continues to eat planets smaller than him to amass size. His final plan(not well thought through is to eat the sun and become a black hole finishing off the humans! and showing them what for.

entries.title: Grow!
entries.description:
For my first Ludum Dare I created a game called "Grow!", where you have to shoot the enemies in order to get bigger. The code is with FlashPunk, and I created the sounds and background music with my Tenor Saxophone. I hope you enjoy it...
*PANDA version includes minor bug fixes and a panda as the final boss :)...

entries.title: Intersection
entries.description:
Intersection is a two-player (or one, if you're lonely) puzzle game based around the emergence of unique, tiny worlds from the intersection of large worlds.

The mechanic itself is neat, but making puzzles for it turned out to be surprisingly difficult (though interesting!), so what's here is just a basic environment that hopefully gets the point across.

entries.title: Itty Bitty Boxy Thingy
entries.description:
This is my entry for LD#23 compo.

The game is called 'Itty Bitty Boxy Thingy'. It's a Sokoban-like puzzle game in which your goal is to gather all diamonds and push blocks to reserved areas. But watch out! There are evil robots off to kill you! Just dodge them or grab a magic potion which kills every robot in the level.

The game is graphically and otherwise very tiny, so I recommend that you choose the 'stretched'-option in launch screen.

The game has 16 levels that vary a little. Some are completely based on puzzles while some are based on running from enemies.

entries.title: MacGuffin Quest!
entries.description:
A simple platforming game where your entire purpose is to find the magical MacGuffin!
Not very long or complicated, but it does have a room with some pretty hard platforming.

Game was made with Stencyl, so the "source code" is the folder that the project lives in zipped up. You can place it into the games folder accessible from the Debug menu and it should hopefully detect it after a reload and let you edit it.

entries.title: NanoTanks - A tiny programming game for a tiny world
entries.description:
Nanotank is programming game which pits your wits as a programmer against the tiny mind of the computer. Your creations (written in a tiny Scheme-like language) will battle for supremacy of the tiny world of the computer. Its a small and simple world, but the nature of the language makes it an extremely open one. 

Contains a complete custom tank-controlling progamming language, graphics and some buttons. And a disabled slider bar. Read the README for documentation and instructions.

Stuff I was happy with
----------------------
- I like the concept. It's not that original, but programming little tanks in Scheme-like is actually quite fun (for me).
- The language implementation is pretty solid. I spent way too much time on it, but it's not that horrible.
  
Stuff I would have done with more time
--------------------------------------
- A better code editor. I recommend editing the code in a better editor and using cut and paste. Also syntax highlighting would be awesome.
- More game mechanics and balance. It's very minimal as it stands.
- Sound and Music.
- Much better language documentation. I had a tutorial planned, but ran out of time.
- Better looking UI.
- Testing on Windows and Mac.

entries.title: Particulate Planet
entries.description:
Are you ready to embark on an epic sci-fi journey that will take you on an untold voyage? Are you ready to see the epic cutscene we poured a little too much time into? ;)

Then sit back and enjoy that ol' B-movie, handcrafted awesomeness!

This desperately needed a post-compo version for better gameplay and a highscore bugfix and now there is one with those things and more! :) However, we submitted in time and I think the compo is a pretty good entry overall!

P.S. I FORGOT TO MENTION it before but for the compo release, I don't recommend playing the game to completion. The completion time of five minutes was chosen in the insanity, seconds before the jam deadline, when unity was crashing left and right from the newly-added highscore. After five minutes, you just see "Good job!" This is way too long, so, in reality here's some difficulty levels for how long you need to survive the game:  (honor system :) )
Easy: 45 seconds
Medium: 60 seconds
Hard: 90 seconds
if you survive that long for the difficulty you choose (honor system), good job! :)


*STORY*
What we didn't get a chance to explain, you can try to figure out as you go :)

*HOW TO PLAY*
Once it starts, you use a 3D-targeting cursor to shoot missiles at pills that are trying to wipe you out. You can use the mouse wheel to change the depth. (See above note about not trying to play the compo release to completion)

entries.title: Pluto's Revenge
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare ended in some measure of success. I finished something but I'm not sure it's a game, so I'm calling it a narrative pinball experience. Enjoy.

Play Here: www.holdenlink.com/ludumdare23
My Website: www.holdenlink.com

entries.title: Skully's Microscopic World
entries.description:
A 2D game where you have to remove all the 'bacteria' from the area as a white blood cell named Phil

collide with bacteria to ingest them, remove all bacteria to complete the game

CONTROLS:
WASD/Arrow keys	- control Phil
P		- Pause/Unpause the game
R		- Restart the game
Esc		- Quit the game

HINTS:

- Cocci (Spherical bacteria) spawns at a slower rate than the Bacilli (Rod bacteria)
  Decide for yourself which is best to attack first

- Once there are alot of bacteria, it will be hard to keep up with their reprodcution
  rate, it is advised to try and herd them like sheep into bunches

- If a bacterium is near a cell wall it may reproduce into the wall, this child
  bacterium will spawn at a random location in the area, therefore you want to try
  to keep bacteria away from the cell walls

- Cocci reporduces in hexagonal patterns in random directions, while the Bacilli
  will reproduce in an upwards branching direction

- You're not getting any younger! As such a small organism, you have a limited life
  span, and are unable to reproduce at the rate of these dirty youngsters!

- it's also a drain on yourself to take out bacteria, so don't waste time on wild
  goose chases, quick plan of action is needed for victory!

references:

http://www.lunerouge.org - bacteria spawn noise

http://www2.research.att.com/~ttsweb/tts/demo.php - phil's amazing voice

http://www.libgosu.org/ - the amazing 2D graphics libary that greatly helped with time
			  constraints!


appologies:
If you're a microbiologist or have some sort of knowledge on the subject, you may possibly be
offended by how terribly inaccurate my game is with regards to microbiology, so sorry
if it does offend. However, ever more sinsere appologies if said game is so unenjoyable
that it offends you. This is my first shot at a game from scratch by myself with
minimal planning and experience.
If on the other hand you did somehow enjoy this game, then I'm exceptionally happy that
it was able to be enjoyable for you.

I advise you start of on easy to get a feeling for how the cells and bacterium interact and then once you have the hang of it, try the harder difficulties.

the score is based off your remaining life to the power of the difficulty. If you lower your difficulty in game this will affect your score and if you knockup your difficulty ingame, the change will be ignored (as you have a larger lifespan)
I've uploaded a screenshot of my current best, feel free to try to top it

entries.title: So Many Tiny Worlds, So Little Time
entries.description:
Our first Jam entry, and the first time using the language and engine. Great fun was had.

The game is written in JavaScript using the CraftyJS engine. To play it, you should use either Google Chrome or Chromium as those are the only browsers we tested.

To prevent silly glitches, download the archive and open the index.html locally.

Have fun, and thanks for playing :)

entries.title: Spread
entries.description:
You have to defend your tiny world!

If you want to play then you'll need the following redistributables:
Visual Studio 2010 C++: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555
DirectX June(2010): http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=8109

Controls:
Left mouse button to select
Arrow keys to move camera
Q,A to zoom

This is my first entry and I changed the game-play several times and finally came up with something to finish the game in time.
Basically, the player who has no more fields to obtain has lost.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Tiny Globsch alone against the sandstorm
entries.description:
First LD entry ever, whoohoo!
No time = No sound for poison
Also, you'll need .net framework 4 / XNA in order to run this - or to change source after your liking in order to make it run.
Sound credits go to madpew from #ludumdare at afternet, great work you did there!

entries.title: trapped.
entries.description:
trapped. is an arena-style platform game with a quasi-retro aesthetic. You are trapped in a tiny world, with its inhabitants out to get you. Survive as long as you can.

This game was created in a grand total of 11 hours. It was created in pure Java (it only uses the JLayer library for playing the mp3). See my forthcoming blog post for more information.

Use WASD to move around, and aim/fire using the mouse. Create your own levels by making a copy of the map_template.map file in the trapped/maps/ directory, and editing it with a text editor. Please see the included README file for more information.

Thanks for playing trapped. - Have fun!

--

Please note, you must have Java installed to play this game. Also, the source is included in the downloads (open the .jar file with WinRAR or similar to view).

Last-minute update: fixed some bugs with the Windows and Linux scripts, a bug in the graphics buffering (it wasn't working on some machines) and a bug where the game would launch in a tiny window (this may not actually be fixed - if it occurs, please re-launch the game again).

entries.title: Urth Defense
entries.description:
Defend your tiny world, Urth, from an onslaught of nuclear missiles. Featuring an extra small game area intended to make the game more frantic and to give a feeling of claustrophobia.

Collect power-ups to assist you in your mission. Blast those missiles out of the sky!

Controls: Arrow keys to move. Tap or hold Space to shoot. 

If you survive, your score is multiplied by the number of lives you have remaining. If you shoot down all 100 missiles and collect all 5 bonuses, you have played a perfect game and will receive the maximum score possible (1000 points). Leave your highest score in the comments. 

Good luck!

entries.title: @kanye
entries.description:
One man is about to slip into deep traumatic psychological disorder, and you'll get to watch the whole thing from inside his Twitter account!!

The game is still a WIP, but maybe playing it like this is more fun...

Game runs best in Chrome or Safari. Once you download the folder, open the file labeled 'index.html'

entries.title: AdventuresInTinyWorld
entries.description:
You are Reginald, a kitty whose lost his ball.  Brave the world of made of the letters of 'Tiny' to locate your lost ball.  Look out for other really annoying kitties who will hurt you and try to stop you from reaching your goal.

Controls: WASD/arrow keys.  Space for jump, hold for longer jump.  Down/S is 'slink' mode to make yourself smaller to move through narrower areas.

Source requries Nuclex framework and farseer physics (binaries are in the windows download).

entries.title: Battle For 35 Leukothea
entries.description:
Should work in Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux!
Mac and Linux users should install Pygame first.


I made an ASCII tower defense game, set upon a small asteroid.

An asteroid that, thanks to you, is becoming not so small.

It went well! I used Python and the Pytality console library that I made after Pyweek, which until now had not been put to the test of an LD48. And it worked really well.

The game came together much more rapidly than I'd expected, and seems pretty stable. The towers ought to be reasonably balanced between each other.

30 waves, three difficulties.

If you beat Hard difficulty, leave a comment! I'd like to know just how evil it is.

The game will try to run in either Pygame or native Windows console. If one of them fails, try the other - you can pass "pygame" or "winconsole" to it as a command-line argument to switch. 

NOTE: If the windows .exe crashes immediately on load, please try the Python source link!

Controls:
Arrow Keys: Scroll the map.
All other hotkeys are highlighted as [KEY] in-game.

entries.title: Casal Navity
entries.description:
Casal Navity is a story of a small creature who lives in somebody's nasal cavity. He faces many opponents that threaten the peace of his home.

I got the idea for this game at the Dawn of the First Day. I woke up to a nosebleed. While waiting for it to end I checked the LD theme. So I made the game take place in a tiny world, a nasal cavity.

Warning: Not for those with a weak stomach.

Controls:
Arrows - move
Space - jump

entries.title: Dr. Biology's Educational Game
entries.description:
Made in four hours, sorry for the graphics.

Click and drag to split cells.

There is a level editor! Technically done in the jam but still done in considerably less than 48 hours.

Made in FlashPunk, of course.

entries.title: Incredible Story of All Living Things
entries.description:
IT's an  MMO* made with node.js/backbone/three.js/tween.js/underscore/...

... and all the good parts of javascript.

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-23/?action=preview&uid=12078



What is it all about?

You are in charge of an evergrowing world in a universe full of evergrowing discs.
But growth comes at a terrible price.

In the advent of your great growth-inducing politics the general disc-populace grows weary of overpopulation and overproduction.
You decide to take the best way forward.
WAR.
War against the unknowingly weak non-blue discs.
Carefully you plan your next aquisitions while balancing your infrastructure spendings with your investitions in green energy and hauntingly large disc-machines of war.

 

What does work:

Support for up to 51.00000000000002 players
Planets indicate their current production capacity by growing
Planets may revolt (red tint)
Military and a good investition in green technology help to overcome riots.
Attacking
What doesn't work:

There is no chat or ranking.
You cannot transfer your all-killing-war-machines to a friendly planet
If you tab out there is a high chance your browser might die.
Simulation is a bit rough. Hadn't had time to make animations
Same for graphics.
Player starting positions can be compromised from time to time. If you can't grow your disc: reload the page
 


Thanks for your time. Have a blast!



http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-23/?action=preview&uid=12078

 

*at least in a realtivély tiny world it would be a MASSIVELY MULTIPLAYER ONLINE experience. Here it's somewhat of a medium scale multiplayer app.

entries.title: My (Tiny) World
entries.description: Here is what I managed to get out in just under 10 hours. It is not fantastic but it does show what I wanted to turn it into had I had enough time.

entries.title: Planet Protector
entries.description:
----------
|STORY|
----------
You are the last living thing on an undisclosed planet.  It is your goal to fix the damage that the asteroids do to your planet.  You must stand over the cracks the asteroids make and work until they are fixed.  If you get more than 3 cracks on your planet, the planet explodes.

----------------
|CONTROLS|
----------------
Left/Right Arrow - Move counter-clockwise and clockwise
Space Bar - Fix cracks (must stand over them)

---------
|BUGS|
---------
- Don't go counter-clockwise around the planet or you will not be able to fix cracks
- You can't stop fixing a crack and go on to another crack
- If page doesn't fit on screen, it will sometimes move
- If you are holding space when you die, it automatically starts a new game
- Doesn't load properly on some browsers

-------------------
|POST COMPO|
-------------------
The Post Compo version fixes all of the above bugs and adds a loading bar so that the game doesn't start until all of the assets are loaded.  I also added the final score into the death screen.

entries.title: Pro Stew Chugger
entries.description: It's a 2D dual-shooter with some stew laying about to drink.  There are 5 levels finished and in the game.  Each level requires a certain door-combination pattern to find the true exit.  If you get stuck long enough you get a graphical hint.  There is a pretty big bonus for finishing a level under the bonus time limit (15 seconds).  It's a compiled Windows EXE written in a bastardization of C/C++ with dangerous casts and hardcoded data all over the place.

entries.title: Puny World
entries.description:
*** Important for webplayer ***
I didn't have time to change the controls to work properly with the web-player. Works best when downloaded.

*** Story ***
As you are scouring the galaxy for cookies, you happen upon a world - which is puny. It cannot be allowed to live!

Destroy the Puny World and everything on it!

*** Readme ***
My first ever LudumDare and also first ever solo game.

I don't really feel finished, but here goes!

My greatest regret is not making more levels, and spending way too much time on assets. If I only had one more day..

Good luck everyone!

*** How to play ***
Simply unpack the .rar anywhere, and launch .exe

*** Controls ***
LeftClick = shoot
RightClick = drop asteroid
LAlt = Zoom in
Space = Zoom out
wasd/arrows = orbit

*** Credits at game end ***

entries.title: Recluse
entries.description:
UPDATES: 

May.5 - The OSX and Linux versions are back online!
Apr.23 - I fixed a bug that ocurred when people tried to resize the window.


DESCRIPTION:

This is a short metroidvania about persistence. Play as a socially withdrawn snail who never left its shell and try to find a way out of a recluse lifestyle. For an additional challenge, try to find all 3 hidden secrets!


HOW TO PLAY:

-Arrow keys to move 
-Alternatively, Z to jump instead of up arrow, in case you like the Z key as much as I do.
-Esc to close game


-----

The screen sometimes flashes in some computers, but that's not intentional, it's a result of how Java deals with the game's core mechanic.

I'd like to thank everyone from my indie group, www.catavento.art.br, for the moral support, and Helo and Saint11 for helping me hosting and uploading the game.

entries.title: Tininess Defense
entries.description:
Hi all! First Ludum Dare here! Great experience but next time I need to sleep more ><

************************************************************

Survival Platformer 2D where you try to defend the tininess of your planet destroying meteors that would make it bigger. The meteors are destroyed by running over the surface of the planet making it to spin and burning the meteors with the accelerated atmosphere.  NASA approves

Just try to destroy all meteors before they hit the planet. If a meteor hits the planet it creates a crater. Craters disappear after 10 seconds making the world to grow.

The timer shows the time since the start of the level.
The pink bar is the "love" for the planet.
Yellow bar is the energy needed to run.

Controls are [A],[D] or [<-],[->] and [_____Space_____]
Menu controls are [W],[S],[Enter],[Esc]

known bugs:
* Timer should stop when the pink bars becomes empty
* Particles move weird in the web build in fullscreen.

Notes: 
- When you die nothing happens but I made it that way. You can Esc+Restart.
- I planned to add more planets, so when you lose one, you travel to another, but I had no time to implement that :(. I will in the future.
- Sounds were made in a rush and I know some are to loud

Having problems downloading windows version? Try this http://cm7.webatu.com/Force/TininessDefense.rar

entries.title: Tiny Apocalypse
entries.description:
Save the people lost on the Tiny Meteorite before it crashes into Tiny Earth!

Arrow Keys - Movement
Spacebar - Jetpack

Remember, you can only move when flying. No walking!
Use this to your advantage!

Made with Love2D 0.7.2 - Does not work in 0.8.0 for some odd reason, sorry Mac and Linux users!

entries.title: Tiny Defenders
entries.description:
The Tiny Defenders game for Ludum Dare 23 compo.

You live on the Tiny Floating Island, but the Evil Enemies want to destroy your home! It's time to fight the evil, It's time to defend our homes!

The game itself is pretty simple, each attack wave consists of some number of enemies, you must destroy them all. But you only have one action - build Tiny Defender. Use it wisely!

Many features I planned isn't done in this game, I was busy in RL and my time is run out. Maybe  later I will finish what I begun.

I really hope you enjoy playing this tiny game! Have a great time, cy! ^_^

entries.title: Tiny Defenders
entries.description:
Fight against the hoardes of black ants to defend your colony!

Everything is mouse driven, mouse over the buttons to the right to see prices/descriptions of the units to place.

If you try to run and have missing libraries (for shame!) they're packed in folders in this zip (and actually larger than the game itself...) you can either copy them into the main directory or set your LD_LIBRARY_PATH to it when running.

Do NOT use these commands unless it does not run normally, if your system is set up properly there's the chance that running like this will not work while just simply running the game would.
for 32  bit
LD_LIBRARY_PATH="./linux-libs_x86" ./tinydefenders_linux-x86
for 64 bit
LD_LIBRARY_PATH="./linux-libs_x86-64" ./tinydefenders_linux-x86-64

There is a rare bug (no pun intended) that makes the ants not spawn, I did not have time to track it down for the compo as it rarely happens and I wanted the game more "complete" first. If this occurs simply close and restart.

Tools/Languages Used:
IDE: Code::Blocks 
Language: C++
Compiler(s): GCC & Mingw32
Libraries: TinyXML, SDL, SDL_mixer, SDL_image, SDL_ttf, OpenGL
Graphics: Gimp(backdrops), Sprite Editor (sprites)
Sound: SFXR
Music: autotracker-c, audacity,schismtracker

Per Request, Stats on the different ant types:

Defenders: (all units start at level 1, so they get the first bonus free)
Levelup cost is (level*1.5)*base cost
__Army Ant:
____Attack Delay: .55s
____Damage: 10
____Range: 32
____Damage Bonus: 7/level
____Delay Reduction: .1s/level
____Range Increase: 16/level
____Levelup Base cost: 10
__Magic Ant:
____Attack Delay: 4s
____Damage: 0
____Range: 64
____Damage Bonus: 0/level
____Delay Reduction: .2s/level
____Range Increase: 16/level
____Levelup Base cost: 15
__Brute:
____Attack Delay: 2s
____Damage: 25
____Range: 48
____Damage Bonus: 25/level
____Delay Reduction: .05s/level
____Range Increase: 16/level
____Levelup Base cost: 17

Attackers: (attacktime/damage is how quickly they damage your ant hill)
__Black Ant:
____HP: 60
____Speed: 15.0
____AttackTime: 1s
____Killpoints: 1
__Giant Ant:
____HP: 300
____Speed: 7.0
____AttackTime: 1s
____Killpoints: 2
__Scout Ant:
____HP: 15
____Speed: 30.0
____AttackTime: 2s
____Killpoints: 1

entries.title: Where Are You Teddy?
