entries.title: CAPSULE [web]
entries.description:
CAPSULE is a really weird interactive experience. While it is considered complete, it is not really much of a game, and I have no idea if anyone will like it or even get it. But, I had a heap of fun making this 'thing', and I hope you'll enjoy exploring it.

Comments are very much welcome. I live for them! I have very low expectations for this game so I can handle any criticism or negative feedback too - just leave an opinion :D

---------

Controls:

LMB - positive interaction
RMB - negative interaction

---------

Tips:

- This game is deeper than it might seem, but it is short.
- There are 4 ways to end the game.
- The most entries at game end you can get at once is 10.
- Finished? Try playing again in a different style.

---------

Find me on Twitter: http://twitter.com/TrueValhalla

entries.title: Circus Flea
entries.description:
Complete an ever-escalating array of trick challenges with your highly-trained and super tiny circus flea!

Lots of fun dialog in this one! My kids and I had a blast talking in the background. It might be unique in this compo, but with 1000 games, who can tell?

Sorry I didn't make this a full flea circus simulator like I was hoping for. But this one "sideshow" is a bit Tony Hawk Pro Skater in its move combinations. I hope you enjoy it!

I wrote this in Processing, which does not handle audio on web versions very well.  I didn't have time to solve that problem before the deadline, sorry!

Tips:
* You can safely mash the spacebar to skip the yappin', or tap once, sit back, and enjoy the 5 second interludes of comedy!
* Practice jumping into the wee lil' bucket for a while. You aren't penalized for missing tricks, just missing the bucket!
* How high have you jumped? Have you touched the light?

entries.title: Cube God
entries.description:
Greetings everybody! 

Man, this was 1 heck of joint effort to pull off within 72hrs! This was the 1st LD for the 3 of us. And I must say it was one heck of an experience! 

So without further ado. Here's our entry: Cube God!

You are a young and inexperienced god that has to use your elemental powers to construct and sculpt up the land for a race of tiny people called "Tinimen". but the thing is your powers dont always work "on cue". So they come to you randomly. And you are forced to just put things in a spot that you feel they will fit. Hence why it it is labeled a puzzle game. But with sim-like gameplay melded into it. 

Right now we didnt get to get in everything we were hoping to. But for now you can at least get a good idea of where we were going. After the compo. We will push further and get the full game completed. But for now... 

What is working: earth blocks, water blocks, and fire blocks. earth blocks turn into grass after a while, water dissipates unless completely surounded, and grass is grass. Fire does nothing except for turn all nine touching water blocks to earth

WASD and QE control camera

space and left click both place a block

Credits:
Mike Poole- Design & concept
Logan Granberry- Programming & 3D
Pat Pereria- BGM

Thank you and enjoy!

entries.title: In a Lonely Sea of Stars
entries.description:
This was my first Ludum Dare entry! I'm so proud to have gotten so far, even though it's not 100% perfect.

Anyway. I think it's pretty self-explanatory in-game (there is an included tutorial), but I'll explain here, anyway:

You're the president of a galactic harvesting company. You build harvesters on suns to harvest their energy and ship it back to earth and sell it. (Click the green button in the bottom right corner to build a harvester)

However, the space commies (you all know the USSR was evicted from earth in '94 after World War III, right?) will do anything to attack your precious, precious energy. They'll send ships to attack your transports. You need to protect them. (Click the purple button in the bottom right corner to build a turret)

CANCEL BUILDS BY PRESSING 'ESC'!

There was no time to implement an end goal or a title screen, but I think this is an excellent first shot.

KNOWN BUGS:

- Turrets place farther away from earth than where you put them.
- Game is impossible to beat if you follow the tutorial (ships come too early to build a defense turret)
- Defense turrets do not aim anywhere.

Edit: I forgot to mention that you may cancel the current selection (harvester or turret) by pressing ESC at any time. Cheers, and thanks for the feedback!

entries.title: Nano Strike
entries.description:
WE RECOMMEND YOU TO PLAY THE TUTORIAL FIRST!

It's 2045 and technologies, especially nano-technologies, has improved a lot since 2012. Today almost everything is produced via nano-technologies and the only science that still refuses to accept them is medicine.
Or, it has been so far. It's rumoured, that few young talented scientists test a nanobot based cure on people.
You are the program, that controls the nanobots. Fight with viruses and bacteries that come across you and save the body. But be careful. If you want to win, you mustn't kill your host although you have to kill some of his cells to spread.

In game, you have three resources (Carbon, Nitrogen and Oxygen) that you can gather through rebuilding cells to nanofactories. To do this, you must firstly prepare them to this with Engineer nanobot. Then you have to rebuilt nucleus of the cell to factory or to barracks with your Builder nanobot. Each enables you to get different troops.
You can also just destroy the cell with Gatherer nanobot in order to get much more resources, but for the price of losing the cell. Finally, with your Warbots, you can fight against all sorts of disease. Your Builder nanobot can also build turrets from cells to increase your tactical advantage.

Controls:
Use mouse to explore the map.
Left click selects a unit and gives orders, right click sends them to location.
Building: Select a builder, on the bottom of the screen controls show up, choose one and click it, click a cell.

For bottom buttons you can use hotkeys: a,s,d,f

Nanobots:
 - Engineer (nanobot with drill)
It prepares nucleus of a cell for nanotechnology.
 - Builder (nanobot with 2 antennas)
It transforms nucleus of a cell to buildings such as HQ or barracks. 
 - Warbot
Nanobot with powerful shields predestined to fight with diseases
 - Gatherer
It has ability to gather resources from cells.

Buildings:
 - HQ
Every nanobot unit except the Warbot can be constructed here.
 - Barracks
Warbot's construction site.
 - Turret
Strong, defensive unit


Everything else is up to you.

entries.title: SimAsteroid
entries.description:
**If you're struggling with the size of the UI and graphics, zooming in Chrome (and then possibly refreshing) will make everything larger, and still play fine.**

SimAsteroid is a management game where you extract rare earth minerals from a rock flying through space for profit.

The men and women of K421 look to you for leadership and a cool head. With a small window of time to work, you must grow your colony fast and extract as much profit as possible from the dead rock. 

SimAsteroid is the first production of Capsaicin Games, jointly @tinheadned and @tenpn. It is written in javascript and uses the CraftyJS engine.

Compatibility:

Works with latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari on Linux and OSX. Also works on iPad. Please report any problems below.

Instructions:

_There is a limited tutorial, so keep an eye on the status bar on the bottom of the page. The status bar will also warn you of any new issues or problems._

You manage your asteroid by constructing buildings and moving colonists between those buildings. Every game turn, each building consumes some resources, and then produces some. If it can't consume all necessary resources, the building does not produce anything. 

You have 600 days to produce rare earth minerals, and ship them through a freight depot for points. After that you will be out of range of the support ships, and must abandon asteroid.

The root of the resources tree are the ores you extract from the asteroid tiles. Each tile produces one type of resource. You can click the Resources button on the right to see the resources around your landing ship, or use the astoanalyser to further explore the asteroid.

A mine will extract the ore from the tile, but then it needs refining in another building before becoming really useful. Ice needs melting in an ice melter, iron converts to steel in a steel refinery, regolith becomes plastic when put through a regoplasticiser, and rare earth ore smelts into rare earth minerals.

Each building needs energy, which must be produced by solar panels. At the end of every turn, energy not used gets thrown away. The Energy Production label tells you how much excess you are wasting at the moment.

You can get more colonists by providing enough excess food and water. Food is provided by providing water to a hydroponics building. If you are running out of room for colonists, you will need to build a habitat to house the new arrivals.

**If you're struggling with the size of the UI and graphics, zooming in Chrome (and then possibly refreshing) will make everything larger, and still play fine.**

entries.title: Wild West World

entries.title: World of doors
entries.description: ofx osx.. use the arrows to move, space jumps, x attakcs

entries.title: 2 Tiny Gods
entries.description:
What if your ammunition decided it didn't like you?

What if your ammunition decided it no longer shared your beliefs and began following a different god than you?

What if your ammunition was also your power, your strength and your life?

The ancient gods are not pleased with your recent apotheosis and endeavor to bring about your Fall.  They send wave after wave of evil beings to destroy you!  But something doesn't add up.  Their attacks are coordinated, and surprisingly effective -- the ancient gods are not usually this coordinated in their efforts.  

Something is directing them.  Will you survive long enough to uncover the truth?

Tiny Gods is my interpretation of the Tiny World theme for LD48.  Tiny Gods is  a 2D "Bullet Hell" game in the style of 1995-1998 SNES games.  In Tiny Gods, you are a new demi-god, but your powers are not yet stable and are easily influenced by your followers on all the worlds you find throughout the universe.  As a demi-god you can absorb worlds to give you ammunition to defeat your foes, or you can stay close to worlds that give you power.  You must constantly balance staying in the proximity of worlds (to absorb their influence) and consuming worlds (to give you ammunition).  But don't stay too close for too long -- the attacks of your foes will damage the worlds as well, changing them into Dead Worlds where the people follow the gods of the underworld -- Pluto and Proserpine.

entries.title: Cereal Killer

Made for the 48 hour compo. Sound was created using SFXR, all sprites and backgrounds were created by me. A timelapse video may be posted soon. In the meanwhile, enjoy the game!

entries.title: Cloud Realm
entries.description:
Cloud Realm is a very small game where you play as a young boy, fighting against a huge robotic sky serpent, one which siblings have been tormenting previously peaceful areas. The game may be very hard or very easy depending on how quickly one handles the controls.

~CONTROLS~
A & D - move around
W, SPACE & Left mouse - jump when not flying
ESC - skip the first part of the game (in case you want to get to the action quickly)

Left mouse - shoot while flying
Right mouse or E - leave a bomb while hanging from a surface
Space - cling to a surface and jump off it, more about this in the in-game instructions

In the game you're controlling a glider-ish vehicle, so horizontal momentum matters a lot - you glide when your horizontal momentum is high, but start losing altitude when you slow down. However, diving a bit and then accelerating makes you gain height. This may need some trying but you have infinite retries!!

All this is also explained in the in-game instruction screen. Shouldn't be too weird.
The game should work on Wine.

entries.title: Deconstructorium
entries.description:
You are an evil scientist seeking for the world's destruction. If you get stuck you can go outside the lab to breath some fresh air and get some ideas.

The scientist can travel inside common objects molecules and extract special atoms. Combine them inside de Deconstructorium (the room to the right) in order to obtain new powers.

This is meant to be a mixed platform/puzzle game, so be patient and write down the formulas you discover for making it easier. I hope you enjoy!

-----------

Update May 2nd : I'm considering to develop a proper and more complete version of Deconstructorium. If you are interested you can follow our team development journal at http://www.deconstructeam.com/

The blog is only avalaible in spanish, but is going to get an english version soon. Sorry :P

entries.title: Michael is Myopic
entries.description:
Carmichael's guide to sensible eating:

1. Ensure food will fit in mouth.
1a. Ensure mouth does not obstruct food.
2. In case of bodily expansion, ensure there is sufficient room for expanded body.
3. Prolonged durations without eating may result in death.
4. Food that has been eaten once may not be eaten again.


How to play:

WASD / arrows move.
P pauses.

Eat:

Move over green box to eat a bite off them. 
You can only bite into sides that will fit inside the black box.  
Eating fills the black box's lower/yellow bar.
When that bar is full, the black box will expand.

Death:

If body expands into adjacent green rect, you pop.
If top/red bar empties, you starve.


Notes:

Evidently I built before saving a last-minute change I'd made to the "last" level, which fixes the borders to make the level passable. 
Unsure how this relates to the LD rules, I've left the "fixed" webplayer version at:
http://www.selenoscope.com//LudumDare/LD23/oops


Made in Unity in C#, without any Unity extensions or my own previous code.
Sound effects made with CFXR.
Menu graphics (such as they are) made with Adobe Illustrator.
Code written in Unity's included MonoDevelop as well as Sublime Text 2, despite their tendency to stab each other. 


** The source link just includes the Scripts (i.e. my code). For what it's worth, I've also zipped up the Unity project at: http://www.selenoscope.com//LudumDare/LD23/LD23_Myop_Unity.zip

entries.title: Mineral Cities
entries.description:
Mineral  Cities is a city-building, resource-management optimisation game inspired by my fond memories of SimCity sprawl, the LD48-23 theme and a game of 7 Wonders on Friday night.

Primary control is of the tiny world itself (cursors or WASD), with the number keys 1 to 4 building either grass, water, hills or cities.

When built close to each other, those features produce resource based on their dependencies (e.g. grass needs water, water hills, cities both water and grass). Each feature costs a different amount to produce.

Production slows to a total of 5 iterations, but can be restarted by building something new nearby.

-------------------------------------------------

Cities get more expensive each time you build one...

...but cities are the only way of obtaining minerals (just build a city on top of some minerals).

Over-arching progress is in accumulation of minerals. There are 50 mineral spots each time you play -- and they can be harvested by as many cities as you can get close enough (3 in most cases, 4 if you're very careful).

Because the cities get more expensive, your play tactics and overall strategy have to adapt during the course of play.

-------------------------------------------------

I'm enjoying the play curve, though looking forward to getting some feedback from others -- I've generally been using the following tactics:

- leave gaps (go in and build hills there later to restart production)
- cluster around dependencies (e.g. grass around water)
- be patient (don't restart production until it's over, as you'll waste valuable cycles)
- cities themselves can earn a lot of money, use them wisely (don't build just because you can)

Would love to hear someone prove out the math at the top end -- I've played this through on the final build to just over 20 minerals.

-------------------------------------------------

Some background on what was used:

- Unity (first project in Unity -- generally pretty happy with it)
- Propellerhead's Figure (iOS synth) + Audacity for the background music
- Cfxr + Audactiy for the sound fx
- "Cheri" font, Illustrator for instructions page
- Lots of lemsips

-------------------------------------------------

Easter egg: if you're using WASD, you can also use Q and E to "roll" the tiny world.

entries.title: Panopticon
entries.description:
A short adventure. Three different endings. Headphones preferable. To play, download the zip file and extract the contents to the desired location. Run panopticon.exe.

To the people not using Windows: You might be able to run the game from source. What is needed is Ruby 1.9.2 (the game might run in previous versions but I'm not sure) and the Gosu gem (see http://www.libgosu.org/), which is available for Mac OS X, Windows and Linux. Please tell me if it works (or if it doesn't).

Made using Ruby with Gosu and OCRA. GIMP, Paint and markers for graphics. Audacity, Bfxr and MilkyTracker for sounds and music. Contains a map editor of sorts (needs Ruby and Gosu to run) and some (poor) documentation to explain mapformat in the maps directory.

Controls:
Arrow keys for walking
Space or return to perform action (possible when indicated by questionmark above character).

The Panopticon is a type of building. See wikipedia for more info: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panopticon

WARNING: Small spoiler (hint) in comments. Don't read them before playing. Unless you want to.

entries.title: Tiny Tempers
entries.description:
Tiny Tempers is a very unpolished game about height complex's and mass genocide.

Story

Your race's home planet has become uninhabitable and your people have spread all over looking for new worlds that can sustain life. The only solar system to be found so far that is capable of this is a system of tiny planets, around a tiny sun with tiny inhabitants! These inhabitants are a bit touchy about their height, though and attack you on sight so your government has sent you to wipe them off the face of their own planets.

Controls

WASD - Move around.
Space - Jump.
E - Get in and out of your ship. (Watch out when doing this in space. The vacuum of space kills very quickly)
R - Resets you and your ship back to your re spawn point. 
Mouse 1 - Fires your lasers when in your ship.

Tinies

Tinies are the little red creatures you will be seeing inhabiting the planets you visit. If they see you they will attack you then run away. They're far too small for our weapons systems to lock on and as such, the only way to kill the little blighters is to squash them with a good solid stomp.

entries.title: Tinysasters

The tiny world is constantly damaged by natural disasters. Help restore the equilibrium by constructing a powerful shrine. 

I used :
the TweenLite library : http://www.greensock.com/
Casalib : http://casalib.org/


-------------------------
Instructions
-------------------------

M : mute
Mouse only
The goal is to build a level 4 shrine.

Collect ressources by building workplaces. The type of ressource depends on the tile the workplace is build on.
Grassland -> Food
Lake -> Water
Forest -> Woods
Mountain -> Iron

Cities produce two additionnal ressources :
Craft
Techs (level 2+ city)
A level 3 city is needed to build the level 4 shrine.

Shrines produce mana. The mana allows you to reconfigure the ground if you want. Same as before, the mana depends on the tile the shrine is build on.
Grassland -> Green mana
Lake -> Blue mana
Forest -> Brown mana
Mountain -> Grey mana

Every now and then, natural disasters happen. They reconfigure the ground and make your life harder !

entries.title: Battle For Tiny Space - Routing Edition
entries.description:
::Goal::
You select things, and attempt to guide them to their corresponding things. The small, moving things are selectable, and should be guided to their corresponding large stationary thing. Colors code where they go, as well as their shape (the ones with holes go to the ones with holes, etc.). The faster you get them there, the more points, but any thing that leaves the world, or hits a non-corresponding large thing is lost.

There are two game modes:
-Time attack mode, where you must collect as many points as possible in 2 minutes, disregarding lost things entirely
-Score attack mode, where you die when you've lost 200 things.

[NEW]
It seems the gameplay here is quite confusing, as even my brother upon vocal explanation and demonstration took two rounds to get it, so instead, I'll now go into excruciating detail. You're adviced to keep an eye on the screenshot as you read along.
In the middle of the screenshot there are two large circles (purble and red) that are filled. We call these two for "Nodes". The four large circles with dark spots 
(toruses) in the corners we call "Warps". All of these spawn, at fixed intervals, the smaller versions of each other we call "Particles". Nodes spawn paricles that correspond to warps, meaning they look the same, in the same color as the warp they correspond to. Warps spawn particles corresponding to either nodes or other waprs. Thus, something coming out of the center circles corresponds to one of the corners, but something coming out of the conrner may correspond to other corners as well as center circles.
You are in charge of uniting corresponding particles and nodes _and_ corresponding particles and warps. Any particle that appears it is your mission to get to the corresponsing Node or Warp. Keeping on top of that task is the game...

You do this task by "boxing" a set og particles (with LMB) and then routing them somewhere (with RMB). This alone will only get you so far though, as there are tricks to be employed. Once you have given a particle the order to go to it's corresponding node / warp it will speed up.

The rest of this section will describe one such trick:
The speed-up, coupled with the (Shift + RMB) "append command" functionality ( by holding down shift, and giving a series of points to visit, the particles will visit them in order all the way to the last one) allows you to group units together, string them around the world and towards one node/warp, at which point some of them will speed up, and the rest can be taken off crash course in time.
[END NEW]

::Controls::
-Left mouse button : Selects things by DRAGGING THE SELECTION BOX OVER THEM, clicking will not work!
-Right mouse buttons : Gives move-commands
-Shift : Modifies the above as such:
    LMB now extends the old selection with the new one
    RMB adds that move-command after the last previous one given to that unit (used to create zig-zag routes)
-Crtl + [0-9], Ctrl + [Num 0-9] / Ctrl + F1-F10 : Creates control group with selected things
-0-9, Num 0-9, F1-F10 : Selects the corresponding control group
-Space or P : Pauses/Unpauses the game
-Escape : Closes the game from the menu, returns to manu from ingame
The following two are bugged, and should NOT be used (or be nescessary):
-Mouse Wheel : Zoom
-Mouse Wheel pressed + drag : Moves view

Also important:
Once a thing has been routed to it's correct destination, it will become slightly darker and speed up. This is so things don't get cluttered; you can still give it new orders.

::Story::
Alas, the (back)story fits neatly to an RTS game, not so much to this. But how is it related to "Tiny world" then, you say? Well, the universe is vast, size is perspective, and we only see a few objects somewhere in space, with nothing to relate their size to. For now, let's just assume they are tiny ;)

::Comment::
See next post...

::PS::
There was a massive bug in the first version, but this has now been fixed.

::Linux Notes::
See readme included in tarball. Only 64-bit for now.

entries.title: Boxed
entries.description:
Puzzle platformer based in two boxes, and each box contains the other box.  You must use the shrines located around to alter the other box, and eventually place both boxes on the correct shrine to unite them into a full-spectrum universe!

Controls are:

WASD to move.
Ctrl to pick up.
Space to switch universes (must be near a box).

entries.title: Don't mess with magical cube
entries.description:
You are a young boy having fun to a funfair when you met a weird guys talking about a tiny cube supposed to be magical and that contains a parallel world. You made fun on him and you told that his story is stupid. For revenge, the old strange man threw you a curse and made you prisoner of the cube. It's your punishment and now you have you to pass the tests of the cube to hope to get out.

PS: It was my first LD so... not enough experiences and a bad overall organisation, only level 1 and 3 are playable... have fun anyway! : D

About my theme interpretation, i think it's: There is no tiny world. A tiny world can be huge, it's all about point of view.

Concerning the controls:

Move with arrows.
Jump with SPACE.
Action key is X.
To pass the very awful scenario text, press space :)

About the goal of the game:

It was planned to add some in game indications but i was not done always due to the lake of time. So, to end up the game (escape the cube); you need to complete the six levels (in the version i released for the compo, you can only play on level one and three). However, this is not a linear game, in each level you have what i called a "console" (a super interrupter) that needs a key to be activated, those key are hidden in levels. You start the game with the red key. To clear a level, you just need to find the "super-interrupter" and activate it.
I hope it's clearer now : D

entries.title: Ethereal Isles

The game features a really small world, so small, it can hardly hold a single factory up straight. You have too keep the production and the factory up.

enjoy!

A tiny NES puzzle game.

Html5 and JS. Using the Zepto.js library for convenience. Sound effects coded in MML (source is included). Music was created in garageband with the YMCK magical8bit plugin.

Works best in webkit desktop browsers (Chrome, Safari). Note: It takes some time to load all the sounds/music and I didn't include a loading screen so it'll just kick in when it's ready, hope it doesn't scare you when it happens.

Enjoy.

entries.title: Little Mischief Makers
entries.description:
Collect tools, dig holes, steal keys, and make a big mess before time runs out!

Ever lost your keys? You're the little creature responsible. Ever see a broken piece of furniture? You did that too. You're the reason the world is always running a little late and is always going to the hardware store.

entries.title: Merlin, Build Me a Castle
entries.description:
The sibling rivalry between King Arthur and his lesser known brother King Brothur has reached new heights as the two command Merlin to build them extravagant castles in the sky.

Of course, it's no good having a castle in the sky if your brother has one too. Assemble your castle; you then have 15 seconds to destroy as much of your opponent's castle as possible. The player with the tallest castle at the end wins. Ties go to Arthur (Player 1) because he's slightly older.

The game is two players at one keyboard. Player 1 gets WASD + space and Player 2 gets the arrow keys + enter. Clicking anywhere after the game is over restarts. Pushing the other player physically is allowed, but I'm not responsible for any injuries, broken computers or hurt feelings. 

(This combines Tiny World with Castles/Castles in the Sky/Build It, Then Use It/Limited Resources. Possible alternate title is Castles In The Sky Are Tiny Worlds Where You Build It, Then Use It With Limited Resources).

entries.title: Out for arrest
entries.description:
This is an HTML5 game made with Construct2 by http://www.scirra.com

Arrest gang members by spotting them through a satellite.
Don't arrest innocent civilians, arrest all gang members before the time runs out.

Programming, sound : Kyatric
Graphic art: PixolPalette 

---
Controls:
Use the mouse.
On the title screen, click to continue to the briefing room.

On the briefing room, click OK to go to the assignement.

In game, spot gang members in your scope and click them to make the arrest.
Beware, don't arrest civilians.

The dots around the scope turns to a more pronounced shade of red when you get closer to a gang member. 
---

entries.title: PixDodge
entries.description:
Made with Construct 2, Photoshop and sfxr.
First game I made which I considered "done".

Instructions : click and see what happens!

entries.title: PLANET CONQUERED
entries.description:
As a convicted felon you have been drafted into the PC program.  The program is set up to send those deemed "useless" to society on suicide missions to conquer alien world's to expand the Empire's territory.  The only way to redeem yourself and return to your life is the complete your mission.  Command your ship.  Complete your mission.  LEAVE NOTHING STANDING!

Control your ship with the WASD keys.
Aim with the mouse.
Left click to shoot.

Edit:
I had to take down my Windows 64-bit build in order to feature the time lapse, you can find it here still:
http://www.penguinofdoom.com/unity/LD23/PlanetConquered-64bit.zip

entries.title: Seed Star
entries.description:
Here you play as a farmer on the back of a giant space turtle, whose farm is constantly being hit my meteors.

LEFT/RIGHT moves the walrusman

UP places a shield over a farm plot, protecting it until it gets hit
DOWN plants and harvests a crop

NOTE: crops grow slower while under the protection of a shield

entries.title: Simini
entries.description:
Simini is a miniature Sim. The application window is 62x78 pixels. Control is entirely mouse-based, except for full-screening (Alt-Enter).

Left Click: Select/Place structures or view a structure's range.
Right Click: Scroll

Houses generate income based on structures within their proximity. Forests = Wood, Mountains = Stone, Skyscrapers = Money. Structures must be placed within range of roads.

Use the bulldozer to destroy structures.

This build has houses, roads, and skyscrapers you can build. Mostly just a fun, little time killer.

entries.title: stack::tracer()
entries.description:
Collect and create "functions" to make a path, destroying them to drop down to the exit();.

Each function on the stack is a "tiny world" which you create and destroy.

Controls are explained in the game, but here they are:
Arrows : Move
X : (Hold) Open inventory
X + left/right : select "function"
X + up : use the selected "function"
X + down : destroy the topmost function on the stack

Edit : I posted the game to Kongregate, so I updated the "Web" link. If you hate ads or the color red, you can also still play it here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/253784/stacktracer.html

entries.title: Sun Bringers
entries.description:
The world is full of tiny seeds, just waiting to sprout. If only the sun could reach them. With the power of solar alchemy at your disposal, you can create Sun Bringers - tiny creatures carrying the power of the sun. 

With just five levels it IS tiny, so I hope you enjoy it as long as it lasts :-)

entries.title: The Last Square
entries.description:
The Last Square is a multiplayer online game.

Note : If you are not in Europe you should expect lags, lots of them, i made a lagfree version but note that it's a post submission version so try the lagging version as well :)
LAGFREE server > http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8211966/prog/s2_LD23LF.swf

Rules :
You move the mouse over the squares to conquer them.
At the bottom of the window is the energy bar.

The red bar represents the energy max, the more dots you get the bigger is your energy max. If the bar goes over the 3 black bars you unlock 1, 2 and 3 towers.

To put a tower you need a 3x3 square and click on the center.

I'll try to host a server for the time of voting at the Web link. But you can also host a server yourself.

Line 338 > LD23.hx : Change the server ip
Line 386 > server.py : Change the server port

Note : I didn't work on lag at all, so it might feel sluggish for you (especially if you are not in Europe), i'll work on that after the votings. Also some of you have pointed that instructions are not visible enough so be sure to read the rules. It's also a part of things i won't allow me to change before the end of votings but the list at the right is actually a ranking not just a list of participants.

entries.title: The Tiny Planet Earth
entries.description:
This is the RTS-sort-of-thingy that I got done in about 35 hours. Unfortunately there is no pathfinding, and the ballance is pretty bad, but have fun anyway :-)

Click and drag to select units
Right mouse to move units
Move units close to enemies to attack. 
Units will only fire when they stand still. 
There is a unit limit of 64 per team.

entries.title: Tiny Black Hole
entries.description:
My first time entering an LD contest. yay!
Tiny Black Hole

You are a tiny black hole living in a tiny world. You hate it. You hate being the
smallest one around. Everything around you must die so that you can become the largest
black hole in the world. Start your campaign of destruction, but make sure you pick 
on the little guys who are much smaller than you. If you even get close to a square
that is larger than you, he'll ruin a bit of your consumed power.

Use the arrow keys to move around.
Press the space bar when on top of a small triangle to eat it.
Don't run into the moving squares.
Try to eat as many triangles as you can to grow huge.

entries.title: Tiny Dream
entries.description:
/Genre
Platformer/Adventure/Exploration

/Description
A short platformer in tiny dream world. The main Goal is to collect 4 keys, to open 4 doors.

/Controls
WASD or Arrows to move, "S" to pick up items and "C" to throw them away.

/Tools
Flashdevelop, Flixel, Paint.NET


If you stuck in the green world with the box - try to jump on the right side(with the guy) from the corner - to get out from the pit. To go further, you need to find an improved jump(hint - on the first world).

entries.title: A Mouse' Tiny World
entries.description:
The game did not progress as well as I hoped it would. Mostly because it was lacking the art it required. But the game was to be a simple platformer where you play as a mouse who must venture out of the only world he has ever known in order to find his father.

The game was written entirely in XNA and is for Windows only. I have no intention of winning, I just did this comp because it's been a really long time since I've built a game from start to finish.
(Note: There is a glitch in the physics, however I didn't want to concentrate on fixing it unless it became critical)

entries.title: Aegaeon
entries.description:
Earth is running out of power. Scientists have discovered a new substance called Zevatrons. One gallon of Zevatron liquid can power New york City for a year. High levels of Zevatron radiation have been detected on Saturn's smallest moon, Aegaeon.

You have been sent to Aegaeon to harvest some Zevatrons to bring back to earth and restore power.

(I didn't have enough time left to add animations or sound. Sorry about that!)

Controls:
WASD to Move
Mouse to look around
Left Click to attack (Only whilst on Aegaeon)

entries.title: Antibody
entries.description:
So much more to do with this idea than what is here. My wife did the graphics and I did the coding, it was a great time.

Using only the mouse, you control an antibody and attack different viruses. 
Left click selects your antibody. After selected, left click anywhere to move.
Right clicking deselects your current antibody.

Only a few levels here, we have more art for more types of antibodies and viruses.

entries.title: Atomsmash
entries.description:
An evil atom faction has somehow built a tiny empire out of even smaller particles. It is your duty to annihilate them for some reason.

This is a game for the Commodore 64 made using the Shoot 'em up Construction Kit. To celebrate the 10th anniversary of Ludum Dare I decided to go back to my roots and make a game for my first computer :).

It's not very finished and therefore not very good even for a SEUCK game, but here it is anyway. I hope you manage to derive some fun from it.

The disk image contains both the game executable ("Atomsmash"), and the SEUCK data files ("Atomsmash Data"). You can load it on a C64 emulator or on a real C64, like I did :).

Emulator instructions:

1. Download CCS64 from http://www.ccs64.com/
2. Run the emulator and drag the disk image into the emulator window.
3. The disk boots and loads. The screen will flash different colours until this is done. This takes a minute or so since it's emulating the original floppy drive from 1982 :).
4. While the game is loading you can configure an emulated input device. To do this:
5. Press F10 and navigate to Options > Input
6. Configure an emulated joystick on either control port one or two, it doesn't matter which (or you can configure both and play two-player).
7. Press escape until you get back to the game/loading screen.

I did want to provide an easy way to play online without an emulator but I haven't had a chance to do this due to illness. Sorry :(.

entries.title: Carbots
entries.description: A journey across your world, a bright but cold planet traversed easily in your cute car to gather your citrus friends.

entries.title: Epic Robot Battle For Territory
entries.description:
Send my little game to Ludum Dare 48, a simple flash game played with two persons in the same keyboard.

You control a giant square robot, and you have to destroy the other giant square robot, or you can hit the entire population of the another planet, and conquer more space for you.

You can attack with charges, or with itens sended by the population. Use their mortal yellow shot, or make a trap to your opponent or planet with a giant mine.

Hope you like it! Enjoy!

CONTROLS

Player 1
WASD to Move
SHIFT to shoot

Player 2
Arrow keys to move
CTRL to shoot

entries.title: Everlasting
entries.description:
There are an infinite amount of tiny worlds within our own world, and for the ones that need saving, that's what this game is about.
Play as an unlikely blue hero, saving tiny worlds forever and avoiding deadly hungry pink monsters.

Collect hundreds of coins and save 8 hearts in a row to cleanse an ailing tiny world, one biome at a time.

=====
Controls
=====
Arrow Keys or WASD to move
M to toggle music
R to reset the world
Esc to toggle pause

=====
About
=====
This is my 4th Ludum Dare entry, and I am super proud of it!

Everlasting was programmed solo in 48 hours
using C++ and SFML 1.6 in Visual C++ 2008
All music and sound was made in PXTone and sfxr and
converted using Audacity.
All art was drawn using GIMP

entries.title: Eye Quest
entries.description:
Kobiwanjamone presents ... EYE QUEST!

Gaia is sad, and needs planet souls to make happy face. Begin the Eye Quest! Explore and interact with strange tiny worlds during your Eye Quest for Gaia's happiness. Solve complex puzzles while listening to a kicking soundtrack. We hope you enjoy your Eye Quest!

Available for Windows and Mac OSX.

entries.title: Game With a Fantastic Title
entries.description:
Woah, do you like music? How about hopping around little planets to make beautiful songs? If you answered either of these questions, then this is the game for YOU.

A very simple, easy to play game I designed to make you smile! :)

entries.title: I Will Burn The Earth Down For You
entries.description:
Save your beautiful capsule partner!
Pilot a flying saucer, be an arsonist, you can do it all!

-----

Not my best Ludum Dare entry, but probably my favourite. (Made in about 4 hrs)

entries.title: Just My Immagination
KittenWorld
entries.description: This is an experiment in games based on cellular automata.

entries.title: Lonely Hated Rock
entries.description:
Controls: Arrows+ZXC

Press C to build a scaffold, and then hold c while near it to cycle through things to turn it into.
Once you build something out of it, hold c near it again to upgrade it.
Research upgrades with the headquarters
Collect the circles enemies and asteroids drop to gain resources, or press down to drill into your planet for resources. Drilling drains your planet's health.
Z "jumps" to let you get the resource orbs, and you can also use it to cut off low-flying enemies.

EDIT 1:
Added a post-compo build and a few more screens.
Changes in the POST-COMPO BUILD:
-Changed Barricades' upgrades
-Added generators, which you can build after you've made a headquarters
-Press left and right at the same time while over a building to destroy it. You'll get a few resources back.
-Gave Pirate ships a new weapon
-Changes to fighter bay and its fighters.

entries.title: My World
entries.description:
Press X to interact. No sound. It was created using the Game Maker 8.1 Lite. Sorry for the watermark.

[EDIT]
Actually, this game is not finished. Really sorry.

entries.title: On Another Scale
entries.description:
In "On Another Scale" you are occasionally huge and therefore "tiny" changes its meaning. It's a calm exploration game, where you have to find your way to the other side of a large crater. 

Created with Unity, Blender, Ableton Live, Photoshop and Illustrator.

entries.title: Pony Spacial Golf
entries.description:
To play the game is very simple: Use the spacebar. One hit to start the gauge and another to set the power then swing.

Use the planets gravity to guide your comet to the black hole.

entries.title: Predicament

Created in HTML5, audio only working in Chrome, game works in Chrome, Firefox and Safari.. crashes in Opera.

entries.title: Spermatozoon vs. Zombies (tiny world defence)
entries.description:
Hi, everyone!

I hope you will enjoy this game ))

Only the best spermatozoon is stay alive after spermatozoons marathon. Every others spermatozoons must die. But, death is just a beginning!

Best spermatozoon must protect his tiny world. He will fight against nasty undead spermatozoons!

Genere: Tower Defence

 

Gameplay: Shooting undead spermatozoons. Keep an eye on charger, weapon is automatically slowly reload. Don’t waste the bullits. Also, combo-shoots is accelerate reloading process.

entries.title: Tiny Garden
entries.description:
Miniature god sim.
Try to balance the world for as long as possible!

Playing the web version can be annoying since the game uses the right mouse button and I didn't realize that would be a problem until it was too late.

entries.title: Tiny World Defense
entries.description:
Help the Tiny Homeworld defend themselves from invading aliens! Go out and get powerups to build up their capabilities and fend off the alien hordes!

Arrow keys to move, space to shoot.

Built with FlashDevelop and Flixel, also used FlxBackdrop (http://forums.flixel.org/index.php?topic=5245.0), bfxr to generate sounds, and mtPaint to draw art.

entries.title: To What a Mountain?
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry. Made in Unity and Gimp. Quick to complete. I tried to compensate for the poor gameplay with humour.

SPACE to jump. CTRL to punch.

Edit: downloadable version 'should' work now.

And 'WARNING: there is some rudeness, yes. I apologise if it's not your cup of tea.' :)

entries.title: Virtual Immersion
entries.description:
We loved the great experience of participating to the 23rd Ludum Dare. Our team absorbed a lot of knowledge in these three days of Jamming.

The "tiny world" theme inspired us to unite the most classic platform games into one, mixing them with funny images and story.

Although our team hadn't had the best design and organization, we made a creative game with the resources we had (XNA and Photoshop), wich was really hard to accomplish, due to excessive programmers and lack of artists.

We would like to thank Ludum Dare for having organized this competition for free. Even though we had some boring discussions along the development (due to spending too many hours with too many men in the same house), it was very fun of challenging ourselves to finish a game in 72 hours.

Cheers from Brazil,

Fluence Games.

entries.title: Another Day In My Tiny World
entries.description:
You progress through time by walking to the right. As you walk in your tiny world, you will meet other characters along the way
Try interacting with them by jumping (but don't overdo it), waiting near an other character can also be considered as an interaction, some won't like if you stand too close before they know you better, so try standing a little bit farther. It all depends of their moods...

I know the game is a little bit "experimental", but I hope you'll enjoy the experience :p

Have fun !


Controls :
LEFT/RIGHT ARROWS : Move
UP ARROW : Jump
ESCAPE : Exit

entries.title: Ants and Stuff
entries.description: Missing features: SPIDERS, non-crap art, more sound.

entries.title: Brevity
entries.description:

Not really finished, but good enough! Control your tiny world of bacteria and nanobots.

entries.title: Conqueror
entries.description:
Everybody has their traumas. Some people withdraw into themselves. Some people push themselves to get better.

Some people take over the world.

This is a game of knowledge. It starts easy, then it kicks your butt. For higher levels, you will need to look this stuff up.

** UPDATE ** I've moved the game off my tiny web server onto a CDN. I hope that from this point forward, everyone gets to play.

** UPDATE 2 ** Way less frustrating post-comp version posted. You know the rules. Rate the comp version.

entries.title: Cricket in a Bottle
entries.description:
You are a Cricket trapped in Bottle.
Explore your TINY WORLD and find all the nectar.

CONTROLS:

WASD to Move
SPACE to Jump
HOLD SPACE to Jump higher

CREDITS:

-Created by Ian M Stead a.k.a. barcode in Unity 3.5
-Music by Kevin Macleod www.incompetech.com 
-Sounds from www.freesounds.org
-Uses a mix of Unity models and textures and original ones that I created.
-Some textures from www.cgtextures.net

NOTES:

This was my first Ludum Dare and game jam using Unity! I focused on art and assembling the scene and extremely simple gameplay. I am very inexperienced with scripting and and used the most basic scripts that come with Unity and tutorials to implement first person platforming and a simple collectible. There is no win or lose condition.

The web version should be compatible with all browsers and computers that can run the Unity web player.

The OSX and Windows versions are zip files with the stand-alone EXE and .App files.

The source is a Unity Package containing all assets including additional imported packages which I couldn't easily trim out. All additional packages are free and either come with Unity or can be downloaded for free on the Unity Asset Store. There are also additional sounds and textures included from incompetech.com, freesound.org and cgtextures.com.

entries.title: Fart Together
entries.description:
Presenting... Fart Together!

Players fart all over the world in this geocaching game, receiving points.

The idea was to implement badges and rewards, but there was no time for that; instead enjoy farting all over the world :)

farts are tiny in this big world :)

The game is not really finished, just the framework is there, but you can see where it is going.

All credits and stuff are given on about page http://fart-together.herokuapp.com/about

Android and Web Client are there.

entries.title: Flatlands
entries.description:
From the Readme:

Flatlands is a puzzle game with an ever changing world! You control a very tiny world (3x3 grid) and can place various tiles on any of	the 9 places available to you. But be careful! As you're placing tiles, parts of the world have a tendacy to fall off! Every 5 turns or so, select columns from 1 to all my fall of the edge from the top! To reach the win condition, you're going to have to manically modify your land fast to reach the world state you so desire! 

Built with XNA 4.0. You may need to download the Redistributable to make it run (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914) Sorry about the inconvenience.

entries.title: Free Donutia
entries.description:
"Free Donutia" is an action/rts game where you have to lead an army of very tiny soldier against the invasion of the evil race of the Tiny Aliens. Of course, they're tiny as well.

Save the donut-shaped planet Donutia by taking back all of the five cities scattered on the very limited planet's surface in large-scale (even though still tiny) battles. Lead your tiny men to victory!

I had SO much fun making this game, and I'm quite happy with the result! Hope you have fun playing it :)

Unfortunately I haven't been able to test the web version on many configurations / OS's, but thanks to the wonderful people on the irc channel i got some great feedback. Even though Chrome seems to be the best choice for running the game, it should work on other browsers as well. If the applet doesn't load, you can download the runnable jar for your OS and hopefully you'll be good to go :)

Here's the link to the time-lapse of my LD weekend:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MB06ndhPjyo

entries.title: Galactic Taxi
entries.description:
The galaxy is composed of many tiny worlds, each world are populated by humans. But their problem : with the expansion of the galactic internet, they meet friends and family members from other tiny worlds and so the need for transport between these worlds increased. This is why you've created a brand-new service : the galactic taxis. You are one of these galactic taxi-driver and you must transport people from world to world in a certain amount of time while avoiding meteorits. Also, be sure to not land to fast!

Note: the build is currently only for Linux and for distribution which have Allegro5 in their repository (which means not a lot... I can only say for the moment that ArchLinux does). I think I'll have to do a static compile... ouch.
For Windows, I don't have one right now, I'll create a build on Tuesday 24.

A video of the gameplay could be watched here : http://remeh.fr/files/galactictaxi.ogv

entries.title: Home is where the robots are.
entries.description:
It's robot mating season once again and the robots are flocking to your tiny world with your tiny house on it.  You've put your laser proof viking helm on so it's time to headbutt these jerks off your land!

Btw Space is to headbutt and the arrow keys are for movement.

Sorry for being 1h45min late, this was my first time doing something like this and I didn't know that I couldn't use file input streams in jars and i spent the last 2+ hours fixing that...

All and all a great experience, I learned a lot!

UPDATE:
I was having a lot of trouble getting my game to work as an applet over the weekend however I decided for kicks I'd try and load the page again and sure enough it worked...  I've attached a link to the web version, it will probably ask you for permissions.  

UPDATE 2:
Apparently there are some issues for Mac users.

entries.title: Immune System (virus vs. antibodies game)
entries.description:
The theme of this ludum dare event was "tiny world", so I created a game with virusses and immune globulines.

Time used: 24 - 26 hours

Frameworks used: lycheeJS (http://github.com/martensms/lycheeJS)

Sounds / Voices used: Command and Conquer Tiberium Dawn. They were made public for the huge modding community some years ago.


The concept:

You can either play the virus team or the immune system team (Main Menu > Settings!). You have two Computer players taking part in the game. One is neutral and controlled passively by the Immune System. This neutral Computer is the one that controls the leucocytes that are controlled by the interleucines (produced by the globulines) and will attack the cells that are under control by the virus team. The viruses spawn rate is higher than the spawn rate of the immune system, but virusses are stronger than globulines.

The immune system player is the one that is defensive, but he can also attack with "Blitzkrieg" strategy and making the virus team busy whilst using his leucocytes bonus.

The virus player is the one that is aggressive, he is the one that has to infect as much cells as possible. The more time he has, the stronger he gets and the harder it is for the counterpart to eliminate the virus player.


TL;DR

Have a look at the settings, where you can set which team you want to play. Also, there is a PRO Mode for guys that enjoyed games like "I wanna be the guy" or SuperMeatBoy in the past :) You have to be really good and fast to have a chance against the computer counterpart. It automatically turns the tutorial at the beginning of.

The one that infects all cells has won. You've got to catch them all :)


POST-MORTEM-WORK:

Well, I did a lot of refactoring the code meanwhile. The path algorithm behind is now much smarter and caches commonly used paths. Also, the clustering is now a self-generated cluster. There is no hitmap or collision model used by the path algorithm, I'm using an own path system here - because I think A-Star and common hitmaps are the false way to go. Meaning there are no manually set paths, everything generated by shapes. Play the roundabout skirmish map to see what's up :)

The AI / COM is also very smart. Now being able to be set to different modes (aggressive, defensive, passive) and with different strengths.

Also, I decided to move the levels to a campaign-style game. For now, only the Immune system's campaign is working - due to undone refactoring of code :)

Take a look at the post-mortem game (requires a Web Console! Firefox + Firebug or Chrome or IE with F12 (DevTools)):

http://martens.ms/lycheeJS/demo/game/immune/

entries.title: Little Locations
entries.description:
Travel through four tiny worlds. Collect spheres for bonus points. Try to reach the door at the end of each world.

Use the arrow keys. Press 0 (zero) to mute.

entries.title: Moonmen: Journey to the Giant World
entries.description: A simple, easy platformer with a fairy tale-ish plot.  Version 1.1 should fix the falling off screen bugs.  Remember to read "how to play" since I'm way too lazy to just write the controls here!  I've tried making a version that I think would be mac compatible, but the build experienced so many inexplicable bugs that I don't think I'll have anything for mac users in the near future.

entries.title: Nature Wisp
entries.description:
You are the Nature Wisp. Use your supernatural green thumb abilities to heal the plants and the clouds by removing the harmful red substances.

Controls: Simply press the arrow keys to move, and press 'Z' to look at the goals.

Made in JavaScript. It's a game that requires both speed and patience.
Personal Challenge Suggestion: Complete the levels as fast as you can! :P

entries.title: Our Small World
entries.description:
Mouse only.

Objective: 65000 current wisdom (roughly - it's the sum of all possible upgrades + 10%).

Buildings are categorised by their wisdom output, from School (highest) to Farm (lowest).

Bless/punish: randomly, buildings are struck with either good luck (green event text in the tooltip) or catastrophe (red event text). You may choose to reverse the effect by punishing (to counter good) or blessing (countering bad) the structure. Blessings will give you a short-term boost in wisdom income, but a long-term *loss* in wisdom income (translated as "people are inspired by their god's actions, but grow quick to expect it all too often"). Punish should not be used (it destroys output both during and after because of feature-creep in dev time).

Upgrading: you can only upgrade one building in a category at any one time, but several categories may be upgraded simultaneously. For example, you may not upgrade two schools, but you may upgrade a castle and a school. All remaining buildings in the same category are upgraded (the new knowledge spreads) once the first completes. ** Upgrade speed is determined by the building's wisdom output. **

New buildings are created as existing buildings of the same category reach a certain stage of maturity (hidden value). This process is automatic.

Technical note: if I recall (it's 3.30 in the morning, bear with me), you need at least Flash 10.2 to run the game - I don't think I bumped it to 11.2 just because I "could".

Hotfix version uploaded and github pushed (so you can verify the minimal change yourself if desired). Again, the original is still up in case you're a stickler for "what was submitted at deadline is what is judged". Thank you.

entries.title: Perspectives
entries.description:
Hi, I'm Simon and this is my first LD.

I decided to try and make a game about the different perspectives that one can have about a certain place.
The player is led to discover the world thanks to friendly NPCs and the higher she gets the greater she can see the world as it is.
In spite of the bugs and the lack of polish I hope that you'll still enjoy the game !

Controls: Arrows to move and jump.
Tools: Komodo Edit (IDE), my own javascript engine (http://www.assembla.com/code/fm-javascript-framework/subversion/nodes), Inkscape, GraphicsGale, and Otomata (http://www.earslap.com/projectslab/otomata).

EDIT: I forgot to say that I have tested the game only on Firefox and Chrome although my framework is supposed to work on Opera and Safari too.

entries.title: Rotten World
entries.description:
A sort of Action Puzzler, you need to eat all the world around you. Trap the monsters without be hurt. Be careful you can fall down.

10 levels.

Try to complete them!!! Hard times.

Enhanced Version :

V 0.2 :
      -3 lifes per level.
      -save progress.

entries.title: Save the tiny world!
entries.description:
First of all sorry for any grammatical/spelling error, I'm spanish :)

I'm pretty happy with the result, finally my main focus was the art...never expect that haha It's the second game I finished, and I've just started learning programming 5 months ago! so everything went so well using the things I learned on that time!

It was my first LD and it was amazing, sometimes I tought about surrender, but finally I managed to came up with something playable :D I will be in the next LD FOR SURE!




The gameplay and the controls are explained in the game, so you just have to follow the instructions :D



Known bugs: 

-The Pigz and the Npcs don't collide with each other..so they are collapsing all the time...

-The animation of the boy and the woman sometimes don't correspond to the direction the are walking to...

-The animation of the Pigz works so bad, dunno why!



Tools used:

Please, rate and comment :)

entries.title: These are your Friends
entries.description:
No man is an island; but get a load of this lady.

The picking up the boat thing is a glitch its a remnant of when i was going a different direction with the game and forgot to comment it out.

entries.title: Tiny Apocalypse
entries.description: The world is collapsing? It's getting TINY? Run, quickly, and save yourself before it is too late!

entries.title: Tiny Ranger
entries.description:
-Story:

In the dark borders of the galaxy, where no stars shine, life thrives in dark colonies.
Tiny Ranger is the only defense force in these lonely little planets, where plants generate their own light.
The evil Photon Suckers roam from planet to planet, vanishing all life traces.
Nothing can stop them, but you can delay their attack long enough to allow some planets to survive and avoid total extinction of the glowing species.

-Controls:

Move left = Left arrow
Move right = Right arrow
Shoot = Space bar, Up arrow

-Comments:

Monkey Armada team is glad to present Tiny Ranger as a concept with a lot of potential.
I'ts been a wonderful time developing this game and we have learn a lot, and we know we'll learn from the post mortem for sure.
We would have liked to dedicate a few more hours to the project, but our time is limited and so is the dare's. But that's the beauty of the experience.

-Credits:

	Jaume Mayor - Coder / Game design
	Jordi Garcia - Lead Artist / Game design
	Fran Lloret - Artist

	Marta, Adriana, Pepa - Human Supporters
	Maki, Mitsu, Bruce, Pichi - Non-Human Supporters

entries.title: TMORPG
entries.description:
woooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!

It's a Tiny multiplayer online role playing game.

There are two major bugs at present:

1. Sometimes the first time you connect, the game doesn't set your name properly and you end up with a blank name.

2. Losing your connection = death, the game does nothing to try to re-establish a connection to a client it's lost.

Do not attempt to play in IE. Works best in Chrome - sort of (fastest in Chrome anyway). There are a few bugs I'm working out at the moment.

Lots of stuff didn't make it into the game, I'll be writing up a post-mortem later on and linking it here. I may even do a post-compo version.

Enjoy :)

entries.title: Zombie Arena TinyWorld
entries.description:
There is a little history.txt file, that i appreciate if you read.

First time using dropbox (just installed), hope no problem for you to download it. either way, you can download it from github (along with all code) here https://github.com/Shephiroth/LD23-TinyWorld

Before i forgot, if dropbox fail and you go to github, no need to compile anything. Just use the appletloader.html on the root folder :)

WARNING!!!! Due technical error, you can only upgrade while on selecting level. While you are fighting zombies cant use shop. SORRY
Since im updating my game for myself, i have created a second branch on github. I created a special .jar release that fixed shops and lowered music to 10%. Just change .jar for the original the rest remain, no new content or graphics are added.

entries.title: A Week in the life of...
entries.description:
"It started a few years ago. A lot of people cite reasons for their fear of the outdoors. The sky is too high, they say, they might fall in. There are too many scary people out there who want to hurt them. My condition is not based in any such fears. I simply preferred the indoors, and had no reason to go outdoors. It got to the point that everything I needed was in my home. Some call me a freak. But I don't need to go outside. Perhaps I could if i wanted to, perhaps I'd break down - either way, it doesn't matter. My home is my world. My own, personal, clean, orderly, perfect tiny world."

The first game I have EVER made, completed within 72 hours with a great group of friends, the ENTIRE game was made from scratch, story, php events story system, graphics, music and more! Coded in PHP, CSS and HTML. We hope you enjoy the story of Eve and her tiny world!

entries.title: ANT SURF HERO: THE SURFENING
entries.description:
A platforming shooter game where you surf on ants and must kill the evil Dr. Electrostorm.

Controls:
* Left/Right to move
* S/Space to shoot
* D/CTRL/Up to jump

Created using Multimedia Fusion 2, Labchirp, FL Studio and Photoshop.

Game, source and assets released under Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0) 

* May contain kittens

http://Jigxor.com
Twitter: @JigxorAndy
By Andrew Sum (AKA JigxorAndy/Assault Andy).


Post your high score! Have fun! :)

entries.title: Collect ALL the resources
entries.description:
If you are looking for a game with a real game play this "game" doesn't have it. Right now it's more like a game engine I can build my future game on it, and that's what I'm aiming to do after ludum dare (strategy game perhaps).

So what you can do right now is playing some fixed map and gather enough resources to build the TOWER (my personal challenge to you, it costs 10000 material each). Right click to build facility. Each facility produce something depending on the amount of workers, houses produce more workers (if you know what I mean ;) ).

The rest I'm leaving to you to find by yourself :)

NOTICE: there are problems with loading (on OS X especially) and I don't know why, sorry.

entries.title: Downsize the World!
entries.description:
Economy is getting worse and worse, not even the gods of ...whatever are able to go about their business without cutting costs.  That includes the world.  It's time to Downsize.

Made with Flashpunk, MS Paint and Guitar Pro.

Check the cheat sheet for some info and read the first screen.  It's a rough prototype.  Sorry.  I had to roll a Demon Hunter.

entries.title: Friends and Foes
entries.description:
Whoo!  A bit more polished than my last successful entry, but it's still really buggy.  You may get a few false deaths here and there (and the end-game trigger doesn't work, so you'll die when you reach the end of the level- you'll know it when you see it).

Anyway, the game itself:

You play a little bird who has just horribly misinterpreted a metaphor made by his mother ("You're not a tiny world, son.  Not everything revolves around you"), and has now set off in search of proof that things DO indeed revolve around him.  He succeeds- sort of.

That story would make a LOT more sense if I had time to do an opening cutscene.

But yeah.  Fly around, climb walls, don't die.  Y'know, platformer stuff.  Read the instructions for more on that.

entries.title: Full Circuit
entries.description: Any highly civilized planet has all sorts of circuitry running through its body, providing energy to the whole entire population.  But what happens if this circuitry is tampered with by means of nature? That is why Less Patters travels the universe as a planetary repair man, using his skills to restore electricity to those civilizations whose source of energy has been ravaged by subterranean forces. Join Less as he ventures out to the galaxy Messier 81 for another day's worth of work...

entries.title: IÄTI
entries.description:
^Thats an A-umlaut in the title.

What a blast it was making this.

Since the game itself is a bit cryptic about itself I'll describe the main mechanics here:

1. By pressing space you release eggs from the bird.

2. These eggs are blue,green,brown and gold and will produce water,grass,dirt and humans.

3. You can then further drop eggs on these to create new stuff, such as a tent is created by dropping grass on a human.

4. A tent can then be used to score by raising it up via dropping grass on it.

5. Evil ghosts will kill the humans and the tent, but can be disposed with eggs.

6. The game can end in 2 ways: you can run out of eggs or one of the ground blocks touches the bird.

There is no game over screen, so whatever score you have when the bird dies or you run out of eggs is your final score :)

The game uses the brilliant html5 engine Impact
http://impactjs.com

The music and (shockingly beautiful) art were all made by me. The game and story are loosely based on finnish folklore creation myth and Kalevala.

Despite some bugs I am very happy with what I got together.
I hope you enjoy the game.

entries.title: Lost Oxide
entries.description:
Note: Runs best with Chrome!

This is my entry for Ludum Dare 23. The game was made in roughly 20 hours of work.

- Whats it all about?
--- You control a surrealistic character which resides inside a blood cell
--- Within each blood cell of our body, there is a tiny litte world
--- These worlds vary in size (different levels)
--- Blood cells real function is to deliver oxygen around the body. So..
--- The character in the game's function is to gather the oxygen bubbles within a blood cell, so that the blood cell can successfully do its job.

- How do i play?!
--- Use the arrow buttons to navigate. While next to a wall, press left/right to jump off the wall. Hold the arrow down key to slide fast down the walls!



The game was obviously rushed, thus some introductional features didnt make it in. Additional levels, mechanics, polish and some time pressure was planned but didnt make it in. The music and the menu were created within the last hour, which is fairly reflected in the demo!

Tools used: Aviary for music, Photoshop for art, and the Construct 2 engine for everything else.

Hope you enjoy it!



- Read more here:
--- http://sidetrackgames.wordpress.com/2012/04/23/ludum-dare-23-participation/

- See my post-mortem post here:
--- http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/24/lost-oxide-post-mortem/

- Try the tool i used to make my entry for free here:
--- http://www.scirra.com/?a=1k2

links.label: Source removed, contact me for more info.

entries.title: MediBot
Merl's Hicventures
entries.description:
Developed by:
   Jase Deacon (programming, art)
   Scott Drew (programming, art)
   Jamey Kennedy (sound)

You play as Merl, a drunken redneck. The image we had for him was to be an angry drunk that wanders through his tiny world (business district and trailer park) to eventually find out that it wasnt so small after all.

We had imagined using beer for health; he would drink one to refresh himself, and also beer for ammo; he would throw projectile beer at enemies.

Some of the enemies we had planned on really pushed some stereotypes. We had condescending monocle-clad businessmen, hurried white collar workers eager to push him out of the way as the bustle to and from their apparently stressful jobs, hoards of children that cried "daddy" as he tried to evade them in the trailer park, his super-butch bearded wife who wields babies by their umbilical cords, a half dozen girlfriends who are angry at him because he never calls, a half dozen boyfriends who are angry at him because of the way he is with their girlfriends.

What we ended up with was a lovely tiny world that we call the "Hub World", its round, you can walk all the way around its circumference. This world acts as a hub for all the other worlds and shops we had initially planned.

We got basic gameplay in, with no real goal in the end. We had planned boss fights and pickups, collectibles.

Have fun!

entries.title: Neurochemicals

This game is about a small planet. Population of this planet is dying, because there is something wrong with their water supplies. You must go underground and investigate what's going on. Your goal is to save entire planet!

entries.title: Tiny World '82
entries.description:
This is VERY incomplete.  It's not even a game yet. Various things conspired against me, preventing me from getting a proper game even reasonably fleshed out.  Instead, I have this.  It's just the beginnings of an old-school game.  Old enough school, in fact, that it requires an emulator (like MAME) to run.  It is a romset for "mspacmab" (bootleg ms pac-man) arcade hardware.  (Z80 using my z80 game kernel, available on google code)

About all you can do is drop a coin, hit start, and move the red duck dragon around the planet.   I have a lot of a game designed, and will probably flesh it out over the coming weeks, but until then, here ya go.

Download the MAME zip, rename it "mspacmab.zip" drop it in your MAME ROMS folder, then select that romset when you run MAME. 

To play in google chrome: 
1. download the link labelled 'mspacmab' above 
2. rename the "TinyWorld82_002_mspacmab.zip" file as "mspacmab.zip" 
3. install the Robby Roto MAME port in chrome: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/kcfbijoldkenmemnbbkjnpdhnijgahck?hl=en-US
4. run it 
5. select the link at the bottom: "Click here to run MAME with your own ROMs" 
6. find the "mspacmab.zip" file 
7. press 'start game'

arrows - move player

entries.title: Dead Run
entries.description:
You are one of the final survivors of a rather pixelated zombie apocalypse. Unfortunately, you are the only survivor who knows how to handle a gun. Defend the  final settlement of mankind against a horde of zombies in a Fallout-inspired world! Upgrade your weapons and armor! Kill as many zombies as you can!

INSTRUCTIONS:

-Press Escape to pause

entries.title: Desire
entries.description:
"This land is too small and we desire so much. Help us fulfill our desires at the island of Desire"

Desire is a citizen placement game where you try to fulfill everyone's desires as best as you can on a tiny, yet bigger than where they started, island. There are different kinds of desires.

Important: If you manage to play through until the end, your score will say 0 until you place the final citizen. If you click on the raft instead of the citizen the game will restart.

entries.title: Fooling Yourself in Moderation
entries.description: Drop boxes to protect yourself.  The more you drop, the smaller your world gets.

entries.title: Joe The Alien
entries.description:
This is my first entry for a Ludum Dare competition! I hope you enjoy it.

"Joe The Alien" is a 2.5D platformer in cartoon style. I'm not the best graphics guy but I did my best.

The game has also a little story about Joe and his unnamed friend. Their UFO broke and the had to make an emergency landing onto the earth!

Making this game took about twenty hours. I used GLBasic because it's a wonderful language for rapid game prototyping and has a powerful 2D and 3D engine included.

For 3D modelling and texturing I use Milkshape 3D. For 2D graphics I mainly used Paint.NET but also a little bit of Adobe Photoshop (the titlescreen for example). For sound I used sfxr and for music... wait there is no music at all... I can't make music :(. For planning I used a piece of paper and a pen (what a surprise!).

Development was stright forward. There was only one badass bug which didn't want to get fixed (took around 4 hours :(...) Now I hope the game is bugfree, but I don't think so.

entries.title: My Little Dungeon
entries.description:
My Little Dungeon is an indirect RPG. In this game you don't control the hero directly but rather build a dungeon for him to go through. Ultimately you want him to gain enough strength to enter the "Tiny World" and solve its mysteries.. Though you have to be careful, if you push him too much you'll kill  your hero!

Have a quick read through the instructions but most of it should be self-explanatory. The game can be beat! You might have to try a few different strategies though.

The download is an executable JAR. In Windows just double click the file. On Mac/Linux should be able to run it with: "java -jar MyLittleDungeon.jar". Make sure you have JAVA installed! Any problems let us know. And yes, you have to restart the app if you die. Sorry :( 

Web version should run in any modern web browser that supports WebGl.

Controls
********
Left Mouse: Place rooms
Right Mouse (Web: S): Switch room type
Mouse Wheel (Web: A&D): Change room size
Enter/Space: Go down one level

Rooms
*****
Stone Room: Easy enemies, low loot drop
Red Sandstone Room: Harder enemies, better loot drop
Cave: Gives your hero a break and regenerates hp + fatigue

Attributes
**********
HP: Your hero's health
Fatigue/Food: Keep this high or the hero will die
Shield/Attack: Explains itself
XP: Current xp
LVL: Current lvl
Gold: How much Gold you have left. You'll need gold to build rooms!

********

This game was developed by Stefan Bachmann, Simon Bachmann and Gavin Harrison in less than 72hrs. We hope you enjoy the game!

entries.title: One Room War

entries.title: Professor Squeaks: The Circuitous Escape!
entries.description:
Escape from the laboratory!

You'll have to dodge obstacles, collect circuit elements, and repair circuits if you are to escape with your life!

Find out which kinds of circuit elements go which slots on the circuit board and use that knowledge to solve the more chalenging circuits. If you complete a valid but incorrect circuit, a graph will appear on the top-left of the screen to help you.

While Escaping:
Use A and D to move left and right
Use W to jump
Use E to use door access panels

While Completing a Circuit:
Use A and D to change selection spot on the circuit board
Use W and S to select a circuit element
Press E to attach a circuit element to the circuit board
Press Q to return to Escape Mode


Press M to mute.

Additional Info:
The Crashless-Web version has the 2nd crash (see below) fixed.
This required some modification to the collision detection code. 
Nothing but the code detecting collisions between the player and non-interactive environment was changed as I wanted to keep the game as close to the original as possible. There are still plenty of not-so-lovely (but not game breaking) collision bugs in this version.

If you wish to play the original (with only the 1st crash fixed) select the Original-Web link.


Fixed game-breaking bugs since release:
1. When near an item, the collision detection could sometimes fill the player's available item slots with 1 circuit element type, causing the player to no longer be able to progress through the level.
2. The collision detection could mess up causing the player to fall off the map and the game to crash.

entries.title: Pale Blue Dot

entries.title: Shipwrecked

IMPORTANT: play-through available: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/04/27/how2play-shipwrecked/

A ship crashes on an unknow land. Capitan is the only survivor. Help him escape from there! Kitten and ROUS (rodent of unusual size) includen!

Mouse to interact, WASD/Arrow keys to scroll.

I couldn't upload an .html file to Dropbox so the game is .swf and larger than supposed.

Source code is available via right-click in-game. If you need it, of course.

Tips if you don't get how to play:
1.See stats. There is "Tools level" stat. It's in top 1 not understood things. You need 1 to chop, 2 to dig, 3 to build, 4 to win. There is also "Material". When you have enough material tools will be crafted automatically (same as leveling). There is 1 material type. And you don't need material to build.

2.You can only interact with tile you stand on. Otherwise you can only move.

3.A shelter, you say? If you don't know why do you need it, don't build it.

And... press "?" often. At least once for each tile. Just when you start.

[b]It seems many of you don't press "?". Why did I make it???[/b]

entries.title: Sirus the Virus
entries.description:
Sirus the Virus

Your name's Sirus and you're a virus. You prey on unsuspecting humans, jumping, and replicating your way through their body, up to their brain. Once there the human realizes you're no ordinary virus...

Move with left/right arrow keys, or A/D keys.
Jump with Up, X, or W.
Collect the red blood cells to replicate. Clones of yourself can jump in mid-air while spawning!
If you get stuck restart with the R button. There is a small camera bug that I did not have time to fix.

Reach the human's brain to infect him!

Oh by the way, the names of the planets all stand for 'tiny' but just in another language. Small detail ;P

Enjoy!
