entries.title: Wulcan
entries.description:
!! PLEASE READ, THERE ARE NO DIRECTION IN GAME !!


Wulcan
--------

(pronounced Vulcan)

DON'T STOP MOVING. Fly through an interstellar grand canyon as the walls slowly
close in on you. Destroy wave after wave of enemies trying to get you. Dual
weapon gameplay, one for killing and another for pushing the walls back.


How To Play
-------------

From the title screen press ENTER to begin the game.

During the game you control your ship with the arrow keys.

As time goes on, enemies will fly at you and the walls will slowly close in.
You have two guns to deal with both of these problems:

Pressing (or holding) X will shoot the Alpha gun, a blue bolt that will kill
enemies. Kill enemies to earn points.

Holding C will charge and shoot your Beta gun. A pink bolt that pushes the
walls back when it hits an enemy.

The bar at the top is your health. It goes down when you take damage. The game
is over when your health goes to 0 or the walls crush you

Tips
------

Some enemies have a chance to drop powerups. The red powerup will restore some
of your health. The blue powerup will improve both of your guns.

Try to get the blue powerups whenever possible, this will improve your Beta gun
so you can push the walls back when they start to close in really fast.

About
-------

Made in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 23
Leaf "leafo" Corcoran 2012 <http://leafo.net>

Must be run with Love 0.8.0 if using the `.love` file.

Powered by:

 * <https://love2d.org/>
 * <http://moonscript.org/>

entries.title: It's a Tiny Life...
entries.description:
I'm very bad in drawings & it's my first Ludum Dare, so... But I hope you enjoy all the easter-eggs & this fun story. 

Also, sorry for some conversations in English. I'm french and my English Teacher was very ugly, so... ;)

It's a Point & Click adventure, created with Adventure Game Studio. Duration ? Four minutes maximum. 

Mouse : left button to click, right button to choose your action

Enjoy !

entries.title: love in the time of fishbowls

entries.title: March of the Ladybirds
entries.description:
So, this is my first Ludum Dare entry (and also first time using Flixel, which has saved me shedloads of time). Woo!

It's a small homage to Lemmings/Troddlers, but with ladybirds (which don't get enough gaming prominence nowadays).

I don't think any of the levels are too tough, although I mostly reverse engineered them from "wouldn't it be cool if..." scenarios so let me know how you get on. 

It was starting to get a little close to the deadline so I've not had a chance to add sound. Also, apologies for the lack of a proper ending.

Instructions are on the HTML page accompanying the game

Enjoy

entries.title: My Little Friends
entries.description:
My Little Friends is the story of a Big Robot in a tiny world. Protect your little friends from the bad things that come from the sky.

entries.title: Nexus Rails
entries.description:
Created by Bill Crane and Mike DeRoy

Made using OpenGL. Nexus Rails is a game in which you hop from rail to rail in order to get to the end of the level. 

Controls:
Press a key to jump to an adjacent rail.
If you hit the end of a rail, it will slow you down and move you back.
Try to get to the end with the highest score possible.

Tiny World Adventure is the result of my 48 hours effort. I spent first 36 hours to implement Virtual Machine with simple TXT and GFX editor (I recorded more than 16GB of screen video during this time). entries.title: Tinyvilization

entries.title: Watercolour
entries.description: The world is not tiny but the time you have left in it is.

entries.title: 6 Degrees of Sabotage
entries.description:
---------------------------------------
6 Degrees of Sabotage
---------------------------------------
One hour ago, a bomb exploded at the mayor's rally.

We have gathered intelligence that implicates the Clockmaker as the mastermind behind the attack. However, the Gambler was seen placing the bomb at the rally. We believe the Clockmaker does not personally know the Gambler.

There is a network of saboteurs disguised among groups of innocent citizens. Bomb instructions were passed between multiple pairs of saboteur acquaintances.

Review the security tapes from today to track the note and uncover the saboteurs.
---------------------------------------

This game is based on the concept of six degrees of separation, also known as a small-world network. I wanted to show how short connections between acquaintances can lead to long chains. Making a large world much smaller.

Actually what I really wanted to show was the completely different and totally bitchin concept I worked out for Alchemy. Oh well. Hopefully this hits the Tiny World theme well enough. Enjoy.

---------------------------------------
UPDATE
---------------------------------------
The fixed version has the following changes:
- Fixes the end-game success/fail check to actually work properly. (Pro-tip: "for each" on a string doesn't iterate through its characters in AS3)
- Reduces the swf height a bit to fit better on smaller screens
- Fixes a typo: ELMINATED -> ELIMINATED

entries.title: Ant-hill escape thingy
entries.description:
Made using a slightly changed version of löve 0.8.0 found here: bitbucket.org/teomat/love (slight changes to the physics module)

Windows version should work as is.
For the linux version (only 64 bit version available, sorry):
Installing the package found on the official löve website (love2d.org) should install all dependencies needed to run.
No mac version because I couldn't compile it.

Warning:
The animations are crappy, the sprites unfinished, there are no sounds and no music and the hitboxes are sometimes wonky.
Oh, and there is barely two levels worth of content.

Overall kinda crap, but at least I got something done... :<

entries.title: Dino Wrangler
entries.description:
REGARDING MUSIC:  When I entered this, the game had music, and the music was REALLY good.  I didn't produce it.  I had tried but failed misserably so threw in a mod file out of frustration without thinking about the fact that I DIDN'T produce it.  I HAVE SINCE REMOVED MUSIC BECAUSE OF THIS.  I don't feel that the skewed ratings will matter so that is why the game is still up.  If it happens that this game does well, I am asking now to be removed from the top list because I did not get there on equal grounds as everyone else who entered.

Wrangle all the Dinosaurs!

The extinction of the Dinosaurs millions of years ago was inevitable until you, Alec, discovered efficient time travel.  Now you must wrangle them all out of harms way!

Because Dinosaurs!!!1!!111

GamePlay:

RESTART A LEVEL any time by pressing R.  Handy when you launch a dinosaur way off screen :)

You must move all the dinosaurs to the labeled planet.  The level ends when you have landed on the labeled planet with all of the dinosaurs on it.

Escape to return to main menu.
R to restart he level.
WASD/Arrow Keys
Space or Control Jump.
Shift launches the dinosaurs.

There is no 'end' screen.  It just plays the last level over and over...  Time is a pain.  Should be mostly bug free :D

entries.title: Farming Simulator
entries.description:
Got pretty far, but decided against finishing up for various reasons. The main thing that's missing is more crops (and maybe seasons).

I was going to try to fit it into the theme, but like I said, I decided not to completely finish. :P

I probably didn't even spent a little less than 10 hours on the game, because I was out of town.

Controls:
Mouse wheel or Up/Down arrows change the selected tool.
Left clicking uses the current tool, right clicking sells plants (if they are grown).
O decreases the time rate, P increases it. L sets it to the default.

It really isn't that accurate. It's just a quick clone off of Harvest Moon (minus characters... and everything else).

"Jack" is a short platform game based (very loosely) on the English folk tales of Jack the Giant Killer. It was made with Flixel in FlashDevelop, with the help of GIMP, bfxr and FL Studio with Kontakt. Enjoy!

entries.title: Mage Duel
entries.description:
For centuries when mages would disagree, they would spend hours in boring and pointless debates that would last for sometimes years.  To counteract this, they developed the "Trial Plane", a tiny world existing solely for the resolution of these conflicts.

The game is basically an artillery game.  (You know, like Scorched Earth, or the game with the gorillas and bananas.)  Two twists, its in real time and it uses your previous play throughs as opponents.

IMPORTANT NOTE #1 - The game uses your previous play throughs as your opponents.  Therefore, you must play the game at least 2 times (The first time is against a dummy) to get the other mage firing back.  

IMPORTANT NOTE #2 - The game is in XNA 4.0.  If YOU DO NOT have XNA, you will need to use the install package or download XNA from the links below. If you ALREADY  HAVE Xna installed on your machine, you can download the "RAW" link.  

Up Arrow, Down Arrow, W, S - Change Power
Left Arrow, Right Arrow, D, A - Change Angle
1-7 - Cast Spells

.NET 4.0 DOWNLOAD
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=24872
XNA 4.0 Redistrutable DOWNLOAD
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

Thanks for your time!

entries.title: Minikin
entries.description:
This is an adventure game where you have to go on a quest in your tiny kingdom to save some knights.

I was hoping to get a different theme so the game is kind of rushed and generic, so yea.

Press arrow keys to move, up or space to jump, A to attack, and e to open up your equipment.

If you're frustrated by the small size of the sword keep pressing on, they get bigger as you go.

Feedback is much appreciated, I really like the style and size this game turned out to be so I'm going to build on it unless I get a lot of negative feedback.

Right click and save the windows version just to play it offline. (This is a better experience, my web one is slightly off centered)

BUG: While working on the extended version I noticed a bug a few people have mentioned, if you defeat the Hydra you have a random chance to not go to the ending credits. So if you beat the Hydra, that's the end.  All you're missing out on is a black screen thanking my friends.

entries.title: Minisk, You Will

Minisk is a planet, a very small planet. So small, in fact, that it is located in a single drop of water. It is also your home. 

Its surface being rich in nutrients and resources alike, it has become the target of all nearby living organisms. Unfortunately, they don't want to live there. They're only after its resources, and won't stop until they've sucked your planet dry, leaving it uninhabitable. 

It's your task to ward off these thieves. Five waves of enemies, each progressively more harder than the last.

Controls:
WASD/Directional Keys - Movement
Q - Shop
F - Place Teleporters
W - Use Teleporters
Mouse - Fire Arrows

Tools:
IDE - FlashDevelop
Engine - FlashPunk
Graphics - Photoshop
Sfx - Sfxr
Music - FL Studio

entries.title: Tiny Basket World
entries.description:
Plays on unity webplayer.

Unfortunatelly it's lacking a lot of polish.
This is one of the first things I've made in unity3D, and I kind of like it more now.

I think this game is fun mostly when doing something else, like talking on skype with someone

Software used:
- Unity3D (I love it now, but I want to try getting some plugins and experimenting more with it)
- Blender 3D for the basket ring, and for the net. The net gave me a lot of trouble, and I had to remake it like 10 times due to me not understanding blender.
- Inkscape to draw the world
- paint.net to draw the net, and the guy

Theme: one could argue that this game is not much on the theme of a tiny world, and it might be true. It's probably the worst excuse for a "tiny world game" but if I had better drawing skills, the player would be god, playing with the world, and theme would fit it more.

I'm very limited by my lack of artistic skills, so I made a game that required as little graphics as possible.

Thank you all for your nice comments. I see that the main thing about my game is the addictiveness, and that's what I was going for. I'm trying to have a friend make some art for me, to try to make this into a real game.

entries.title: Tiny Card World
entries.description:
=========== IMPORTANT ===========

I've added a better description for everybody who finds it difficult to understand how the battle works.

The goal of the game is to master every battle on the (rather tiny) world!
(Because we all wanna be the very best, right?)

=========== CONTROLLS ===========

On every screen:
   * Escape: Go back

On the map screen:
   * Click: Go to a Town/Battle

On the battle screen:
   * Click on card: Select it
   * Click on middle energy bar: Add energy to your attack (at least 1)
   * Click on Fight: Start the battle


=========== BATTLE EXPLAINED ===========

After you have chosen a card and how much energy you add to your attack, the battle works like this:

1. Calculate the power of the attack (Value of the card times the energy spent)
2. Apply special cases (see below)
3. The stronger attack wins and the difference will be subtracted from the loser's health.

=========== SPECIAL CASES ===========

1. If the two elements are the same, no modification of the attack value happens here.
2. If one of the attack is colored, its attack value is multiplied by 2.
3. If you fight against a weak element, the attack power of the weak element is added to yours. (you "absorb" the attack) This also means that the enemy's attack power is zeroed out.

=========== BATTLE EXAMPLES ===========

3 Energy, 2 Fire vs. 1 Energy, 1 Fire

Steps (see above):
1. 6 Power vs. 1 Power
2. No modification
3. 5 Damage to the second player

5 Energy, 1 Colorless vs. 3 Energy, 1 Water

Steps (see above):
1. 5 Power vs. 3 Power
2. Second Player's Power times 2 (Water vs. Colorless)
3. 1 Damage to the first player

1 Energy, 1 Fire vs. 5 Energy, 3 Water

Steps (see above):
1. 1 Power vs. 15 Power
2. Second Player's power added to first player's power (Fire vs Water)
3. 16 Damage to the second player

entries.title: Tiny Domination
entries.description:
In this game your goal is to claim world domination! To do so, simply take over every planet in each level.

Controls:
Listed in game via tutorial.
Move around by clicking on the minimap or by using the WASD/arrow keys. The minimap shows planets and your current viewport only. This is an RTS so you must watch your resources carefully while fending off the AI or attacking a planet it controls. Build oil rigs to get money, and build turrets or HP regeneration stations as defensive buildings. The only moving unit is the fighter.

Click and drag to select fighters, right click a planet to make them travel there. They will attack enemies automatically and attempt to take over neutral or enemy planets.

In total there are 9 levels. The AI may either crush you or you it. In general, the AI is most often conservative in the beginning and when it builds up a fleet will send them out.

Cheats:
Numpad +/- to switch levels.

Created with the help of the following tools:
GameMaker:HTML5
GIMP
Audacity
BFXR
LMMS

THERE IS A WEB VERSION OF THIS GAME, HERE'S WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW:
REALLY IMPORTANT: The tutorial under the "How" button does not correctly draw the first screen of the tutorial. When you press that button and get sent to a blank blue screen, PRESS THE SPACEBAR to continue. The missing screen basically summarizes the information given in these notes.

Chrome has a bug that prevents the game from running normally, it wants to run twice as fast as I designed the game to run. I was kind of able to hack around this limitation, but the result was making Chrome run even slower and more choppy than other browsers.

This game is HTML5/Javascript. It supports both WebGL and canvas for maximum performance and compatibility. HTML5 is a new technology and there are many differences between browsers (for instance, how shapes and sprites look).

This game can get quite intensive and may run poorly on slower machines. If you have any problems with the web version, PLEASE DOWNLOAD THE WINDOWS VERSION.

4/24 - Added timelapse. May be 360p for a while.

entries.title: An Hell Of A Kitchen
entries.description:
My tiny world is the one where all the bacterias can live happy far from the cleaning stuff. Just behind your forniture :)

This is a turn-game where you're supposed to fill of bacterias the kitchen of a really obsessive maid
before she decides to move all the forniture to kill you.
You can win in 2 ways:
- Build the ultimate bacteria which can resist even the terrible maid

But remember that the maid will arrive sooner or later, so you've to hurry!

entries.title: Critter Clash

Critter Clash is a total multiplayer mayhem up to four players!

Every player controls 3 small critters:
an agile sharpshooter,
a slow one with close combat projectiles and
fast fatty critter with shield breaking pulse!

Requirements:
Operating system: Windows
Players: 2-4
Resolution: 1920x1080

Read more info from readme.

entries.title: Earth Is Dying!
entries.description:
The Earth is not big enough for everyone. Population growth combined with resource decline will drain what we have very shortly, we must expand! You must send as many refuges away from Earth as you can, before the planet is dead and humankind with it. Oh, and you have, like, 3 minutes.


How to play:
As soon as you pop into the game, Earth is quickly becoming a wasteland. 

A/D/Left/Right: Move left/right along the solar system.
Space: Launch a rocketship with colonists from Earth
S: Launch a seed ship with resources from Earth
(debug) P: Restart game, so you don't have to close/reopen

The Point:
Save as many people from Earth as possible, the game ends when Earth dies. Your score is the number (in Millions) of people who are not on Earth at that time. People in ships don't count (to prevent cheating by launching to nowhere at the last moment). Have it planned. The game is meant to be played in about 2-3 minute attempts.


Sadly, I did not finish what I set out to do. I did not have the time on Sunday I had planned, so now I am releasing what I have. It is "gameplay complete", it plays, and there is a start and finish. 

What isn't included:
Sound
Music
High score keeping
Help instructions
Aesthetics (proper graphics, backgrounds)
Better UI


I (luckily) had prototyped out my game on Saturday, so the gameplay is actually there.

What is included:
Windows executable and source code, of course. The source is a Unity project, it will generate an OSX app without issue, though I haven't included one here. 


Tips:
Ships take time to reach their destinations, and also cost resources. With Earths resources already dwindling, you must balance out population growth on multiple planets to save as many people as possible.

If a planet hits 0 resources, all colonists die. Do not allow this!

entries.title: Enter The Mechanism
entries.description:
My first attempt at using Stencyl to make a game. Try and find your way through the mechanism...managed to get 5 levels done.

entries.title: First Import
entries.description:
Edit: Now with linux-ability! Hopefully. No guarantees about it working on mac at all as I didn't/can't test it, but.. maybe? To run the linux version just grab the linux archive and run the included launcher.sh to start the game.

Wow! I finished it! There are some quirks with how the missiles work, collision detection isn't incredibly accurate, and the mining planes are worthless, but hey.

So, I present the game... First Import! (A play on Last Exile, if anyone's seen that anime. I saw it a few days before this started)

It's airplane with hookshots colonizing dirtballs in :space:! Also, I voice-acted everything except the background music.

Please do read the included readme.txt for instructions on how to play the game, and be a bit patient; unsurprisingly, I didn't have time to put in the extra polish that would make it play more nicely.

Also, the source code to the game is included in the source sub-folder, the .bat there should build the game's FirstImport.jar, and the source for the base code used is in source/com/ixee/

Edit after like.. a week and a half: So it turns out it doesn't work on Linux or Mac. That sort of sucks, and I can test/fix it for Linux this weekend, but I don't have a Mac available to test on so.. I'll try setting up a virtual machine at some point. For the time being though I apologize for the problem, and don't really have much to give for you non-Windows folk.

Finals next week, so take it with a grain of salt, but I should be able to post a version with some fixes to major issues (like missiles not clearly being spawned, being spawned at the wrong spot, etc. And a better explanation of what exactly there is to do) in another week and a half.

entries.title: NANO M.D.

You control a nano machine designed to destroy ailments from within.  Go inside a body to fight amoebas, bacteria, worms, and viruses.

Released under GPL.  64-bit linux, Windows 64-bit & 32-bit, and MAC downloads are available.  I'll try to make some 32-bit binaries for linux if there is a need, otherwise you can download love2d from http://www.love2d.org and then download nanomd.love from the source repository to run on 32-bit systems.

Known Bugs:

1) Collision detection for bacteria (blue cylinder shape) is messed up.  You can still destroy them but sometimes shots will pass through.  Just shoot around their general area and you'll hit it.

2) Worms don't move exactly as I had intended but it'll work.


===PRO TIP===

Once you play the way it is meant to be played :), you can hold down '=' key and increase rate of fire.  Some debug mechanisms I forgot to take out.  Holding down '-' will decrease rate of fire.

entries.title: Nematode
entries.description:
My tiny world is viewed through a telescope and populated by colourful Nematode worms.  The aim is to create worms with specific patterns by feeding them the right coloured food in the right order.  They have a habit of turning at the wrong time though or eating the wrong coloured food.

 Instructions

-Left click drops food.
-The colour of the next piece of food in shown in the bottom right hand corner.
-When a worm eats a piece of food that colour is added to the front of their body.
-The worm you are trying to match the colours of is in the bottom left hand corner.
-Your score is shown on the left and the time remaining on the right
-Matching a worm gives you points and more time
-When the timer reaches zero its game over.

 Hints

When worms get older / longer they die and make way for new worms.  Try to feed longer worms to get rid of them quicker to make way for smaller worms.

The sequence of colours must be in the correct order from front to back. If you have to create a match to a worm with a red head and blue tail first find a single blue worm.  Then feeding it one piece of red food will create a match.

The worms move at different speeds.  Try and find slower worms to feed for matches and try and get rid of fater worms by feeding them up quickly.


UPDATE :  

It seems my instruction wrinting skills are weak. I knew the game was fiddly to play but I didn't realise the concept was tricky that tricky to grasp. I will try and describe it again now I have had more sleep.   

There is a worm shown in a box the bottom left corner. The aim is to feed the worms randomly milling around the screen to that they match the length and colours of the worm in the box.  

You can't control worms directly but you can drop food in front of them to feed them. The next colour food in displayed in the bottom right. So if you have to match a worm that has a red head and a blue tail you need to find a worm that is just a single blue dot and feed it some red food. You will then get points and more time for getting a match and another target worm for you to try and match will appear in the bottom left hand corner.  Rinse and repeat.

entries.title: Pin Party
entries.description:
It's a party! How many angels can dance on the head of a pin? Seven. Gather the other six angels and bring them back to the pin in this fast-paced score-attack twin-stick-style shooter... hyper fighting edition.

Controls:
Arrow Keys: Move
WASD: Shoot

Use the Party Sense Arrow above your head to find the nearest angel or your way back to the pin.


Spacebar: Start

Java 6/7 is required! One binary fits all. Unzip the archive. Run ludumdare.bat on Win and ludumdare.sh on other platforms in unzipped directory.

Every year these mites have this thrill seeking race around some person's house - risking it all for the big trophy

Dwayne - art and design
Blkmrkt - sound and music
Artyom - coding and complains

entries.title: Stade 2 (Mr.Oizo)
entries.description:
A game about a song on some kind of tiny world..

1. Turn up your speakers/headphones!
2. Right click -> GoFullscreen recommended
3. Click to start, mouse to move (side-to-side and up/down)
4. Avoid deathtraps!


My first Ludum Dare! Not a complete game, but I plan to finish it (or at least flesh it out until the giant death robot's appearance at about 1:30 in the song >:) 

*Update: Thanks for the incredible feedback. I've linked a page where I'll be uploading post-jam improvements. There are so many LD games for me to play and rate before I can make any major additions, but for starters you will no longer be able to lose by running into the presses sideways.

Music:
"Stade 2" by Mr.Oizo

entries.title: The Collector
entries.description:
You are a wizard and a monster collector. However, monsters take a lot of space and in order to fit them in your Terrorium, you first have to shrink them down. GO and explore the world around you, capturing and bringing back home the tiny versions of deadly monsters that wander around. Do not forget to feed them though or they will starve to death... Gain experience, become a better spellcaster and become the ultimate collector ! 

It is a dangerous sports though... Will you be strong enough to beat and capture even the fierce hellspawns that dwells down below ?


----Gameplay and tips:

*left and right to move. Double tap to run.
*Up to jump, Up again for a double jump.
*Left click for a fireball.
*Right click for the shrink spell ( only works on weakened enemies and if the spell is charged enough time).
You can charge a stronger shrink spell every time you level up.
*Get experience by killing monsters, get double experience by capturing them. You can capture 5 of each type of monster except for bosses ( only 1 ).
*collect food or your monsters will starve. Food grows back after a long time.
*Drop off monsters ( get extra XP again) and food at your Terrorium at home. 
* Press enter to look at your terrorium and its inhabitants you caught.
* Messages at the top of the screen will tell you if your shrink spell is either not charged enough for the monster you shot or if the monster still has too much health. It will also warn you when you approach some dangerous places.
* When you fight a monster, remember it's strength ! Its the best way to know how to capture it! 
*There IS an ending. Good luck.
*There is a total of 8 different creatures +2 bosses to get.

----Notes:

Apologies for the Mac and Linux versions which seem to have issues with aiming and musics! 
Only current way to quit is to force quit ( alt+F4 or alt tab)

Thanks to Anaconda for making Mac and Linux exporters.

----spoiler:

If you're lost, here is the world map.
http://ftarabout.com/misc/worldmap_thecollector.jpg



If you liked this game, you are welcome to come see more stuff here! http://insertcoinsplz.blogspot.com/

Diminutive Dungeon is a retro, generative, tiny "roguelike" role-playing game set in a total 8 tiles. The idea was to make something set in a tiny space that would be infinitely playable by giving the player character line of sight-- when areas of the map fall out of the characters vision new creatures and items get generated.

HTML5 Canvas, Javascript, Ableton Live, Ye Olde Photoshoppe

entries.title: Inlander
entries.description:
== IMPORTANT ==
1. The all-in-one .exe requires no other files, but seems suspicious because it has no publisher signed to it. THe .zip looks safe, but ofcourse they both are.
2. This is a fixed version. In the original, a map did not spawn enough iron ore to craft the required iron bars for a boat. More updates coming soon.
======

A little Minecraft-ish game.

You spawn on a tiny island and need to find a way to escape.
On a day when there was almost no fog, you could see the mainland over to the west. Now you need to find a way to get there.

Use WSAD to move and the mouse to interact. You start with a wooden axe, use it to chop down some trees.

Because I didn't have enough time, some features may be buggy or even missing. I'm planning a lot of updates for after the compo. Stay tuned!

There are a minimap and an FPS counter left over from development stage. Hold the right mouse button to view it.

There are no enemies or ways to lose health. There isn't even health. You can only win the game. I might add those later.

Made with LOVE (www.love2d.org) using Lua. Graphics created with Photoshop CS6. No audio included because time.

Perlin Noise generator snippet: http://pastebin.com/QadsmgcM


PS. This is my first Ludum Dare, please be easy on me ^^

The idea is that you are a tiny oyster in a tiny tidal pool.  The world is your oyster.

Ran into some scaling issues with html and DOM manipulation.  Leaks like a sieve, eventually crashes.  Overall it was fun, but I'm going to use a better framework next time.

I have a html5 3d engine, but I judged the time it would take to shoehorn a puzzle game in there would be prohibitive.

entries.description:
Find your way to the end of this puzzling game for total victory.  Use the arrow keys to avoid getting sent back a level by the paramecium or other nasties.  Consume the DNA to be transported to the next level!

I made this game, and my best score is 59 seconds.  Can you top that?

(I promise the game is solvable, sometimes you have to outthink rather than outrun...)

entries.title: Shorted Out
entries.description:
Here is the compo version of Shorted Out, my first game ever in Unity. I didn't end up having time to add sound effects or music, but I'm happy with the progress I did make within the time limit. I managed to create four levels at least for this strange racing game.

Basic idea is that you are a lost electron and you have to reach the SAFE-T zone at each level. You use the arrow keys to move and if you short out on anything metal you spark and take a little penalty delay. Tracks your lowest time record.

entries.title: Teeming
entries.description:
After hearing about the "Tiny World" theme, I decided to go  with a game in a petri dish.  You control a microorganism, and you can swim around the dish eating bacteria, gathering symbiotes, battling your competitor microbes, and dividing yourself to produce more of your species.

There are ten levels.  Your goal is to reach the target population level of cells.  You may also be required to eliminate your competitors in later levels.  If you take too long, your petri dish will dry out, and you'll have to try the level again.

This was my first entry for Ludum Dare - just heard about it earlier this year.  A lot of fun.  Many thanks to my mom for putting up with my programming.

I used the excellent CraftyJS library as a basis, BFXR and GoldWave for sound, Gimp and Irfanview for art, PowerPoint for some other art, and NotePad++ for coding.

entries.title: The Pioneer
entries.description:
There are still some bugs in this one, mostly physics related ones. I'm sure there are probably ones I don't even know of, seeing as I am submitting this with... uh, like 5 minutes left.

It was kind of rushed, but the core engine is complete- there is one flying enemy, one walking enemy and about 10 level maps. All of these elements undergo randomization that is derived from a seed you enter at the start of the game. Also, it will tell you letters and numbers are allowed in the seed, but only letters are currently. This will be fixed soon of course but it really shouldn't matter anyway.

The game is completable, although you will certainly notice the dearth of content. I opted to make a single enemy of each variety (walking, flying and boss) and in the end that was all I had time for- even then I had to rush. Alas. I suppose that's what I get for beginning a whole 24 hours late.

I got a bunch of help on this from my friends Marius Schneider, Zachery Delafosse, and Benjamin Pullen.

This is made in Game Maker, so it's windows only right now.

Check out the readme for controls and basic story info! 

Uses the SGAudio DLL for game maker by snake5: http://gmc.yoyogames.com/index.php?showtopic=506072

**** WHAT IS THE PIONEER? ****

It's a game about a supernatural little being who goes between tiny planets in space and exterminates the monsters that inhabit them. My idea with this was that the "tiny world" concept could translate into a lot of small, separate places conveyed in a screen-based platformer.

The design for the final version of the game is kind of leaned towards being an almost roguelike sort of escapade- the rooms are not actually randomly generated, but based on set skeletal structures with lots of points of articulation.

In every map there are bits of solid and stuff that might not appear, enemy slots that have a higher chance of being filled the further on into the play session the player is, etc. There are also twelve color palettes and four tilesets that skin themselves over the levels.

Speaking of the randomized features, they aren't all purely aesthetic- the monsters, in particular, all level up as the player survives longer. These levels give them points that they allocate into statistics and abilities- giving them more survivability through hit points, dole out harder damage to the player, or move faster. The skill builds are not global between all monsters of a single type, but rather become randomized on each level- slimes could be very fast and jump between the floor and ceiling in one stage, and be very slow with a lot of HP on the next.

Again I am highly disappointed that I couldn't work fast enough to supply more content than what's available here, but I hope the barren framework and concept is enough to catch your interest to watch its further developments. There are a lot of different enemies planned; teleporting wizards with ranged attacks, skeletons that try to get to you, a wheel-shaped creature with four legs that travels along all sides of solid surfaces, and a lot more. More player abilities are also to come in a more fleshed out release, such as lava resistance, slow-fall and a few other neat things.

More features and tons of content are definitely in store for this game, so please keep watching if it has caught your interest!

I had a lot of fun working quickly to meet a deadline and I'll definitely want to get a better head-start on the next Ludum Dare!

**** UPDATE: POST-JAM VERSION 1 ****

This is not a greatly fleshed out version of what was first released, but it does have a few things brushed up: the environment tileset composed of blocks has been redone and looks nicer, levels with unfair jumps were tweaked to be easier and you can now restart the game [bypassing the logo + sound] after you die or win by pressing enter.

The end-screen restart was supposed to be in for the initial release, but a small coding error caused it to make the audio DLL freak out and produce a lot of loud, weird glitchy noises... so I, unfortunately, had to temporarily pull it.

There's still more to come for this game!

'Hack computers as much as you can in every room'.

To hack a computer simply turn it on and win the minigame.

Tiny Agent is a game made less than three days for the Ludum Dare 23 Jam

Hack a computer: complete a minigame. There is only one minigame: use mouse to shot all the enemy ships.
No ending, sorry.

toaster

Thank you for playing.

entries.title: Tiny Eco
entries.description:
Tiny Eco is my take on Conway's Game of Life, crossed with an old shareware game I played as a kid called "Eco Master". I started about halfway through the competition, so it's rough around the edges, but it's a fun little game/toy with an elaborate simulation driving it. 

Construct a small ecosystem out of terrain tiles and place animals into the world. When you click "Lock In", the game of survival begins. 

Balance is key: too many hares on a tile and they will reduce the rate at which edible plants grow. Too many foxes on a tile and they'll hunt the hares to extinction. No hares for the foxes and they'll starve. 

When the simulation is complete, you will receive points for each surviving animal: 5 points for a fox and 1 for a hare. The highest score on each puzzle is recorded. There are 12 puzzles for you to try.

Hope you enjoy playing!  =)

- Truce


TL;DR - Drag land tiles and animal tokens to complete the map, click Lock In. Watch it go, then reset and try for more points.

entries.title: Tiny Quest
entries.description:
!NOTE! - The game works in wine if you don't want to build the Linux-version, or are using a platform without a port (but with wine)

!!NOTE!! As of 2012-04-24 23:55 CEST, there is a Mac OS X application bundle.  Link added. (This is a pure port with no enhancements, and should qualify for rating according to the rules of porting)

Known problems with the game (This list is written after all the feedback I've gotten ;)):

* Jumping is kind of awkward, especially easy to notice at a later point in the game (This is my number one regret - I should have fixed this :()

* There is a minor issue with the bounding box of the character, where he can get stuck on a ledge - you only have to jump to get down.

* Sometimes the blobs will fly away on their own when you enter the screen.

* Due to the way I implemented gravity, you can get damaged for the wrong reason when standing on a platform near a flame.


The game is attempting to clone the look and feel of the old Nintendo Game Boy,
as that was apparently what I felt like doing this time.

How to play:

* Arrow keys or a/d moves the player sideways.
* Space makes your character jump.
* Space while jumping makes your character jump higher, aka. a double jump - if you have the necessary artifact. (The game will clearly tell you when you have it).


The game can be completed.

The Linux-version is the source-version in a tarball, build instructions inside README. (It's quite simple, you just have to make sure that the dependencies is in place)


If something does not work as it should, please contact me on twitter, mail or
IRC.

Enjoy and let me know what you think!

entries.title: Planet Devourer
entries.description:
This is our entry for the Jam. It is a game about who is the bigger fish out there in the wild. A tale of hunter and prey.

Try to stay alive as long as possible, while upgrading your engine and charging your jump drive. But beware, something lurks out there...

Controls:
- Arrows
- 1, 2, 3
- Space/Enter for menu

So this was a three man collaboration. Made in Flixel and the actual work effort is probably around 48 hours. Great fun and our first Ludum Dare Jam.

My co-workers Ludum Dare account:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/category/ld-23/?author_name=TheVideoGameMechanic

NOTE:
The flash file might be very big and graphical, also we don't have a loading screen, so be patient and try refresh if it doesn't show up

entries.title: Professor McSteen, and his shrinking machine
entries.description:
Escape from the lair of Professor McSteen, using his shrinking machines! 

 If you get stuck, there are tips on the Help page in game, but I suggest you attempt the game first before reading the tips, as they contain spoilers.

 Controls: Arrow keys to move/jump. WASD if you prefer. Use the mouse to click on blocks next to you to pick them up, then click on a space next to you to place them.

Since everyone is struggling so much, I've added a video showing how to complete the first section of the game, along with tips and an explanation of the objective.

entries.title: Rubiq's Garden
entries.description:
WASD for character movement
Arrow Keys to move the world

Can you beat all 10 levels?

Protips:
- Try defeating enemies by shifting them into traps or off the board
- Keep track of the door - otherwise, you'll have to search for it 

Update: Apparently our game inspired a comic from one of our players, which adds a (strange, dystopian, and unintentional) backstory to the game.  You can find it under the 'An Interpretation of Rubiq's Garden From a Player (Comic)' link above.

links.label: An Interpretation of Rubiq's Garden From a Player (Comic)

entries.title: Shoot Dem Asteroids
entries.description:
Controls:

- WASD to move
- Space to shoot


Tips:

- Your ship's gun will overheat, so try to fire in bursts.
- It's easier to defend Earth if you stay near it
- The red arrows around you ship point to asteroids

Note: There is no way to win this game, you just shoot asteroids until you die :)

entries.title: Smallworld Survival
entries.description:
A wee sim game about the survival of a community in a tiny world.

Apologies for the lack of graphics/sound, I wasn't able to find much time to work on this over the weekend.

EDIT: Added source code links.

I stupidly didn't keep the exact version that I uploaded for the jam around, the non-fixed version should behave the same, but with an added debug mode if you press "d", showing the path finding as well as dark grid squares where the cached distance values weren't cleared. The fixed version fixes those, making the pathfinding work much more reliably, though I think it also removes some of the character of the people.

entries.title: Spitoon
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare competition. For my first attempt, I'm just glad I finished something. The game is full of minor and moderate bugs, and the game is far too short (7 levels in all). That said, I had a blast participating and it was quite a learning experience.

The game is based around spitting out one of three colored blobs of which the main character is composed. Your size is dependent on how many blobs you possess, and you'll need to be very small to fit through some of the narrow passageways. In levels with pressure plates, the Exit sign won't light up until all of them have been triggered by one of your spitballs landing on them.

entries.title: subAtomic
entries.description:
A dysfunctional family are miniaturised in their misguided search for a holiday, thanks to the scientific minds at S.H.A.T. (Space Holidays via Accelerated Transport).

Features:
* Visceral point-and-click action!
* Literally tens of hilarious jokes.
* Experience the beginning, middle, and end of a story. The decisions you make will completely shape your experience and the final outcome of the game.
* The lack of a save-game feature means your actions have real-world consequences.
* Witness the epic development of more than one character as you control some of their actions.
* subAtomic plunges you into the scene at the deep end, with more than 10 different, immersive sound effects!
* A rousing, all-original musical score.
* Features unofficial cameo appearances by Albert Einstein and Carl Sagan!

Created by Murray Lewis & David Blake, using Adventure Game Studio 3.2.1, in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 23 Jam.

-------------------

CONTROLS:

Ctrl+Q: Quit

Left click: Look at/walk
Right click: Interact

entries.title: The Office
entries.description:
In "The Office", you start as an intern, exploring the place and finding things to do - or not to do.

Try to find as many items and events as you can, and maybe even earn a much sought after promotion! If the boss is feeling generous, that is...

entries.title: There is a Picture
entries.description:
A cosmonaut in his spaceship wants to create a brand new planet. He'll have to trade with people and stuff.

About 20 minutes.

Made with eXaHeVa and Alias Conrad Coldwood on RPG Maker 2003

entries.title: Tiny (Growing) World
entries.description:
The idea was to start as a tiny planet and build up your mass by collecting other celestial bodies, but we never finished scaling, so we have a sort of asteroid catching game.

There is no concrete objective. Asteroids (grey) detract from your atmosphere, but add more mass and Comets (blue) add to atmosphere and a little bit of mass.

Also, being close to the sun reduces your atmosphere.

Controls
WASD to move, space to stop

Issue List
Exit in Menu doesn't work
Player not centered
Hitbox slightly off for player
Player is as fast as every other object
Player can collide with sun.
Music doesn't play
(There are more)

entries.title: Tiny War
entries.description:
Tiny war is one of those games where you send ships to fight over planets, except the planets actually behave like planets and orbit. The game's tactics thus depend on waiting for a good launch window, as ships that go farther are weaker. There were a few things planned that didn't get in, like some pretty planet graphics and a mechanic involving affecting planetary orbits, but I'm just happy to have actually finished a game this time.

Instructions:
Welcome to Tiny War. You play as green. The goal of the game is to send ships out and destroy blue. To attack a planet, drag from a planet you have ships on to a planet you want to send them to. This will send some ships from each planet you dragged over to the one you ended on. A fleet of ships loses strength the longer it's in space, so try to time your movement to take advantages of differing orbits. Your ships and your enemy's ships will destroy each other if they are on the same planet. The number of ships on a planet is indicated by the numbers above and below it. When your ships are the only ones on the planet, they will begin to capture it at a rate proportional to their number. Once a planet is captured, it will have a white ring when selected, and will begin producing ships. Bigger planets take longer to capture but produce ships faster. Press space to give up the level, and 'd' to turn on demo mode. Try to beat the AI and win the game!

entries.title: Tiny World
entries.description:
Tiny World By Carter Patterson

NOTE: currently I only have the source code release, you will need a Java 
editor such as netbeans or eclips to run this. I will release a Jar file 
when I can.

------------------------------------------------------------------

You awake to find yourself alone in a strange world filled with
shoadowy creatures. You have no idea how you got there, but you do know
that if you don't find something to eat soon you will die.
Welcome to your tiny new world.

------------------------------------------------------------------

The objective is to simply not die. While you could stay inside the
house to avoid the monsters, you will howerver eventually starve to death
if you don't find food.

At the start of each new day you will be warped back to your house, then
a random amount of monsters and chests will be created and randomly placed
throughout the world. The chests will ether hold potions to heal yourself,
food that you can eat to prevent yourself from starving to death, or bonus
points.

Controls:
Arrow keys: move the character
spacebar: use potion to heal yourself
E key: eat food

Thanks you for playing, sorry it isn't much. There was allot more I
wanted to add but sadly I ran out of time before that. If you have any
tips, suggestions, feedback, or bug-reports you can submit them on the
ludum dare page or my twitter (@SgtQuad) thanks!

Timelaps coming soon!
subscribe to my youtube (http://www.youtube.com/user/SgtQuad)

entries.title: Unworld
entries.description:
The game is ready at the end... But not completely,

In the game, you have to dodge(you are the mouse) red word but appears with a distance and you dodge when the word disappear.

For my firts game, this was a great experience 

there are a probleme if you have a amd/ati graphic card (4000-7000), i have to upgarde sfml 1.6 to 2.0

entries.title: Where It Begins
entries.description:
Hello there,

I've made this in the last 6 hours of the Ludum Dare as a special gift for the 1st birthday of my son. I can't write any spoiler here so click on the link below and take the little trip I prepared for you.

You control the blue and must go all the way up to reach "pink bubbles". You can't shoot or defend yourself: just avoid the red bubbles that try to go down.

Just use the arrows to move your character (and click on "play" on the first screen !)

Edit : version 1.1 with 2 fixes : you can't go through walls if you push too hard, and the burst of blue bubbles is now fixed too.
I hope you will enjoy it as much as I enjoyed doing it.

entries.title: a little place.
entries.description:
You're the white circles. Attack the magenta squares.

It's a canvas/javascript game, so you'll need to have a modern browser with js enabled.

entries.title: An Imperative Journey
entries.description:
If you've got an older machine, try the _4WDrenderer version of the download (it won't look quite as nice unfortunately). If in doubt please try the regular download, it's only 10 meg :)

- instructions for those a bit lost!:
sorry! it's not so obvious from the first task- basically for milk follow the white line (then to the hedgehog), water the blue (then to the flower),(then upstairs), leaf the green (then to the stand-alone green plant). Then to the kitchen, off the main 'hub' room.

- Additionally: there's no pause screen, you'll need to alt-f4 to quit (or lose focus with alt-tab and close the window, if you're using windowed)

entries.title: Ant In Training
entries.description:
This is an adventure / puzzle game. As such, I don't want to say too much in risk of spoiling it.

If you need help, check out the data folder. My maps are png images that get parsed to generate the maps. They should be rather revealing...

entries.title: Ant Swarms
entries.description: Green ants versus red ants.  You have to control the ants by placing pheromone which will attract them.  There is a very simple AI for the red ants.  The game is not really fun, but I'm glad to be a part of LD48!

entries.title: BigMe
entries.description:
Flash Game, no audio

Some bugs are features ^_^

entries.title: Buggy, Tank and Missile Launcher!!!
entries.description:
NOTE: Place a link to your entry in the comment section if you want me to review!

=====================================================
INFO
=====================================================
On a tiny planet, far far away. Blue really hates Red.

BTML (Buggy, Tank, Missile Launcher) is a RTS game that takes place on a small, round planet. You expand your base by adding modules and floors to your flat. This allows you to construct units. You attack and defend by placing units on one of the 3 lanes. The enemy has learned this as well, so watch out, you might meet him on the battlefield!

Warning: The game is quite hard :).

Hint1: Build a factory to build units
Hint2: You can add floors to your building by pressing the + button at the top of your screen. MORE MODULES :)!
Hint3: Long range units can shoot past your short range units.
Hint4: Use upgrades!
Hint5: Don't give up, it is beatable! Make the blues proud!

Creators
Cavit & Vic

Tools used:
Wasabi Chips

Update: Bug Fixed where labels did not show up, be careful boys and girls, GL calls are a tricky thing in Unity :).

entries.title: Crater
entries.description:
This Game was done during Ludum Dare #23 (Theme: Tiny World).
My first entry in a Ludum Dare
Total working time around 20 hours.
By not beeing as fast as i guessed and missing some hours on Day2
i wasn't able to fill the World and make use of some ideas.
A proper post Dare post will follow at www.ludumdare.com/compo/

Controls:

WASD to move
Run over items to collect
E to interact with Objects and Charakters

ESC to close game.

Gameplay:
An adventure with a really empty world.
Game ends when you die by hunger.

Original Idea:
An adventure where the player decides the outcome.
Become a crazy explorer. Get Loved. Or even get totaly wasted.


Tools used:

CodeBlocks with mingw.
SFML 2 RC
PyxelEdit
Paint.net

Source:

Crazy bad code.
Looking at or even using the code at your own risk.
Feel free to do with it what ever you want.

To compile you will need to link the SFML 2 RC.

entries.title: Faelanx
entries.description:
Faelanx

Explore as far down in the Faded Dungeon within the Fae realm, training your magic and equipping yourself to survive the monsters driven mad.

Notes: A few things didn't get fully done (achievements are all the same type), but I hope to get a post competition version out soon that will finish up what was missed. I didn't have time to integrate any story into the game at all, so don't expect tiny worlds. :)

entries.title: Gnome Purseuit
entries.description: You are a mischievous gnome that aims to take stuff from a lady's purse. Wait for the gnome portal to be ready and don't let the hand get the disputed objects.

entries.title: Honey Heist
entries.description:
This Game requires Microsoft .NET 4 and Microsoft XNA 4.0. If you don't already have them, you can download them at the links above. Both files are under 8 MB.



Concept: This game is a mix of Metal Gear Solid and arcade style gameplay. You must avoid enemies, gather pollen and return it before your energy runs out. Pollen is your score and you must meet a minimum amount before the wave timer runs out. You can return to the honeycomb at any time to drop off pollen and recharge your energy, but you may run out of time if you waste it carelessly and return too often.

entries.title: It's a crazy tiny world after all !
entries.description:
You versus it's a tiny world's attraction.
Kill those dolls before they make you too stressed out!

entries.title: microchip
entries.description:
You a creature in small world of the microchip. You have to clean this world.

Z- jump
X - to eat (you have to eat all the wrong blocks on the level)
C - to create a block (only during the jump)

I recommend playing with headphones.

What I used:

SC2

FL studio

sfxr

Flash

 
I hope you enjoy!

Thanks!

entries.title: Most of us live in a tiny world
entries.description:
Alright, so here's my jam entry.  It was supposed to be a board game, but lack of time forbid developing it further.



Warning: this was produced between 10pm and 4am with 6 hours remaining before the jam ends.  I was busy studying for exams all weekend so wasn't able to start earlier.

Needless to say, I wasn't able to realise my full idea for the game due to tiredness and late start :(

I had fun making the short audio loop, would have made more music tracks and some levels of play/decision making if time had permitted.  Ah well, onto the next compo!  

PS.

If you're looking for a list of other compos, http://compohub.net

entries.title: My Kid Dropped The Planet
entries.description:
Ever wanted to play catch with Whoville? Sure you have! Well, now you can do it. 

You are the guiding hand of Fate, controlling where the minature world will land as 8 kids toss it around in the home of an mad scientist. You can try to get it to safety before everyone on it is killed, or you can try and destroy it before time runs out.

Will you be Good....or Evil?

Press F1 for in-game help. There's an interactive tutorial, too.

entries.title: Nano Commander
entries.description:
Nano Commander is an RTS-style game where you take control of units in order to destroy your opponent. All the help you need can be viewed in-game or below. There are currently 6 maps available which can be added to by converting a png with similar layout to the current maps (#000000 for wall, #FFFFFF for empty space, #00FF00 for friendly units, #FF0000 for enemies).

There are a few annoyances I should note. First of all is the unit movement. Due to limited time and complexity of the movement, units are fairly solitary and will queue up all attempting to reach the same spot without flocking around the target position.

Secondly is the simplicity. I'd have liked to add more types of units, better upgrades, more balanced upgrade system, building more units, strategic enemies, etc.

Last off all is community. I didn't manage to stream as much as I'd hoped I could, nor post as much as I'd have liked either. Too busy developing this :P

entries.title: Pixel MMO
entries.description:
So I decided to participate in my first Ludum Dare competition this weekend. I have never made a game before, so this was an interesting adventure and I learned quite a bit; so I am pleased. I have heard before that the first game a person makes should be an MMO, and that makes a lot of sense really. So I made an MMO!

Adhering to the Tiny World theme, this is a tiny MMO (as far as MMOs go). As small as possible, actually, since to be fair I have no experience in making MMOs. Or any kind of game for that matter. I made the game with JavaScript and HTML to make playing it more accessible [it is, afterall, an MMO!].

The client was made with the following dependencies:
-Twitter's Bootstrap CSS library
-John Resig's JQuery JavaScript library
-Guillermo Rauch's Socket.IO JavaScript library
-Tomas Pettersson's sfxr

And on the server, I used:
-Ryan Dahl's node.js server
-TJ Holowaychuk's Express plugin for node.js
-Guillermo Rauch's Socket.IO plugin for node.js
-Tom Gallacher's gzippo plugin for node.js
-Ben Smawfield's Sanitizer plugin for node.js

Thanks to all the above people!

In the game, you play as a single coloured pixel in a small 2D world. Your goal as a pixel is simply to kill players of colours other than your own. In addition to this core Player-vs-Player mechanic, the game features real-time world chat so that you may taunt your opponents!

I hope the game's server does not catch fire while I sleep.

Good night, tiny world.

entries.title: SUBPIXEL
entries.description:
Entry by cr0ybot (Cory Hughart)
@cr0ybot on twitter

This Tiny World is the world of subpixels, the tiny red, green, and blue parts that make up the millions of pixels on your monitor.

Tools:
FlashDevelop
Flixel
Photoshop
Bfxr

INSTRUCTIONS:

Match subpixels to form a whole pixel (RGB in any order horizontally)

Use your mouse to aim, and use WASD or arrow keys or the mouse wheel to change to different sides of the screen.

Currently there is no logic for when a subpixel goes out of the bounding area... nor is there an explicit "endgame", so venture at your own risk.

Apologies for no music. Will have it in the next build, hopefully.

entries.title: Supernova
entries.description:
Essentially a tower defense game.

Controls:

Mouse - click on planet buttons (left panel) to buy planets; click on an orbit to add the purchased planet to your level.
ESC - Clears currently held planet.
SPACE/P - Pauses your planets (CAREFUL: The rest of the game will continue to function! Do this at your own risk!)

Thanks for playing. Leave a review!

entries.title: Sword of Altaria
entries.description: You awaken in a strange land, you discover that you have been shrunken and begin a quest to regain your normal size. Adventure through a land filled with dangerous and magical enemies. Collect new weapons and wield powerful magic to slay the witch and regain your height!

entries.title: Tin World
entries.description: I misheard the theme, sorry ;)

entries.title: Tinius Worldifica
entries.description:
Tinius Worldifica
In this game you travel around the multiple worlds (that are tiny!), collecting coins, and eventually finding keys which lead you to the next world. Remember to take things slowly, as they are only easy at the beginning! 

Have fun!


Controls
WASD to Move
Space to interact.

WARNING!
If you can't finish a level, then you'll have to restart! So you better take your time.

entries.title: Tiny Monk
entries.description:
A sole monk, living on a tiny world surrounded by monsters.
Rebuild the land and defeat the evil monsters!

entries.title: World Gone Wrong
entries.description:
You are Federation Droid No. 104. Your job is to destroy tiny, unnecessary planets that interfere with Federation plans, by planting explosives at their cores. 

In another tiresome day at work, something horrible happens. Your soil digger malfunctions right after you plant the explosives. Unable to use the digger, you must run away from the explosion and find your way up to the surface so that you can signal your mothership to pick you up before the planet melts down. 

Getting to the surface will be tricky.

---

There's a constantly growing hole in the middle of each level. You should try to avoid it and find the exit to the next level.

entries.title: 3 Arrows
entries.description:
The village is lost, hurry to the castle with only 3 arrows (which you can pick up after shooting) and try to survive!

Keyboard:
Movement: Arrow Keys
Action: A
Shoot: S
Restart: R

##############################
JUST VOTE FOR THE 48h VERSION!
##############################


UPDATES (Extended Version):

Update 4/23/2012:

Update 4/24/2012:

entries.title: aidas
entries.description:
Platformer puzzle about our personal worlds. Inspired partly by my previous experiments with sokoban puzzles, The Myth of Sisyphus and the Earth Day.

The music was procedurally generated using WolframTones.

Controls:
arrows to move, 
up or z to jump, 
r resets level (you will need it a lot)

entries.title: Attack of the Tiny People
entries.description:
I didn't quite manage to finish my game within the 48 hours so I took advantage of an extra 3/4 hours on the final day of the Jam to finish things up.

I've created an almost bullet hell style shmup as I wanted to create a different style of game to what I'm used to.

You can move around with the arrow keys or w,a,s,d (I find wasd seem to work better) Space is fire and you can boost to dodge bullets faster with Ctrl, but it does have a cooldown.

I created it in GM8.1 HTML5, and it can be played via the internet or as an executable.

I did really want to create a great menu screen but didn't have the time to sadly :( But the rest is pretty much there, so enjoy!

Also as it's in the style of a bullet hell style shooter you have a red blob on the character, this is your health centre, if it gets hit you get hurt, the rest of you can sustain the hits though. This was in my instructions screen but I seem to of not updated the image in the build I uploaded.

I've tested the game in IE9 and Chrome and it runs at a much faster framerate in Chrome fyi. Also it has sound effects (no music sadly) so I recommend headphones if you want a little sound :)

entries.title: BEEFWAR
entries.description:
This is BEEFWAR a strategy game that takes place on a cattle.

Features:
- 48 cuts of beef
- 7 types of panzers
- intense strategies

Instructions are in game.

Post Compo Version: blinkbat.nfshost.com/BEEFWAR.ZIP
Added music, polish, tweeked balances

entries.title: Crimson Booties
entries.description:
This game is our attempt at an entirely dialogue driven, story focused game. Interact with the characters on screen to progress the story, your decisions throughout the story will affect the outcome of the story.

Unfortunately we didn't finish formatting all our dialogue in time (Oh, there was a LOT) so only the first act (the intro) is playable in the pre-compo version. If you play the 'Web (extended)' version however, then you'll get to play right through to the end.

Code / Graphics: Waynetron.
Writers: Anita, Tim & Karl.

entries.title: Endless Siege
entries.description:
You are the lone defender of your village. Fight off waves of demons to protect the towns folk!

WASD to move
Mouse to aim
Left click to swing your sword

There are two possible endings

This is my first Ludum Dare game. I wrote it using XNA so unfortunately it is only compatible with windows but I thought it best to stick with the language I am most comfortable with for my first entry.

Follow me on Twitter @FlaxenFlash for updates if you like it. Thinking of expanding it and releasing it on phones

entries.title: Invaders!
entries.description:
Its essentially spinning Space Invaders. I wrote up a whole site on the project over at http://ld23.wibbly.org.uk/

Tested in Firefox and Chrome but its a lot smoother in Chrome. Probably wont work in IE.

Developer high score is currently 172000!

entries.title: Nanobot Rescue Team
entries.description:
Here, behold the first Ludum Dare entry of mine.

In Nanobot Rescue Team you are on an (endless) mission trying to rescue the organism you are in from nasty parasites and virii it has caught!

Choose your favorite from 3 different ships with unique gun setups. Blast out the baddies, pick up power-ups to aid your journey and try to get rid of as many of them as fast as possible.

Be careful though, you can't let 5 or more of them to pass you, or your host organism fails!

-------------------------------------------------

It was one tough of a compo, took me nearly 9 hours from the beginning to get an idea(after sleeping a few hours), but it was well worth it. The code is full of makeshift solutions, which I believe is the point of this compo :D

I was going to add a final boss for each level, but time was really short. I am normally a programmer, so making all the sprites took quite some time. 

The soundtrack was made with autotracker, SFX with Bfxr, graphics with GraphicsGale Free, IDE was Sublime 2 + cmd.

If you spot any bugs/crashes, feel free to email them to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ To compile the game you need at least pygame and numpy. I used python 2.7 for compiling the .exe, other versions might not be supported

Also, follow me on twitter! https://twitter.com/Hegemege

--------------------------------------------
KNOWN ISSUES
*Mute doesnt work for sound effects
*The game can be very hard at times(read: inevitable gameover), due to the random nature of powerups, 
*The Squid is underpowered
*The sounds aren't well balanced.

FUTURE ADDITIONS:
*Level ending boss
*better audio environment to match the blood vessel
*Score
*Slight tweaks in some sound effects
*more to come...

entries.title: New Life
entries.description:
New Life by fugliara

Help the mother naureza. Creating a New Life.

1. Avoid cell defense.
2. Join allied cells.
3. Destroy cells when combined.
4. Score extra points by moving.
5. Find the ovule.

Developed with HTML5 and JavaScript.

Runs on:
Internet Explorer 9;
Google Chrome;
Firefox (no audio).

entries.title: No One Said It Wasn't Aliens
entries.description: Run from the military after UFOs turn you into a monster.

entries.title: Pow! Pow! Pow!
entries.description:
Pow! Pow! Pow!
aka; A Game About a 16mm Hero Who Fights Off Invading Aliens 
from Supersizing His Home Planet

You play as the leader of the faraway small-sized planet Pipbit 
who sets out to kick out invading aliens from supersizing and 
completely taking over his home planet. 

With your powers of Minification and your army of micro-fighters, 
go out and get rid of these invaders and restore your home back to 
its rightful small state.

This was made by....
Matias Giachino (Zeik) : Coder extraordinaire. 
-Flashpunk 
-AS3
Christina Pham (Cake / microcake): Artist, UI Designer, and Level designer.
-Photoshop (level design and raster work)
-Illustrator (raw artwork)
-InDesign (level layout)
-Dreamweaver (level creation via XML)

entries.title: Rogue Worlds
entries.description:
Well I didn't get the network finished in time, but single player works fine and is pretty fun! 

The original idea was to have two separate games running side by side. The players would interact with each other by picking up items that drop from defeated enemies. For example, the tome item would spawn a more powerful enemy in your opponent's world.

My top score so far is around 5K.

entries.title: Shake it up!
entries.description:
>> The goal of this game is to go through the circuit board without touching the electrical conductor
>> Use arrow keys or WASD to move
>> Collect crumbs to restore your health
>> I admit that the difficulty may be little challenging at the beginning, but it just needs some time practicing.

entries.title: Slunks everywhere
entries.description:
Sadly I couldn't finish it ...
In the last few minutes I tried to make a menu but it didn't work so I had to skip it :S
I'll try to finish it in the following days anyways ^^
The sourcecode is very messy ... 

Story:
There are generators placed all over the map.
These generators erase your planet from existence.
Your mission is to find and deactivate them before it is too late.

... btw the name is unrelated

Controls:
Moving around: arrow keys
Deactivating generators: spacebar

entries.title: Stargazer
entries.description:
Requires Flash Player!

The source download is available at the bottom of the Web Player page or direct above.  Protected by Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 3.0 license.

Stargazer is a game about a tiny little island of pygmies who think their island world is all that exists. One day, following beautiful meteor showers the night before, they find themselves beset by debris from the sky. Steel yourself, and raise your spear, for you are the savior of your people.

Controls:
A or Left Arrow - Move Left
D or Right Arrow - Move Right
Left Click - Throw Spear
Enter - Accept / Skip / Continue

Reload by standing in front of the spear rack in the center hut.

You can select your game mode with the NUMBER KEYS on the title screen.

Story Mode - 5 levels of gameplay telling the story of our pygmy hero.

Survival Mode - infinite length gameplay, harder than story mode, continues until you are wiped out.

Controls are available on the title screen by pressing '3'.

entries.title: Surrounded by Snails
entries.description:
About 1.5 hours late, but I got it in!

So in this tiny world, you must collect lost powerups to make your way back to your normal size self! But wait... a mysterious huge creature may try to stop you!

Click the 'Web' link (above) to play!

entries.title: The Big Run
entries.description: Run around the world as far as you can!

entries.title: The Tiny Gryphalope
entries.description:
[Edit] Added an updated version with tweaks based on the
feedback I got and I also added some other stuff that never made it into the game before the deadline. 
Try it if you've played and rated the original! :)

____________________________________________________________________

~The Tiny Gryphalope~

  a 3D Shoot-em-up

____________________________________________________________________

Controls:

-Steer with w,a,s,d
-Roll with q,e
-Switch weapons with 1,2 or left,right
-Shoot and aim with the mouse
-Should work with xbox gamepad as well

____________________________________________________________________

Description:

You're controlling the tiny Gryphalope(a gryphon-jackalope :D )
through a dark tunnel filled with giant laser-spitting bug swarms.
You have three different weapons(switch with 1,2 or left,right), so
should you run out of ammo in one of them you can switch to the
next(they are not identical though).
If you crash into the walls you lose health.

I've configured gamepad support based on the logitech f710, which is
more or less an xbox 360 controller clone(xinput), so xbox 360
controllers should work.

____________________________________________________________________

In case of lag:

I'm having some lag issues with the web player, if you're
experiencing lag as well, the build might work better.

____________________________________________________________________

Tools used:

Unity 3d, PSE10, bfxr, audacity, inudge, 
Blender, Visual Studio

____________________________________________________________________

This was my first ludum dare, although I managed to do a lot more
than I thought, I still would've liked to add a bit more polish to
the game. Some parts are still pretty rough, imo.
I might add an updated version during the week.

entries.title: Antibody
entries.description:
Antibody is an arcade-style 'puzzle' game that takes place in the human body.  It's one part Tetris, one part DOTA, and one part Tower Defense. Control your body's immune system to repel invading Viruses and Bacteria!  Learn vaguely accurate cell biology!  Most importantly, have fun!

Check out the tutorial and periodic help messages at the bottom.  Beyond that:

Click or use number keys to select items.  
Click to place.
Right click places a beacon that attracts friendly cells.
Click a Helper Cell (turret) and hold to re-aim.

Postmortem/more details to come soon!

entries.title: AquaWars
entries.description: A battle of aquatic proportions is taking place in your own room! Play as a school of small fish to defend your fishtank as you disregard obvious plot holes such where are these mysterious enemy fish coming from. Collect sand dollars from your battles and trade them in for fish food (increase the speed of a single fish), additional fish, or beautiful plants (plants increase sand dollar drop rates) to decorate your fishtank with! Beware, once ten or more enemy fish are in your tank at any time it's game over! Direct your school of fish by clicking anywhere in the fishtank to guide them to that location. Your highscore is saved, so you can always try again to beat your best score!

entries.title: Centhra's Electrical RTS Thing

entries.title: DEREK
entries.description:
You are a giant named Derek. All Derek wants is to be friends with everyone and the village people think he is a bad person. To make the village people like you, you will need to kick the robots out until they realise you are a nice person.

The win and death screen look different to the main menu because I had to rush it.

entries.title: Life in jar
entries.description:
Small alien colony crashed into glass jar. You must take care of them and tell them what to do.
You need to collect enough material to build rocket and fly away.

Think wisely what you will do with your startup materials or you can get stuck.

On start you must buy tools to unlock tasks (pickaxe - mining, fishing rod - fishing etc.) If you upgrade tools, minions will colect materials more faster. If u want more workers working on one task you must upgrade buildings to add. You can get more minions by buying a house. 

Controls:
WSAD - camera rotation
MouseWheel - zoom in, zoom out
LBM - to open craftbook and choose upgrades from it
    - to set tasks of aliens

Sorry for cutted edges in beginning screen. It`s because of webplayer.

entries.title: Pieces
entries.description:
We did it in the 48-hour compo rules, but as a team!

Eastern Kentucky Universities ACM-hosted GameJam for Ludum Dare #23's entry!

People who worked on it:
Daniel Huster
Matthew Bryant
John Conder
Chris Cottrill (ACM. President of 2012 at EKU.)

{You can play using the a game controller, it makes camera and movement and jumping drastically easier!}

entries.title: Scorched Earth
entries.description:
Created in Java with LWJGL and Slick-Util. Uses some code from the LWJGL documentation to create the window.

Two people play this game on the same computer, the goal is to destroy all the opponent's pieces. Factories make new pieces, but you make impassable terrain for each unit you create! 

This was a fun first Ludum Dare! :D

-------------------------------
The goal of the game is to destroy all the enemies.
Each side takes turns moving their pieces and making new ones, with the spacebar to switch turns.

To play, arrow keys to move. Z to select a unit, or a factory, and then press Z again at the location you want them to move to/destroy. Soldiers can move up to 3 spaces either vertically or horizontally, but not both.

Destroyed Terrain is impassable, and can be used to decide where troops must go, but you can only destroy terrain that you own. Destroying terrain is how you make new pieces from the factory. To do so, select the factory, then select anywhere you own.

Also, due to time, Roads and Mountains are functionally identical to Grass. No change in how much you can move.

entries.title: SimHamlet
entries.description:
Requires:
XNA 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.NET 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

A simple medieval empire sim along the lines of "The Settlers".

The aim of the game is to balance wood, stone, grain and food production, ultimately to build a castle (costing 40 wood and stone) and to store up 40 food to be able to survive a siege (note, siege not shown in-game). If you ever run out of food, you lose.

Buildings:
Mason's: costs 3 stone, 1 wood. Produces stone from surrounding mountains, consumes food.
Woodcutter's: 3 stone, 1 wood. Produces wood from surrounding forests, consumes food.
Farm: 3 stone, 2 wood. Plants fields in surrounding empty space, produces grain.
Windmill: 5 stone, 3 wood. Consumes grain, produces food. Each produces enough food to feed a single mason or woodcutter.
Castle: 40 wood, 40 stone. Building a castle and amassing 40 food wins you the game.

Known bugs:
The windmill is missing its blades in the radial menu.
The radial menu is impossible to close without building something.

No sound, sorry.

entries.title: snowglobe
entries.description:
Not very "game-like" at this point.  But it is interactive, so left-click-and-hold. Escape to quit, space to pause.

Warning: I have no idea how well this works across different distros for linux (and have some limited evidence that it might not work at all without a rebuild), haven't tried to do that very often, so let me know if you have problems.

See the README for build instructions.

I will attempt to do a windows port later.

"current" will always be latest version (for next few hours), other versions are in same directory.

UPDATE 2012-04-30: After several more hours than I spent on the original entry, and a failed attempt at using emscripten, I learned javascript enough to port the whole damn thing.  It is as close to a straight port (no enhancements or bug fixes) as I could manage.  Events aren't as well handled as I'd like, but good enough.

entries.title: Space Imperator
entries.description:

Controls - Universal

U - Upgrade Ship
G - Launch Drop Pod (Costs 25 Credits)
Left Click - Fire Bolts
Right Click - Fire Missile (Costs 10 Credits)
W - Accelerate
S - Decelerate
F1 - View Help
