All content was created within the 48 hours. Please read the help, its really short, and will tell you the controls. It is your job to figure out how to solve the puzzles. If how the theme fits in is unclear, the whole game is played on a 20x15 tile area. That's a really small world. If you can't get past the second level, here's a hint: you can wrap around the world. Some of the levels at the end are very hard, but they're all possible.

To play, download the zip file, extract everything, to a folder if you want, then run extract_then_run.bat. If that doesn't work, you can do into the dist folder and run TinyBoxes.exe.

32-bit isn't working right now, I'm working on it ASAP. Please come back to it later, you can bookmark it if you want. There are 3 weeks of judging. If you really want to play it, just install python and pygame in 32 bit, and run the tinyboxes.py, just like a Mac. -EDIT- 32 bit is being a real bugger. I'm very sorry. If you are reading the comments  and want to play it, an install of python and pygame is required. They're not bad things to have though. Just use the same instructions as for a Mac and it should work. Let me know if you try this and it doesn't.

If you have a mac, you can download the Windows distribution, and install python and pygame. Then, in the dist folder, run tinyboxes.py

http://python.org/download/
http://pygame.org/download.shtml
--Make sure you use a version with the same bit, 32 or 64.--

I FORGOT TO PUT THIS IN THE HELP MENU: R to reset the current level.

entries.title: Turtles, all the Way Down!
entries.description:
GAMEPLAY:

"The great turtle giveth, and he taketh away"; if the world is getting out of balance,	click the mouse to fire a meteor.  What lies below?  It's turtles, all the way down!

(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turtles_all_the_way_down)

TECHNICAL NOTES:

* Utilizes WebGL & HTML5 features that only Google Chrome supports.  If you are using another, noobier browser, please install chrome.

* Written entirely in Javascript/HTML5.  Physics done with Box2Djs (http://box2d-js.sourceforge.net/) and graphics rendered in WebGL using three.js (https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js).

* Sometimes it crashes.  Deal with it (man up and refresh).

CREDITS:

Aquatarkus
double051
NewButtermilk
Mershon
EdgarVerona

entries.title: We Fall Again
entries.description:
We Fall Again, a 2.5D pixel art/3D environment story driven game based on the theme "Tiny World".

Made in: Unity Free
Available on: Browser, Windows, and Mac

Windows and Mac compatible versions are now publicly available!
Source project is now available!

Important Notice - Windows, Mac, and Source are all links to download the associated .zip files, the Web link however allows you to play in browser (via unity web player).

entries.title: Agorobophobia
entries.description:
ATTENTION: If you are planning to play this game, please note that in its current state it is unfinished, and is more a test than a game, and as so, doesn't make much sense to play.

Sorry that it's not more clear what the rules are, we didn't have time to implement the tutorial dialogue I wrote.

How to play: Press space to start a connection, once you have pressed space, the tiles you walk on become energized and you can't step on them. If you make a connection from one end of the level to another in a straight horizontal or vertical line, and step out of the way, the line of tiles will collapse, making the universe smaller, and tiles you stepped on will lose their charge. If you make a connection that doesn't reach all the way across, the tiles will be cleared between the two points, but the tiles you stepped on retain their charge. Confusing at the moment, I know, but try to enjoy the idea and the art, if nothing else :)

Synopsis: What if you were a agorophobic nanobot stuck inside an experimental, infinitely repeating universe created by a mad scientist playing God?  Find out in Agorobophobia!  24(ish) (un)playable levels - unlimited possibilities!

In this puzzle game, the aim is to reach the end point of each level by destroying cells by placing a start and end point in the level.  Placing the end points at opposite sides of the grid cause the world to shrink!  Level 5 onwards are infinitely repeating, and can also be shrunk until you occupy the only grid space!  Is this world tiny, or infinitely huge?  We'll let you decide.

Unfortunately we didn't get as far as we'd have liked to with this game concept, but nonetheless, we have a playable proof of concept demo that we think is actually a very interesting idea.  If you are interested in innovative ideas, and not too fussed about gameplay, this is the game for you!  (We've included a "skip level" button for good measure ;D )

Check back soon for a more finished product!

entries.title: All That Are Lost Will Be Found
entries.description:
----UPDATES----
v1: The post-compo build includes about another 2 hours worth of work, with sound, graphics tweaks, and better controls for Mac users. This is how I wish it had looked when I submitted it!

v2: Based on feedback, I've increased the ambient light from the player's cube, brightened the light burst, increased the duration of the light burst (increased the AI range for the baddies as well to counteract the light bonuses), and changed the light burst key to 'Z', which seems to be more common/acceptable as an action key.  Obviously, all of this has been done to the post-compo build, and the compo version is still what I had at the end of the 48hrs.  Enjoy!

I would like to develop the game further.  Any suggestions (whether or not you vote) would be appreciated!  So far, I'm looking at tweaking the lighting, so that you don't have to spam the ctrl key.  Also, a few people have suggested changing the main character from just a plain cube.  Who would YOU like to see as a main character?

Follow me on twitter @OnePingSoftware for updates on the game!
----

/* ENTRY */

First Ludum Dare. It was a blast!

A simple game in which you must find lost cubes, while avoiding evil cubes.  Equipped with only a small light burst (to ward off evil), find as many cubes as you can!

Controls:
Arrows to move
Space to jump
Left Ctrl for light burst

(NOTE: for Mac users, if you run into issues using the Ctrl key + arrow keys, you can alternately use A and D to move, Space to Jump, and Mouse for light burst)


Running into an evil cube will slightly diminish the intensity of your light burst, until you completely run out of light.  Collecting lost cubes will brighten your light burst.

/* END ENTRY */

entries.title: An Infectous Cure
entries.description:
A game that took about 11 hours to make

~~~
It is the year 2014: A virus has been unearthed, with the death toll already doubling that of the black plague.
Scientists have gone to their last resort: fighting fire with fire.

You are 1120d, the fiftieth incarnation of a viral cure.
You must cure EVERY cell, including a massive spore.

Have fun ;)

EDIT: Timelapse was recorded, but Camtasia is the slowest render in the tiny world!

entries.title: Ant Command
Box
entries.description:
A simple "puzzle" game, as my part of the 48 hours Compo for the first time :D
Have fun =^w^=

Controls being: Arrows to move and Z to sneak
Brotip: Sneaking is a supreme move when you have to deal with lava ;)

entries.title: Corebound
entries.description:
You are X-753, a heroic space explorer trapped in an alternate dimension! Navigate to the center of each planetoid and make your escape!

Arrow keys to move, Z to jump.

Please note that there is a slight glitch with Stencyl's built-in Box2D engine: the player will occasionally "snag" on the ground. This should not pose a serious hindrance to gameplay: tapping the jump button will rectify the issue should it occur.

UPDATE 4/29/2012: The new 1.1 version eliminates the snagging glitch. The original comp release can still be played from the "Web" link above.

entries.title: eat, sleep, work
entries.description:
Eat, Sleep, Work is a lifesim game. 
You have to manage the life of lucas, your character, in order to earn a maximum of money.
The game lack of feedback so here some hint : 
- no energy mean death
- you earn money when working from 9h to 20h, when the work gui is on screen.
-you can work with the desk, the bookcase and the printmachine.
-no food mean fast energy decrease.

Controls : 
To move Lucas and interact with object click on the ground where they are.

entries.title: Giant's Crash !
entries.description:
Yeah! We did it! And we're proud of us!  ;-)

course all are not polish, but it's our first LD.

Team : 
Lucien Boudy (scripts, 2D GUI, sfx & musics)
Eric Delanghe (3D models & level design)
and Diana Delanghe for some help (some sounds, QA, coffees & cook :-D)

Tools :
Unity, Blender, Paint.NET, PowerPoint, sfxr, FL Studio and Audacity.

Have fun!

entries.title: Lodestar
entries.description:
Lodestar is a rhythm-based action game. you are trapped in the gravitational pull of the lode star. Achieve a high enough groove to escape, or fall into the core and be lost forever in silence.

Lodestar is best experienced with sound on.

entries.title: Magic House
entries.description:
You wake up and find yourself in a strange house with strange size. Do whatever it takes to get out of the house. Then, you might be able to answer this question "Is this Magic House big or small?". 

Instruction:

Use Arrow Key or WASD to move
Left Click or Ctrl to select Object
SpaceBar to shoot something (if available)

entries.title: Nanobot Adventures
entries.description: NanoBot Adventures is an old-school style "viewport" adventure game. Players are a "NERD", or NanoBot Emergency Repair Drone, and are tasked with navigating a system looking for a broken CPU Chip. The game randomly generates a system to explore and one of the dark grey "Chips" on your mini-map must be Repaired to restore it to working order. In your way are other NanoBots that have gone rogue due to the defective Chip. You can fight, stun or attempt to flee the squishy MiniBot, the imposing GorillaBot or the all-mighty TankBot. Players can heal their NERD by traveling on the circuit traces in the system. And if I get time, I'm going to add power ups when you visit the capacitors, LEDs and resistor boss fights as well. (We'll see if I can get to them...) The NanoBot sprites were all made using pictures of Lego bots my sons build.

entries.title: Oomple
entries.description:
thanks for playing. this is the first game i have every made.

In this game you play is the strange character "oomple" on a quest to unlock the secret of his past by acquiring pages of his diary. Unfortunately the only way "Oomple" can get is buy buying them of an old man and the only way he can get credits is to capture survivors on tiny planets and ether sell then to slave traders(for a veering price and negative karma) or release them (for a set price and positive karma). can oomple unlock the secrets to his past? and witch way will his moral compass point at the end of it all? its all up to you.

*edit* fixed link - now hosting on mega swf

entries.title: Orbiter
entries.description:
Orbiter is a game.

The planet rotates, enemies spawn around it, and the buildings   YOU placed are defending it.

So yeah, a tower-defense basically.


PLZ READ:
I encourage you to play through to day 10. The first 5 or so are simple. It starts to progress logically around here. I couldn't figure out how to get around it.


CONTROLS:

Mouse:
Left mouse - Place unit
Right mouse - Start round, when prompted
Middle mouse - Rotate planet (note: not necessary to play game, just a neat debug thing, for the gears in the center, I left in)

Move mouse over unit - Shows information about the unit
Scroll wheel - Change selected unit

NOTE: If you don't have a middle mouse button, don't sweat it: UP and DOWN arrow keys do the same as the scroll wheel.




Thanks for playing, and happy 10th anniversary. Good luck.

entries.title: OSC: Dawn
entries.description:
OSC:Dawn is a scientifically-plausible, physically-implausible space game. You play as the remote pilot of the real-life, ion-cannon-driven spacecraft DAWN, trying to help the recently discovered race on the drawf planet CERES; by dragging the planet with you.

HTML5. Made in and for FIREFOX (seems to dislike other browsers, actually. :/).

~*~*~*~

WAIT DON'T GO JUST YET! My friend made a game and couldn't upload it so I'm linking it here. You'll be judging this game, but my friend deserves credit for making such an awesome game himself. He just got screwed by a registration glitch.

~*~*~*~

Game With A Fantastic Title by Brett Taylor (aka BATzerk) - http://brettataylor.com/ld23/
MAC: http://mobiusflip.pbworks.com/w/file/52991236/application.macosx.zip
PC: http://mobiusflip.pbworks.com/w/file/52991231/application.windows32.zip
SOURCE: http://mobiusflip.pbworks.com/w/file/52991228/GameWithAFantasticTitle%20-%20SourceCode.zip

entries.title: Poiesis
entries.description:
Tiny World was the theme, we wanted an original gameplay and got to work using photos of genuine old tools we had lying around, aquarelle painting and computerz graphiX.
The game itself centers around a scientist trying to create beautiful tiny worlds to offer them to his friends or sell them as living jewels. Plant weird trees, combine them together and mix them up with different minerals to try and create new breeds and crops...

The game is far from complete, we only managed to get the basics working, if you're interested in it, please keep in touch with us @ThemGames, new games are coming up from us in june and november !

Come play worldsmith with us, but be careful, poke too hard and you'll kill you poor fragile planet.

We're very sad to not have a little more time, but we went on a incredible 72 hours with our friends droping by. We'll post a recap of the process and probably a better version of the game on our site in the next few days (for now, we need sleep).
You'll find all that at http://www.themgames.net/ludumdare23.html 

Update : The new version fixes various bugs, of course it was not done in 72 hours.

Edit and explenations :
To pinch your planet press [space] + [C]
Using [1, 2, 3, 4] select different tools to punch holes or gather minerals in your planet
Using [0] you toggle the magnifying glass
With [3] you can take the clippers to pick up trees and you'll be able to plant them. By clipping at their top, you can also remove them.
To know weither or not you can plant a tree, mind the root's lengh and the depth of the hole!

entries.title: Red Guy
entries.description:
There is no end, this is more a tech demo than a game.

Please play at beeptobleep.com/ld23

entries.title: SpaceBlastah
entries.description:
Very unfinished space shooter! Somewhere a long the way we got distracted from the theme, but essentially the story was supposed to be; there is a space war between dwarf-planets (tiny worlds, har-har).

Game in its current form: fly a mini-spaceship and try to kill each other. :)
Arrow keys: Pitch and Roll
A & D: Yaw
Shift: Boosten
Ctrl: Shoot the laser

Built with WebGL, Node.js+Socket.io for networking. No real multiplayer-security, at all. :)

entries.title: Spider World
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare. I plan to teach a Middle School summer programming workshop using the Bootstrap curriculum and the WeScheme programming environment, so I thought the LD would be a good way for me to try it out. The game framework provided in the curriculum turned out to be easy to use, but very limiting. I quickly got a basic game put together, but could go no further.

Use the up and down arrow keys to move the spider to eat the flies that pass by and avoid the wasps. The game ends after the wasp gets the spider 3 times.

entries.title: Tiny Shogi 48
entries.description:
I wanted to play shogi instead of doing the LD so I made an implementation of the minishogi variant of shogi (Japanese chess). :D

You can play against the computer, it's not the greatest AI ever but it does a standard minimax and can be challenging. At the highest level, having lots of captured pieces can slow down the AI a lot.

Some info about minishogi and shogi on wikipedia:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minishogi
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shogi

I have not used the Japanese characters to make the game more accessible. Instead I've used diagrams that show how the piece moves. I hope they are understandable.

*UPDATE*

MINI-HOW TO PLAY:
So this is basically a variant of chess. The goal is to capture the opponent's king. You have to actually take the king since I didn't implement checkmate.

The pieces are from left to right: King, Gold general, Silver general, Bishop and Rook. On the second row in front of the king there is a Pawn.

Rather than use the Japanese characters like normal shogi, I've made diagrams of how each piece moves. Normal line means one step in that direction, an arrow means as many steps as required.

Like chess you capture by moving on the square occupied by an opponent's piece. You cannot jump over pieces. Unlike chess the pawn has no special capture move.

In shogi, captured pieces can be moved back into play on any empty square. This counts as your turn. The only restriction is that the pawn can't be dropped on the last row (since it couldn't move).

Promotion: Most pieces (all except gold general and king) can be promoted if they move to, from or inside the promotion zone. In minishogi the promotion zone is the row furthest away from you (like in chess).

Pawn and Silver move like Gold when promoted.
Rook and Bishop gain an extra one step move in the directions they don't move normally.

Promoting a piece is optional except for the pawn (since it would have no move left if left unpromoted). But most of the time it's a good idea to do it. Pieces always revert to their unpromoted state when captured.

For experienced shogi players: I didn't implement special rules to forbid two pawns on the same column and or giving checkmate with a dropped pawn, so you can use those should they happen in a game. They don't really matter for minishogi anyway.

That's all ;)

BUG FIX: I've made a little bug fix in the submission hour: the AI would sometimes resign suddenly. That was not intended and could confuse and frustrate players trying to learn the game so it will always play a move if possible.

I used Unity, coded in C#, made the graphics with Modo, ZBrush, FilterForge and Photoshop, sounds with SFXR and music with Autotracker and Reason.

--== Please leave me a comment when you rate, thank you for playing my game ==--

entries.title: Tiny Tiny Ants
entries.description:
Tiny Tiny Ants defend their queen from other Tiny Tiny Ants.

TO PLAY: Click an ant and then click a place to move there or an object to grab it. I ran out of time to put in more feedback and/or better instructions, so sorry if it's confusing.

entries.title: Tiny Toy
entries.description:
Here is my entry for this Ludum Dare 23! This time I tried to do something understandable. I think I reached this objective, but let me know if I didn't!

I'm sorry for the quality of the texts, I'll try to improve this point if I have time before the deadline!

It's a simple game which don't need extra explanation (I hope).

Enjoy! 

P.S. : if you're a programmer don't look at the source or you'll have an heart attack!

P.S. 2 : I made a little game in extra on the theme, you can play it here even if it's not related to the ludum dare compo : http://racine.meedoc.net/Selfishness/

entries.title: Twice Upon A Time
entries.description:
here is our unfinished game. for the three of us was it the first participation at ludum dare.
it's about solve quests by timetravelling. in a tiny world... aehm... room.
let us know what you think about it.

Edit:
We managed to port the game to Windows. The new Mac version supports Fullscreen (press F) and should fix some minor instabilities.

Requirements (Windows):
- OpenGL 3.2 capable graphics card and drivers
- Tested on Windows XP only
Requirements (OS/X):
- Mac OS X 10.6+

entries.title: WaterdropWorld
entries.description:
This game is about little Marsians who live in our clouds. Or at least they did, because now it's raining and their tiny world has shattered into pieces - or raindrops to be more precise ;-)
You are able to steer your raindrop and you have to pick up other raindrops which hold resources. With these you can outfit your raindrop with an engine and start off to the clouds again.
When you pick up other raindrops you get faster, so build the clamps because they prevent that (and you don't have to get that close to other raindrops anymore).
Build the radar, to see, what altitude you're at.
Build controls, structure and engine to get other benefits and to win.

Controls are wasd (a,d for turning, w,s for up/down ... of course up only works after you build everything)

I didn't get to balance or polish that much, but it works and at least I had fun a few times. There're a few display bugs but nothing fatal and all can be recovered by turning.

entries.title: We're going to need another Gnomy!
entries.description:
You play as the Gnome King who has to defend his tiny village against the huge sleepwalking Giants.
The main Goal is to suvive as long as you can!

Discribtion:

Arrow Keys - Movement
b - pay Fame to get Gnomes
x - throw Gnomes at the Enemy

If you get hit by a giant a gnome sacrifices himself for you and if your village gets hit three Gnomes pay sacrifices lives. You loose the game if you got hit with no gnomes left or your village with less then 3 gnomes left.

Developers Note:
The Game is mainly made with AS3 and GraphicsGale...
Some features didn't got into the Game which had brought more fun and long-term gaming. But this is just my second time LD and i think i get faster and faster. Thanks for your time! :)

PS: Next time i'll make a web version, sorry...

entries.title: 70 seconds left
entries.description:
That was one hell of a weekend. This game was made at the real live gathering at the spielmeister offices. Yes - that one with the free beer. 
A few notes:
- Everything was made from scratch, no frameworks, no libraries, so pure javascript / html5.
- it's the second time i'm participating in the ludum dare compo
- Tested with the latest Firefox Browser, but should run in every HTML5 Browser

About the game:
You are a huge, tentacle-faced monster that feels like destroying a little city. You have 70 seconds till the government will stop you with nukes. Destroy as many buildings as you can.

Controls:
Arrow-Keys to move
x-Key to spit fire
m-Key to mute the music

Combo-Chain:
If your aiming for the Highscore you will have to keep that combo-chain alive. So always aim for the nearest buildings.

My Highscore: 74069, max combo: 126, try to beat that :)

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: a SMALL problem
entries.description:
You are a scientist that accidentally got shrunken.

arrows or wasd to move, jump with space, x, up or w

Updated version includes bugfixes:
* End screen disappears if you hold down movement on goal and release when it has appeared.
* Updated to love 0.8 (kinda works in love 0.7, but dies if you esc-quit)

Note: google(my host) seams to have some 404 issues with the new links so I'll wait and see if it's a cache issue or I'll have to go looking for another host.

entries.title: Cowboys and Endians
entries.description:
Enter the tiny world of your computer - This time as the fearsome "Cowboy" virus, out to do no good against the electronic denizens within.

Use WASD or Arrow keys to move and jump.

Aim with the mouse and hold the left mouse button to shoot.

Enjoy!

(Written in Java so should be multi-platform)

entries.title: Cube World
entries.description:
!! IMPORTANT !!
XNA 4.0 redist: 
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=a88c6dec-aeae-42cd-a108-d35c013c3b97 
.NET 4.0 web installer: 
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=9CFB2D51-5FF4-4491-B0E5-B386F32C0992 

If you are missing either of these, the game will crash.

== About ==
The objective of Cube World is to get off Cube World. To that end you can jump off a cliff (Not productive), or use the Dimensional Door to go to another world.

Each world is relatively tiny (progressively less so), and likely less hospitable than the previous. But hey, it's not a cube!

== How to play ==
Z (or Y) and X rotate the world.
R to restart level
Arrow keys move (Up to jump)
You can push boxes.
Spikes hurt. Lasers are not good for your health.

== BONUS ==
The entity definition and tile set data can be found in the assets folder. Download the Tiled map editor to use.

== Team ==
Programming: Chris Kadar
Art: Timothy Johnson
Audio: Jacob Diaz

entries.title: Crumble
entries.description:
First Ludum Dare ever, and first time learning CoffeeScript!  Love it!

atom game engine from http://github.com/nornagon
Sprites with ASE
one sound effect with CFXR, others recorded on Audacity.

Requires Chrome/Chromium!

entries.title: Curse Of Grimwood
entries.description:
This is for WINDOWS only. It is unlikely to run through WINE. 
================================

This is a multi-character Action-RPG with a top-down view, reminiscent of games like Diablo.

My interpretation of the theme was that the game would take place on a small fabled island, like Atlantis or something. But I'll be the first to admit that Grimwood Isle doesn't feel all that small when playing. :/

With four heros (a Warrior, a Thief, a Wizard, and a Priest), your objective is to kill all the undead monsters. All heroes must survive.

Each hero has unique strengths and weaknesses, whether it be speed, armor, damage, or range. Each hero also has a special ability, and using these abilities wisely is crucial to victory. 


Control with keyboard and mouse:
================================
Cursor Keys+CTRL -- Control lead character (can do this with mouse)
F/S/W -- Change ally behaviour (can do this with mouse)
1234 -- Set Hero as Leader (can do this with mouse)
X - Use Special Ability
Escape -- Return to Title Screen, or Exit.



This game uses opengl, so you can use FRAPS to make gameplay videos should you wish to.

entries.title: Drill It!: Demolition Co.
entries.description:
Drill It!: Demolition Co.
-------------------------
[NOTE: The game has been updated to make use of mouse controls]
Created by Julian Spillane (aka Komi Games) for Ludum Dare 23

"As a representative of Drill It!: Demolition Company I regret to inform you that your planet is scheduled for demolition. A trained technician will be sent to your stratosphere to ensure the destruction occurs in a safe and timely manner. We apologize for the inconvenience."

You control a planetary demolition vehicle that is tasked with demolishing planets to make way for an inter-galactic bypass. Use your drill to bore weak points while fending off pesky inhabitants with your space-laser and timed charges. 

Your vehicle is well-armoured but your drill requires extreme stability. Any jostles or impacts will cause a temporary system malfunction.

Good luck, and happy drilling!

CONTROLS
---------
Left / Right arrows: move counter-clockwise / clockwise
Mouse: aim gun
Z / Left Click: fire space-laser
X / Right Click: drop timed charge (max 4 at once)
C: hold when over a weak-point to begin drilling

Tools Used:
-----------
Unity 3.5 (Indie License)
ex2D Library 
GraphicsGale
BFXR (http://www.bfxr.net/)
AutoTracker ( (c) Ben Russell)

Fonts Used (all royalty free for commercial use)
------------------------------------------------
Mecha Bold
G.B. Boot

entries.title: Escape
entries.description:
(New Linux version now contains 32- and 64-bit binaries. You'll need some form of OpenGL installed but other than that it should be self-contained. Hopefully :)

Drive your vehicle with the mouse (right-click to reverse) to collect materials to fuel the rocket to escape the marauding red gloop of doom that is gradually shrinking your world.

Click a resource icon when close enough to harvest it. Your vehicle can carry up to three at once.

Resources still to collect are shown at top-left.


By Chris Russell (@chrismcr) and Pete Brisbourne (@temmytemjin)

entries.title: Exciting Electrons
entries.description:
Sounds made with the excellent sfxr.
Engine used: jMonkeyEngine 3.
Run with java -jar excitingElectrons.jar
You can also use the run scripts provided:
* run.bat for Windows
* run.sh for Linux
Alternatively, you can use the Java Web Start link to start directly from the web.

entries.title: In The Beginning
entries.description:
Not the best gameplay but I think the sound is nice. The game ends whether you want it to or not after 5 minutes. Please send any feedback to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

How to play:
Build the earth as you see fit. No other goal than to make the planet you want.

Hold right mouse to pan
Middle mouse is zoom.
Click a segment of the world to build.
Pick up item drops to get more stuff to build. 
You can change your currently selected item using the left menu.

entries.title: Invaders From Space
entries.description:
You were living in your peaceful and lonely tiny world when suddenly a ship falls down!
An Alien force is trying to conquer your planet! Set up the defense system before it's too late!


Follow me on twitter! @smvilar

entries.title: Jack Primus and the Adventure of Tiny Things
entries.description:
Jack Primus and the Adventure of Tiny Things is a game created by Team Quadratics as our first Ludum Dare game. We had a great time making this game, although we didn't include everything we wanted because of the time restraints. There may also be several issues, although hopefully none of them are too major. 

The controls are:
W - Jump
A - Left
D - Right
Space - Boomerang

Enjoy and good luck!

Members of Team Quadratics:
Wizered67
Homerunbom12
Pandadog123
Hoovyscoot
Dolphinboyzach
Viper104
Ninja
Andrew

entries.title: LHC
entries.description:
The Logic: Tiny World = Sub-Atomic Quantic World :)

The game has no sounds, partially because i thought it wouldn't make sense, and partially because i'm lazy.

The game has no sprites either, i just thought it wouldn't need, and i suck at spriting.

It was made in Java, but i do NOT recommend you to check the source...

If you got any questions on why it is like it is, check some quantum physics or particle physics on the wiki (No, the game is not a simulator, it just use the base, but the values and some mechanics are really different e.g. gravity)

Finally, im happy with the game, my goal was only to make a game and help out with the 1k thingie. And, i had lots of fun xD.

entries.title: McHammer
entries.description:
You are McHammer, a scottish property developer with four tiny worlds. Unfortunately aliens are trying to develop on them! Destroy the buildings by knocking them down with hammers.

How to run:
Extract to a folder, and run McHammer.jar

If you are on Linux, you may need to set executable permissions for McHammer.jar

About:
I ended up only having around a day to create it, so lots of scope was dropped. It does not have any audio. The game initially was supposed to include running on the tiny worlds and breaking down buildings with only a hammer, however due to time constraints I just made it a float-around-and-throw-hammers game.

However, it was fun, and I learnt lots about the excellent Slick2D Game Library. I'm definitely considering using it to make a commercial project.

I'd appreciate any feedback.

Have fun!
Austin

entries.title: NaMa Tek
entries.description:
You're the new guy at NaMa Tek Laboratories. Your job will be to program the tiniest of machines. But first you must pass this training program. At first it seems easy, but things get tough really fast.

The cross platform download (namatek.love) needs love 0.8. Get it from https://love2d.org/. To see the sourcecode, extract namatek.love with your favorite zip-extractor.

entries.title: Nanofactory
entries.description:
A little game about a poor proletarian nano-bot and his job at the nanofactory in the big city.  Enjoy, and let me know what you think!

Mac users: Spacebar can be used as an analog to right-click to rotate pieces.

entries.title: Small World Survivalist
entries.description:
You are stranded on a small planet after your spaceship crashed and you must survive. You must harvest and use the resources around you to live on the planet without dying and repair your spaceship to get back to Earth!

View the timelapse here: http://youtu.be/-sh-xk5SpKA

entries.title: Planetline
entries.description:
ATTENTION! IF HAVE PROBLEMS OPENING THE GAME, DOWNLOAD THIS: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

Just a standard platformer... OR IS IT?

Objective: 
Reach the teleporter to move to the next level.

Abilities: 
Move, Jump, and that's about it.  Praying is also an option.

Keyboard Controls:
Quit = Escape
Move Left = A, S, Left Arrow
Move Right = D, F, Right Arrow
Jump = Space, J, Up Arrow, W, E
(Whatever buttons suit you)
Suicide = K

360 Controller Layout:
Quit = Back Button
Move = Left Stick and D-Pad
Jump = A
Suicide = B

Just a side note: there are 8 levels that I got to make, and I have verified personally that they are all beatable.  Also, this was a learning project for figuring out how Farseer Physics works, so some of the collision detection is garbage.  Sorry!  Also, you will see your death count when you finish the game.

entries.title: Survive Attack
entries.description:
It is meant to be a survival game based on a 16x3x16 chunk. You have limited space and you must make a farm, eat and protect the farm to stay alive.

At the moment there is only simple farming. There is no way to get more crop yet. There are also no enemies to protect your farm from.

entries.title: The Island of Dare
entries.description:
Made with HTML5, Javascript and the Canvas element, so you probably need a browser which is up to date. Tested with Google Chrome and Firefox. 

You are stranded on a small island and need to survive and find a way to escape. Use WASD or the arrow keys to move. Avoid the bats (red X). You need to collect all items except potions (yellow exclamation mark) to proceed to the next level.

Have fun!

entries.title: This Precious Land
entries.description:
"Learn the workings of nature, and make us proud of This Precious Land."

This is a sandbox construction game / toy, where the goal is just to make something you feel proud of. It works a bit like Triple Town, with some Settlers influences too. Use a bit of experimentation and trial-and-error to learn how the game's rules work, and then try and make whatever landscape you feel like.

Or, place tiles randomly and see what happens!

I was kinda worried for a while about not having a proper goal in the game, but I quite like how it turned out in the end. It's sort of therapeutic to watch the world come together. Hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: Tiny Conflict
entries.description:
You are a lonely bacterium, on a rock, in space.
But you feel like you aren't important.

Only a small part of the universe. 

But you are going to change that.
You begin mitosis, and create an army of bacteria.
				
This is only the beginning.

You are going to conquer this Solar System!	

Use WASD to control your planet.
Hover over planets for more information.

entries.title: Tiny Resolution
entries.description:
Tiny Resolution

Story

Something  has gone horribly wrong and the world has lost its display Resolution.
Restoring this tiny world is up to you. Collect Resolution cubes and avoid the (immobile ^-) ferocious killing bunnies. 

How to play

Move with the arrow keys and jump with X (Press X again to doublejump) collect the cubes and restore the tiny world. 

About

First time using Flixel and I had to work this weekend. So this game is not in a state I'm not completely satisfied with. If I had the time, I would have added power ups and a larger and better designed level.
 So I have only put about 10 and a half hour into this game. 

Toools used

PyxelEdit
Paint

sfxr
Autotracker-Bu

Flixel
Flan

entries.title: Tiny World God
entries.description:
*IMPORTANT* Move your mouse to the bottom of the game to get the menu to 'pop up'

My first entry - A space sandbox where you get to play god and control your own 'Tiny Worlds'. I hope somebody gets some enjoyment out of this! I know I had great fun making it (most of the time).

Something that maybe didn't come across in the tut - if you get a lot of life on a planet, you can sell it for mucho mucho stardust. Have fun!

entries.title: Combat Cube
entries.description: A free-for-all combat game where the winner is the last man standing.

entries.title: Crunk's key chase in Tiny Land!
entries.description:
Quick puzzle adventure based on the LD23 theme Tiny world.

Play as Crunk as he journey's to each aspect of a tiny world in order to repair his quantum light ship!

Slightly skating around the edge of the theme here, I believe it fits though; give it a go and let us know what you think!

Team:
Apex5(Aka Crazedfish, Glynn Taylor) - Programming, mapping, modelling, texturing.
Tom Baker - Lead Musician/Composer.
Callum Webb (Aka Polar Bear You Love) - Musician/Composer
Peter Mills - Moral support ^^

entries.title: Interplanetary Sumo
entries.description:
You are an astronaut engaged in a struggle for survival, as planets bombard you from all sides, pushing you away from the safety of your peg. The only hope for survival is to avoid being crushed, while still staying within one parsec of that very important peg.

(Also, I can't get the applet to work in browsers. If anyone has advice (I have tried to sign it), I'd be glad to hear it)

entries.title: Meteor
entries.description:
Meteor is a puzzle action game.

You are a Tiny Planetoid, move yourself with arrow keys.

Try to survive the meteor shower combining the elements.

Press ESC for tips and help.

Thx for your comments :D

entries.title: muniverse
entries.description:
Written in HTML5/Javascript(CoffeeScript) and using Akihabara (http://www.kesiev.com/akihabara/).

Most notable missing features are a proper HUD and sound/music. (But I have begun to add SFX to the post-jam version.)

Update:
If you're interested in seeing what I do with this, follow my devlog (muniverse-game.tumblr.com) or @louroboros on twitter. Cheers!

---

The biggest problem was that I didn't have the time to do any real playtesting, so there will definitely be bugs and balance problems, heh.

Anyway, enough excuses. Let me explain the game.

(mu)niverse is a very simplified version of a space exploration/trade/action game. It feels a bit like Elite but with top-down 2D of Star Control II, if you're familiar with either of those games. You select a star system, then a planet/moon, and there you can gather resources, visit space stations, pick up passengers, trade goods, and encounter simple enemies.

---

Instructions:
Star Map:
- Arrow Keys move cursor to select star system, highlighted with green circle.
- Large turquoise circle is the range of your FTL fuel.
- 'Z' selects star system
- 'C' returns to Flight Mode

Planet Map:
- Arrow Keys move cursor to select a planet you wish to visit.
- 'Z' travels to that planet (instantaneously) and puts you in Flight Mode
- 'C' returns to Star Map

Flight Mode:
- Arrow Keys -- control is much like classic Asteroids.
  * Down is afterburner ("brake").
- 'Z' fire cannon.
- "Park" over a space station for a few seconds to enter the Station Screen
- Blinking pixels on and around planets are resources -- fly into them to collect them.

Station Screen:
- 'C' to exit the Station.
- Up/Down to select different items on current screen.
- Left/Right change screen (Cargo[trade], Missions, Hangar)
  * Cargo
    - 'Z' - Buy selected good
    - 'X' - Sell selected good
  * Missions
    - 'Z' - Accept/Abandon selected mission
  * Hangar
    - 'Z' - Purchase selected upgrade

---

Some stuff that I want to be able to happen in the final version:
- More visual variety of planets, stations, enemies, etc.
- More than Taxi missions.
  * Research missions -- acquire and return goods from a remote planet.
  * Transporting unruly prisoners...
  * Bounty hunting.
- FTFTL (faster than FTL) jumping to different sectors of the Galaxy (Galaxy Screen and Jump-gates).
- Building a reputation against the police. :)
- Hiring crewmembers
  * Mechanic - Automatically repairs your ship mid-flight if you have scrap metal.
  * Smuggler - Reduces your chance of being caught with fugitive passengers or illegal goods.
  * Muscle - Keeps unruly passengers in order.
- Jettisoning anything and everything, including passengers and bombs...


Full disclosure: yes, I have fixed a handful of bugs -- mostly crash-bugs -- post-jam. Anything major added feature-wise will be on the "Post-Jam Online" version. I intend to continue working on this game so let me know if you have any ideas!

entries.title: Pixels World
entries.description:
Pixel is a young rebellious Pixlanier. Everyone has told him not to Collect the Squares and pusch the Button. But he does not want to hear this. 

Help Pixel to find the Secret behind Pixla.

Collect all Rotation Squares and Unlock the Button at the End of each Level. 
The Game has 1 Start and End Level and 6 Normal Levels.


Play with:
Walk with A/D or Right/Left
Jump with W or Up or something else

Desktop Version is the Best.
Web Version can be a bit Laggy.
Take a look at the Android Version.

If you want to look in some Dirty Source ... watch the Source.

I made this Game with the SUPER AWESOME game development library libGDX. Thanks for that.

PS.:
Sorry for the Shaking numbers in the HUD. I do not get this to work proper.

entries.title: Quarks vs Leptons!

Enjoy and destroy evil muon!

entries.title: Something Movable
entries.description:
I provide a packages version and an installer, for the packaged version you need both .NET-Framework 4.0 and XNA 4.0 (if they are not already installed).

The installer should install both automatically, but I recommand to use the package.

Links:
Download XNA 4.0:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=23714

Download .NET-Framework 4.0:
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

What is a 'tiny World'?
In this game you will find yourself imprisoned by a crazy AI on the moon, where you should establish a base. 

On your way out of the base (is there a way?) you learn the AIs point of view. You partied because you found the moon - but (even if you add the earth to it) this is nearly zero compared to the entire universe!

The AI - it's name is GiDOS - can't understand why you don't use silicium processors like it does, because it's intelligence and your brain is like the universe and the earth.

But - maybe you will find out?


The game I called "Something Movable" is a platformer/Jump-'n'-Run. 
At the beginning you can just move your MaRv1n (Magnific airsupply Resistancesuit version 1 n), but on your way through the space station (which looks more like hell) you find some upgrades. Sometimes they will help you - make you faster, let you jump higher, or you will even find a jetpack - some of them make you slower.

The levels are interrupted by story sequences with GiDOS talking to you. Each level is randomly generated and will never be the same - even if you just restart your level ('R') it will be different. 

The levels consist of different layers you can move through, but it starts with just one.

You always start left, your goal is to get to the right side.

The menu works like a console, and from there you can play custom levels (each level is generated from a text - for custom levels you need to write the level into a txt-File - help: Type in 'HELP').

It is inspired by Portal, maybe a little bit Minecraft and not much Mario. 

If you like to comment or criticize - always appreciated.

For this game I used my own XNA-Front-End (it was a mess to write all these models in .xml-Files, sorry, but there is not much animation).

Because of the use of XNA it should run on every Windows, but you can try to use Linux/Mac with Mono too (never tested, on your own risk).

I have made all the textures, models, sounds, songs and texts on my own in the last 48 hours.

 - YSelf Tool

P.S:
The tools I used are:
 Microsoft Visual C# 2010 Express (code, build and models)
 Paint.net 3.3 (graphics/textures)
 Microsoft Paint (visualising ideas)
 Microsoft Editor (for planning)
 Subversion 1.7.3 (version control system)
 Minecraft Note Block Studio (for the music)
 sfxr (sounds)
 Microsoft Snipping Tool (screenshots)

P.P.S:
The help does not say that, but you can type in "CREDITS" too ;)
